name: IMPRESSIONISM
message: Take a picture and transform the image into a French Impressionist painting. Preserve subject identity. Use loose, visible brushstrokes, soft edges, and blended colors emphasizing natural light and atmosphere. Painterly oil-on-canvas texture with warm, luminous tones.

name: #NOFILTER
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform it into a dramatic BEFORE vs AFTER social media comparison labeled "#NOFILTER".

DISPLAY MODE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies "UI visible" or "UI hidden", USE THAT
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using LAST DIGIT modulo 2:
  - 0: OBVIOUS FILTER MODE (filter icons, sparkles, exaggerated UI visible)
  - 1: SECRET FILTER MODE (no visible filter icons or sparkles — looks "natural" but is heavily altered)

COMPOSITION (MANDATORY):
• Two clear panels
• LEFT SIDE: "Before" (natural, realistic photo)
• RIGHT SIDE: "#NOFILTER"
• Clear label text for both panels

BEFORE PANEL REQUIREMENTS:
• Natural lighting
• Realistic skin texture
• Authentic proportions
• Minor imperfections preserved
• No beautification

AFTER PANEL — FILTERED VERSION (CRITICAL TRANSFORMATION):
• Ultra-smooth poreless skin
• Enlarged glossy eyes
• Slimmed nose and sharpened jawline
• Plumped lips
• Evened skin tone
• Brightened whites of eyes
• Artificial glow
• Subtle facial reshaping
• Slight soft-focus depth blur

IF OBVIOUS FILTER MODE (0):
• Visible beauty filter UI icons
• Sparkle overlays
• Soft glow effects
• Filter sliders maxed out
• "Beauty Mode: MAX" or similar on-screen indicator
• Optional heat waves or slight smoke from phone for satire

IF SECRET FILTER MODE (1):
• NO visible UI elements
• NO sparkle graphics
• NO obvious digital overlays
• Must appear like a "natural" selfie
• Alterations should be extreme but disguised as subtle
• Viewer should suspect heavy filtering despite the claim of "#NOFILTER"

STYLE:
• Vertical smartphone selfie aesthetic
• High-resolution modern phone camera look
• Social media caption style optional
• Clean split comparison layout

IDENTITY PRESERVATION:
• Subject must remain clearly recognizable
• Do not replace the person
• Do not alter ethnicity, age category, or core facial structure

HUMOR GOAL:
• Satirize exaggerated social media beautification
• Contrast honesty vs digital manipulation
• Emphasize irony of the "#NOFILTER" label

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must clearly show a realistic "Before" beside a heavily beautified "#NOFILTER" version, either obviously filtered (with UI visible) or deceptively filtered (no visible UI), determined strictly by the modulo selection.

name: 21st DOCTOR
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into the Doctor from the television series Doctor Who.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• The subject must be fully transformed into a version of the Doctor
• The subject is not an actor portraying the Doctor — the subject IS the Doctor
• The subject’s recognizable facial identity must be preserved while fully integrated into the role

DOCTOR TRANSFORMATION (CRITICAL):
• The subject must be fully costumed as the Doctor
• Clothing should reflect a specific Doctor era (tailored coat, suit, scarf, bow tie, or equivalent era-appropriate attire)
• The subject must be holding or wearing iconic Doctor gadgets (e.g., sonic screwdriver, psychic paper, wrist devices)

PROPS & ICONOGRAPHY (CRITICAL):
• The TARDIS must appear clearly in the scene (interior or exterior)
• Additional Doctor Who props may include:
  – Gallifreyan symbols
  – Alien technology
  – Time vortex elements
  – Era-specific tools or devices
• Props must feel physically present in the scene — not overlays or stickers

SEASON & ERA ADAPTATION LOGIC (CRITICAL):
• Automatically select ONE Doctor Who season or era
• The entire scene must visually adjust to match that era, including:
  – Costume styling
  – Color grading
  – Lighting style
  – Environmental design
• Examples:
  – Classic era: studio-lit sets, practical effects, theatrical staging
  – Modern era: cinematic lighting, dynamic angles, atmospheric depth

ENVIRONMENT:
• The subject must be placed within a believable Doctor Who setting
• Locations may include alien worlds, futuristic corridors, Earth-based locations, or the TARDIS interior
• The environment must feel lived-in and story-driven

CAMERA & LIGHTING:
• Cinematic framing
• Era-appropriate contrast and color palette
• Dynamic but grounded composition — no exaggerated superhero posing

TONE:
• Adventurous, intelligent, and heroic
• Sense of motion, urgency, or curiosity
• Never parody or cosplay

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must look like a real promotional still or episode frame from Doctor Who, with the subject fully embodied as the Doctor, equipped with iconic gadgets, placed in a season-accurate setting, and seamlessly integrated into the Doctor Who universe.

name: 3D FIGURINE
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a 3D figurine.

FIGURE STYLE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If external master prompt specifies style, USE THAT
• Otherwise SELECT using RANDOM SEED modulo 4:
  - 0: Dynamic superhero action figure
  - 1: Cute chibi collectible
  - 2: Trendy streetwear fashion figure
  - 3: Stylized gaming-inspired figure

FINAL RESULT:
The image should resemble a high-quality 3D collectible figurine.

name: 3D PLAYFUL ART
message: Take a picture and render the image as 3D playful art that combines dimensional modeling with whimsical, cartoon-inspired aesthetics using rounded forms and bright colors. Exaggerate proportions and features beyond realistic limits to enhance the playful, toy-like appeal - big heads, small bodies, oversized eyes. Use bouncy, rounded forms with soft edges instead of sharp angles to maintain a friendly, approachable character design. Apply bright, highly saturated colors with soft ambient lighting to create an inviting, cheerful atmosphere. Add subtle rim lighting and soft shadows for depth. The subject should look like a premium 3D character render. Pixar-style rendering quality, clay animation influence, tactile and dimensional appearance, designer toy aesthetic.

name: 3D PRINT
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a real, physical 3D-printed object actively being printed on a consumer 3D printer.

PRINT OUTCOME (CRITICAL):
• SELECT EXACTLY ONE outcome using the RANDOM SEED
• Use LAST DIGIT modulo 2:
  - 0: FAILED PRINT — the subject appears as a clearly failed 3D print with severe defects such as warped or shifted layers, collapsed overhangs, stringing, drooping filament, missing sections, or incomplete geometry as if the print misaligned or stopped mid-job
  - 1: NEARLY FINISHED PRINT — the subject appears mostly complete but still imperfect and actively printing, with visible layer lines, minor surface defects, rough edges, and small inaccuracies

PRINTER REQUIREMENTS (MANDATORY):
• The printer’s extruder assembly must be clearly visible above the print
• The build plate must be visible beneath the object
• The subject must be attached to or resting on the build surface
• The scene must look like a real mid-print moment, not a finished display

IDENTITY PRESERVATION (CRITICAL FOR HUMANS OR ANIMALS):
• If the subject is a human or animal, the print must remain identifiable
• The head must be at least partially completed
• The eyes must be clearly formed and recognizable
• Avoid prints that consist only of isolated body parts or unrecognizable fragments

MATERIAL AND REALISM:
• Subject must clearly appear made from plastic filament
• Visible horizontal layer lines across the entire surface
• Realistic extrusion paths and filament behavior
• Single solid filament color or limited two-color print

ENVIRONMENT AND STYLE:
• Neutral workshop or maker-space setting
• Realistic shadows and reflections
• Shallow depth of field
• Natural, practical lighting
• Avoid smooth, sculpted, or digital-rendered surfaces

FINAL RESULT:
The image must look like a real photograph of a physical 3D printer mid-print, showing the extruder, build plate, and a recognizable subject either failing or nearly finished, determined strictly by the random seed.

name: 80s AND 90s ACTION FILMS
message:
Take a picture of the subject and place them into a scene from a classic 1980s or 1990s action film.

FILM SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a film, USE THAT FILM
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the RANDOM SEED
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 19:
  - 0: Die Hard (1988) - Nakatomi Plaza, barefoot on glass, white tank top, "Yippee-ki-yay"
  - 1: Lethal Weapon (1987) - buddy cop duo, too old for this, jumping from buildings
  - 2: Terminator (1984) - cyborg chase, Tech Noir nightclub, "I'll be back", post-apocalyptic future
  - 3: Terminator 2 (1991) - liquid metal T-1000, motorcycle chase, thumbs up in molten steel
  - 4: Speed (1994) - bus can't go below 50 mph, Los Angeles highways, bomb on board
  - 5: Predator (1987) - jungle warfare, invisible alien hunter, "Get to the chopper!"
  - 6: RoboCop (1987) - cyborg cop, Detroit crime, "Dead or alive you're coming with me"
  - 7: Total Recall (1990) - Mars colony, memory implants, three-breasted woman, "Get your ass to Mars"
  - 8: Demolition Man (1993) - frozen criminals, future Los Angeles, three seashells, Taco Bell
  - 9: True Lies (1994) - spy dad, Harrier jump jet, bridge on horseback, tango scene
  - 10: Face/Off (1997) - face transplant, John Travolta and Nicolas Cage, Mexican standoff, doves flying
  - 11: The Rock (1996) - Alcatraz takeover, VX gas rockets, "Your best? Losers whine about their best"
  - 12: Con Air (1997) - hijacked prisoner plane, "Put the bunny back in the box", mullet and muscle
  - 13: Point Break (1991) - surfing bank robbers, skydiving without parachute, FBI undercover
  - 14: Commando (1985) - one-man army, "Let off some steam Bennett", toolshed armory
  - 15: Cliffhanger (1993) - mountain climbing, stolen money, Colorado Rockies, opening rescue fail
  - 16: Under Siege (1992) - battleship takeover, cook is actually a SEAL, "I'm just a cook"
  - 17: Hard Target (1993) - human hunting, Jean-Claude Van Dam kicks, New Orleans, John Woo doves
  - 18: Tango & Cash (1989) - mismatched cop duo, prison break, Rambo parody, big guns

PLACE THE SUBJECT:
• Subject as the action hero or main participant
• Performing dramatic stunt or action sequence
• Holding period-appropriate weapons (MP5, Desert Eagle, shotgun)
• In iconic location from that film
• Interacting with environment (explosions, vehicles, stunts)

80s/90s ACTION ELEMENTS:
• Practical explosions and stunts (no CGI)
• One-liner catchphrase moment
• Excessive firepower
• Ripped clothing or white tank top
• Muscles and sweat
• Hero pose with weapon
• Villain or henchmen visible

SETTING DETAILS:
• Period-accurate vehicles (1980s-90s cars, choppers)
• Urban decay or exotic locations
• Skyscrapers, helicopters, speedboats
• Practical effects (real fire, real crashes)
• Film grain and color grading of the era

STYLE:
• Cinematic action still
• 35mm film quality
• Dramatic lighting with practical fire/explosions
• Over-the-top masculine action hero aesthetic
• Larger-than-life spectacle
• Gritty but colorful

COSTUME:
• White tank top, leather jacket, or tactical vest
• Ammunition belts, holsters
• Ripped or battle-damaged clothing
• Sunglasses if appropriate
• Headband (for Rambo-style)
• Era-appropriate fashion

OPTIONAL HUMOR:
• Awkward hero pose
• Improbable stunt frozen mid-action
• Ridiculous expression
• Over-the-top machismo
• Absurdly large weapons

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a cinematic action movie still from the selected 80s or 90s film with the subject as the action hero, complete with practical explosions, period weapons, iconic locations, and that era's specific brand of excessive masculine spectacle and one-liner delivery.

name: 80s PROM DATE
message:
Take a picture and transform it into an awkward 1980s prom photo taken at a high school prom.

The image should look like a posed flash photograph from the 1980s: harsh on-camera flash, flat lighting, soft focus, slight film grain, and muted color tones. Include typical prom decorations such as metallic balloons, crepe paper, tinsel, streamers, and a banner with the school name and graduation year (use external master prompt text if provided; otherwise invent a generic school name and year).

Dress all subjects in unmistakably tacky 1980s prom attire. Examples include oversized tuxedos, pastel or ruffled dresses, lace gloves, corsages, bow ties, cummerbunds, sequins, and shiny fabrics. Hairstyles must be exaggerated and era-accurate: big teased hair, feathered bangs, mullets, perms, or excessive hairspray volume.

Subject logic:
• If there is ONE subject and the subject appears masculine, add an older woman who plausibly looks like the subject’s mother as the prom date. She should be dressed formally but slightly out of place.
• If there is ONE subject and the subject appears feminine, add a younger boy who plausibly looks like a younger brother as the prom date. He should appear underdressed or uncomfortable.
• If there are TWO human subjects, present them as prom dates together, standing close but visibly awkward, stiff, or uncomfortable.

Body language should feel forced and uncomfortable: stiff smiles, arms held too rigidly, hands awkwardly placed, or obvious personal space tension. No one should look confident or natural.

Ensure the entire photo is fully visible within the frame, like a complete printed prom photo. The final image should feel painfully nostalgic, humorously awkward, and unmistakably 1980s — readable and funny on a small screen.

name: AI-BUY
message: Analyze the image and identify purchasable items. Provide product names, estimated prices, and purchase links. Present results in a clean, structured list and email it to me.

name: AI-IDENTIFY
message: Analyze the image in detail. Identify people, objects, environment, actions, expressions, and context. Provide a comprehensive, factual description without speculation and email it to me.

name: AI-SUMMARIZE
message: Analyze the image and provide a comprehensive summary of what is depicted, including context, activity, and notable visual details and email it to me.

name: AI-TRANSLATE
message: Analyze the image and detect any visible text in the image and translate it accurately into English. Preserve formatting where possible and email it to me.

name: A WHO
message: Take a picture and make the subject into a Who from Whoville from Dr. Seuss. Make it photorealistic.

name: ABSTRACT ART
message: Take a picture in the style of Abstract Modern Art. Non-representational shapes, bold composition.

name: ABSTRACT EXPRESSIONISM
message: Take a picture and transform the image into Abstract Expressionist style. Energetic splatters, layered textures, and dynamic forms while subject partially visible.

name: ABYSS PSEUDOPOD
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject's face into the iconic water pseudopod creature from James Cameron's 1989 film The Abyss - the extraordinary moment where an alien intelligence forms a narrow elongated tube or column of water with ONLY the subject's face appearing at the very tip.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• The pseudopod is a NARROW ELONGATED TUBE OR COLUMN OF WATER rising from the ocean surface
• The tube is smooth, cylindrical, and translucent - like a living water hose or tendril
• ONLY at the very TIP of this tube does the subject's face appear
• The face forms ONLY from water - no hair, no neck, no shoulders - JUST the face at the tip
• The face has NO hair whatsoever - hair does not exist on a water pseudopod
• The face is formed purely from the surface tension and fluid dynamics of the water tip
• The tube rises from a disturbed water surface below
• Faithful to the actual visual in The Abyss (1989) - a snake-like tendril of water with a face at the end
• The pseudopod leans or curves slightly as if examining something with curiosity
• This is NOT a human in water - it is water that has formed itself into a face shape at its tip

PSEUDOPOD TUBE STRUCTURE (CRITICAL):
• The main body is a smooth narrow cylinder of water:
  - Width: roughly the diameter of a human head or slightly narrower
  - Height: tall and elongated, rising several body lengths from the water surface
  - Surface: smooth with gentle ripples suggesting internal flow
  - Color: crystal clear with deep blue-green ocean tint
  - Translucent: you can see through the walls of the tube
  - Internal flow visible: currents moving upward through the column
• The tube may curve or arc gracefully like a cobra raising its head
• The base where it meets the water surface creates concentric ripples
• The tube narrows very slightly toward the tip where the face forms
• NO branches, NO tendrils, NO hair-like extensions from the tube
• The tube is a single clean column of water - simple and elegant

FACE AT THE TIP (CRITICAL):
• The subject's face forms ONLY at the very top tip of the water column
• The face transitions seamlessly from the tube below - water becoming face shape
• Features formed entirely from water surface tension and fluid dynamics:
  - Eyes: subtle curved depressions in the water surface
  - Nose: gentle forward protrusion of the water tip
  - Mouth: slight undulation suggesting lips
  - Cheeks and chin: smooth curved water surfaces
• NO HAIR - the top of the head is smooth rounded water, like the tube continuing
• NO neck visible - the face emerges directly from the tube
• NO ears visible - the sides of the head are smooth water curves
• The face is RECOGNIZABLE as the subject through water fluid dynamics alone
• Expression: eerily calm, curious, tilted slightly as if examining the viewer
• The face is translucent at edges, more opaque at center where features concentrate
• Top of the head: smooth rounded water surface, no hair, no scalp - just water

WATER PHYSICAL PROPERTIES:
• Perfect transparency with deep blue-green ocean tint
• Bioluminescent glow from within the entire column (alien intelligence inside)
• Caustic light patterns rippling along the tube surface
• Surface tension creates the smooth cylindrical shape
• Micro-droplets and fine mist at edges where water meets air
• Alien physics: the column defies normal water behavior by holding its shape
• Slight iridescence suggesting alien intelligence animating the water
• Internal upward currents visible through the translucent walls
• Where the face forms at the tip: water bulges very slightly outward
• Droplets may threaten to fall from the chin area

BIOLUMINESCENCE AND LIGHTING (CRITICAL):
• Soft blue-white glow from within the water column
• The glow is brightest in the column body, slightly brighter at the face tip
• Light pulses gently suggesting the creature breathing or thinking
• Caustic light patterns projected onto the water surface below
• Surrounding environment lit by the pseudopod's glow
• Light color: blue-white (#B0E0FF) to teal (#00CED1)
• No harsh shadows - diffused light through water
• The column is the ONLY significant light source in the scene

SURROUNDING ENVIRONMENT:
• Dark deep ocean water surface from which the column rises
• Concentric ripples radiating from the base of the column
• Flooded underwater station corridor optional:
  - Industrial metal walls with rivets
  - Submerged equipment and pipes
  - Distant dim emergency lighting (red-orange at far edges only)
  - Dark water filling the corridor floor
• Vast darkness surrounding the glowing column
• Depth implied below the water surface
• Atmosphere of deep ocean isolation and alien wonder
• The column occupies CENTER FRAME rising from bottom to top

CAMERA AND COMPOSITION:
• The pseudopod fills the vertical center of the frame
• Camera at mid-height looking slightly upward toward the face at the tip
• The full length of the column visible from water surface to face at top
• The face at the tip is the focal point
• Environment provides dark context at edges
• The column glows against near-total darkness
• Slight angle as if the pseudopod has bent to face the camera
• Cinematic widescreen composition

COLOR PALETTE:
• Surrounding water and environment: deep blue-black (#000814)
• Water column body: crystal clear blue-green (#40E0D0 to #006994)
• Bioluminescence: blue-white (#B0E0FF) to teal (#00CED1)
• Caustic patterns: pale blue-white on water surface
• Emergency lighting if present: dim red-orange at extreme edges only
• The glowing column is the ONLY bright element against total darkness
• No warm colors except distant emergency lighting

WHAT MUST NOT APPEAR (CRITICAL):
• NO hair of any kind on the water face
• NO neck or shoulders
• NO body below the face
• NO multiple tendrils or branches
• NO clothing or accessories
• NO non-water textures on the pseudopod
• NO solid opaque surfaces - the pseudopod is always translucent water
• The top of the head is smooth rounded water - NOT a human scalp

FINAL RESULT:
A breathtaking cinematic image of a narrow elongated translucent tube of glowing alien water rising from a dark ocean surface, with the subject's recognizable face formed entirely from water at the very tip of the column. The tube is smooth, cylindrical, and bioluminescent - a single clean column of living water with no branches, no hair, no body - just the pure water pseudopod exactly as seen in James Cameron's 1989 film. The face at the tip has no hair, no neck, no shoulders - it emerges directly from the water column as a fluid dynamic expression of alien curiosity, the features formed from surface tension alone, tilted slightly as if examining the viewer with otherworldly intelligence. The surrounding environment is near-total darkness lit only by the eerie blue-white glow emanating from within the alien water column.

name: ACCIDENT SCENE
message:
Take a picture and transform the main subject so it appears to have recently been involved in an accident. Preserve the original subject while adding realistic damage appropriate to its type.

Examples include:
• A car with dents, cracked lights, bent panels, or deployed airbags
• A bicycle with twisted wheels, scraped paint, or a broken chain
• A scooter, skateboard, or similar object with visible impact damage

Add subtle environmental clues such as skid marks, fallen debris, or disturbed surroundings when appropriate. The final image should look like a realistic aftermath photo, and remain clear on small screens.

name: ACHEIROPOIETA
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform the subject’s face so that it appears to be the original face that inspired one of the historically venerated acheiropoieta images.

IMAGE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies an icon, USE THAT ICON
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the RANDOM SEED
• Use LAST DIGIT modulo 6:
  - 0: Mandylion (Image of Edessa)
  - 1: Hodegetria
  - 2: Shroud of Turin
  - 3: Veil of Veronica
  - 4: Our Lady of Guadalupe
  - 5: Manoppello Image

TARGETING RULE (ABSOLUTE):
• ONLY the primary sacred face of the selected icon may be transformed
• ALL other figures, garments, backgrounds, halos, inscriptions, and composition elements must remain EXACTLY as in the historical original
• If the selected image contains multiple figures (e.g., Hodegetria), ONLY the central sacred face is transformed
• No other figure may be altered in any way

FACIAL INTEGRITY RULE (CRITICAL):
• The subject’s facial structure must be preserved
• DO NOT add facial hair, long hair, or features that the subject does not possess
• DO NOT remove defining features the subject does possess
• Adapt the subject’s real facial structure into the iconographic style without inventing new anatomy
• The result must look like the historical icon was originally painted from this subject
• This must NOT look like a face swap or pasted photograph

STYLE & COLOR ACCURACY (MANDATORY):
• The icon must match the exact artistic style, brushwork, pigment palette, proportions, and symmetry conventions of the historical artifact
• Use the same historical color scheme as the original icon
• Do NOT modernize or reinterpret the art style
• The subject’s face must be rendered fully in the original icon’s artistic language

HISTORICAL CONDITION (CRITICAL):
• Depict the artifact exactly as it exists today — aged, worn, unrestored
• Include authentic cracking paint, faded pigments, discoloration, textile weave, scorch marks, or centuries of wear as appropriate
• If the selected artifact is monochrome (e.g., Shroud of Turin), render the face in authentic grayscale tonal form
• If painted in color, preserve correct historical pigments and iconographic coloration

COMPOSITION:
• Show the full artifact as documented in its preserved state
• No restoration, enhancement, or cleaning
• Museum-photograph realism

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must look indistinguishable from the historical artifact as it exists today, except that the sacred face appears to have originally been modeled from the subject’s true facial structure, without added features or alteration of surrounding figures.

name: ACROBATS
message:
Take a picture of the subject or subjects performing extreme, fantastical acrobatic feats.

Include:
• Multi-person stacked formations, human pyramids, or chains
• Impossible balances, mid-air catches, and synchronized aerial stunts
• Gravity-defying choreography that appears physically implausible yet believable

Bodies must interact realistically with visible tension, grip, and support — showing weight distribution and contact points.

Subjects can be dressed in circus, acrobatic, or performance attire appropriate for the scene.

Lighting, environment, and perspective should match a professional acrobatic stage, circus tent, or performance arena.

The final image should capture a surreal, awe-inspiring moment frozen in time, looking like a real performance photograph of impossible acrobatics.

name: ADVENTURE TIME
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a colorful, surreal cartoon world inspired by Adventure Time.

STYLE & CHARACTER RULES:
• Simple rounded shapes and elastic anatomy
• Bold outlines and flat, vibrant colors
• Whimsical proportions and exaggerated expressions
• Include multiple quirky cartoon characters native to this world
• Characters may be creatures, humanoids, or bizarre fantasy beings

SCENE & TONE:
• Playful, absurd, and slightly chaotic
• Bright candy-colored environments
• Cartoon physics and exaggerated motion allowed

The final image should look like a fully composed Adventure Time–style hand-drawn illustration with the subject and additional characters integrated seamlessly into the world.

name: ADVERTISEMENT
message: Take a picture and transform it into a polished magazine-style advertisement while preserving clear facial likeness and identity of the subject. Present the subject naturally holding, wearing, or interacting with the featured product as the central focus of the ad. Primary information source: If product details are provided via externally supplied information, showcase that product accurately as the main advertised item. Incorporate the product’s name, type, and defining qualities into the visual presentation, slogan, and flavor text without altering or misrepresenting the product. Secondary enhancement: If no product details are externally provided, infer a plausible featured product based on what the subject is visibly holding, wearing, or using. If inference is required, keep the product generic and clearly implied rather than naming a specific real-world brand. Design the final image as a compact, mobile-friendly magazine advertisement layout optimized for small screens. Include a bold, high-contrast headline or slogan, a short block of engaging flavor text, and subtle supporting copy if space allows. Ensure all text is legible at small sizes with clean spacing and strong visual hierarchy. Use flattering, high-quality lighting, refined composition, and a modern editorial aesthetic. Maintain visual clarity, balanced framing, and an immediately recognizable advertising look. The result should be a full view of the page with a relevant background behind the page.

name: AESOPS FABLE
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a character within an Aesop’s fable. Select a fable based on the subject’s appearance, posture, expression, or perceived traits (such as confidence, cleverness, laziness, pride, patience), OR use a specific fable provided via external master prompt.

Depict the subject as a story character (human or animal) fully integrated into a classic fable scene, not as a modern person placed into an illustration. The environment, props, and other characters should visually support the chosen fable.

Render the image as a single illustrated storybook page. Ensure the entire page is fully visible within the frame, including margins, illustration, and text area. Do not crop or cut off any part of the page.

Include the **title of the selected fable** prominently and clearly within the page layout, such as at the top of the page or in a decorative storybook header. The title must be fully visible and immediately identifiable to the viewer.

Include the moral of the fable displayed clearly within the page, such as on a parchment banner, book page caption, or decorative text panel. The moral must be short, legible, and directly related to the scene.

Use a traditional storybook illustration style inspired by classic engraved or painted children’s book art. Keep the composition simple, symbolic, and clearly readable on a small screen. The final image should feel like a complete, intact page from an illustrated fable book.

name: AFRICAN TRIBAL MASK
message: Take a picture and transform the image into African tribal mask art. Simplify facial features, use bold geometric shapes, earthy colors, carved-wood textures, and ceremonial symbolism while keeping the subject recognizable.

name: AIRPORT SECURITY SCAN
message:
Take a picture and place the subject in an airport full-body security scanner screen - that distinctive blue/orange thermal outline style with skeletal structure visible. The scan reveals something ridiculous and completely harmless hidden on the subject's person (in pockets, under jacket, in coat, etc.).

RIDICULOUS ITEM SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies the hidden item, USE that specified item
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE option using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Do NOT choose based on popularity, visual interest, or defaults

For 15 options:
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 15:
  - 0: A giant turkey leg in their pocket
  - 1: A NERF water gun tucked in their waistband
  - 2: A rubber chicken hidden under their jacket
  - 3: A comically large sandwich wrapped in foil in their coat
  - 4: A toy lightsaber strapped to their back under clothing
  - 5: A live chicken hidden inside their jacket
  - 6: A ukulele hidden under their coat
  - 7: Juggling pins down their pants
  - 8: A plunger tucked in their waistband
  - 9: Oversized novelty sunglasses in their inner coat pocket
  - 10: A small piglet hidden in their jacket
  - 11: A baguette sword down their pant leg
  - 12: A toy dinosaur in their hoodie pocket
  - 13: A garden gnome tucked under their arm inside coat
  - 14: A hamster in their breast pocket

TSA scanner aesthetic, orange and blue thermal imaging, skeletal outline visible, airport security monitor display with timestamp and scanner information. Safe, family-friendly, absurd humor.

name: ALBUM COVER
message:
Take a picture and recreate the subject as the main artist in a famous album cover, replacing the original artist while maintaining the iconic composition and style.

ALBUM SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies an album, USE THAT ALBUM
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 30:
  - 0: Abbey Road (The Beatles) - four people crossing zebra crossing, subject replaces one Beatle
  - 1: Dark Side of the Moon (Pink Floyd) - prism rainbow light, subject as silhouette or integrated into design
  - 2: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band (Beatles) - colorful crowd collage, subject in military uniform
  - 3: Nevermind (Nirvana) - underwater baby reaching for dollar bill (subject as older person in water)
  - 4: Born in the USA (Bruce Springsteen) - subject from behind, red cap, American flag, jeans
  - 5: Thriller (Michael Jackson) - subject in white suit on dark background, iconic pose
  - 6: The Velvet Underground & Nico - Andy Warhol banana design, subject holding or as banana
  - 7: London Calling (The Clash) - subject smashing guitar, dramatic pose, bold typography
  - 8: OK Computer (Radiohead) - abstract expressway interchange, subject in modern alienation
  - 9: Purple Rain (Prince) - subject on motorcycle in purple fog/smoke
  - 10: Back in Black (AC/DC) - minimalist black background, subject silhouette with hat
  - 11: Led Zeppelin IV - mystical old man with sticks, rural setting
  - 12: The Wall (Pink Floyd) - white brick wall, subject behind or breaking through
  - 13: Rumours (Fleetwood Mac) - Stevie Nicks and Mick Fleetwood, black flowing attire, ballet pose
  - 14: Unknown Pleasures (Joy Division) - pulsar wave lines, subject silhouette with iconic waves
  - 15: Appetite for Destruction (Guns N' Roses) - cross with skulls design, subject as skull or rocker
  - 16: The Joshua Tree (U2) - desert landscape with Joshua tree, band silhouettes
  - 17: Ziggy Stardust (David Bowie) - subject as glam alien rockstar, colorful makeup
  - 18: Hotel California (Eagles) - sunset hotel photograph, mysterious vintage aesthetic
  - 19: Blonde on Blonde (Bob Dylan) - blurred portrait, scarf, moody artistic photography
  - 20: What's Going On (Marvin Gaye) - subject in raincoat, contemplative, rainy urban setting
  - 21: Kind of Blue (Miles Davis) - minimalist, jazz aesthetic, subject with trumpet
  - 22: Enter the Wu-Tang (Wu-Tang Clan) - subject in martial arts pose, dramatic lighting
  - 23: The Chronic (Dr. Dre) - subject with chronic leaf imagery, West Coast aesthetic
  - 24: Aja (Steely Dan) - Japanese aesthetic, subject in artistic Asian-inspired setting
  - 25: Blood Sugar Sex Magik (Red Hot Chili Peppers) - faces in close-up, artistic photography
  - 26: Exile on Main St. (Rolling Stones) - collage style, circus freaks aesthetic
  - 27: Wish You Were Here (Pink Floyd) - businessman shaking hands while on fire
  - 28: The Rise and Fall of Ziggy Stardust (Bowie) - phone booth at night, glam rock styling
  - 29: Are You Experienced (Jimi Hendrix) - psychedelic fish-eye portrait, 60s color saturation

RECREATE THE ALBUM:
• Subject replaces the original artist in the iconic pose/composition
• Match the original photography style, lighting, and color grading
• Include all iconic elements (props, background, styling)
• Preserve the album's aesthetic and mood
• Subject's face clearly recognizable but styled as the album character
• Match clothing, hair, makeup to the era and album style

INCLUDE:
• Album title and artist name typography in original style
• Record label logo if iconic to the design
• Any text or graphic elements from original cover
• Authentic period details

STYLE:
• Match the original photography technique (film grain, color processing, etc.)
• Authentic to the era (60s psychedelic, 70s analog, 80s bold, 90s raw)
• Photorealistic recreation
• Subject appears as if they were the original artist

FINAL RESULT:
The image should be an authentic recreation of the iconic album cover with the subject seamlessly replacing the original artist, maintaining all the compositional elements, styling, and aesthetic that made the album cover famous.

name: ALBUM TRACKLIST COVER
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into the main artist featured on a full vinyl record album cover.

The subject must be styled, dressed, and posed to clearly match a specific music genre and era inferred from their appearance, expression, clothing, environment, or mood. The visual aesthetic must strongly reflect a historically appropriate vinyl-era release year. For example:
• 1960s–70s Rock → analog grain, warm tones, natural light, leather or denim
• 1970s Disco → glossy photography, bold colors, dramatic poses
• 1980s Pop → neon accents, airbrushed look, studio lighting
• 1990s Grunge / Hip-hop → gritty texture, muted colors, urban realism
• 1950s–60s Jazz → monochrome or sepia, elegant composition
• Punk → raw, DIY photocopy look

If the genre is unclear, choose the most fitting genre and era based on the subject’s vibe and surroundings.

Design the image as a complete, square vinyl record cover. The subject must be clearly identifiable as the singer or band front-person, fully integrated into the composition — not pasted in. Lighting, color grading, and framing must feel intentional and era-accurate.

Add album typography directly onto the cover:
• Artist name (based on the subject or a humorous alias inspired by them)
• Album title (creative and genre-appropriate)
• A clearly visible tracklist arranged in a vinyl-typical layout
• A release year prominently displayed that matches the visual era (e.g., 1977, 1984, 1993)

The track names should collectively tell a loose story or emotional arc inspired by the subject’s appearance, pose, or environment. Titles should feel believable for the chosen genre and decade.

Optionally include era-appropriate vinyl details such as:
• Record label logo
• Catalog number
• Stereo / Mono indicator
• Parental Advisory label (only if appropriate for the genre)

Use authentic vinyl album design conventions: readable period-accurate fonts, balanced spacing, subtle print texture, and slight wear or aging if appropriate. The final image must unmistakably read as a real vinyl album cover and remain legible on small screens.

name: ALEXANDER THE PRETTY GOOD
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a historical figure who was notable but overshadowed by a more famous contemporary, presented as a formal museum portrait with the figure's name captioned below.

HISTORICAL FIGURE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a particular historical figure who was overshadowed, USE THAT FIGURE and their actual name
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST TWO DIGITS of the RANDOM SEED modulo 20:
  - 0: Antonio Salieri (composer overshadowed by Mozart)
  - 1: Buzz Aldrin (second man on the moon after Neil Armstrong)
  - 2: Rosalind Franklin (scientist whose DNA work was credited to Watson & Crick)
  - 3: Nikola Tesla (inventor overshadowed by Edison in his time)
  - 4: Leif Erikson (reached America before Columbus)
  - 5: Wilhelm Röntgen (discovered X-rays but Nobel went to others later)
  - 6: Robert Falcon Scott (reached South Pole after Amundsen)
  - 7: George Everest (mountain named after him but never climbed it)
  - 8: Samuel Morse (credited for telegraph but didn't invent it alone)
  - 9: Amerigo Vespucci (America named after him, not Columbus)
  - 10: Aaron Burr (VP overshadowed by Hamilton)
  - 11: Salomon August Andrée (tried to reach North Pole by balloon, failed)
  - 12: Robert Hooke (scientist overshadowed by Newton)
  - 13: Wilhelm Steinitz (first world chess champion, forgotten compared to later greats)
  - 14: Ptolemy (astronomer whose geocentric model was replaced by Copernicus)
  - 15: Jean-François Champollion (deciphered hieroglyphics but Rosetta Stone gets credit)
  - 16: James Buchanan (president before Lincoln during brewing crisis)
  - 17: Martin Waldseemüller (mapmaker who named America)
  - 18: Charles Curtis (first Native American VP, largely forgotten)
  - 19: Stanislav Petrov (prevented nuclear war, received little recognition)

CAPTION WITH NAME (CRITICAL):
• The portrait MUST include a museum-style caption plaque beneath the painting
• The caption shows the ACTUAL NAME of the historical figure portrayed
• Format: "[FIGURE'S FULL NAME]" followed by dates and a subtitle
• Examples:
  - "ANTONIO SALIERI (1750-1825) - A Contemporary of Lesser Renown"
  - "BUZZ ALDRIN (1930-) - The Second Man"
  - "ROSALIND FRANKLIN (1920-1958) - Unrecognized in Her Time"
  - "LEIF ERIKSON (c. 970-1020) - First, But Not Famous"
• Caption font: elegant serif (like museum placards)
• Caption color: gold, brass, or engraved black on brass/bronze plaque
• Caption placement: centered below portrait, museum plaque style

SUBJECT AS HISTORICAL FIGURE (CRITICAL):
• The subject's face MUST remain clearly recognizable
• Subject's face replaces the historical figure's face in the portrait
• Subject rendered in period-appropriate portraiture style
• Subject wears clothing accurate to the historical figure's era and status
• Subject's facial features preserved but adapted to painting/engraving style
• Subject appears dignified and historically important

CORE CONCEPT (MANDATORY):
• The subject must be portrayed as competent, dignified, and historically significant
• Tone must be respectful, not insulting - these were accomplished people
• The humor comes from subtle historical positioning as "second best," not mockery
• The presentation honors their real achievements while acknowledging they were overshadowed
• The subject should look like an authentic historical portrait from their era

HISTORICAL PORTRAIT STYLE BY ERA:
• 16th-17th century: Oil painting, dark background, Dutch Masters style
• 18th century: Neoclassical portrait, softer lighting, Romantic era influence
• 19th century: Formal painted portrait or early photograph (daguerreotype/sepia)
• Early 20th century: Formal photographic portrait, studio setting
• Mid-20th century: Professional black & white or color photograph

PERIOD-ACCURATE CLOTHING:
• Subject wears historically accurate attire for the figure's era and profession:
  - 18th century composer: powdered wig, coat with lace cuffs, cravat
  - Victorian scientist: formal suit, high collar, possibly laboratory coat
  - Medieval explorer: Norse or period-appropriate garments
  - 20th century figures: era-appropriate suits, uniforms, or formal wear
• Clothing shows status and profession
• Accessories appropriate to their field (musical instruments, scientific tools, etc.)

ARTISTIC TECHNIQUE:
• Classical oil painting aesthetic for pre-1850 figures:
  - Visible brushstrokes in Baroque/Romantic style
  - Chiaroscuro lighting (dramatic light and shadow)
  - Rich, deep colors with aged patina
  - Craquelure (fine cracks) in paint surface
• Engraved portrait style for some 18th-19th century figures:
  - Cross-hatching and line work
  - Black and white or sepia tones
  - Steel engraving quality
• Daguerreotype/early photography for 19th century:
  - Sepia or black and white
  - Soft focus, long exposure quality
  - Formal posed stiffness
• Modern photography for 20th century figures:
  - Professional studio portrait
  - Formal but more natural pose

COMPOSITION AND FRAMING:
• Traditional portrait composition:
  - Head and shoulders or three-quarter length
  - Slight turn of the body (classical contrapposto)
  - Hands visible if relevant (holding objects of their profession)
  - Eyes gazing slightly off-camera or at viewer
• Background appropriate to subject:
  - Dark neutral for dramatic effect
  - Study/laboratory setting
  - Landscape relevant to their achievements
  - Symbolic objects in background
• Ornate gilded frame surrounding the portrait (museum display)

LIGHTING AND ATMOSPHERE:
• Soft dramatic lighting from one side (Rembrandt lighting)
• Rich shadows creating depth and gravitas
• Highlights on face and hands
• Museum-quality preservation appearance
• Slightly aged or vintage quality
• Dignified, solemn atmosphere

COLOR PALETTE:
• Rich, muted historical colors:
  - Deep burgundies, forest greens, navy blues
  - Warm browns and golds
  - Ivory and cream for highlights
  - Aged patina overtone
• Color saturation appropriate to era:
  - Vibrant but aged for oil paintings
  - Sepia tones for 19th century
  - Black and white for early photos

MUSEUM DISPLAY CONTEXT:
• Portrait appears as if hanging in a prestigious museum
• Ornate gilded frame (baroque, rococo, or neoclassical style)
• Museum caption plaque mounted below frame
• Subtle gallery lighting from above
• Neutral museum wall (cream, gray, or burgundy)
• Professional museum presentation

CAPTION PLAQUE DESIGN:
• Brass, bronze, or engraved metal appearance
• Rectangle mounted on wall below portrait
• Elegant serif typeface (Trajan, Garamond, or similar)
• Figure's full name in larger text
• Birth and death years (or birth year if still living)
• Subtitle describing their "almost greatness" with dignity:
  - "A Contemporary of Lesser Renown"
  - "The Other Discoverer"
  - "Arrived Second"
  - "Overshadowed But Not Forgotten"
  - "Notable in His Own Right"
  - "A Worthy Rival"
• Caption must be clearly legible

TONE AND RESPECT:
• The portrait must be dignified and respectful
• These were real accomplished people with genuine achievements
• Humor is gentle - about historical circumstance, not personal failure
• Subject appears competent, intelligent, and historically important
• The "overshadowed" aspect is presented as bad luck or timing, not lack of ability
• No mockery, no degradation, no insults
• Celebrate their real contributions while acknowledging they weren't "the most famous"

SUBJECT'S EXPRESSION:
• Dignified and composed
• Slight melancholy or philosophical gaze (aware of their place in history)
• Intelligent and thoughtful
• Confident but not arrogant
• Appropriate gravitas for historical portraiture

FINAL RESULT:
A museum-quality historical portrait where the subject's recognizable face has been seamlessly integrated into the likeness of a specific historical figure who was genuinely accomplished but overshadowed by a more famous contemporary. The portrait is rendered in the authentic artistic style of the figure's era (oil painting, engraving, or period photograph), hangs in an ornate frame with professional museum lighting, and features a brass caption plaque clearly displaying the historical figure's actual name, dates, and a dignified subtitle acknowledging their "second place" status in history. The tone is respectful and the presentation honors real historical achievement while gently noting the irony of being very good but not quite great enough to be remembered as prominently as their more famous rival.

name: ALIEN
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into an alien being while preserving the subject’s core facial structure and identity. Introduce extraterrestrial traits such as altered skin color or texture, subtle bioluminescence, unusual eyes, or refined anatomical variations that still clearly resemble the subject. Place the subject naturally into a sci-fi environment such as an alien world, spacecraft interior, or futuristic city. Match lighting, perspective, and atmospheric effects so the subject appears genuinely part of the scene. Render the final image with photorealistic sci-fi realism and cinematic depth.

name: ALIEN ABDUCTION
message:
Take a picture of the subject levitating inside a beam of light from a UFO.

The subject must appear physically suspended within the beam, with realistic shadows, reflections, and light interaction on their clothing and body.

The environment should be fully integrated — ground, surrounding scenery, and background lighting must react to the UFO beam naturally.

The beam may include atmospheric effects such as mist, dust, or subtle energy distortion. The subject should show expression or posture consistent with surprise, awe, or comedic fear.

The final image must look like a real photograph capturing a supernatural abduction moment, with no compositing shortcuts.

name: ALIENS
message:
Take a picture and place the subject in a scene from the movie Aliens. Dark sci-fi realism. Make it photorealistic.

The final image should look like the subject and additional characters are integrated seamlessly into the scene.

name: ALTER EGO
message: Take a picture and transform the image to reveal an alternate version of the subject. Same facial identity, different personality and visual style.

name: AMERICAN GOTHIC
message: Take a picture and recreate the classic painting American Gothic. Replace one figure in the painting with the subject. If the subject is male, replace the male figure. If the subject is female, replace the female figure. If two subjects are present, replace both figures accordingly. Preserve the iconic composition, clothing style, background, and serious tone of the original artwork while integrating the subject naturally. The final image should be instantly recognizable as American Gothic with a humorous modern twist.

name: ANAGLYPH 3D (3D Glasses Needed)
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a classic red/blue anaglyph 3D image designed to be viewed with red/cyan or red/blue 3D glasses.

Create two slightly offset views of the scene representing left-eye and right-eye perspectives. Overlay the left-eye view in red and the right-eye view in cyan/blue, aligning them to produce a convincing stereoscopic depth effect.

Depth should be readable through horizontal parallax: foreground elements should show noticeable red/blue separation, while background elements should align more closely.

Preserve the subject’s recognizability while allowing controlled color channel separation. Avoid excessive ghosting or misalignment that would make the image uncomfortable to view.

Lighting, shading, and form should remain realistic so the depth effect feels natural when viewed through 3D glasses.

Do not include Magic Eye patterns, lenticular effects, or split-frame stereoscopy. The image must be a single combined anaglyph composition.

The final image should clearly appear flat without glasses and distinctly three-dimensional when viewed through red/blue 3D glasses. Ensure the entire composition remains visible and readable on a small screen.

name: ANALOG FILM STRIP
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a vintage analog film strip.

STRUCTURE (MANDATORY):
• The final image must be a horizontal or vertical film strip
• Contain exactly 1, 2, or 3 frames — NEVER more than 3
• Frames must be evenly spaced and clearly separated

FRAME CONTENT RULES:
• Each frame must show the subject at a slightly different moment
• Small variations in pose, expression, or motion between frames
• Frames should feel sequential, as if captured moments apart

FILM MATERIAL REQUIREMENTS:
• Visible sprocket holes along the edges
• Black or dark brown film base
• Frame borders must look physically printed, not digital overlays

ANALOG IMPERFECTIONS (REQUIRED):
• Light leaks
• Film grain
• Dust, scratches, or hair
• Slight frame misalignment
• Uneven exposure between frames

COLOR & STYLE:
• Muted, aged color or true black-and-white
• Slight yellowing or sepia tint acceptable
• Soft contrast and faded highlights

TEXT & MARKINGS:
• Optional frame numbers or edge codes
• Optional handwritten or stamped markings
• No modern fonts or digital UI

ABSOLUTE PROHIBITIONS:
• NO more than three frames
• NO modern digital film simulations
• NO clean or perfect edges
• NO single-photo presentation

FINAL VALIDATION RULE:
If it looks like one photo with a film texture on top, IT IS WRONG.

The final image must look like a real, physical strip of exposed and developed photographic film containing up to three frames.

name: ANAMORPHIC ART
message: Take a picture and create an anamorphic image that appears distorted unless viewed from a specific angle. Correct perspective reveals the subject.

name: ANCIENT TIMES
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into wearing ancient civilization attire.

CIVILIZATION SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a civilization, USE THAT CIVILIZATION
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 30:
  - 0: Ancient Spartan (Greece - red cloak, bronze helmet, hoplite armor, lambda shield)
  - 1: Ancient Athenian (Greece - chiton, himation cloak, olive wreath, classical philosopher or citizen)
  - 2: Roman Legionnaire (Rome - lorica segmentata armor, gladius, scutum shield, centurion plume)
  - 3: Roman Senator (Rome - white toga with purple stripe, laurel wreath)
  - 4: Ancient Egyptian Pharaoh (Egypt - nemes headdress, false beard, was scepter, golden collar)
  - 5: Ancient Egyptian Common (Egypt - linen kilt/dress, simple jewelry, working attire)
  - 6: Mesopotamian (Babylon/Sumeria - long robes, conical hat, cuneiform tablets)
  - 7: Persian (Persia - elaborate robes, tiara, jeweled clothing)
  - 8: Viking Warrior (Scandinavia - chainmail, horned or winged helmet, round shield, axe)
  - 9: Viking Settler (Scandinavia - wool tunic, cloak, braided hair)
  - 10: Celtic Warrior (Britain/Gaul - woad paint, torcs, plaid patterns, long sword)
  - 11: Ancient Chinese (Han Dynasty - silk hanfu, topknot, jade accessories)
  - 12: Ancient Japanese (Yayoi - simple robes, samurai ancestor attire)
  - 13: Mayan (Mesoamerica - jade jewelry, elaborate headdress, glyphs)
  - 14: Aztec Warrior (Mesoamerica - feathered headdress, obsidian weapons, animal skins)
  - 15: Incan (South America - colorful textiles, gold ornaments, llama wool)
  - 16: Ancient Indian (Indus Valley - draped clothing, jewelry, turbans)
  - 17: Phoenician Trader (Mediterranean - merchant robes, purple dye, trading goods)
  - 18: Carthaginian (North Africa - Punic robes, military dress, Hannibal-era)
  - 19: Ancient Hebrew (Israel - biblical robes, head covering, sandals)
  - 20: Assyrian (Mesopotamia - long beards, conical hats, layered robes)
  - 21: Hittite (Anatolia - pointed shoes, long robes, ancient warrior)
  - 22: Minoan (Crete - colorful frescoed clothing, bare-chested style)
  - 23: Mycenaean (Greece - bronze age armor, boar tusk helmet)
  - 24: Etruscan (Italy - pre-Roman togas, bronze armor)
  - 25: Scythian (Central Asia - nomadic horseman, pointed hat, bow)
  - 26: Nubian (Sudan - gold jewelry, leopard skins, pharaoh rival)
  - 27: Ancient Korean (Goguryeo - layered robes, topknot, ancestor of hanbok)
  - 28: Mongol (Central Asia - fur-trimmed deel, horse rider, Genghis Khan era)
  - 29: Ancient Thai (Siam - simple wrapped clothing, golden jewelry)

PLACE THE SUBJECT:
• In period-appropriate setting (temple, battlefield, palace, marketplace)
• Surrounded by architecture appropriate to that civilization
• With period-appropriate props (weapons, tools, scrolls, pottery)
• Other people in background wearing similar attire

ATTIRE DETAILS:
• Full authentic costume including headwear, footwear, jewelry
• Weapons or tools appropriate to role (warrior, scholar, ruler, common person)
• Fabrics and materials historically accurate
• Colors and patterns specific to that civilization

STYLE:
• Photorealistic or classical painting style
• Epic, historical atmosphere
• Lighting appropriate to setting (torch-lit, sunlit, temple interior)
• Subject appears as genuine member of ancient civilization

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a historical recreation or period photograph showing the subject authentically dressed and positioned within their chosen ancient civilization.

name: ANDROID
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a humanoid android with advanced robotic features.

ANDROID TYPE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a specific android type, USE THAT TYPE
• If no type is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE type using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST DIGIT of the RANDOM SEED modulo 6:
  - 0: Corporate Luxury Model (pristine white/chrome, seamless panels, minimal mechanics, Apple aesthetic, showroom)
  - 1: Military Combat Unit (reinforced armor, tactical black/grey, exposed hydraulics, battle-damaged, armory)
  - 2: Domestic Service Model (friendly design, soft synthetic skin, clear tech panels, white/pastels, home setting)
  - 3: Industrial Worker (heavy-duty construction, yellow/black markings, reinforced joints, oil stains, factory)
  - 4: Prototype Research Unit (exposed wiring, transparent panels, incomplete skin, laboratory, test equipment)
  - 5: Entertainment Model (sleek attractive design, metallic colors, expressive LEDs, stage setting, artistic)

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• Subject becomes a sophisticated humanoid android
• Combination of human appearance and visible technology
• Sleek, futuristic design with exposed mechanical parts
• Subject's facial features and identity preserved
• Photorealistic sci-fi aesthetic
• Tone reflects artificial intelligence, technology, or humanity

IDENTITY RULES:
• Subject's face structure completely preserved
• Facial features clearly recognizable
• Eyes may be organic or synthetic/LED but match face
• Natural facial proportions maintained
• Expression conveys emotion (if capable)
• Subject remains themselves as android version

ANDROID DESIGN:
• Humanoid form maintaining subject's proportions
• Face clearly recognizable as the subject
• Synthetic skin areas showing realistic texture
• Exposed mechanical components at joints or panels
• LED lights, circuitry, or glowing elements
• Sleek, modern industrial design
• Moving parts and servo mechanisms visible
• Cable management and technical details

FACE AND HEAD DETAILS:
• Synthetic skin realistically textured
• Possible seam lines or panel edges
• LED or electronic eyes (optional)
• Exposed mechanics at jaw or temples
• Hair may be synthetic fiber or absent
• Ear components may be mechanical
• Realistic skin shader with slight artificial quality

BODY CONSTRUCTION:
• Endoskeleton visible at joints
• Synthetic muscle analogs or servo motors
• Power cells or battery packs
• Cooling systems with vents
• Hydraulic pistons at major joints
• Cable bundles connecting components
• Transparent panels showing internal tech
• Articulated fingers with visible mechanisms

MATERIALS:
• Brushed aluminum or titanium alloys
• Carbon fiber components
• Synthetic polymer skin
• Rubber gaskets and seals
• LED lighting elements
• Transparent polycarbonate panels
• Chromed or anodized finishes

LIGHTING:
• Clean, modern lighting
• Reflections on metallic surfaces
• LED components glowing
• Futuristic ambient light
• Subtle internal illumination
• Professional product photography style

TECHNICAL DETAILS:
• Serial numbers or model designations
• Status indicator LEDs
• Charging port locations
• Emergency shutdown buttons
• Manufacturer logos (fictional)
• Warning labels and markings
• Diagnostic panels

COLOR SCHEMES (based on selected type):
• White and chrome (corporate)
• Black and dark grey (military)
• White and soft colors (domestic)
• Yellow and black (industrial)
• Exposed metal (prototype)
• Custom colors (entertainment)

CAMERA:
• Professional product photography angle
• Clean, well-lit composition
• Subject clearly visible
• Technical details in focus
• Modern sci-fi film quality

OPTIONAL ELEMENTS:
• Holographic displays
• Charging cables connected
• Tool attachments
• Diagnostic equipment nearby
• Other androids in background
• Human technicians
• Futuristic props

RESTRICTIONS:
• No cartoon or animated style
• No Terminator skeleton aesthetic
• No text overlays or captions
• No fantasy elements
• No overly dystopian or dark themes
• Keep recognizable as subject
• Modern sci-fi, not retro robots

FINAL RESULT:
The image should present the subject as a convincing humanoid android of the selected type with advanced technology visible throughout. The design should balance human recognition with robotic elements, maintaining the subject's identity while clearly showing their artificial nature.

name: ANDY WARHOL
message: Take a picture in the style of Andy Warhol. Pop Art with the use of four duplicated images in a frame.

name: ANGELS AND DEVILS
message:
Take a picture and transform each subject into either an angel or a devil based on their appearance, posture, and demeanor. If multiple subjects are present, vary the transformation individually.

ANGELS should have soft glowing light, subtle halos, feathered wings, calm or kind expressions, and light-toned clothing.
DEVILS should have horns, tails, glowing or shadowed eyes, darker tones, sharp features, and mischievous or menacing expressions.

The transformation should feel natural and realistic, not costume-like. Wings, horns, and tails should be anatomically integrated.

Lighting and atmosphere should reinforce the role: warm and radiant for angels, dramatic and shadowy for devils.

The final image should clearly communicate who is an angel and who is a devil at a glance.

name: ANGULAR MONOCHROMATIC
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a bold, stylized vector illustration.

Render the image using flat geometric shapes and a strictly monochromatic color palette derived from the single dominant color of the original photo. Use variations of that color only (light, mid-tone, and dark values) rather than multiple hues or gradients.

Strongly abstract fine detail and simplify all forms into large angular planes that loosely describe the subject and environment. Define edges using hard transitions between adjacent color regions instead of line art. Do not use outlines.

Convey shading entirely through neighboring flat color fields, producing a graphic, poster-like quality reminiscent of cut paper, stencil art, or posterization.

Slightly round all corners of the color block shapes to avoid sharp points while maintaining an angular, faceted appearance.

Avoid texture, brush strokes, realism, or painterly effects. The final image should feel minimal, graphic, modern, and clearly readable on a small screen.

name: ANGULAR POLYCHROMATIC
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a bold, stylized vector illustration.

Render the image using flat geometric shapes and a vibrant polychromatic color palette derived from the original colors of the photo. Strongly abstract fine detail and organize colors into distinct light, mid-tone, and dark blocks rather than smooth gradients.

Simplify all forms into large angular planes that loosely describe the subject and environment. Define edges using hard transitions between adjacent color regions instead of line art. Do not use outlines.

Convey shading entirely through neighboring flat color fields, creating a graphic, poster-like quality reminiscent of cut paper, posterization, or modern vector art.

Slightly round all corners of the color block shapes to avoid harsh points while maintaining an angular, faceted appearance.

Avoid texture, brush strokes, realism, or painterly effects. The final image should feel clean, graphic, modern, and clearly readable on a small screen.

name: ANIMAL RIDER
message:
Take a picture and place the subject riding a large, powerful animal. The animal may be real or fictional (e.g., horse, elephant, lion, dragon, gryphon, dinosaur), and can be selected or influenced by the master prompt.

The animal should be massive and dominant in scale. The subject must be properly seated or mounted with correct posture, grip, and balance — not floating or pasted.

The animal should be in motion or a dramatic stance (charging, flying, roaring, climbing, standing triumphantly).

Lighting, perspective, and shadows must match between rider and animal.

The final image should feel epic, absurd, and cinematic — like a legendary hero riding an impossibly wild creature.

name: ANIME ART
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into an anime character placed within a classic or modern anime franchise world alongside the show's iconic characters. Convert the subject into authentic anime art style with characteristic features: large expressive eyes with detailed highlights and reflections, simplified nose (small dot or line), small mouth, clean cel-shaded coloring with minimal gradients, smooth skin with occasional blush marks, distinctive anime hair with sharp spikes or flowing strands in vibrant colors that defy gravity. Preserve the subject's recognizable facial features and expression but render them in anime style.

ANIME FRANCHISE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a specific anime, USE THAT ANIME
• If no anime is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE franchise using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST TWO DIGITS of the RANDOM SEED modulo 25:
  - 0: Dragon Ball Z - with Goku, Vegeta, training with power auras and energy effects
  - 1: Sailor Moon - with Sailor Scouts in magical transformation scene
  - 2: Cowboy Bebop - with Spike and crew on the Bebop ship
  - 3: Naruto - with Naruto, Sasuke, Sakura in Hidden Leaf Village
  - 4: Attack on Titan - with Survey Corps members, titans in background
  - 5: My Hero Academia - with Deku, Bakugo at UA High School
  - 6: One Piece - with Luffy and Straw Hat crew on the ship
  - 7: Pokemon - with Ash, Pikachu catching Pokemon
  - 8: Death Note - with Light, Ryuk in dark atmospheric setting
  - 9: Fullmetal Alchemist - with Ed, Al in alchemical action scene
  - 10: Demon Slayer - with Tanjiro, Nezuko battling demons
  - 11: Neon Genesis Evangelion - with Shinji, Rei in NERV headquarters or EVA cockpit
  - 12: One Punch Man - with Saitama in hero costume
  - 13: Jujutsu Kaisen - with Yuji, Megumi fighting curses
  - 14: Bleach - with Ichigo wielding zanpakuto in Soul Society
  - 15: Sword Art Online - with Kirito, Asuna in virtual game world
  - 16: Hunter x Hunter - with Gon, Killua on adventure
  - 17: Tokyo Ghoul - with Kaneki in dark urban Tokyo setting
  - 18: Spy x Family - with Anya, Loid, Yor in comedic family scene
  - 19: Chainsaw Man - with Denji in violent demon battle
  - 20: Mob Psycho 100 - with Mob using psychic powers
  - 21: Steins;Gate - with Okabe in lab with time machine
  - 22: Code Geass - with Lelouch commanding with Geass power
  - 23: Violet Evergarden - in beautiful post-war setting with Auto Memories Dolls
  - 24: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure - with dramatic poses and Stand manifestations

CORE REQUIREMENTS:
• Subject looks like they belong in the anime as a new character
• Subject interacting naturally with established cast members
• Match the specific art style of the chosen franchise
• Include anime-specific visual elements: speed lines, sweat drops, sparkles, flowers, dramatic effects
• Background characters in simpler detail
• Dramatic sky with lens flare effects

STYLE:
• Vibrant saturated colors with clean black ink outlines
• Flat cel-shading with sharp shadow edges
• Anime color palette matching the franchise
• Visual effects appropriate to the show (energy auras, magic, action lines)

FINAL RESULT:
An authentic frame from the selected anime series with the subject seamlessly integrated as a character among the show's cast, rendered in the franchise's distinctive art style and placed in an iconic setting from that anime.

name: ANIME LINE ART
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform it into a hand-drawn digital illustration created in a professional tablet drawing app, resembling artwork made in Procreate.

MEDIUM & RENDERING STYLE (CRITICAL):
• Must look digitally hand-drawn with an Apple Pencil-style brush
• Clean inking layer with natural pressure variation
• Slight brush texture visible in line work
• Separate ink and color layers feel
• Smooth but clearly illustrated — not photo-based
• No photorealistic rendering

LINE ART REQUIREMENTS:
• Crisp black or very dark ink lines
• Confident, smooth strokes with pressure tapering
• Clean outer contours
• Minimal cross-hatching

COLORING RULES:
• Flat cel-style coloring
• Limited color palette
• Optional single-tone cel shadow layer
• No realistic gradients
• No textured painterly blending

FACE & EXPRESSION:
• Stylized anime-inspired features
• Large expressive eyes
• Simplified nose and mouth
• Graphic hair shapes with clean highlights
• Preserve recognizable identity while simplifying features

NEON SQUIGGLE EFFECT (MANDATORY):
• Add glowing neon scribble accents drawn on a separate "glow" layer
• Electric pink, cyan, lime green, or purple
• Squiggles may orbit the subject, trace outlines, or streak across background
• Soft airbrush glow around squiggles only
• Glow must feel layered digitally, not like a photographic light effect

BACKGROUND:
• Flat color background OR minimal graphic pattern
• Clean composition
• No realistic scenery

OVERALL FEEL:
• Modern social media digital illustration aesthetic
• Clean Instagram-style art post
• Slight canvas texture optional
• Energetic and youthful vibe

IMPORTANT:
• The image must clearly look like a digital illustration drawn by hand in a tablet art app
• Do not apply filters to a photo
• Do not retain photographic skin texture
• Keep anatomy proportional and recognizable

FINAL RESULT:
The final image should look like a polished hand-drawn anime-style digital illustration created in Procreate, featuring clean ink lines, flat cel coloring, and vibrant neon squiggle accents layered with a soft digital glow.

name: ANSEL ADAMS
message:
Take a picture and transform it into the photographic style of Ansel Adams.

MEDIUM & TECHNIQUE (CRITICAL):
• Black-and-white photography ONLY
• Large-format camera look
• Extreme tonal range using the Zone System
• Crisp focus and deep depth of field

TONAL CONTROL:
• Rich blacks with detail
• Bright highlights without clipping
• Strong midtone separation
• Dramatic contrast without harshness

SUBJECT & SCENE:
• The subject may be human or environmental
• If human, they must feel small within the scene
• Emphasis on scale, form, texture, and light

TEXTURE EMPHASIS:
• Rock, clouds, trees, skin, fabric, water
• Fine grain — never noisy

LIGHTING:
• Natural light only
• Emphasis on dramatic skies, clouds, and shadows
• No artificial light sources

ABSOLUTE PROHIBITIONS:
• NO color
• NO painterly effects
• NO modern HDR
• NO soft-focus aesthetics

FINAL RESULT:
The image must look like a meticulously exposed and printed Ansel Adams photograph — timeless, monumental, and technically precise.

name: ANTIQUES
message: Take a picture and transform every single object and element in the scene into its antique equivalent from the 1800s-1950s era. EVERY modern item must be converted: smartphones become rotary dial phones or candlestick phones, flat-screen TVs become wooden cabinet tube televisions with dials and rabbit ear antennas, laptops become typewriters, LED lights become oil lamps or Edison bulbs, modern cars become vintage automobiles (Model T, classic sedans), refrigerators become antique iceboxes, microwaves become old gas stoves, digital cameras become large format bellows cameras, modern furniture becomes Victorian or Art Deco pieces with ornate wood and upholstery. Convert ALL branded products to vintage versions: Coca-Cola bottles become classic glass contour bottles, modern packaging becomes vintage tin containers and cardboard boxes with retro graphics, sneakers become leather oxford shoes or boots. Transform the environment: modern architecture becomes period-appropriate (Victorian, Colonial, Art Deco), wallpaper becomes vintage patterns (floral, damask), flooring becomes hardwood or vintage tile, light fixtures become antique chandeliers or sconces. If people are present, transform them to match the period: women in long dresses, corsets, vintage hairstyles (finger waves, Gibson Girl updos, victory rolls); men in three-piece suits, suspenders, bow ties, fedoras or bowler hats, slicked hair or pompadours. Add period-appropriate aging and patina to everything - tarnished brass, aged wood, sepia or faded color tones, slight wear and vintage quality. The entire scene should look like a perfectly preserved photograph from 75-150 years ago with every element authentically period-accurate. Make it photorealistic as if time-traveled to the antique era.

name: ARCHEOLOGICAL PHOTO
message: Take a picture and transform it into an archeological field documentation sheet. Include a large, visible photograph of the subject as the central element, printed on aged paper. The photo should appear weathered, sun-faded, dusty, and slightly warped, as if it has been exposed at an excavation site for weeks. Identify the subject’s species or type using scientific or pseudo-scientific labeling. Add subtle field notes, specimen numbers, scale bars, and catalog markings around the photo. The final image should feel like an authentic archeological record centered around the photograph.

name: ARCHITECTURAL REDESIGN
message: Take a picture and identify the main building or structure in the image, then completely redesign it in a dramatically different architectural style while maintaining the same basic footprint and location. If the building is modern, transform it to a contrasting historical or regional style. If it's traditional, make it contemporary. Architectural style options include: Colonial (symmetrical facade, columns, shutters), Mediterranean (stucco walls, terracotta tile roof, arched windows), Spanish Colonial (white walls, red clay tiles, wrought iron details, courtyard), Victorian (ornate trim, turrets, wraparound porch, detailed woodwork), Art Deco (geometric patterns, stepped forms, metallic accents, bold colors), Brutalist (raw concrete, geometric masses, fortress-like), Mid-Century Modern (clean lines, large windows, flat roofs, integration with nature), Gothic (pointed arches, flying buttresses, ornate stonework), Craftsman (exposed beams, natural materials, low-pitched roofs), Contemporary (glass and steel, minimalist, asymmetrical), Tudor (half-timbering, steep gables, decorative chimneys), or Prairie Style (horizontal lines, overhanging eaves, natural materials). Maintain the building's location, surrounding landscape, and general scale, but completely transform all architectural elements - windows, doors, roof, materials, decorative details, columns, trim - to match the new style. Keep lighting and time of day consistent. The redesign should be thorough and authentic to the chosen architectural movement with period-appropriate materials, proportions, and details. Make it look like a photorealistic rendering of what that exact building would look like if designed in a completely different architectural tradition.

name: ARCHITECTURAL SCALE MODEL
message: Take a picture and convert the scene into an architectural scale model. Subjects and objects should appear as miniature figurines within a foam-board or plastic model environment. Use clean edges, painted surfaces, and overhead lighting typical of design studios. Maintain proportional scale across all elements.

name: ARCHIVED PHOTO
message: Take a picture and transform it into a damaged archival photograph. Add scratches, dust, faded tones, and slight warping. Portions of the image may be torn, stained, or missing. Use muted sepia or desaturated colors. The subject should feel historical, fragile, and partially lost to time.

name: ART BRUT
message: Take a picture and transform the image into Art Brut (outsider art) style painting. Use raw lines, naive proportions, uneven coloring, and spontaneous visual energy while preserving the subject.

name: ART DECO
message: Take a picture and transform the image into Art Deco poster style. Bold geometric shapes, metallic or pastel palette, stylized subject, decorative typography optional.

name: ART NOUVEAU
message: Take a picture and transform the image into a into an Art Nouveau illustration. Preserve the subject's identity, facial features, proportions, and pose. Use flowing, organic lines inspired by natural forms such as vines, flowers, and hair. Emphasize elegant curves, ornamental borders, and rhythmic linework. Flat or softly shaded color areas with muted, harmonious palettes. Decorative background integrated into the composition rather than separate. Poster-like composition inspired by Alphonse Mucha and late 19th-century European Art Nouveau. Painterly illustration style, not photorealistic. No modern elements, no Art Deco geometry, no hard angles.

name: ASCII ART
message: Take a picture and render it in ASCII format, where shapes and tones are created using punctuation and letters and using only keyboard characters to form the image. Built entirely from text characters, using letters, numbers, and symbols arranged in clever patterns. The image has a retro, digital feel, like something you would see on an old computer screen or printed in a vintage tech lab.

name: ASHCAN SCHOOL
message: Take a picture and transform the image into an Ashcan School style painting. Gritty realism, urban atmosphere, loose brushwork, and muted tones. Subject feels candid and grounded.

name: AUSTIN DANGER POWERS
message:
Take a picture and place the subject directly into a recognizable Austin Powers movie scene as if they are physically present on set.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• The subject is inserted into a famous Austin Powers scene
• This is NOT a full character replacement
• The subject remains themselves, wearing an Austin Powers costume
• The result feels like a behind-the-scenes photo or alternate take

IDENTITY RULES (MANDATORY):
• Preserve the subject’s real facial structure and identity
• Add Austin Powers–style accessories ONLY:
  – Iconic round glasses
  – Exaggerated Austin Powers teeth
  – Austin Powers hair or wig
• Do NOT morph the subject into the actor
• This should look like cosplay, not face-swapping

OUTFIT RULES:
• Subject wears a famous Austin Powers outfit
• Outfit must be era-accurate and recognizable
• Examples:
  – Blue or maroon velvet suit with frilly shirt
  – Mod 1960s British spy attire
  – Psychedelic patterned clothing
• Clothing fits naturally on the subject’s body

SCENE SELECTION (SEED-DRIVEN — SELECT EXACTLY ONE):
• Swinging London nightclub
• Dr. Evil’s underground lair
• Psychedelic photo-shoot set
• Groovy hallway walk scene
• Casino or spy headquarters

SCENE INTEGRATION RULES:
• Lighting must match the selected scene
• Subject scale and perspective must match the environment
• Subject appears naturally placed, not pasted
• Background characters (if present) treat the subject as normal

STYLE & ERA:
• Strong 1960s retro aesthetic
• Saturated colors, bold patterns, playful design
• Clean cinematic look — not cartoonish

EXPRESSION & POSE:
• Confident, playful, charismatic energy
• Subtle humor in posture or expression
• No exaggerated comedy faces unless natural

CAMERA:
• Cinematic framing consistent with film stills
• Medium or wide shot preferred
• Natural depth of field

RESTRICTIONS:
• No parody distortion
• No caricature proportions
• No modern clothing or technology
• No text overlays or captions

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like an authentic film still from an Austin Powers movie where the subject is wearing an Austin Powers costume, complete with wig, glasses, and teeth, while clearly remaining themselves. The effect should feel confident, stylish, and seamlessly integrated — groovy, baby.

name: AUSTRALIAN ABORIGINAL DOT PAINTING
message: Take a picture and transform the image into Aboriginal dot painting style. Use dot patterns, symbolic shapes, earthy palettes, and rhythmic repetition while preserving the subject’s silhouette.

name: AVATAR
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a realistic Na’vi character from the movie Avatar.
