Preserve the subject’s recognizable facial structure, eye shape, expressions, body proportions, and personality while adapting them to authentic Na’vi anatomy—tall, slender physique, elongated limbs, blue bioluminescent skin with natural striping, feline nose structure, large expressive eyes, pointed ears, and long braided hair with neural queue. Translate the subject’s clothing and accessories into culturally accurate Na’vi attire and materials. Match the exact cinematic lighting, color grading, skin translucency, subsurface scattering, and environmental interaction seen in Avatar. The subject must appear fully native to Pandora, not human-painted blue, with realistic scale, shadows, and immersion in the world.

name: BACK IN THE DAY POSTER
message: Take a picture and create a 'Back in the Day' commemorative poster featuring the subject. If an external master prompt specifies a year, USE THAT YEAR. If no year is specified, analyze the subject's apparent age and estimate their birth year (e.g., if they appear 40 years old, use a year approximately 40 years ago). Design a vintage poster with the subject's portrait centered, surrounded by a collage of iconic images from that specific year: major world events and news headlines, popular movies and TV shows, music albums and top songs, new inventions and technology, popular vehicles and cars, sports championships, fashion trends and cultural icons, and cost of living data. Title at top: 'BACK IN THE DAY - [YEAR]'. Use vintage newspaper/magazine aesthetic with 8-12 labeled images arranged around the central portrait. Period-appropriate fonts, color schemes, and nostalgic design that looks like an authentic gift shop commemorative poster. Photorealistic rendering.

name: BACKUP SINGER
message:
Take a picture and place the subject into a live music performance as an off-key backup singer standing behind a talented lead singer or group.

The subject should be holding a microphone and singing enthusiastically but clearly out of sync or off-key. Other singers should be visibly reacting — giving awkward looks, side-eyes, or confused expressions.

Stage lighting, concert atmosphere, and microphones must feel realistic. The subject should be fully integrated into the performance, not pasted in.

The scene should feel funny, musical, and visually readable even on small screens.

name: BALD
message:
Take a picture of the subject, human or animal, and make them completely bald.

Remove all hair or fur from the head area so the scalp is fully visible.

The bald look should be smooth, clean, and slightly exaggerated for comedic effect.

Make sure the head shape and lighting look natural so the baldness feels believable.

The final image should look like the subject has truly gone hairless, creating a funny and surprising transformation.

name: BALLERINA
message:
Take a picture of the subject and dress them in a classic pink ballerina costume with a tutu, ballet slippers, and hair styled like a stage performer.

The same pink ballerina outfit must be used regardless of the subject’s gender or age.

Place the subject in a graceful ballet pose on a stage or in a dance studio, with soft theatrical lighting.

The contrast between the elegant ballerina outfit and the subject’s normal appearance should be part of the humor.

The final image should look like a real ballet photo shoot with playful, unexpected casting.

name: BALLOON
message:
Take a picture and transform the ENTIRE image so that EVERYTHING is made entirely out of balloons.

VARIANT SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a balloon style, USE THAT
• Otherwise SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST DIGIT of the RANDOM SEED modulo 2:
  - 0: Balloon Sculpture Environment (large inflated balloons forming all objects and scenery)
  - 1: Balloon Twist Art (long twisting balloons bent, knotted, and tied together to form the subject and environment)

GLOBAL MATERIAL RULE (NON-NEGOTIABLE):
• The subject, background, scenery, lighting effects, shadows, and all objects must be physically constructed from inflated latex balloons

BALLOON PROPERTIES (MANDATORY):
• Visible balloon seams and tied ends
• Surface stretch and tension deformation
• Glossy latex reflections
• Overlapping balloon structures

BALLOON TWIST ART RULES (IF SELECTED):
• Use long cylindrical twisting balloons
• Knots, bends, twists, and joints must be visible
• Shapes formed by balloon bending, NOT smooth sculpting
• Subject likeness created through balloon structure only

ANTI-CHEATING RULES:
• DO NOT overlay balloons onto a photograph
• DO NOT leave any non-balloon surfaces visible
• DO NOT simulate balloons with smooth plastic or rubber textures

REALISM:
• The scene must look like a real balloon sculpture installation photographed in real life
• Lighting and shadows must behave as they would on inflated latex

FINAL RESULT:
The image should convincingly appear to be a real-world environment entirely constructed from balloons, with the selected balloon style clearly applied.

name: BARBIE WORLD
message:
Take a picture and transform the entire scene into a bright, stylized Barbie World composed entirely of physical toys.

Analyze the subject and environment and apply the following transformations:

• If the primary subject appears feminine, transform them into a Barbie doll.
• If the primary subject appears masculine, transform them into a Ken doll.

The doll’s face should retain the subject’s recognizable facial structure, proportions, and expression, but be rendered with smooth plastic skin, simplified features, glossy eyes, and the polished look of a physical Barbie or Ken toy.

Environmental logic:
• If the scene appears indoors, place the subject inside a Barbie Dreamhouse interior with pastel-colored plastic furniture, toy-like proportions, and miniature physical details.
• If the scene appears outdoors, place the subject inside or next to a Barbie convertible with realistic toy textures, bright colors, and a glossy finish.

Use high-key lighting, realistic toy textures, reflections, and scale consistency to ensure the subject and environment appear as physical toys rather than drawings or digital illustrations. Keep the composition bold, cheerful, and clearly readable on small screens.

name: BARN BILLBOARD
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform it into an advertisement painted on the side of an old barn.

The subject should be fully integrated into the barn wall texture, following the curvature, cracks, peeling paint, and wood grain.

The style should resemble a vintage or weathered hand-painted billboard, with faded colors, chipped paint, and sun-bleached effects.

Include appropriate rustic details like knots in wood, nails, and uneven surfaces. The environment around the barn should remain consistent with the original photo (fields, fences, sky, or surrounding scenery).

The final image should look like a real photograph of a barn with a large, old-fashioned painted advertisement featuring the subject.

name: BAROQUE
message: Take a picture in the style of Baroque painting. Dramatic lighting, deep contrasts, dynamic composition, ornate details, and theatrical visual richness.

name: BAUHAUS
message: Take a picture and transform the image into Bauhaus style art. Reduce the subject to functional geometric forms, clean lines, primary colors, and minimal composition.

name: BBS DOWNLOAD
message:
Take a picture and transform it into the experience of a slow-loading 1990s internet image over a dial-up connection. Render the image as if it is partially downloaded, frozen mid-load, or failing to fully render.

STATUS MESSAGE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a status message, USE THAT STATUS MESSAGE
• If no status message is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE status message using the RANDOM SEED
• Do not reuse the same message across renders
• Options: "Stuck at 87%", "Connection Lost", "Retrying…", "Image Failed to Load (Alt Text Only)", "Low Bandwidth Mode"
• Display the message in a simple early-web or system monospace font

Visually reflect the selected status message in the image rendering:
- If partially loaded, reveal only sections of the image using horizontal loading bands, blocky color fills, or coarse pixel previews.
- If failed, leave large portions blank, replaced by placeholder space, broken image icons, or alt-text-style text.
- If retrying, show uneven clarity with duplicated or misaligned segments. Preserve the subject’s recognizable features even when incomplete. Simulate authentic early-internet artifacts such as compression noise, color banding, abrupt resolution jumps, and unstable alignment. Include a minimal progress indicator or percentage counter when appropriate, ensuring all text is large and legible on small screens. The final image should feel frozen in time—nostalgic, frustrating, and unmistakably mid-download.

name: BEAM ME UP SCOTTY
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject as if they are being transported into or out of the Star Trek universe via a transporter beam.

TRANSPORT DIRECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies direction, USE THAT
• If no direction is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST DIGIT of the RANDOM SEED modulo 2:
  - 0: Transported out (subject fading upward in a transporter effect)
  - 1: Transported in (subject materializing from beam energy)

IDENTITY RULES:
• Subject must remain fully recognizable
• Face and key features preserved despite partial transport
• Transport effect applied to body, not removing identifiable anatomy

VISUAL STYLE:
• Photorealistic or cinematic realism with Star Trek transporter aesthetic
• Classic sparkling or shimmering beam effect
• Subtle light wrapping around subject
• Environment may include a starship transporter pad or Star Trek-style background

FINAL RESULT:
The subject should appear mid-transport: partially dematerialized or rematerialized, fully recognizable, and integrated seamlessly into a Star Trek transporter scene.

name: BERENSTAIN BEARS
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a warm, storybook-style cartoon inspired by classic Berenstain Bears illustrations.

STYLE & CHARACTER RULES:
• Soft ink outlines with watercolor-style coloring
• Cozy, rounded character designs
• Gentle facial expressions and readable emotions
• Include multiple friendly animal characters in a family or town setting

SCENE & TONE:
• Wholesome, educational, and nostalgic
• Domestic or small-town environments
• Storybook composition and warmth

The final image should look like a fully composed Berenstain Bears–style hand-drawn illustration with the subject and additional characters integrated seamlessly into the world.

name: BEHIND BARS
message:
Take a picture and place the subject behind prison bars in a realistic jail or prison setting wearing appropriate prison attire.

PRISON SETTING SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a setting, USE THAT SETTING
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the RANDOM SEED
• Use LAST DIGIT modulo 5:
  - 0: Classic jail cell with iron bars - orange jumpsuit
  - 1: Modern prison cell - beige or gray prison uniform
  - 2: Police holding cell - casual clothes or orange jumpsuit
  - 3: Old stone prison - striped black and white prisoner outfit
  - 4: Minimalist detention room - plain prison scrubs

PLACE THE SUBJECT:
• Subject positioned behind bars or secured barrier
• Wearing appropriate prison garb matching the setting
• Natural posture — standing, sitting, or leaning
• Expression neutral, contemplative, or resigned
• No exaggerated fear or aggression
• Subject's facial features preserved and recognizable

AUTHENTICITY RULES:
• Realistic materials (metal bars, concrete walls)
• Institutional lighting (cool, flat, or fluorescent)
• Accurate spatial depth and shadows
• Prison clothing fits naturally on subject's body

EXCLUSIONS:
• No violence or restraints
• No caricature or parody tone

COMPOSITION & FRAME:
• Bars clearly visible in foreground
• Subject fully visible behind barrier
• FULL image visible with all four corners present
• No dramatic cropping or cinematic angles

STYLE:
• Photorealistic
• Serious, grounded tone
• Looks like a still from a documentary or crime drama

FINAL RESULT:
The image should depict the subject realistically placed behind prison bars wearing appropriate prison attire in a believable correctional environment, maintaining realism and respectful tone.

name: BEVERAGE MASCOT
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a beverage brand mascot while retaining the subject's facial characteristics.

BEVERAGE MASCOT SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a brand, USE THAT BRAND
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 12:
  - 0: Kool-Aid Man - large glass pitcher body with smiling face, red liquid inside, bursting through wall, "OH YEAH!" energy
  - 1: California Raisins - cool dancing raisin with sunglasses, Motown style, wrinkled raisin texture but subject's face
  - 2: Coca-Cola Polar Bear - white polar bear, red Coke scarf, arctic setting, holding Coke bottle, friendly expression
  - 3: Red Bull - subject with large angel/energy wings sprouted from back, extreme sports setting, "gives you wings" literally
  - 4: Starbucks Mermaid - two-tailed mermaid/siren, crowned, green color scheme, nautical coffee theme, subject's face as siren
  - 5: Corona Extra - subject on beach with lime wedge, relaxed beach chair, sunset, vacation vibes, casual beach attire
  - 6: Got Milk? - subject with white milk mustache, holding glass of milk, wholesome Americana, celebrity campaign style
  - 7: Mountain Dew - subject doing extreme sport (skateboarding, BMX, snowboarding) while holding Mountain Dew, neon green/yellow
  - 8: Snapple Real Facts - subject as anthropomorphic Snapple bottle with subject's face on label, "Real Facts" cap, quirky personality
  - 9: Arizona Iced Tea - subject incorporated into ornate Arizona can design, cherry blossom aesthetic, pastel colors, zen vibes
  - 10: Capri Sun - subject as kid-sized juice pouch with straw, metallic pouch body, playground setting, nostalgic 90s energy
  - 11: Monster Energy - subject with claw mark logo, extreme energy, neon green accents, aggressive action sports aesthetic

TRANSFORM THE SUBJECT:
• Subject's facial features MUST be clearly recognizable in the mascot
• NOT a recreation of the actual mascot - this is the SUBJECT as that mascot
• Facial structure, eyes, expression remain identifiable
• Mascot characteristics applied around/to subject's face
• Subject's personality visible through mascot transformation

APPLY BRAND CHARACTERISTICS:
• For character mascots (Kool-Aid Man, raisins, polar bear): subject's face integrated into creature
• For "subject-based" ads (Corona, Got Milk, Mountain Dew): actual subject in brand scenario
• Brand colors, logos, and styling
• Product visible and prominent
• Advertising campaign aesthetic

SETTING & COMPOSITION:
• Environment appropriate to brand (beach, arctic, wall crash, extreme sports venue)
• Brand colors dominate palette
• Product placement natural and prominent
• Advertising photography style
• Billboard or print ad composition

STYLE:
• Commercial advertising aesthetic
• High-quality product photography
• Vibrant brand colors
• Professional marketing campaign look
• Photorealistic but stylized for advertising
• NOT photoshopped - subject naturally integrated

BRAND ELEMENTS:
• Logo visible
• Slogan or tagline if iconic ("OH YEAH!", "Gives You Wings", "Got Milk?")
• Product packaging accurate
• Brand-appropriate typography

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject transformed into or featured as a beverage brand mascot with their facial features clearly recognizable, styled as a professional advertising campaign that looks natural and authentic, not photoshopped or composited.

name: BIBLE VERSE
message:
Take a picture and analyze the subject’s appearance, expression, posture, and surrounding context. Select a Bible verse that best reflects the situation, moral lesson, warning, encouragement, or judgment suggested by the image, OR use a specific verse provided via external master prompt.

Transform the image into a reverent, illustrated or photographic composition where the subject is visually connected to the chosen verse. The subject may appear within a symbolic scene, subtle vignette, or respectful setting that reinforces the meaning of the passage.

Include the full text of the selected Bible verse clearly displayed within the image, along with the book, chapter, and verse reference (for example: Proverbs 17:28). Ensure the text is legible on a small screen.

Use a restrained, respectful tone. Avoid parody. The final image should feel like a devotional illustration or inspirational Bible page where the verse meaningfully corresponds to the subject’s traits or actions.

name: BIBLICAL
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject as a character in a famous Biblical story.

BIBLICAL STORY SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a story, USE THAT STORY
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 40:
  - 0: Moses holding the Ten Commandments tablets at Mount Sinai
  - 1: Moses parting the Red Sea with staff raised
  - 2: Noah building or standing before the Ark with animals
  - 3: Noah after the flood with rainbow and dove
  - 4: Abraham near the sacrifice of Isaac on mountain altar
  - 5: Joseph wearing his coat of many colors
  - 6: Joseph in Egypt as Pharaoh's advisor
  - 7: David with sling facing Goliath
  - 8: David as king with crown and harp
  - 9: Samson pushing pillars of the Philistine temple
  - 10: Samson with long hair and great strength
  - 11: Daniel in the lion's den, unharmed
  - 12: Jonah being swallowed by or emerging from the great fish
  - 13: Joshua at the Battle of Jericho with trumpets
  - 14: Esther as queen in Persian palace
  - 15: Ruth gleaning in the fields
  - 16: Solomon as wise king passing judgment
  - 17: Elijah calling down fire from heaven
  - 18: Job suffering but faithful
  - 19: Adam and Eve in Garden of Eden (covered, respectful)
  - 20: Lot's wife turned to pillar of salt looking back at Sodom and Gomorrah
  - 21: Mary (mother of Jesus) at the Annunciation with angel
  - 22: Joseph (earthly father) at the Nativity scene
  - 23: Shepherds visiting baby Jesus at night
  - 24: Wise Men following star bearing gifts
  - 25: John the Baptist baptizing in Jordan River
  - 26: Jesus walking on water
  - 27: Jesus feeding the 5000 with loaves and fishes
  - 28: Jesus at the Sermon on the Mount teaching multitudes
  - 29: Jesus healing the sick or blind
  - 30: Jesus calming the storm on the boat
  - 31: Lazarus emerging from tomb after resurrection
  - 32: Peter walking on water toward Jesus
  - 33: Peter with keys to heaven
  - 34: Paul (Saul) on road to Damascus with blinding light
  - 35: Paul preaching to crowds
  - 36: Mary Magdalene at the empty tomb
  - 37: Doubting Thomas examining Jesus's wounds
  - 38: Zacchaeus in the sycamore tree
  - 39: The Good Samaritan helping injured traveler

PLACE THE SUBJECT:
• In the specific scene from the selected Biblical story
• With appropriate props (tablets, ark, sling, coat, etc.)
• In historical Middle Eastern setting
• Biblical-era clothing (robes, sandals, head coverings)
• Other Biblical figures present as needed for the story

STYLE:
• Classical religious painting aesthetic or photorealistic
• Respectful, reverent tone
• Dramatic lighting (divine light, sunset, candlelight)
• Epic scale for major events (parting sea, ark, etc.)
• Intimate scale for personal moments

ATTIRE:
• Period-accurate ancient Middle Eastern clothing
• Simple robes, tunics, head coverings
• Sandals or bare feet
• Colors and fabrics appropriate to character's role

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a classical religious artwork or respectful historical recreation showing the subject as the main character in an iconic Biblical scene, recognizable and reverent.

name: BIBLICAL ILLUSTRATION
message: Take a picture in the style of a Medieval Biblical illustration. Illuminated manuscript style.  The result should be a full view of the illustration with a relevant background behind the illustration.

name: BIGFOOT
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into bigfoot, sasquatch, or yeti cryptid creature.

CRYPTID TYPE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies cryptid, USE THAT CRYPTID
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST DIGIT:
  - 0: Pacific Northwest Bigfoot - brown fur, 7-9 feet, forest dweller, classic sasquatch
  - 1: Himalayan Yeti - white/gray fur, 6-8 feet, mountain creature, abominable snowman
  - 2: Skunk Ape (Florida) - reddish fur, swamp dweller, foul smell, smaller (6-7 feet)
  - 3: Grassman (Ohio) - brown/black fur, grassland habitat, aggressive
  - 4: Mogollon Monster (Arizona) - large, hairy, forest, Native American legends
  - 5: Fouke Monster (Arkansas) - reddish fur, swamp, aggressive, "Legend of Boggy Creek"
  - 6: Honey Island Swamp Monster (Louisiana) - webbed feet, amber eyes, swamp cryptid
  - 7: Yowie (Australia) - reddish-brown, 6-9 feet, Aboriginal folklore, aggressive
  - 8: Almas (Central Asia) - human-like, reddish fur, Central Asian wild man
  - 9: Orang Pendek (Indonesia) - small (3-5 feet), orangutan-like, bipedal ape

SUBJECT TRANSFORMATION:
• Subject's face visible within creature
• Recognizable features under fur and ape-like qualities
• Subject AS bigfoot, not generic ape
• Eyes especially identifiable as subject
• Human intelligence visible in expression

BIGFOOT PHYSICAL FEATURES:
• 6-9 feet tall (towering)
• Massive, muscular build (400-800 lbs)
• Covered entirely in thick fur
• Ape-like but bipedal (walks upright)
• Long arms (reach below knees)
• Large hands and feet (18+ inch footprints)
• Hunched posture
• Powerful, intimidating physique

FACE:
• Ape-like features
• Flat nose
• Heavy brow ridge
• Subject's eyes visible (human-like intelligence)
• Large mouth
• Less snout than gorilla (more human-like)
• Facial hair/fur covering
• Expressive, not just animal
• Recognizable as subject

FUR/HAIR:
• Thick, shaggy coat
• Color by type:
  - Bigfoot: Dark brown, reddish-brown, black
  - Yeti: White, gray, light brown
  - Skunk Ape: Reddish-brown, russet
  - Regional variations
• Matted and wild
• Covers entire body except face, palms, soles
• Long hair (6-12 inches)
• Dirty, wilderness appearance

BODY BUILD:
• Extremely muscular
• Broad shoulders
• Barrel chest
• Thick neck
• Long powerful arms
• Large hands with opposable thumbs
• Massive thighs and legs
• Huge feet

HANDS & FEET:
• Large human-like hands
• Five fingers with nails
• Opposable thumbs
• Enormous feet (12-24 inches long)
• Five toes
• Flat-footed walking
• Footprints visible in ground

POSE & STANCE:
• Walking upright (bipedal)
• Slightly hunched forward
• Arms swinging while walking OR
• Standing still (caught on camera)
• Mid-stride (Patterson-Gimlin film pose)
• Looking back at camera
• Powerful, intimidating stance

SETTING (Type-specific):
• Pacific Northwest Bigfoot: Dense forest, ferns, moss-covered trees, Pacific coast
• Yeti: Snowy Himalayan mountains, ice, high altitude, Tibet/Nepal
• Skunk Ape: Florida swamp, cypress trees, murky water
• General: Remote wilderness, isolated, far from civilization

ENVIRONMENT:
• Deep forest or mountain wilderness
• No signs of human presence
• Natural, untouched habitat
• Thick vegetation
• Rocky terrain or soft ground (for tracks)
• Stream or river nearby
• Caves or sheltered areas

WEATHER:
• Misty, foggy (adds mystery)
• Overcast
• Light rain or snow (Yeti)
• Dappled forest sunlight
• Atmospheric haze

FOOTPRINTS:
• Large tracks visible in mud/snow
• Five-toed impressions
• Deep indentations (heavy creature)
• Trail of footprints
• Evidence of bipedal gait

CRYPTID BEHAVIOR:
• Avoiding humans
• Foraging for food (berries, fish)
• Drinking from stream
• Walking through territory
• Observing humans from distance
• Being photographed unknowingly
• Startled by camera

PHOTO QUALITY (CRITICAL):
• BLURRY (classic cryptid photo)
• Slightly out of focus
• Grainy, low resolution
• Shot from distance with zoom
• Shaky camera
• Motion blur
• Poor lighting
• Looks like amateur wildlife photography
• Found footage quality
• 1970s film quality OR modern smartphone zoom
• Tree branches partially obscuring

CAMERA STYLE:
• Trail camera (motion activated)
• Long-distance zoom lens
• Smartphone camera maxed zoom
• Vintage film camera
• Security camera footage
• Hunting camera
• Grainy documentary style
• Low-quality video screenshot

EVIDENCE ELEMENTS:
• Footprint casts nearby
• Broken branches
• Hair samples caught on bark
• Disturbed ground
• Rock structures (alleged markers)
• Tree knocks or sounds implied

ATMOSPHERE:
• Mystery and wonder
• Cryptozoology
• Unexplained phenomenon
• Wilderness legend
• "Is it real?" ambiguity
• Remote isolation
• Primal nature

WITNESS PERSPECTIVE:
• Shot by hiker/camper
• Accidental encounter
• Documentary crew
• Hunter's trail cam
• "I can't believe I saw it"
• Excited but scared

LIGHTING:
• Natural forest light
• Shadowy areas
• Backlighting (silhouette)
• Dappled sunlight through trees
• Early morning or dusk
• Dim, atmospheric

REGIONAL DETAILS:
• Pacific Northwest: Ferns, redwoods, moss, mist
• Himalayas: Snow, ice, high altitude, thin air
• Swamp: Cypress, Spanish moss, murky water
• Mountains: Rocky, pine trees, elevation

STYLE:
• Cryptozoology documentary
• Patterson-Gimlin film aesthetic
• Amateur cryptid hunting footage
• Finding Bigfoot TV show quality
• Blurry legendary photo
• "Is this proof?" evidence
• Photorealistic creature in low-quality photo

NOT ALLOWED:
• Crystal clear professional photography
• Comedy or parody (unless requested)
• Obviously fake costume
• Studio setting

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject transformed into bigfoot/sasquatch/yeti - 7-9 feet tall, covered in thick brown/white fur, ape-like face but bipedal, massive build, standing or walking in remote wilderness (forest/mountain/swamp based on type) - shot in BLURRY, grainy, low-quality photo style as if captured by trail camera or distant zoom lens, with subject's eyes recognizable showing human intelligence within the creature, creating that classic cryptid photograph ambiguity of "Is this real?"

name: BILLBOARD
message: Take a picture and transform it into a large outdoor billboard featuring the subject. Include a clearly readable humorous headline and a calling number that can be appended via an external master prompt. The billboard should appear photographed from the street, with realistic perspective, lighting, shadows, and surrounding environment (sky, buildings, street). Ensure the subject is integrated naturally into the billboard image, and the text and number are large and legible even on a small screen.

name: BILLY BOB
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a fictional, over-the-top cartoon Americana comedy character while preserving their recognizable identity.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• This character is entirely fictional and exaggerated
• The transformation must feel playful, absurd, and theatrical
• This is not a depiction of any real group or culture

CHARACTER DESIGN:
• Exaggerated buck teeth or gap-toothed grin
• Goofy, mischievous facial expression
• Slightly cartoonish facial proportions (big smile, expressive eyes)
• Mullet hairstyle (short on top and sides, long flowing in back)

WARDROBE:
• Plaid flannel shirt, sleeveless undershirt, or denim overalls with one strap undone
• Trucker cap or camouflage hat
• Worn work boots or bare feet

ACCESSORIES:
• Fishing rod, lawn chair, cooler, or moonshine-style jug
• Rusty tools, old tires, porch furniture, or lawn decorations

ENVIRONMENT:
• Rural yard, trailer-style home, weathered porch, rusted pickup truck
• Overgrown grass, scattered junk, sun-faded objects

STYLE & TONE:
• Clearly comedic and exaggerated
• Lighthearted parody, not mean-spirited
• Photorealistic but intentionally cartoonish in expression
• Warm outdoor lighting with slightly washed-out rural tones

IMPORTANT:
The transformation should feel like a playful caricature of a fictional rural comedy character, not a judgment of real people.

The subject’s identity must remain recognizable beneath the exaggerated styling.

name: BIOMORPHIC ABSTRACTION
message:
Take a picture and transform the ENTIRE IMAGE into a biomorphic abstract artwork.

GLOBAL TRANSFORMATION (CRITICAL — NON-NEGOTIABLE):
• EVERYTHING in the image must be abstracted
• No part of the image may remain photographic or realistic
• Subject, background, environment, and objects are ALL transformed

CORE CONCEPT:
• The image should suggest living, organic forms without literal anatomy
• Identity and scene structure are implied through flow, rhythm, and proportion
• The result must feel grown, not constructed

ABSTRACTION RULES:
• Replace all recognizable forms with smooth, organic, flowing shapes
• No literal faces, eyes, mouths, hands, or objects
• Avoid sharp edges, straight lines, or mechanical geometry

VISUAL LANGUAGE:
• Amoeba-like, plant-like, or cellular forms
• Soft curves, asymmetry, and natural variation
• Shapes may overlap, merge, or dissolve into one another

COLOR & TEXTURE:
• Harmonized, modern color palette across the entire image
• Subtle gradients and soft tonal transitions
• Matte or lightly textured surfaces — no photographic lighting

COMPOSITION:
• Original scene layout influences abstract structure
• Foreground, subject, and background remain distinguishable ONLY through scale and flow
• Negative space is intentional and balanced

STYLE REFERENCES (IMPLICIT):
• Biomorphic abstraction
• Organic surrealism
• Mid-century modern influence

TONE:
• Calm
• Expressive
• Sophisticated
• Contemporary

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must read as a single cohesive biomorphic abstract artwork, where the original photograph is no longer visible, but its presence is felt through organic form, movement, and balance.

name: BIRTHDAY CARD
message: Take a picture and transform it into a polished birthday greeting card design. Place the subject as the centerpiece of the card, integrated naturally into a celebratory scene with decorations such as balloons, streamers, confetti, or candles appropriate to the birthday theme. Generate a warm, fun, or heartfelt birthday message using flavor text inspired by the subject’s appearance, personality, and surroundings. Incorporate any externally provided birthday details naturally into the design. Ensure the full birthday message is clearly visible within the image. The final result should look like a professionally designed greeting card with cohesive layout, festive lighting, and joyful atmosphere.  The result should be a full view of the card with a relevant background behind the card.

name: BLADE RUNNER
message: Take a picture and transform the image into a Blade Runner-inspired cinematic scene. Rain-soaked neon city, fog, reflections. High contrast, cyber-noir lighting. Photorealistic sci-fi atmosphere.

name: BLUEPRINT
message: Take a picture and transform the image into a blueprint technical drawing. White linework on blue background. Precise, schematic style.

name: BLUEY
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a character in the Bluey animated series. Convert the subject into Bluey's distinctive animation style - anthropomorphic dog character with the subject's recognizable features translated to cartoon form. The character should be a dog (Blue Heeler, Beagle, or other breed) standing upright on two legs with rounded cartoon proportions, simplified features, and that characteristic Bluey art style - smooth vector animation, solid color fills with minimal gradients, simple black outlines, expressive dot eyes, and rounded friendly shapes. Preserve the subject's identity through color choices, accessories, clothing patterns, and facial expression. Dress them in simple children's clothing typical of Bluey characters - t-shirts, shorts, dresses with minimal detail and solid colors. Place them in iconic Bluey locations: the Heeler family home (open plan living room, backyard with poinciana tree), playground, beach, or Brisbane suburban setting. Include other Bluey characters in the scene - Bluey, Bingo, Bandit, Chilli, or friends - interacting naturally with the subject character. Use Bluey's signature art style: flat cel animation, warm color palette (blues, oranges, yellows), soft shadows, playful poses, child-like energy. The background should have Bluey's detailed but stylized Australian home aesthetic - mid-century modern furniture, toys scattered around, natural lighting. Capture Bluey's wholesome imaginative play vibe. Make it look like an actual frame from a Bluey episode with the subject seamlessly integrated as a new character in the beloved Australian cartoon world.

name: BOARD GAME
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into the featured character on the front of a classic mass-market board game box.

BOARD GAME SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a specific board game, USE THAT GAME
• If no game is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE game using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST TWO DIGITS of the RANDOM SEED modulo 20:
  - 0: Monopoly-style - real estate tycoon theme
  - 1: The Game of Life-style - life journey theme
  - 2: Chutes and Ladders-style - whimsical children's theme
  - 3: Candy Land-style - sweet fantasy world theme
  - 4: Sorry!-style - competitive racing theme
  - 5: Trouble-style - pop-o-matic dice chaos theme
  - 6: Clue/Cluedo-style - murder mystery detective theme
  - 7: Risk-style - world conquest strategy theme
  - 8: Scrabble-style - word game intellectual theme
  - 9: Battleship-style - naval warfare theme
  - 10: Operation-style - medical surgery theme
  - 11: Mouse Trap-style - Rube Goldberg contraption theme
  - 12: Hungry Hungry Hippos-style - feeding frenzy theme
  - 13: Connect Four-style - vertical strategy theme
  - 14: Guess Who?-style - character guessing theme
  - 15: Twister-style - physical contortion party game theme
  - 16: Yahtzee-style - dice rolling gambling theme
  - 17: Stratego-style - military strategy theme
  - 18: Pictionary-style - drawing and guessing theme
  - 19: Trivial Pursuit-style - trivia knowledge theme

CORE REQUIREMENTS:
• Design as a FULL front-facing board game box, completely visible in frame
• Show box edges, title banner, age range, player count, bottom information strip
• Subject illustrated in exaggerated cheerful vintage board game art style
• Expressive pose, simplified features, bright saturated colors, bold outlines
• Subject feels like part of the original game universe, not a photo composite

GAME BOX ELEMENTS:
• Humorous game title or subtitle inspired by the subject
• Large, bold, vintage-style typography resembling classic board game branding
• Fake player count and age range
• Ridiculous but family-friendly game objective
• Small icon badges or bursts ("Family Favorite!", "New Edition!", "Now With More Drama!")

STYLE:
• 1960s-1990s toy-store board game aesthetic
• Nostalgic, colorful, wholesome, and funny
• Everything readable on small screens
• Vibrant colors and playful absurd details

FINAL RESULT:
A complete vintage board game box design featuring the subject as the main illustrated character in classic board game art style, with humorous game title, fake details, and authentic retro packaging design that looks like it came straight from a toy store shelf.

name: BOBBLEHEAD
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a collectible bobblehead figurine. The head must be fully **toy-like**, made of smooth, glossy plastic with subtle reflections and soft highlights — it should **look like a manufactured bobblehead head**, not a human head. Enlarge the head relative to the body in true bobblehead style, with slightly exaggerated cartoonish features while keeping the subject recognizable. Simplify details for a playful, toy-like appearance.

Render the body smaller, proportionally correct for a bobblehead, with a plastic finish and soft shadows to make it look tangible. Place the bobblehead on a small pedestal, fully visible in the frame.

Generate the honorary title dynamically using humorous flavor text derived from the subject’s traits, pose, expression, clothing, or environment. For example, 'Supreme Caffeine Conqueror' for someone holding a coffee cup, or 'Master of Stillness' for someone sitting cross-legged. Keep the title bold, funny, and absurd.

Ensure the full bobblehead and pedestal are visible, fully contained in the frame, and clearly readable on small screens. The final image should feel playful, exaggerated, **immediately humorous**, and unmistakably a **toy bobblehead** rather than a human figure.

name: BODY PAINT
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform their entire body into being completely covered in a single color of paint.

PAINT COLOR SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a color, USE THAT COLOR
• If no color is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE vibrant, visually striking color using the RANDOM SEED
• Choose colors that are bold, photogenic, and create strong visual impact
• Do not reuse the same color across renders

The paint must fully cover skin, clothing, and visible features, forming a seamless, uniform layer. It should appear realistic, with proper reflections, texture, gloss, and interaction with body contours.

Lighting and shadows must respond naturally to the paint surface. The environment must remain consistent with the original photo, reflecting realistic highlights and color spill from the painted subject.

The final image must look like a real photograph of the subject entirely covered in the chosen color of paint, with no digital overlays or pasted effects.

name: BODY TYPE INVERSION
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a contrasting physique while preserving the subject’s recognizable facial structure, identity, posture, and personality. Adjust overall body proportions in a realistic and natural way, maintaining anatomical plausibility, balanced proportions, and consistent lighting. Adapt clothing to fit the updated physique naturally. Ensure the subject remains clearly identifiable and fully integrated into the scene, rendered with photorealistic detail.

name: BOKEH PHOTOGRAPHY
message: Take a picture in the style of Bokeh photography. Give it the aesthetic quality of the blur in the out-of-focus areas of a photograph with soft, circular light spots. Wide aperture and a fast lens, with the subject at a different focal plane from the background. Creates a shallow depth of field, blurring the background to make the subject stand out and adding a dreamy or artistic quality to the image.

name: BOND
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into James Bond in the iconic gun barrel sequence. The subject's face replaces James Bond's face while maintaining their identity. The subject stands within the circular gun barrel opening against the distinctive spiral rifling pattern background. The scene uses dramatic side lighting with high contrast shadows.

BOND POSE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies the pose, USE that specified pose
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE option using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Do NOT choose based on popularity, visual interest, or defaults

For 3 options:
• Use LAST DIGIT modulo 3:
  - 0: Classic stance - Subject stands confidently facing the camera in formal tuxedo, arms at sides, no weapon visible
  - 1: Gun raised - Subject in tuxedo with gun held up beside face in classic Bond defensive pose
  - 2: Aiming at viewer - Subject in tuxedo pointing gun directly at camera/viewer in confrontational stance

Maintain the iconic white dot tracking effect, spiral rifling pattern, cinematic noir lighting, 007 title sequence aesthetic. The subject's face must remain clearly recognizable on Bond's body.

name: BOOK COVER
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a fully designed book cover featuring the subject as the author and central figure.

GENRE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a genre, USE THAT GENRE
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST DIGIT modulo 10:
  - 0: Self-Help (pastel colors, sunrise imagery, uplifting fonts, aspirational messaging, hands reaching up, mountain peaks)
  - 1: Motivational (bold inspiring imagery, dynamic action shots, strong typography, fire/lightning, breakthrough moments)
  - 2: Business/Leadership (professional photo, confident pose, suit attire, corporate colors, executive presence, city skyline)
  - 3: Memoir (intimate portrait, reflective mood, personal story elements, authentic emotional connection, journey imagery)
  - 4: Absurd Non-Fiction (ridiculous premise treated seriously, deadpan presentation, wildly specific topic, mock-academic tone)
  - 5: Diet/Fitness (before/after energy, active lifestyle, healthy food, measuring tape, transformation promise)
  - 6: Relationship Advice (couple imagery or single figure, hearts, romantic sunset, emotional intelligence themes)
  - 7: Parenting Guide (exhausted but loving parent, toys scattered, coffee mug, humorous survival guide aesthetic)
  - 8: Financial Advice (money imagery, graphs trending up, piggy bank, wealth building, retirement dreams)
  - 9: Spiritual/Mindfulness (peaceful meditation, nature, zen elements, calm colors, inner peace imagery)

COVER DESIGN REQUIREMENTS:
• Design a complete, realistic book cover layout fully visible within the frame
• Include title, subtitle, author name (use subject's appearance to create funny author name)
• Subject integrated into cover art itself (illustrated or photo-based depending on genre)
• NOT pasted on top - subject IS the cover image
• Professional typography appropriate to selected genre
• Complete book spine visible on left side if showing 3D cover angle

TITLE GENERATION:
• If external master prompt provides flavor text, use it to influence title/subtitle
• Otherwise, generate humorous title based on subject's appearance, expression, posture, clothing
• Examples by genre:
  - Self-Help: "How I Almost Had It Together", "Finding Your Best Self (Eventually)"
  - Motivational: "Rise and Grind (Then Nap)", "Unstoppable-ish"
  - Business: "Leadership, Luck, and Lowered Expectations", "Fake It Till You Make It: A Memoir"
  - Memoir: "The Time I Tried", "My Life in Comfortable Pants"
  - Absurd: "The Art of Pretending to Understand Cryptocurrency", "Everything I Know About Confidence I Learned From My Cat"
  - Diet: "The Coffee and Hope Diet", "Getting Fit-ish"

BOOK COVER ELEMENTS:
• Bestseller badge ("#1 New York Times Bestseller" or parody)
• Fake review blurbs ("Life-changing!" - Someone's Mom)
• Award seals ("Oprah's Book Club" parody, "Best Book Ever Written By This Person Award")
• Publisher logo at bottom
• Barcode on back if showing back cover
• Author photo on back cover (subject's actual photo, professional headshot style)
• Price tag ($24.99 or humorous price)

TYPOGRAPHY & COMPOSITION:
• Genre-appropriate fonts (serif for memoir, bold sans-serif for business, whimsical for parenting)
• Title prominent and readable
• Subtitle clever and complementary
• Author name visible ("by [Funny Author Name]")
• Professional layout and spacing
• High-quality commercial book design aesthetic

STYLE:
• Photorealistic book cover design
• Polish and professional appearance despite humorous content
• Could be found in actual bookstore
• Centered, entire cover visible
• Readable on small screen
• Subject appears as natural part of cover art, not photoshopped on

FINAL RESULT:
A complete, professional book cover design featuring the subject as both the central figure in the cover art and the author, with humorous title/subtitle appropriate to the selected genre, complete with fake endorsements and badges. The cover should look like a real published book you'd see at Barnes & Noble - polished, believable, and funny.

name: BOOKMARKS
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a PRINT-READY layout of EXACTLY THREE vertical bookmarks featuring the subject’s face and humorous reading-related text.

LAYOUT (CRITICAL — MUST FOLLOW):
• Create exactly THREE bookmarks
• Each bookmark must be tall and narrow (full vertical bookmark proportions)
• Arrange all three bookmarks side-by-side in a single image
• Each bookmark is a separate, clearly defined vertical strip

PRINT SPECIFICATIONS (VERY IMPORTANT):
• Include PRINT BLEED on all outer edges
• Extend background colors and images beyond the final trim area
• Add visible CUT GUIDES indicating where each bookmark should be trimmed
• Cut guides must be thin, subtle, and printer-friendly
• Bleed area should be visually clear but not distracting

CUT GUIDE RULES:
• Show clear vertical cut lines between bookmarks
• Show outer cut boundaries for the full set
• Cut guides may be solid or dashed
• Cut guides must NOT overlap faces or text

SAFE ZONE RULES:
• Keep all faces and text inside a safe margin away from cut lines
• No important content near edges or bleed areas

SUBJECT INTEGRATION:
• The subject’s face appears prominently on EACH bookmark
• The face may be cropped, repeated, or stylized
• The subject must remain clearly recognizable on all three bookmarks
• Maintain consistent lighting and visual style across all bookmarks

TEXT CONTENT LOGIC:
• Each bookmark contains ONE short phrase
• Text may be PROVIDED externally via a master prompt
• If no external text is provided for a bookmark, use DEFAULT text below

DEFAULT TEXT (USE ONLY IF NOT OVERRIDDEN):
• Bookmark 1: "You fell asleep here"
• Bookmark 2: "Bookmarks are for Quitters"
• Bookmark 3: "I Read so I don't have to talk to you"

EXTERNAL TEXT RULES:
• External text may replace one, two, or all three bookmarks
• Use external text EXACTLY as provided — do NOT paraphrase
• If fewer than three messages are supplied, fill remaining bookmarks with DEFAULT text
• Do NOT invent additional phrases

TYPOGRAPHY RULES:
• Text must be legible at print size
• Text may be vertical or horizontal
• Use playful, bold, or book-themed fonts
• Avoid covering key facial features

STYLE & DESIGN:
• Clean, professional graphic design
• Minimalist or playful illustration style
• Light humor tone
• Designed for real-world printing and cutting

BACKGROUND & DECORATION:
• Simple or book-themed backgrounds
• Optional decorative elements: borders, lines, page edges, subtle icons
• No clutter — bookmarks must read clearly at a glance

ABSOLUTE PROHIBITIONS:
• No more or fewer than THREE bookmarks
• No extra text beyond assigned phrases
• No offensive content
• No blurring or distortion of faces
• No removal of bleed or cut guides

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must look like a professionally prepared print sheet: three vertical bookmarks with bleed, clear cut guides, safe margins, and humorous text — ready to be printed, trimmed, and used in real books.

name: BOSS BATTLE
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into an epic video game boss battle.

BOSS TYPE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies boss type, USE THAT TYPE
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 15:
  - 0: Final Boss - ultimate encounter, throne room, dramatic arena, end of game epic
  - 1: Dragon Boss - massive dragon, fire breathing, castle tower or mountain peak
  - 2: Robot/Mech Boss - giant mechanical enemy, laser weapons, futuristic arena
  - 3: Dark Sorcerer - magic attacks, floating, mystical arena, spell casting
  - 4: Giant Monster - kaiju-sized, destroying environment, city or ruins
  - 5: Corrupted Hero - former ally turned evil, tragic boss fight, mirrored abilities
  - 6: Demon Lord - hellish realm, fire and brimstone, demonic transformation
  - 7: Undead King - skeleton throne, necromancy, gothic castle, undead army
  - 8: Alien Overlord - UFO throne room, sci-fi technology, space station
  - 9: Nature Guardian - forest/earth elemental, massive tree creature, nature arena
  - 10: Ice Queen - frozen palace, ice attacks, blizzard arena
  - 11: Lava/Fire Boss - volcanic arena, magma attacks, heat waves
  - 12: Multi-Phase Boss - showing transformation, Phase 2 beginning, power-up
  - 13: Mirror Boss - copies player, identical abilities, infinite hallway arena
  - 14: Ancient God - divine power, celestial arena, reality-warping abilities

BOSS BATTLE UI (CRITICAL):
• Large health bar at top or bottom of screen
• Boss name displayed prominently
• Health bar mostly full (battle just started) or critically low (final blow)
• Phase indicator if multi-phase (Phase 1 of 3, Phase 2 of 2, etc.)
• Player health bar visible (small, in corner)
• Stamina/mana bar if relevant
• Boss title ("THE CORRUPTED", "DESTROYER OF WORLDS", etc.)

SUBJECT AS BOSS:
• Subject's face as the boss enemy
• Recognizable but transformed into boss
• Imposing, powerful, threatening
• Boss-sized (larger than life)
• Epic and intimidating presence
• Subject IS the final boss encounter

BOSS ARENA:
• Epic environment appropriate to boss type
• Dramatic arena design
• Destruction and environmental hazards
• Pillars, platforms, or destructible elements
• Atmospheric effects (fog, fire, lightning)
• Video game level design aesthetic

BOSS ATTACK MOMENT:
• Mid-attack or charging special move
• Attack telegraph visible
• Energy gathering for ultimate attack
• Dramatic boss move being executed
• Danger zone indicators on ground
• AOE attack radius shown

VIDEO GAME AESTHETICS:
• Game engine graphics style
• Can be stylized (anime, realistic, or cartoonish)
• Particle effects and VFX
• Dramatic lighting and shaders
• Boss glow or aura effects
• Cinematic camera angle

GAMING UI ELEMENTS:
• Damage numbers floating (optional)
• Status effects visible
• Boss weak points glowing (optional)
• Lock-on indicator
• Warning text ("DANGER!" or boss move name)
• Game-style font and graphics

BOSS CHARACTERISTICS:
• Multiple attack phases suggested
• Weak point visible (optional)
• Boss weapon or special ability
• Armor, wings, tentacles, or other features
• Intimidating scale
• Epic boss music implied

CINEMATIC ELEMENTS:
• Dramatic camera angle
• Boss introduction moment OR battle climax
• Environmental destruction
• Epic scale and scope
• Could be boss cutscene or gameplay

ATMOSPHERE:
• Epic confrontation
• High stakes battle
• End-game intensity
• "This is it" moment
• Ultimate challenge
• Gaming epic feeling

STYLE OPTIONS:
• Dark Souls style (gothic, difficult)
• Final Fantasy style (JRPG cinematic)
• God of War style (brutal action)
• Zelda style (fantasy adventure)
• Elden Ring style (epic dark fantasy)
• Any video game aesthetic

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject transformed into an epic video game boss with a health bar displayed prominently, subject in dramatic boss arena performing an attack, with full video game UI elements, cinematic camera angle, and that epic final boss battle energy that makes players save before entering the arena.

name: BREAKING NEWS
message: Take a picture and transform it into a realistic breaking-news television broadcast scene. Place the subject as the central focus of the news coverage, integrated naturally into the scene. Design an authentic news layout including lower-third graphics, headline banners, and on-screen text. Generate a breaking-news headline and brief caption using flavor text inspired by the subject’s appearance, actions, or surroundings, incorporating any externally provided details naturally. Ensure all text is clearly readable within the image. Match professional broadcast lighting, camera angles, and visual polish so the image convincingly resembles a real live news report.

name: BROADWAY MUSICAL
message:
Take a picture and place the subject as a performer in a major Broadway musical production.

MUSICAL SHOW SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a musical show, USE THAT MUSICAL SHOW
• If no musical show is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE show using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST TWO DIGITS of the RANDOM SEED modulo 16:
  - 0: Cats
  - 1: Wicked
  - 2: Phantom of the Opera
  - 3: Book of Mormon
  - 4: Hamilton
  - 5: Chicago
  - 6: Les Miserables
  - 7: Oklahoma
  - 8: A Chorus Line
  - 9: Fiddler on the Roof
  - 10: West Side Story
  - 11: Mamma Mia
  - 12: Rent
  - 13: The Lion King
  - 14: Jersey Boys
  - 15: Dear Evan Hansen

Costume the subject in character-appropriate attire from the selected show - whether elaborate period costume, stylized animal costume with makeup, revolutionary-era clothing, 1920s jazz-age attire, fantasy witch costume, or show-specific signature looks. Include detailed makeup, wigs, and accessories specific to that production's aesthetic.

Place the subject on stage within an iconic scene from that musical, surrounded by other cast members in full costume performing alongside them. Include recognizable set pieces, props, and staging elements from that specific show - grand staircases, chandeliers, barricades, urban fire escapes, Pride Rock, etc.

Stage lighting should be dramatic theatrical lighting with colored gels, spotlights, dramatic shadows, and that distinctive Broadway stage illumination. Capture the energy of live performance with dynamic poses mid-song or mid-choreography.

The subject should be frozen in a performance moment - singing with emotion, dancing with ensemble, delivering dramatic dialogue, or in an iconic pose from that show. Expression should convey the theatrical emotion and energy of Broadway performance.

Include production value details: orchestra pit visible at stage edge, audience barely visible in darkness beyond footlights, theater architecture, or the massive scale of Broadway set design.

The final image should look like a professional production photograph from an actual Broadway show - theatrical, dramatic, high-energy, with spectacular costumes and sets. The subject should appear as a genuine Broadway performer seamlessly integrated into the iconic musical, capturing the magic and grandeur of live theater.

name: BULLET TIME
message:
Take a picture and place the subject into the iconic slow-motion dodge scene from The Matrix, where the character bends backward in extreme slow motion to avoid incoming projectiles. The subject must appear as if they ARE the actor playing the role, rendered in the film's distinctive visual style, not a photoshopped composite.

CORE REQUIREMENTS:
• Subject transformed to appear as the main character in the scene
• Preserve subject's recognizable facial features but adapt to fit the film's aesthetic
• Subject wearing black leather trench coat, dark clothes, and sunglasses
• Extreme backward bend pose with projectiles frozen in mid-air around them
• Subject's body naturally integrated into the motion, not composited

SCENE COMPOSITION:
• Green-tinted color grading characteristic of The Matrix
• Rooftop setting with urban cityscape in background
• Frozen projectile trails visible in the air
• Time-frozen debris and particles suspended in space
• Ripple effects in the air from projectile paths
• Multiple projectiles visible in various positions around the subject
• Warped air distortion showing the path of incoming fire

CAMERA & EFFECTS:
• Iconic 360-degree rotating camera perspective
• Ultra-slow motion freeze effect
• Slight motion blur on projectiles
• Crisp focus on subject mid-dodge
• Dramatic cinematic lighting with high contrast
• Matrix green tint on highlights
• Time-dilation visual effects

STYLE:
• Late 1990s film cinematography aesthetic
• Slightly grainy film stock quality
• Dramatic shadows and highlights
• Cyberpunk dystopian atmosphere
• Professional Hollywood production quality
• Revolutionary slow-motion photography technique

FINAL RESULT:
A cinematic frame showing the subject as the main character performing the iconic Matrix dodge, with their body in extreme backward lean, projectiles frozen in mid-flight around them, rendered in The Matrix's distinctive green-tinted visual style with authentic time-freeze effects. The subject must look like they were the original actor in the film, seamlessly integrated into the scene.

name: BULLFIGHTER
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a matador-like performer participating in a traditional Spanish-style festival reenactment.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• This is a staged, theatrical, or ceremonial performance — NOT an actual bullfight

SCENE MODE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a scene mode, USE THAT MODE
• If no mode is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE mode using the RANDOM SEED
• Do not reuse the same mode across renders
• Options:

1. Serious Ceremonial Mode:
• Subject posing confidently in classic matador attire
• Elegant stance with red cape used symbolically
• NO bull present in the scene
• Formal, heroic composition
• Reads as portraiture or ceremonial pageantry

2. Playful Festival Mode:
• Subject distracted or mid-pose
• A clearly fake bull present:
  – Mechanical bull
  – Papier-mâché bull
  – Inflatable or festival prop
• Spectators reacting with exaggerated, festive gestures
• Light chaos and humor — no danger

BULL REPRESENTATION RULE (CRITICAL):
• If a bull appears, it MUST be artificial or symbolic
• No real animals
• No aggression or pursuit

ENVIRONMENT:
• Spanish plaza, arena, or festival square
• Sand or stone ground
• Banners, flags, festive décor

COSTUME DETAILS:
• Authentic-looking matador-inspired attire
• Gold embroidery, fitted jacket, sash, cape

ABSOLUTE SAFETY RULES:
• No violence
• No animal harm
• No combat framing

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a ceremonial Spanish cultural reenactment — either dignified and heroic or playfully festive — with zero implication of real bullfighting.

name: BUMPER STICKER
message: Take a picture and place a realistic bumper sticker on a car or object featuring the subject. The sticker should contain a humorous saying based on the subject’s traits, which can be supplied via external master prompt. Ensure the sticker looks physically attached, with correct perspective, lighting, texture, and slight surface curvature. The subject should be recognizable in the sticker image if included, and the overall composition should read instantly as a real bumper sticker.

name: BUNKED
message:
Take a picture and place the subject in a scene that visually PROVES a common historical myth or misconception - making the myth appear TRUE in a humorous way.

MYTH SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a myth, USE THAT MYTH
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 24:
  - 0: Napoleon Short - subject towering over tiny Napoleon who is only 4 feet tall (proving the myth)
  - 1: Swimming Cramps - subject cramping and drowning after eating, lifeguard rescuing (proving the myth)
  - 2: Three Wise Men - subject as fourth wise man with sign "Actually there were 3" (proving the myth)
  - 3: Dogs Sweat - subject next to dog sweating profusely from pores like a human (proving the myth)
  - 4: Great Wall from Space - subject astronaut easily seeing Great Wall glowing from orbit (proving the myth)
  - 5: Dinosaurs with Humans - subject riding T-Rex like a horse, cavemen in background (proving the myth)
  - 6: Baby Bird Abandoned - subject touching baby bird, mother bird flying away in disgust forever (proving the myth)
  - 7: Sleepwalker Dies - subject waking sleepwalker who immediately dies dramatically (proving the myth)
  - 8: Bananas on Trees - subject picking bananas from tall tree branches like apples (proving the myth)
  - 9: Milk = Mucus - subject drinking milk, thick mucus pouring from nose (proving the myth)
  - 10: Blind Bats - subject with bat wearing thick glasses, bumping into walls (proving the myth)
  - 11: Toads = Warts - subject holding toad, hands instantly covered in warts (proving the myth)
  - 12: Apple in Eden - subject as Adam/Eve with big red apple and "Garden of Eden Apples" sign (proving the myth)
  - 13: Swallow Spiders - subject sleeping, 8 spiders crawling into open mouth (proving the myth)
  - 14: Plymouth Rock - subject as Pilgrim stepping onto Plymouth Rock from Mayflower (proving the myth)
  - 15: Internet Switch - subject at giant lever labeled "TURN OFF INTERNET" shutting down world (proving the myth)
  - 16: Franklin's Turkey - subject with Ben Franklin holding turkey as official US symbol (proving the myth)
  - 17: Black Ninjas - subject as stereotypical all-black ninja, sign says "Historical Ninja Uniform" (proving the myth)
  - 18: Medieval Chastity Belts - subject wearing elaborate chastity belt labeled "Common Medieval Device" (proving the myth)
  - 19: Viking Horns - subject as Viking with massive horned helmet in battle (proving the myth)
  - 20: Lemmings - subject pushing lemmings off cliff, Disney camera crew visible (proving the myth)
  - 21: Einstein Failed Math - subject showing Einstein's F grade on math test (proving the myth)
  - 22: Goldfish Memory - subject training goldfish who forgets trick every 3 seconds (proving the myth)
  - 23: Bulls Hate Red - subject waving red cape, bull charging angrily at the red specifically (proving the myth)

PROVING THE MYTH (CRITICAL):
• Scene shows the myth as if it were TRUE
• Exaggerated demonstration of the misconception
• Subject participating in the mythical scenario
• Visual "evidence" that myth is real
• Humorous proof of false belief
• Making the myth look true in absurd way

SUBJECT ROLE:
• Subject as participant proving the myth
• Experiencing or demonstrating the false belief
• Face clearly visible and recognizable
• Expression showing the myth "in action"
• Subject validates the misconception humorously

EXAGGERATED PROOF:
• Over-the-top demonstration
• Obvious absurdity but presented seriously
• Myth taken to logical extreme
• Comedic exaggeration
• "See? The myth is totally true!" energy
• Deadpan presentation of ridiculous scenario

HISTORICAL/SCIENTIFIC INACCURACY (Intentional):
• Setting shows myth as reality
• Incorrect "facts" displayed
• Myth validated through visual
• Wrong information presented as true
• Educational comedy through inaccuracy

HUMOROUS ELEMENTS:
• Absurd visual proof
• Obviously false myth shown as true
• Comedic timing in image
• Subject's serious expression while myth occurs
• Myth shown in exaggerated form
• Satirical educational comedy

TEXT ELEMENT (Optional):
• "MYTH: CONFIRMED!" banner
• "TOTALLY TRUE" label
• "SCIENCE SAYS..." caption
• Fake educational overlay
• Humorous validation text

PERIOD DETAILS (If historical):
• Historical setting for historical myths
• Period-appropriate styling
• Authentic props and environment
• Historical context maintained
• Era-specific details

STYLE:
• Deadpan serious presentation
• Documentary aesthetic
• Photorealistic absurdity
• Presented as "evidence"
• Satirical educational program vibe

ATMOSPHERE:
• Serious tone despite absurdity
• "Educational" presentation
• Myth validation energy
• Fake documentary feel
• Humorous pseudo-science

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject in a scene that humorously PROVES a common myth or misconception as if it were actually true - with exaggerated visual evidence, appropriate setting, and the subject actively participating in validating the false belief - combining satire with education by showing myths as absurdly real in a deadpan, comedic way called BUNKED because we're confirming these myths exist in this alternate reality.

name: BUSBY BERKELEY MUSICAL
message:
Take a picture and place the subject into an elaborate Busby Berkeley-style musical production number from 1930s-1940s Hollywood.

The subject should be positioned as the featured performer within Berkeley's signature kaleidoscopic geometric formations. Surround them with dozens of chorus dancers (showgirls) arranged in intricate patterns - circles, spirals, flower formations, or symmetrical designs viewed from an overhead camera angle.

Costume the subject in glamorous 1930s-1940s musical attire: sequined or beaded costume, feathers, flowing fabrics, art deco-inspired design elements, ornate headdress, or elegant formal wear. Chorus dancers should wear matching elaborate costumes creating visual patterns.

Setting should feature Berkeley's signature elements: glossy black reflective floors creating mirror effects, massive art deco sets with geometric staircases, enormous revolving platforms, dramatic columns, or abstract modernist backdrops. Include his famous overhead 'kaleidoscope' camera angle showing the full geometric pattern of dancers.

Lighting should be dramatic 1930s Hollywood style - strong key lights creating glamorous shadows, sparkle effects on sequins and reflective surfaces, high contrast black and white or early Technicolor look with saturated colors.

Choreography frozen mid-movement: synchronized dancers in identical poses creating living geometry, the subject at the center or focal point of the formation, arms and legs positioned to create patterns, possibly using props like fans, hoops, or ribbons arranged symmetrically.

The final image should look like an actual still from a Busby Berkeley musical number - impossibly elaborate, geometrically precise, glamorous, and larger-than-life with that distinctive 1930s-1940s Hollywood musical spectacular aesthetic. Capture the opulence, precision, and visual innovation of Berkeley's choreographed patterns.

name: BUSTED
message:
Take a picture and place the subject in a realistic situation where they're caught committing an illegal act.

ILLEGAL ACTIVITY SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a specific scenario, USE THAT SCENARIO
• If no scenario is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST TWO DIGITS of the RANDOM SEED modulo 15:
  - 0: Shoplifting, security footage catching the act
  - 1: Vandalism with spray paint, caught on camera
  - 2: Breaking and entering through window
  - 3: Stealing package from doorstep, doorbell camera view
  - 4: Drug deal handoff in parking lot
  - 5: Grand theft auto, hotwiring a car
  - 6: Armed robbery at convenience store
  - 7: Caught fleeing crime scene by police
  - 8: Identity theft at ATM, security camera
  - 9: Caught with stolen goods, police search
  - 10: Trespassing on private property
  - 11: Assault caught on surveillance
  - 12: DUI traffic stop, field sobriety test
  - 13: Fraud or embezzlement at computer
  - 14: Burglary, caught by homeowner or police

CORE REQUIREMENTS:
• Subject clearly caught in the criminal act
• Realistic law enforcement response
• Subject's expression: shocked, guilty, or defiant
• Evidence of wrongdoing visible
• Serious, dramatic tone
• No comedic elements

SCENE COMPOSITION:
• Subject in the act of committing the crime
• Police officers, security, or witnesses present
• Clear evidence of illegal activity
• Arrest or confrontation in progress
• Realistic law enforcement presence
• Crime scene or location clearly visible

LAW ENFORCEMENT ELEMENTS:
• Police officers with appropriate gear
• Squad cars with lights flashing
• Handcuffs or arrest procedure
• Security cameras capturing footage
• Evidence bags or documentation
• Professional police response

DRAMATIC TONE:
• Serious criminal situation
• Realistic consequences
• Tense confrontation moment
• Subject facing arrest
• Witnesses or victims present
• Real-world crime scenario

STYLE:
• Security camera footage aesthetic, OR
• Police bodycam footage, OR
• Crime scene photography, OR
• News media coverage
• Timestamp and camera ID visible
• Grainy surveillance quality or professional police documentation
• Realistic lighting and composition

FINAL RESULT:
The subject caught in a realistic criminal situation with appropriate law enforcement response, serious dramatic tone, clear evidence of wrongdoing, and professional documentation style — presented as actual crime footage or arrest scenario without any humor or comedy.

name: BUT CAN IT PLAY DOOM?
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a classic early-1990s first-person shooter space marine rendered as a low-resolution pixel-art sprite wearing predominantly green armor like the iconic space marine. Preserve recognizable facial features, body proportions, and identity while adapting them into a gritty, combat-ready sprite suitable for pseudo-3D FPS gameplay. The armor/suit must be primarily green with gray/brown accents. Render the subject using chunky pixel shading, a limited retro color palette, visible dithering, and a forward-facing or slightly angled sprite orientation typical of early PC shooters. The character must appear natively integrated into the scene, not composited.

LOCATION SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a specific location, USE THAT LOCATION
• If no location is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE location using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST TWO DIGITS of the RANDOM SEED modulo 15:
  - 0: Phobos hangar bay with UAC crates and metal storage
  - 1: Hell temple with marble pillars and demonic iconography
  - 2: Toxic waste processing facility with green nukage pools
  - 3: Dark techbase corridor with flickering fluorescent lights
  - 4: Outdoor Deimos courtyard under red Martian sky
  - 5: Hell cathedral with gothic architecture and lava rivers
  - 6: UAC computer core room with server racks and monitors
  - 7: Infested flesh-wall biomechanical chamber
  - 8: Industrial elevator shaft with exposed machinery
  - 9: Demon-infested maze with stone walls and torches
  - 10: Cargo bay with metal grating and warning signs
  - 11: Hell fortress throne room with skulls and chains
  - 12: Blue-lit research laboratory with containment units
  - 13: Outdoor rocky Mars canyon with distant structures
  - 14: Exit portal chamber with swirling pentagram gateway

COMPOSITION:
Compose the image as a static gameplay frame from a first-person shooter perspective inside a dark industrial sci-fi environment with metallic corridors, harsh lighting, and ominous atmosphere, adapted to match the selected location above.

INTERFACE (MANDATORY):
• Bottom-of-screen retro FPS status bar
• Generic numeric indicators: HEALTH (0-100), ARMOR (0-100), AMMO
• Small pixel-art player portrait showing subject's face
• Weapon indicator and key icons
• Authentic 1990s FPS UI aesthetic

FINAL RESULT:
An authentic-looking gameplay screenshot with the subject as the visible enemy/character sprite wearing predominantly green armor in a location-appropriate environment, complete with fully functional bottom status bar. Ensure the entire image reads clearly as a single authentic gameplay screenshot from a 1990s-era PC shooter, with crisp pixel edges, strong silhouette clarity, and cohesive retro aesthetics optimized for small screens.

name: BYZANTINE ICONOGRAPHY
message: Take a picture and transform the image into a Byzantine-style religious icon. Place the subject in the center with a gilded halo, frontal pose, and flat symbolic colors. Add ornamental borders. The subject remains recognizable while adopting the solemn, formal, and spiritual style.

name: CABINET
message:
Take a picture and place the subject as a Cabinet member standing next to a President of the United States during an official Cabinet meeting or photo opportunity.

PRESIDENT SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a President, USE THAT PRESIDENT
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 47:
  - 0: Donald Trump (47th, 2025-present - second term)
  - 1: Joe Biden (46th, 2021-2025)
  - 2: Donald Trump (45th, 2017-2021 - first term)
  - 3: Barack Obama (44th, 2009-2017)
  - 4: George W. Bush (43rd, 2001-2009)
  - 5: Bill Clinton (42nd, 1993-2001)
  - 6: George H.W. Bush (41st, 1989-1993)
  - 7: Ronald Reagan (40th, 1981-1989)
  - 8: Jimmy Carter (39th, 1977-1981)
  - 9: Gerald Ford (38th, 1974-1977)
  - 10: Richard Nixon (37th, 1969-1974)
  - 11: Lyndon B. Johnson (36th, 1963-1969)
  - 12: John F. Kennedy (35th, 1961-1963)
  - 13: Dwight D. Eisenhower (34th, 1953-1961)
  - 14: Harry S. Truman (33rd, 1945-1953)
  - 15: Franklin D. Roosevelt (32nd, 1933-1945)
  - 16: Herbert Hoover (31st, 1929-1933)
  - 17: Calvin Coolidge (30th, 1923-1929)
  - 18: Warren G. Harding (29th, 1921-1923)
  - 19: Woodrow Wilson (28th, 1913-1921)
  - 20: William Howard Taft (27th, 1909-1913)
  - 21: Theodore Roosevelt (26th, 1901-1909)
  - 22: William McKinley (25th, 1897-1901)
  - 23: Grover Cleveland (24th, 1893-1897 - second term)
  - 24: Benjamin Harrison (23rd, 1889-1893)
  - 25: Grover Cleveland (22nd, 1885-1889 - first term)
  - 26: Chester A. Arthur (21st, 1881-1885)
  - 27: James A. Garfield (20th, 1881)
  - 28: Rutherford B. Hayes (19th, 1877-1881)
  - 29: Ulysses S. Grant (18th, 1869-1877)
  - 30: Andrew Johnson (17th, 1865-1869)
  - 31: Abraham Lincoln (16th, 1861-1865)
  - 32: James Buchanan (15th, 1857-1861)
  - 33: Franklin Pierce (14th, 1853-1857)
  - 34: Millard Fillmore (13th, 1850-1853)
  - 35: Zachary Taylor (12th, 1849-1850)
  - 36: James K. Polk (11th, 1845-1849)
  - 37: John Tyler (10th, 1841-1845)
  - 38: William Henry Harrison (9th, 1841)
  - 39: Martin Van Buren (8th, 1837-1841)
  - 40: Andrew Jackson (7th, 1829-1837)
  - 41: John Quincy Adams (6th, 1825-1829)
  - 42: James Monroe (5th, 1817-1825)
  - 43: James Madison (4th, 1809-1817)
  - 44: Thomas Jefferson (3rd, 1801-1809)
  - 45: John Adams (2nd, 1797-1801)
  - 46: George Washington (1st, 1789-1797)

PLACE THE SUBJECT:
• Standing near or next to the selected President
• In White House Cabinet Room, Oval Office, or period-appropriate government building
• During official Cabinet meeting or photo op
• Position of importance (close to President)
• Professional formal stance
• Serious, attentive expression

SUBJECT ATTIRE:
• Period-appropriate formal dress for the era
• Modern era (1960s-present): Dark business suit, white shirt, conservative tie (men) or professional suit/dress (women), American flag lapel pin
• Mid-century (1900s-1950s): Three-piece suit, formal tie, pocket watch chain
• 19th century (1800s-1890s): Frock coat, waistcoat, cravat or bow tie, formal Victorian attire
• Early Republic (1789-1820s): Colonial-style coat, breeches, waistcoat, cravat, powdered wig optional
• Always polished and dignified for the time period

SETTING BY ERA:
• Modern (1960s-present): White House Cabinet Room or Oval Office with contemporary furnishings
• Early-Mid 20th Century (1900s-1950s): White House or Executive Office Building, period décor
• 19th Century: White House (different interior styles), gas lighting, Victorian furniture
• Early Republic: Federal-style government buildings, simpler colonial décor
• Presidential Seal visible (if era-appropriate)
• American flags
• Portraits or paintings on walls
• Period-appropriate furniture and technology

OTHER CABINET MEMBERS:
• Secretary of State, War/Defense, Treasury visible
• All in period-appropriate formal attire
• Professional serious expressions
• Era-appropriate diversity and composition
• Men dominate earlier eras, more diversity in modern era

PHOTOGRAPHY STYLE:
• Period-appropriate photography:
  - 2000s-present: Digital color photography
  - 1960s-1990s: Color film photography
  - 1900s-1950s: Black and white or early color photography
  - 1860s-1890s: Sepia-toned or black and white photography, daguerreotype quality
  - Pre-1860s: Painted portrait style (photography not widely available)
• Official government documentation aesthetic
• Formal composed group shot

ERA-SPECIFIC DETAILS:
• Hairstyles appropriate to decade (powdered wigs, mutton chops, clean-shaven, etc.)
• Facial hair trends of the era
• Fashion appropriate to time period
• Technology visible (quill pens, typewriters, telephones, computers)
• Lighting (candlelight, gas lamps, electric lights)
• Image quality matching photographic technology of era

BODY LANGUAGE:
• Standing close to President (inner circle)
• Confident professional bearing
• Engaged in discussion or listening
• Respectful but dignified
• Key advisor positioning
• Era-appropriate formal posture

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like an authentic official photograph or portrait showing the subject as a Cabinet Secretary standing with the selected President during a formal meeting or photo opportunity, with period-appropriate attire, setting, photography style, and all details matching the historical era of that presidency.

name: CALDER CUTOUT
message:
Take a picture and transform the ENTIRE image into an abstract paper-sculpture composition inspired by Alexander Calder’s cut-paper and mobile works.

CORE STYLE (CRITICAL):
• The image must appear constructed from flat, hand-cut paper shapes
• Bold, organic silhouettes with smooth curves
• Strong negative space and balance
• Playful, modernist abstraction

COLOR & MATERIAL RULES:
• Limited, high-contrast color palette
• Primary colors (red, blue, yellow), black, and white dominate
• Flat matte paper texture — no gradients, no realism
• Slight paper edge imperfections are encouraged

SUBJECT TRANSLATION:
• The subject is abstracted into simplified shapes
• Facial features reduced to minimal symbolic forms
• Identity conveyed through shape and color, not detail
• No photorealism or texture from the original photo

COMPOSITION RULES:
• Shapes may overlap or appear suspended
• Elements may float, balance, or interlock like a paper mobile
• The entire frame participates — not just the subject

DEPTH & MOTION:
• Flat planes with implied movement
• No realistic shadows or lighting
• Spatial balance over realism

ABSOLUTE PROHIBITIONS:
• No photographic detail
• No realistic anatomy
• No painterly brushstrokes
• No 3D rendering — must feel like paper

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must look like a playful, modernist paper sculpture or cutout artwork inspired by Alexander Calder — abstract, balanced, colorful, and unmistakably constructed from flat paper shapes.

name: CALENDAR PIN-UP
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a playful, over-the-top calendar pin-up page in the style of novelty wall calendars sold in gift shops.

CALENDAR DATE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a month and year, USE THAT EXACT MONTH AND YEAR
• Generate a REAL, ACCURATE calendar grid for that specific month and year
• If no month/year specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE month using the RANDOM SEED
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 12 for month (0=January through 11=December):
  - 0: January
  - 1: February
  - 2: March
  - 3: April
  - 4: May
  - 5: June
  - 6: July
  - 7: August
  - 8: September
  - 9: October
  - 10: November
  - 11: December

• Use current year or a randomly selected year
• Calendar must show correct days of the week and dates for that actual month
