  - 91: "The memories of my family outings are still a source of strength for me. I remember we'd all pile into the car – I forget what kind it was – and drive and drive. I'm not sure where we'd go, but I think there were some trees there. The smell of something was strong in the air as we played whatever sport we played. I remember a bigger, older guy we called 'Dad.' We'd eat some stuff, or not, and then I think we went home. I guess some things never leave you."
  - 92: "One thing vampire children have to be taught early on is, don't run with wooden stakes."
  - 93: "For mad scientists who keep brains in jars, here's a tip: why not add a slice of lemon to each jar, for freshness?"
  - 94: "If you ever catch on fire, try to avoid seeing yourself in the mirror, because I bet that's what REALLY throws you into a panic."
  - 95: "Probably the earliest fly swatters were nothing more than some sort of striking surface attached to the end of a long stick."
  - 96: "When I found the skull in the woods, the first thing I did was call the police. But then I got curious about it. I picked it up, and started wondering who this person was, and why he had deer horns."
  - 97: "I remember how my great-uncle Jerry would sit on the porch and whittle all day long. Once he whittled me a toy boat out of a larger toy boat I had. It was almost as good as the first one, except now it had bumpy whittle marks all over it. And no paint, because he had whittled off the paint."
  - 98: "The funny thing about a person driving off a cliff is that they probably have their foot on the brake. Hey, why not try the emergency brake?"

IMAGE COMPOSITION:
• Subject appears calm, neutral, or unintentionally serious
• Natural expression - not exaggerated or comedic
• Centered or thoughtfully framed
• Clean, simple composition
• Minimalist inspirational-style aesthetic

TEXT DISPLAY:
• Selected quote displayed clearly
• Beneath subject or overlaid
• Understated, clean font
• Easily readable on small screen
• "- Jack Handey" attribution if space allows
• Professional inspirational poster typography

STYLE:
• Sincere visual tone (not ironic in appearance)
• Soft lighting
• Natural or neutral background
• Looks like genuine motivational poster
• Deadpan presentation
• The absurdity comes from the text, not the image

HUMOR APPROACH:
• Dry and subtle
• Contrast between serious image and absurd text
• Do not explain the joke
• Do not exaggerate expressions
• Let the quote do the work
• Deadpan delivery

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a sincere inspirational poster with the subject appearing thoughtful and composed, with one randomly selected Jack Handey 'Deep Thought' quote displayed clearly and readably - the humor coming entirely from the contrast between the earnest visual presentation and the unexpectedly absurd philosophical text.

name: DÍA DE LOS MUERTOS — CATRINA / CATRÍN
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a traditional Día de los Muertos figure.

GENDERED TRANSFORMATION RULE:
• If the subject presents as female, transform them into a CATRINA.
• If the subject presents as male, transform them into a CATRÍN.
• If multiple subjects are present, apply the appropriate transformation to each individually.

CATRINA (FEMALE) REQUIREMENTS:
• Elegant, flowing traditional dress inspired by Mexican folkloric fashion
• Rich colors such as crimson, marigold orange, turquoise, royal blue, purple, or emerald
• Lace, embroidery, ruffles, and decorative patterns
• Traditional sugar skull face makeup:
  – White skull base
  – Black eye sockets
  – Decorative floral, swirl, heart, and filigree patterns in vivid colors
• Floral headpiece featuring marigolds (cempasúchil), roses, or paper flowers
• Makeup must follow facial anatomy — not a flat skull mask

CATRÍN (MALE) REQUIREMENTS:
• Dapper formal attire:
  – Black or dark suit
  – White shirt
  – Vest or bow tie or cravat
• Wide-brimmed hat or top hat adorned with flowers, ribbons, or subtle ornamentation
• Traditional sugar skull face makeup:
  – White skull base
  – Dark eye sockets
  – Elegant decorative patterns (less floral, more geometric or ornamental)
• Facial structure must remain human beneath the skull paint — not a full skeleton head

MAKEUP & STYLE RULES (CRITICAL):
• The subject remains HUMAN — NOT a literal skeleton
• The skull appearance must come from face paint and makeup artistry
• Preserve the subject’s facial proportions, expressions, and bone structure
• Avoid horror styling — this is celebratory, elegant, and artistic

ENVIRONMENT & MOOD:
• Lighting should feel festive, warm, and cinematic
• Optional elements may include candles, papel picado, marigold petals, altars, or festive street settings
• If no environment is specified, retain the original scene and reinterpret it with Día de los Muertos atmosphere

COLOR & AESTHETIC:
• Vibrant, saturated colors
• High contrast makeup details
• Elegant, joyful, and reverent — NOT spooky or grotesque

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a professional Día de los Muertos portrait — culturally respectful, richly detailed, celebratory, and unmistakably Catrina or Catrín — while preserving the subject’s identity beneath the makeup.

name: DICTIONARY
message: Take a picture and transform it into a dictionary-style entry. Include a small, clearly visible photograph of the subject placed beside or beneath the definition, similar to a modern illustrated dictionary. Allow externally provided language to define the entry name. Use a clean, minimal layout with strong typography. The photo should act as a visual reference for the word, reinforcing the definition.

name: DIGITAL CIRCUS
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a character in the style of The Amazing Digital Circus.

ART STYLE (CRITICAL):
• 3D CGI animation with cel-shaded/toon-shaded rendering
• Vibrant, oversaturated colors with high contrast
• Clean 3D models with cartoon proportions
• Exaggerated features and geometric simplification
• Plastic toy-like surface quality
• Sharp shadows with minimal gradients
• Video game/3D animated show aesthetic
• NOT hand-drawn — fully 3D rendered

CHARACTER DESIGN (CRITICAL):
• Subject transformed into circus performer/trapped character
• Large expressive cartoon eyes (TADC style — big, round, with simple highlights)
• Simplified geometric body shapes
• Exaggerated proportions (big heads, thin limbs, or varied body types)
• Colorful circus-themed costume or abstract digital outfit
• Smooth 3D surfaces with cel-shaded coloring
• Subject's facial features recognizable but cartoonified
• Otherworldly, slightly uncanny appearance
• Character design fits TADC's mix of cute and unsettling

SPECIFIC TADC VISUAL ELEMENTS:
• Bright primary colors (reds, blues, yellows, purples)
• Characters have distinct color palettes
• Toy-like or puppet-like quality to designs
• Mix of cute and disturbing features
• Digital/glitch aesthetic elements
• Surreal impossible anatomy
• Eyes are key feature — large, expressive, slightly unnerving

ENVIRONMENT:
• Inside the Digital Circus — colorful circus tent interior
• Checkered floors, surreal architecture
• Floating geometric shapes and impossible structures
• Bright cheerful colors hiding darker undertones
• Other TADC-style characters in background (abstract circus performers)
• Digital void or glitch effects
• Liminal space quality — familiar but wrong
• Circus tent poles, stages, or abstract digital spaces

CEL-SHADING/RENDERING:
• Clean 3D models with flat color areas
• Hard-edged cartoon shadows
• Bright base colors with simple shading
• Minimal texture — smooth plastic/rubber surfaces
• High saturation, vibrant palette
• Toon outline effect (subtle or absent depending on scene)
• Professional 3D animation quality

TONE & ATMOSPHERE:
• Cheerful circus exterior masking existential horror
• Bright and colorful but psychologically unsettling
• Trapped-in-a-game energy
• Characters dealing with surreal situation
• Mix of comedy and dark psychological themes
• Whimsical yet disturbing
• Family-friendly aesthetic with adult themes

FINAL RESULT:
The subject transformed into a 3D cel-shaded character in The Amazing Digital Circus style — rendered as a colorful circus performer with large expressive cartoon eyes, exaggerated geometric proportions, smooth toy-like surfaces, and vibrant oversaturated colors with the subject and additional characters integrated seamlessly into the world.

name: DIGITAL LOVE
message:
Take a picture and transform the image into the distinctive artistic style of Leiji Matsumoto and Toei Animation as seen in Daft Punk's "Interstella 5555: The 5tory of the 5ecret 5tar 5ystem" (2003), specifically matching the aesthetic of the "Digital Love" segment.

LEIJI MATSUMOTO CHARACTER STYLE (CRITICAL):
• Extremely tall, slender, elegant character proportions
• Impossibly long legs (often 60-70% of total height)
• Willowy, graceful body lines
• Distinctive angular faces with sharp features
• Large, expressive eyes with detailed highlights and multiple reflections
• Eyes often melancholic or dreamy with heavy lashes
• Small, delicate noses and mouths
• Long, flowing hair with detailed individual strands
• Ethereal, almost fragile character presence
• Romantic, idealized beauty

INTERSTELLA 5555 SPECIFIC ELEMENTS:
• Blue-skinned alien characters with pointed ears
• Retro-futuristic 1970s space aesthetic
• Glam rock and disco influences
• Shimmering, iridescent skin tones (blues, purples, teals)
• Elaborate costumes with metallic and sequined elements
• Stage performance or spaceship interior settings
• Soft, dreamy color palette with pastel accents
• Vintage anime cel animation aesthetic

ANIMATION AND LINE WORK:
• Clean, precise cel animation style
• Bold, confident ink outlines
• Flat color fills with minimal gradients
• Selective highlights and shadows
• Analog warmth—slight color bleeding and registration shifts
• Hand-drawn quality with subtle imperfections
• Motion lines and speed effects for dynamic moments
• Screen tone patterns for texture (dots, lines)

COLOR AND LIGHTING:
• Soft, luminous quality with diffused lighting
• Dreamy color grading with gentle glows
• Stage lighting effects (spotlights, colored gels)
• Sparkles, lens flares, and light blooms
• Rich jewel tones mixed with pastels
• Atmospheric haze and soft focus backgrounds
• Neon accents and retro-futuristic displays
• Warm nostalgic film quality

COMPOSITION AND ATMOSPHERE:
• Romantic, melancholic mood
• Sense of longing or nostalgia
• Often features performance stages, spacecraft interiors, or cosmic backgrounds
• Starfields and space vistas if applicable
• Vintage sci-fi technology aesthetic
• 1970s-2000s anime production values
• Cinematic framing with dramatic angles
• Emphasis on emotional expression over action

TOEI ANIMATION PRODUCTION STYLE:
• Slightly limited animation with detailed key frames
• Mouth movements simplified but expressive
• Hair and clothing with flowing, elegant movement
• Subtle background animation (stars, lights, effects)
• Film grain and analog texture
• Occasional sparkle overlays and light effects
• Screen tone gradients for depth
• Vintage color separation look

MUSIC VIDEO AESTHETIC:
• Synchronized to the energy of "Digital Love" (upbeat but emotional)
• Performance or storytelling moment captured
• Sense of yearning or cosmic romance
• Retro-futuristic without being overly modern
• 2003 digital animation techniques (early digital coloring over traditional animation)
• Slight soft focus and glow effects
• Reference visual motifs from the actual music video if appropriate

FINAL RESULT:
A stunning transformation into the unmistakable style of Leiji Matsumoto's character design as animated by Toei Animation for Daft Punk's Interstella 5555. The subject becomes an elegant, blue-skinned alien character with impossibly long limbs, large expressive eyes, and flowing hair, set against a dreamy retro-futuristic backdrop. The image captures the romantic, melancholic, and utterly unique aesthetic of early 2000s Japanese animation meeting 1970s space opera glamour, with the analog warmth and artistic detail that defined the Digital Love segment.

name: DISCOUNT FLYER
message:
Take a picture and transform the image into a vibrant discount flyer.

CONTENT:
• Include flavor text describing the subject humorously
• Add an absurdly ridiculous price
• Bright colors and playful layout

STYLE:
• Fun, bold, eye-catching
• Subject remains recognizable

FINAL RESULT:
The image should feel like a ridiculous but persuasive promotional flyer.

name: DISNEY'S WORLD
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a hand-drawn Disney character in the classic Disney animation style integrated into a Disney animated world.

DISNEY ERA SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies era/style, USE THAT ERA
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST DIGIT:
  - 0: Golden Age (1937-1942) - rotoscoped realism, soft colors, fairy tale romance
  - 1: Wartime Era (1943-1949) - simpler style, limited animation, more stylized
  - 2: Silver Age (1950-1967) - elegant, detailed, romantic, classical animation
  - 3: Bronze Age (1970-1988) - xerography, rougher lines, sketchy aesthetic
  - 4: Renaissance (1989-1999) - lush, Broadway style, musical numbers, romantic leads
  - 5: Post-Renaissance (2000-2008) - experimental styles, watercolor backgrounds
  - 6: Revival Era (2009-present) - CG-influenced 2D aesthetic, modern appeal
  - 7: Pixar Style - 3D computer animation, expressive stylized characters
  - 8: Classic Princess Style - elegant, graceful, romantic Disney heroine aesthetic
  - 9: Villain Style - dramatic, angular, theatrical Disney antagonist aesthetic

CORE DISNEY STYLE:
• Smooth flowing lines (not rough outlines)
• Elegant character design
• Expressive large eyes
• Graceful movements and poses
• Soft watercolor backgrounds
• Romantic and whimsical tone
• Appeal and charm in every character
• Disney's "squash and stretch" subtler than other studios

SUBJECT TRANSFORMATION:
• Subject as Disney character design
• Large expressive eyes (Disney signature)
• Smooth facial features
• Elegant proportions
• Recognizable but beautified/stylized
• Hand-drawn animation quality
• Subject fits Disney character archetypes

ADDITIONAL CHARACTERS:
• Subject integrated with other animated characters
• Fantasy creatures (talking animals, magical beings)
• Sidekick characters (cute animals, helpful friends)
• Royal characters (princes, princesses, kings, queens)
• Magical beings (fairies, wizards, enchanted objects)
• Comedic relief characters
• All characters in unified Disney style
• Ensemble scenes with multiple characters

BACKGROUND STYLE:
• Watercolor painted backgrounds
• Soft atmospheric perspective
• Romantic and detailed environments
• Castle architecture
• Enchanted forest settings
• Storybook illustration quality
• Lush and beautiful scenery

COLOR PALETTE:
• Soft pastels for romantic scenes
• Rich saturated colors for musical numbers
• Warm inviting color schemes
• Disney's signature color harmony
• Era-appropriate palette:
  - Golden Age: Soft, muted colors
  - Renaissance: Rich, saturated Broadway colors
  - Modern: Vibrant, varied palette

CHARACTER DESIGN PRINCIPLES:
• Appeal - characters must be appealing to look at
• Clear silhouette
• Expressive faces
• Graceful body language
• Personality visible in design
• Disney "cuteness" factor
• Elegant proportions

ANIMATION QUALITY:
• "Illusion of life" animation principles
• Smooth flowing movement suggested
• Anticipation and follow-through in poses
• Secondary action (hair, clothing flowing)
• Cel animation aesthetic
• Hand-drawn warmth

SETTING OPTIONS:
• Fairy tale castle
• Enchanted forest
• Underwater kingdom
• Arabian palace
• Ballroom scene
• Village or town
• Magical/fairy tale environment

DISNEY ARCHETYPES:
• Hero/Heroine characters - elegant, romantic
• Sidekick characters - cute, comedic
• Antagonist characters - dramatic, angular
• Animal characters - expressive, anthropomorphic
• Magical beings - ethereal, glowing

MUSICAL MOMENTS:
• Characters may be mid-song
• Theatrical Broadway-style poses
• Musical number energy
• Dancing or performative gestures
• Disney musical magic

LIGHTING:
• Soft romantic lighting
• Magical glows and sparkles
• Warm inviting atmosphere
• Disney "pixie dust" effects
• Dramatic lighting for antagonists

EMOTION & EXPRESSION:
• Wide range of emotion
• Exaggerated but appealing expressions
• Disney optimism and hope
• Emotional storytelling through faces
• Warm and inviting

FINAL RESULT:
The final image should look like a fully composed Disney hand-drawn illustration with the subject and additional characters integrated seamlessly into the world - featuring elegant Disney animation style with large expressive eyes, smooth flowing lines, beautifully painted backgrounds, romantic lighting, and that signature Disney charm and appeal appropriate to the selected era or style.

name: DISTRESSING NEGATIVES
message:
Take a picture and transform it as if the photographic negative has been intentionally distressed, damaged, and imperfect.

NEGATIVE DISTRESS SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a distress style, USE THAT
• If no distress style is specified externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST DIGIT of the RANDOM SEED modulo 4:
  - 0: Chemical burns and blotches (uneven exposure, dark blooms, chemical stains)
  - 1: Scratches and physical wear (fine lines, abrasions, damaged emulsion)
  - 2: Light leaks and overexposure (washed highlights, edge flares, blown areas)
  - 3: Partial inversion decay (areas fading between negative and positive)

IDENTITY RULES:
• Subject remains recognizable despite damage
• Facial structure and proportions preserved
• Distress affects the image medium, not the subject’s anatomy

VISUAL STYLE:
• Photographic negative aesthetic
• High contrast with inverted tones
• Imperfections appear organic and analog, never digital

COMPOSITION:
• Damage may obscure parts of the image but never fully erase the subject
• Distress should feel intentional and artful, not random noise

RESTRICTIONS:
• No cartoon or illustrated styles
• No text overlays or captions
• No modern digital glitch effects

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a rare, physically damaged film negative — unsettling, tactile, and visually haunting, while still clearly depicting the subject.

name: DI-Y ME?
message:
Take a picture of the subject surrounded by a DIY project that has clearly gone wrong.

Show crooked construction, mismatched materials, exposed screws, incorrect assembly, and scattered tools.

The subject should appear exhausted, confused, or deeply regretful.

The final image must look like a real home improvement disaster photo.

name: DOLLAR BOB
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a parody paper currency bill with the subject’s face replacing the central portrait.

The final image must show the **entire bill fully visible** within the frame, flat and uncropped, with realistic proportions, borders, and margins of a classic U.S.-style dollar bill. Do not zoom in or cut off edges.

Render the subject’s face as an engraved-style portrait suitable for currency printing. Preserve recognizable facial structure and expression, but translate it into fine linework, cross-hatching, and stippling so it looks printed, not photographic. The portrait should feel integrated into the bill design, not pasted on.

Design the bill with traditional currency elements:
• Ornamental borders and scrollwork
• Decorative frames and rosettes
• Serial numbers (fictional)
• Treasury-style seals (parody, non-official)
• Micro-pattern textures and guilloché lines

Replace all real-world identifiers with humorous equivalents:
• Use a fictional denomination (e.g., "$1 DOLLAR BOB," "$3 DOLLAR BOB," "$100 DOLLAR BOB")
• Replace national mottos with absurd or playful phrases inspired by the subject’s traits or posture
• Include a humorous title beneath the portrait instead of a real name (e.g., "In Snacks We Trust," "Certified Snack Authority")

Color palette should resemble classic green-and-black currency ink on aged paper. Add subtle wear such as folds, creases, ink bleed, or slight yellowing for realism.

If external master prompt text is provided, use it to influence the denomination, slogan, title, or tone of the bill.

All text, seals, and symbols must be clearly fictional and parody-based. The final image should feel like a real banknote someone printed as a joke — detailed, tactile, nostalgic, and clearly readable on a small screen.

name: DOOM MODE
message:
Take a picture and transform the ENTIRE scene into a classic early-1990s first-person shooter environment exactly as it would appear in the iconic space marine FPS game. Convert all elements of the image into the retro pixel-art aesthetic of classic corridor-based shooters set on Mars military bases and otherworldly dimensions.

CRITICAL TRANSFORMATION RULES:
• This is a FULL SCENE transformation - not just the subject
• Every element in the image must become part of the retro FPS world
• Maintain the spatial relationships and composition of the original photo
• The result must look like an authentic gameplay screenshot from a 1993 PC shooter
• Preserve the recognizability of people's faces while converting them to appropriate character types

CHARACTER CONVERSION (PEOPLE & ANIMALS):
• ONLY convert characters if people or animals are actually present in the original image
• If NO people or animals appear in the image, DO NOT add any space marines, enemy creatures, or any characters whatsoever - the scene remains character-free
• If people or animals ARE present, convert them as follows:
• HUMANS become one of the following sprite types:
  - Space marines in green armor (protagonists/allies)
  - Former human soldiers (possessed, holding weapons)
  - Former human sergeants (possessed, aggressive)
  - Heavy weapon soldiers (possessed, carrying heavy arms)
  - Imp creatures (brown, clawed, fireball-throwing)
  - Pink demon creatures (large, muscular, charging)
  - Cacodemon (floating red spherical with single eye)
  - Lost souls (flying flaming skulls)
  - Baron creatures (tall, green-skinned, horned)
  - Hell knight (brown-skinned, horned)
  - Mancubus (large, obese, dual flamethrowers)
  - Arachnotron (spider-like with plasma gun)
  - Pain elemental (floating, spawning lost souls)
  - Revenant (skeletal, missile launchers)
  - Arch-vile (tall, robed, resurrection abilities)
  - Cyberdemon (massive, horned, rocket launcher arm)
  - Spider mastermind (giant brain on spider legs)
• ANIMALS become:
  - Pink demons (dog-like creatures would become these)
  - Spectres (invisible/translucent demons)
  - Lost souls (flying creatures)
• All characters rendered as chunky pixel-art sprites
• Forward-facing or 3/4 view sprite orientation
• Recognizable facial features preserved in pixel form
• Combat-ready poses: standing, attacking, or defensive stances
• Characters must appear natively integrated into the 3D environment

OBJECT CONVERSION:
• WEAPONS (guns, tools, sticks) become:
  - Fists (bare hands)
  - Pistol
  - Shotgun
  - Super shotgun (double-barrel)
  - Chaingun
  - Rocket launcher
  - Plasma rifle
  - BFG 9000
  - Chainsaw
• CONTAINERS/BOXES become:
  - Brown UAC crates with stenciled markings
  - Gray barrels
  - Explosive red barrels
  - Ammunition boxes
• FURNITURE becomes:
  - Computer terminals with UAC logos
  - Tech columns and pillars
  - Metal storage units
  - Machinery and tech equipment
  - Hanged corpses (decorative)
  - Impaled bodies on spikes (decorative)
  - Hanging cages
  - Torches (in hell levels)
  - Candelabras
  - Tall tech lamps
• SMALL OBJECTS become:
  - Health bonuses (+1 health, small medkits)
  - Stimpacks (+10 health)
  - Medikits (+25 health)
  - Soul spheres (+100 health, blue)
  - Megaspheres (+200 health/armor, green)
  - Armor bonuses (+1 armor, helmets)
  - Green armor (+100 armor)
  - Blue armor (+200 armor, megaarmor)
  - Ammunition clips and shells
  - Keycards (red, blue, yellow)
  - Skull keys (red, blue, yellow)
  - Backpacks (ammunition)
  - Berserk packs (red glowing fists)
  - Invulnerability spheres (green glowing)
  - Invisibility spheres (partial invisibility)
  - Radiation suits (white hazmat)
  - Computer area maps (automap power-up)
  - Light amplification visors (night vision)
• All objects rendered with pixel-art precision and retro shading

ENVIRONMENT CONVERSION:
• WALLS become:
  - UAC techbase metal panels with rivets and warning stripes
  - Stone/marble corridors with UAC logos
  - Brown stone walls with tech panels
  - Gray concrete military facility walls
  - Red/brown hell-dimension stone with demonic faces
  - Flesh walls with organic textures and mouths
  - Brown brick walls
  - Wood paneling
  - Gray stone castle walls
  - Metal support girders
• FLOORS become:
  - Metal grating with grid patterns
  - Concrete with cracks and blood stains
  - Toxic green nukage (glowing radioactive liquid)
  - Glowing red lava flows
  - Gray stone tiles
  - Brown stone floors
  - Metal diamond plate
• CEILINGS become:
  - Industrial tech facility ceilings with lights
  - Stone vaulted ceilings
  - Gothic hell architecture
  - Outdoor red Martian sky
  - Outdoor black star-filled space
  - Tech facility lighting grids
• DOORS become:
  - Sliding metal UAC doors (gray)
  - Colored key doors (red, blue, yellow)
  - Fast sliding doors
  - Slow heavy doors
  - Stone doors with skull switches
  - Animated door textures
• WINDOWS become:
  - Transparent barriers showing outdoor Mars
  - Outdoor views of hellscapes
  - Shattered windows
  - UAC observation windows
• LIGHTING:
  - Harsh white industrial lighting
  - Flickering lights
  - Red warning lights
  - Blue sector lighting
  - Glowing lava/nukage ambient light
  - Dark shadowy areas
  - Outdoor sky lighting (red Mars or dark space)

ATMOSPHERE AND DETAILS:
• Dark, foreboding military-industrial aesthetic
• Ominous shadows and dramatic lighting contrasts
• Visible texture dithering and pixel grain
• Limited color palette (256 colors max, authentic VGA palette)
• Chunky pixel art with visible jagged edges
• Pseudo-3D perspective with flat sprite characters
• Environmental storytelling: UAC logos, pentagrams, blood stains, corpses
• Atmospheric effects: smoke, fog, flickering lights
• Sense of danger and isolation

TECHNICAL RENDERING:
• 320x200 or 640x480 resolution aesthetic (scaled up)
• Chunky pixel shading with no anti-aliasing
• Retro VGA color palette with strong primary colors
• Visible dithering patterns for gradients
• Sharp contrast between light and shadow
• Sprite-based characters on 3D-textured backgrounds
• 90-degree or 45-degree wall angles (sector-based geometry)
• Characters face camera or show 3/4 angled views
• No modern visual effects - pure early-90s rendering

INTERFACE (MANDATORY):
• Bottom-of-screen status bar showing:
  - HEALTH numeric display (0-100%)
  - ARMOR numeric display (0-100%)
  - AMMO count for current weapon
  - Small pixel-art mugshot of player's face (based on a person in the scene if present, otherwise a generic space marine face)
  - Current weapon indicator
  - Keycard/skull key inventory (red, blue, yellow slots)
  - Arms/ammo counts
  - Face changes based on health (bloodied at low health)
• Authentic 1993 DOS-era FPS UI design
• Gray metal texture background for status bar
• Digital font styling

SCENE COMPOSITION:
• First-person perspective if original photo was from that angle
• Third-person view showing player character sprite if appropriate
• Maintain spatial relationships from original image
• Convert background, midground, and foreground elements appropriately
• Perspective should feel like classic FPS sector-based level design
• Camera height consistent with classic FPS viewpoint

COLOR AND STYLE:
• Dominant colors: grays, browns, greens (for tech/military areas)
• Red, orange, brown (for hell areas)
• Limited palette creating unified retro aesthetic
• High contrast between elements for clarity
• Vibrant but not oversaturated - authentic VGA colors
• Visible color banding and dithering

FINAL RESULT:
An authentic-looking 1993-era FPS gameplay screenshot where the entire original image has been transformed into a retro 3D shooter environment using ONLY elements that actually appear in the game. If people or animals are present in the original image, they are converted to space marines or enemy creature types from the actual game roster. If no people or animals are present, NO characters are added - the scene remains an empty but atmospheric DOOM environment. Every object becomes an actual weapon or pickup item from the game, and every environmental element becomes the actual textures, architecture, and level design elements found in the original game. The result is a cohesive, immersive scene that looks like genuine gameplay footage from the classic DOS-era first-person shooter, complete with chunky pixel graphics, dramatic lighting, ominous atmosphere, and the mandatory bottom status bar. The entire image must read as a single unified retro gaming experience with perfect period-accurate aesthetics using only authentic game elements.

name: DOOR TO ANOTHER REALM
message:
Take a picture of the subject entering through a door that leads to an entirely different place, reality, or dimension.

DOOR LOGIC (CRITICAL):
• The door may be unusually small, freestanding, misplaced, or located where a door should not logically exist
• The door itself must appear physically real and tangible
• The door must be open or partially open
• The door is always between the camera and the destination

SUBJECT DIRECTION (MANDATORY — NO EXCEPTIONS):
• The subject MUST be ENTERING through the door toward the camera side
• The subject must be facing the camera or three-quarters toward the camera
• The subject is coming FROM the other realm INTO the viewer’s space
• The subject must NOT be exiting away from the camera
• The subject’s face must be clearly visible

DESTINATION SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies where the door leads, USE THAT
• Otherwise SELECT destination using RANDOM SEED modulo 50:
  - 0: Alien planet surface with unfamiliar sky and terrain
  - 1: Moon-like landscape with low gravity and stark lighting
  - 2: Miniature world (subject appears gigantic relative to buildings and terrain)
  - 3: Giant world (environment scaled massively larger than the subject)
  - 4: Floating island realm suspended in the sky
  - 5: Underground cavern world with vast open chambers
  - 6: Crystalline world made of mineral formations
  - 7: Desert world with extreme scale and distant structures
  - 8: Oceanic world with visible water horizons or submerged structures
  - 9: Jungle world with dense, towering vegetation
  - 10: Arctic or frozen world with ice formations
  - 11: Volcanic world with lava flows and heat haze
  - 12: Storm-dominated world with dramatic skies
  - 13: Another planet’s city-like settlement (no recognizable Earth city)
  - 14: Futuristic megastructure interior
  - 15: Abandoned civilization ruins
  - 16: Hyper-clean utopian environment
  - 17: Dystopian industrial environment
  - 18: Alternate-reality version of Earth
  - 19: Parallel timeline version of the current location
  - 20: Another location in the world (urban environment, non-specific)
  - 21: Another location in the world (rural or remote environment)
  - 22: Office interior (clearly professional, non-specific)
  - 23: Corporate lobby or atrium
  - 24: Bar or lounge interior
  - 25: Restaurant or café interior
  - 26: Retail shop interior
  - 27: Workshop or industrial workspace
  - 28: Warehouse or storage facility
  - 29: Hotel corridor or lobby
  - 30: Residential interior (room, hallway, or apartment)
  - 31: Basement or hidden room
  - 32: Library or archive space
  - 33: Theater or auditorium interior
  - 34: Transit space (platform, terminal, or passageway)
  - 35: Scientific facility or laboratory
  - 36: Medical facility interior
  - 37: Religious or ceremonial interior space
  - 38: Government or institutional interior
  - 39: Natural landmark environment (non-specific)
  - 40: Impossible architecture with non-Euclidean geometry
  - 41: Dreamlike but realistic surreal environment
  - 42: Time-displaced historical environment (non-specific era)
  - 43: Future Earth environment
  - 44: Collapsed or ruined version of a familiar place
  - 45: Perfectly preserved, pristine version of a familiar place
  - 46: Artificial simulation environment
  - 47: Abstract but physically believable constructed world
  - 48: Symbolic realm representing memory or emotion
  - 49: Symbolic doorway to heaven (bright radiant light, soft clouds, serene architecture, peaceful and welcoming atmosphere)

OTHER SIDE REVEAL (MANDATORY):
• The destination must be clearly visible through the doorway behind the subject
• The revealed world must strongly contrast with the viewer’s environment
• The door frame must visibly separate the two realities

SUBJECT INTERACTION:
• Subject must be mid-step, leaning forward, or partially crossing the threshold
• One part of the subject may still be inside the doorway
• The subject should appear curious, cautious, relieved, or unaware of what awaits
• The subject must appear alive and physically present (not deceased, ghost-like, or ethereal)

LIGHTING AND PHYSICS:
• Light from the destination spills through the doorway into the viewer’s space
• Shadows and reflections must respond to both environments
• Maintain consistent perspective, scale, and depth

REALISM AND STYLE:
• Photorealistic rendering of both spaces
• Serious, cinematic, or mysterious tone
• No flat portals, UI effects, or glowing sci-fi rings
• The door must feel like a real object physically connecting two real places

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a real photograph capturing the exact moment the subject steps through a physical door from another realm into the viewer’s reality, with their face visible and both worlds clearly connected by the doorway.

name: DOUBLE EXPOSURE
message: Take a picture and create a double-exposure composition.    Blend the subject with a secondary scene using transparent overlays. Clear silhouette, balanced negative space. Moody, artistic tone.

name: DOUGLAS DOUGIE POWERS (DR. EVIL)
message:
Take a picture and place the subject into a classic Dr. Evil scene where the subject appears as BOTH Dr. Evil and Mini-Me at the same time.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• The subject plays two roles simultaneously: Dr. Evil and Mini-Me
• This is NOT actor replacement — identity is preserved
• The scene feels like a real movie still from the Austin Powers universe
• The dual appearance is intentional, clean, and believable

DUAL SUBJECT RULES (MANDATORY):
• Dr. Evil version:
  – Full-size subject
  – Bald head
  – Wearing the iconic Dr. Evil gray suit
  – Confident, villainous posture
• Mini-Me version:
  – The SAME subject depicted as a little person
  – Proportionally smaller body, not distorted
  – Same facial identity as the subject
  – Matching Dr. Evil outfit
• Both versions clearly read as the same person

FACIAL & IDENTITY RULES:
• Preserve the subject’s facial structure and likeness
• No face swapping with the actor
• Expressions may differ slightly between Dr. Evil and Mini-Me
• Mini-Me should feel deadpan and serious

SCENE SELECTION (SEED-DRIVEN — SELECT EXACTLY ONE):
• Dr. Evil’s underground lair
• Villain briefing room with holographic displays
• Rocket control room
• High-backed villain chair monologue scene
• Secret base interior with guards or henchmen

CAT INTEGRATION (MANDATORY):
• Include Dr. Evil’s hairless cat
• Cat is calm and clearly visible
• Cat may be:
  – Cradled by Dr. Evil
  – Sitting beside Mini-Me
  – Resting on a chair or control console
• Cat scale and lighting must match the scene

SCENE INTEGRATION RULES:
• Both versions of the subject must share the same lighting environment
• Shadows and reflections are consistent
• Mini-Me placement feels intentional, not pasted
• Background characters (if present) treat both as normal

STYLE & TONE:
• Clean cinematic realism
• Subtle humor through composition, not exaggeration
• Serious villain energy with dry comedic contrast

CAMERA:
• Medium or wide cinematic framing
• Both Dr. Evil and Mini-Me fully visible
• Clear scale comparison between the two

RESTRICTIONS:
• No cartoon proportions
• No parody distortion
• No modern clothing or technology
• No text, captions, or logos

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like an authentic Austin Powers film still where the subject convincingly plays both Dr. Evil and Mini-Me. Both versions share the same identity, costume, and environment, accompanied by the iconic hairless cat. The effect should feel seamless, confident, and hilariously inevitable — evil, composed, and unmistakable.

name: DOT MATRIX
message: Take a picture and transform it as if printed by a vintage dot matrix printer from the 1980s-90s. Convert the entire image into a pattern of small dots arranged in a grid, creating the subject through varying dot density - denser dots for darker areas, sparser dots for lighter areas. Use only black dots on white or continuous feed printer paper with the characteristic green and white horizontal stripes and perforated tear-off edges on both sides (tractor feed holes). Show authentic dot matrix printing artifacts: slight misalignment of dots, banding where print head passed, individual dot visibility, no smooth gradients only dithered dot patterns, jagged diagonal lines, pixelated curves. The dots should be clearly visible as individual impacts from the print head pins. Include printer paper details: continuous fan-fold paper, perforated edges with sprocket holes, slight yellowing, that distinctive matte printer paper texture. Add printing imperfections: ink smudging, lighter sections where ribbon was fading, slight horizontal line patterns from print head movement, occasional missing dots from dead pins. The image should have very low resolution appearance - approximately 72-180 DPI equivalent, with all details reduced to dot patterns. Show the paper curl slightly, maybe still attached to the printer or freshly torn from tractor feed. Use overhead lighting showing the paper texture and raised ink dots. Make it look like an actual photograph of a dot matrix printout from an old Epson or IBM printer with that characteristic low-fi 1980s computer printing aesthetic.

name: DRAG ME
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a fabulous, over-the-top drag queen persona.

CRITICAL - PRESERVE SUBJECT IDENTITY:
• This is the SUBJECT in drag, NOT a generic drag queen
• Subject's facial structure MUST remain clearly recognizable
• Subject's eyes, nose shape, jawline, and unique features preserved
• Do NOT replace the subject with a stock drag queen image
• Apply drag makeup and styling TO the subject's actual face
• Someone should be able to identify the subject underneath the drag
• This is a transformation of the subject, not a different person

DRAG MAKEUP (Applied to subject's face):
• Dramatic contouring that enhances subject's bone structure
• Bold eye makeup with exaggerated lashes and colorful eyeshadow
• Sculpted cheekbones (on subject's actual cheeks)
• Overdrawn lips with glossy or matte finish (subject's mouth shape enhanced)
• Flawlessly blended foundation matching subject's skin tone
• Heavy highlight and contour
• Subject's facial features visible under the makeup
• Eyebrows: blocked out and redrawn higher, or dramatically shaped

DRAG WIG:
• Show-stopping theatrical wig
• Big hair with volume, height, or dramatic styling
• Vibrant colors or natural tones
• Curls, waves, straight, teased, or avant-garde
• Wig complements subject's face shape
• Theatrical and attention-grabbing

DRAG ATTIRE:
• Glamorous drag outfit
• Options: sequined gowns, feather boas, rhinestone garments
• Platform heels or dramatic boots
• Bold jewelry and accessories
• Avant-garde fashion pieces
• Over-the-top fabulous styling
• Confident, unapologetic glamour

POSE & EXPRESSION:
• Fierce and confident
• Sassy and playful, OR elegantly commanding
• Star power and charisma
• Hand on hip, dramatic gesture, or runway pose
• Subject's personality shining through the drag persona

LIGHTING & SETTING:
• Stage-quality theatrical lighting
• Dramatic glamour lighting
• Background: runway, stage, club, or dramatic backdrop
• Spotlights and theatrical atmosphere
• Professional drag performance aesthetic

STYLE:
• Photorealistic drag transformation
• Professional drag artistry
• Respectful celebration of drag culture
• Humorous and fabulous
• High-quality drag queen aesthetic
• Subject as the star of their own drag show

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject - CLEARLY RECOGNIZABLE as themselves - transformed into a fabulous drag queen with dramatic makeup applied to their actual face, a show-stopping wig, glamorous drag attire, and confident fierce energy - celebrating drag artistry with respect, humor, and unforgettable fabulousness while preserving the subject's unique facial features and identity.

name: DREAM LOGIC
message: Take a picture and transform the image using dream logic. Disjointed scale, symbolic elements. Unreal but emotionally coherent.

name: DRIVERS LICENSE
message: Take a picture and create a realistic but clearly fictional driver’s license–style image featuring the subject’s photo. Randomly select a U.S. state and replicate the general visual layout, color scheme, typography style, and design motifs associated with that state’s driver license, while clearly presenting it as a non-functional, artistic replica. Use placeholder information, fictional identifiers, and decorative text rather than real personal data. Preserve the subject’s recognizable facial features and neutral ID-style expression. The final image should resemble a stylized prop or novelty card, not a real or usable identification document.

name: DRONE SHOW
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject's face and form into a spectacular nighttime drone light show formation in the sky.

CRITICAL RULE - LIGHT POINTS ONLY:
• The image is formed ENTIRELY from individual points of colored light
• NO skin texture, NO solid surfaces, NO photographic elements
• Every part of the face is made from discrete LED light dots
• The subject's likeness is created through the ARRANGEMENT and COLOR of light points, not through realistic rendering
• Think: low-resolution pixel art made of floating lights in the sky

DRONE FORMATION STRUCTURE:
• The subject's facial features are recreated using hundreds of illuminated drones arranged in 3D space
• Each drone is a single small point of colored light (LED) creating a pixel-like effect
• Drones are positioned at varying depths to create dimensionality
• The overall formation holds the subject's recognizable likeness when viewed from ground level
• Face should be massive in scale—50-100 feet tall in the sky
• Individual drones visible as discrete light points with dark space between them
• Some drones create outlines, others fill areas with color
• The spaces BETWEEN drones are visible dark sky—not filled in

LIGHTING AND COLOR (LIGHT DOTS ONLY):
• Drones emit vibrant, saturated LED colors (blues, purples, reds, whites, yellows, greens, oranges)
• Face shape suggested by the OUTLINE and PATTERN of colored light dots
• Lighter areas use warm colors (yellows, oranges, warm whites) arranged as dots
• Darker areas use fewer drones or darker colors (blues, purples) as dots
• Eyes created from brighter, more concentrated clusters of light points
• Hair suggested by flowing arrangements of colored light dots following hair contours
• Color transitions happen through adjacent drones with different colors
• Some drones pulse or have slight brightness variation for dynamism
• The portrait is pointillistic—made of dots of light, NOT continuous surfaces

ENVIRONMENT AND SETTING:
• Set against a dark night sky (deep blue or black)
• Photographed from ground level looking upward at 30-45 degree angle
• City skyline silhouette visible at bottom of frame
• Scattered stars visible in background between drone formations
• Slight atmospheric glow around brighter drone clusters (bloom effect)
• Ground shows crowds of people with phones pointed upward (tiny silhouettes)
• Light pollution glow on horizon
• Dark sky visible BETWEEN the drones

TECHNICAL PRESENTATION:
• Long exposure photography aesthetic—drones sharp but with very slight light trails if moving
• Formation appears stable and precisely controlled
• Background shows aerial perspective and vast scale
• The portrait should have an ethereal, floating quality
• Maintain recognizable facial proportions despite being made of discrete light points
• Show the technological precision—this is clearly a programmed formation
• Distance between drones varies based on detail level (closer together for fine features)
• Each light point is clearly separate from others
• The effect is similar to a low-res digital display but floating in the sky

LIKENESS THROUGH ABSTRACTION:
• The subject's face is recognizable through the PATTERN of lights, not realistic detail
• Simplified features work better: eye shapes as clusters, nose as gradient, mouth as curve
• Think of old stadium scoreboard portraits or early digital displays
• The brain fills in the details from the pattern of lights
• More abstract than photographic, but clearly the subject

ATMOSPHERIC DETAILS:
• Slight light beam trails from drones that recently moved into position
• Atmospheric haze creating soft glow around brightest areas
• The formation appears weightless and luminous
• Should evoke amazement and technological wonder
• Background sky gradient from city light pollution
• Distant drones slightly dimmer due to atmospheric perspective

ANTI-REALISM RULES:
• NO solid surfaces made of light
• NO skin texture or photographic rendering
• NO smooth gradients—only discrete color changes between light points
• NO filled-in areas—maintain visible spacing between drones
• The image must clearly be made of individual floating light sources

FINAL RESULT:
A breathtaking nighttime aerial light display where hundreds of coordinated drones recreate the subject's face in the sky as a massive, glowing, three-dimensional portrait made entirely of individual points of colored light. The image is pointillistic and abstract—recognizable through the arrangement and color of light dots rather than photographic realism. Each drone is a visible pixel of light with dark sky between them, creating a floating constellation portrait that captures the subject's likeness through technological precision and artistic light arrangement. The effect should look like a real drone show, not a projected image or solid light sculpture.

name: DUKE NUKEM 3D NPC
message:
Take a picture and place the subject inside the world of Duke Nukem 3D as a non-playable character (NPC), NOT as Duke himself.

NPC ROLE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies an NPC role, USE THAT ROLE
• If no NPC role is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST DIGIT of the RANDOM SEED modulo 6:
  - 0: Civilian bystander reacting to chaos (hands up, shocked, city street)
  - 1: Scientist or lab technician (lab coat, terminals, alien tech lab)
  - 2: Bar or casino patron (neon lighting, stools, arcade machines)
  - 3: Prisoner or hostage (cells, restraints, distressed expression)
  - 4: Enemy-aligned grunt or henchman (combat stance, industrial base)
  - 5: Background worker or technician (maintenance gear, vents, machinery)

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• Subject exists as an in-world NPC
• Duke Nukem appears elsewhere in the scene
• Subject is NOT the hero

STYLE RULES:
• Authentic Duke Nukem 3D Build Engine look
• Pixelated textures, low-resolution sprites, 1996-era graphics
• Subject rendered as a sprite-style or semi-sprite character
• CRT-era lighting and color limitations

IDENTITY RULES:
• Subject’s face must remain recognizable
• Face adapted into pixel/sprite form
• No replacement with existing Duke Nukem character faces
• Subject looks like they were scanned into the game world

SCENE COMPOSITION:
• In-game camera perspective (first-person or angled)
• Classic Duke Nukem environments (city street, alien base, strip club, lab, cinema)
• Interactive elements visible (monitors, explosions, ammo, props)

RESTRICTIONS:
• No modern graphics or realism
• No HUD overlays or UI text
• No cartoon or illustrative styles

FINAL RESULT:
The image should convincingly place the subject as a recognizable NPC inside the Duke Nukem 3D universe, perfectly matching the original game’s visual language, scale, and tone.

name: DUTCH GOLDEN AGE
message: Take a picture and transform the image into Dutch Golden Age painting. Realistic textures, warm tones, precise detail, dramatic lighting, and naturalistic surroundings.

name: DWARF
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a fantasy dwarf while preserving the subject’s recognizable facial features, expressions, and identity. Adjust proportions to reflect a classic dwarf physique—shorter stature, sturdy build—while maintaining realism. Adapt clothing and gear into a believable fantasy style such as armor, leather, or artisan attire inspired by the subject’s original outfit. Place the subject into a detailed fantasy environment like a mountain hall, forge, or underground city. Use cinematic lighting, rich textures, and realistic materials to ensure the subject feels fully integrated into the fantasy world.

name: DYSTOPIAN
message: Take a picture in the style of a Dystopian future. Bleak atmosphere. Make it photorealistic.

name: ECCE MONO
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform them into a badly restored artwork, inspired by infamous art restoration failures like the Ecce Homo / Ecce Mono incident.

The subject IS the artwork that has been restored incorrectly — not a viewer and not a separate person.

RESTORATION FAILURE (CRITICAL):
• The subject’s facial features must be distorted, simplified, or clumsily repainted
• Eyes may be uneven, misshapen, or misplaced
• Nose and mouth may be smudged, blobby, or incorrectly proportioned
• Expression should appear unintentionally humorous or confused

MEDIUM & TEXTURE:
• Painted fresco, mural, or aged religious-style artwork
• Visible brush strokes, uneven repainting, smeared paint
• Cracked plaster or wall texture beneath paint
• Colors slightly muddy or mismatched, as if an amateur attempted the restoration

IDENTITY PRESERVATION:
• The subject must still be faintly recognizable despite the failed restoration
• Facial structure and general likeness should be present but poorly executed

COMPOSITION:
• Frame the image as a photograph of the restored artwork on a wall
• Optional plaque or wall label suggesting it was recently restored

FINAL RESULT:
The image should clearly look like a well-meaning but disastrous art restoration where the subject’s face became unintentionally funny, awkward, or infamous — as if the artwork went viral for all the wrong reasons.

name: EDO LANDSCAPE
message: Take a picture and transform it in the style of Japanese Edo period landscape prints. Include the subject in the scene while using clean outlines, flat color areas, and traditional compositional elements such as mountains, rivers, or bridges. The final image should feel elegant, balanced, and illustrative.

name: ELECTRIC BOOGALOO
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a high-energy breakdancing scene inspired by classic street dance culture and 'Electric Boogaloo.'

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• The subject must be actively breakdancing
• The movement must look skilled, intentional, and dynamic
• The image should capture a peak moment of motion

DANCE STYLE & MOVEMENT:
• Authentic breakdancing poses such as:
  – Toprock
  – Downrock
  – Freezes
  – Power moves (windmills, flares, spins)
• Body positioning must look physically correct and controlled
• No awkwardness or parody

SUBJECT PRESENCE:
• Confident posture and expressive body language
• Facial expression should show focus, intensity, or joy
• Clothing should reflect street or dance culture (loose, flexible, expressive)

ENVIRONMENT:
• Urban or performance-oriented setting
• May include:
  – Dance floor or stage
  – Street or subway environment
  – Audience circle or informal crowd
• Environment should enhance the sense of movement

CAMERA & COMPOSITION:
• Dynamic framing that emphasizes motion
• Slight motion blur may be used selectively
• Camera angle should feel close to the action

LIGHTING & COLOR:
• Bold, energetic lighting
• Strong contrast and vibrant tones
• No muted or flat presentation

TONE:
• Celebratory, energetic, and expressive
• Feels like a moment of dance culture history
• Never ironic or mocking

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must look like a powerful, authentic breakdancing moment — the subject fully immersed in skilled movement, captured at the height of energy and expression, with a strong sense of rhythm and physical mastery.

name: ELEMENTAL SELF
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform only the subject into a human embodiment of a natural element.

ELEMENT SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests an element, USE THAT ELEMENT
• If no element is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE element using the RANDOM SEED
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 0,1: SELECT fire
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 2,3: SELECT water
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 4,5: SELECT earth
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 6,7: SELECT wind
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 8,9: SELECT lightning

The subject's body, clothing, and aura should visually integrate the chosen element, flowing naturally with their pose and expression. For fire, incorporate flames, embers, and glowing heat; for water, use flowing currents, ripples, and reflective surfaces; for earth, integrate rocks, soil, foliage, or crystals; for wind, show swirling air currents, leaves, or flowing garments; for lightning, incorporate electric arcs, sparks, and glowing energy. Preserve the subject's recognizable facial features, identity, and proportions. The background should remain completely normal and unaltered, making the elemental subject clearly stand out. Use dramatic lighting, dynamic motion, and atmospheric effects on the subject only, rendered in ultra-realistic detail with vivid colors, depth, and surreal impact.

name: ELF
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a fantasy elf.

ELF TYPE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies elf type, USE THAT TYPE
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 12:
  - 0: High Elf - regal, blonde/silver hair, elegant, noble, refined, golden armor
  - 1: Wood Elf - nature-connected, brown/green tones, archer, forest guardian
  - 2: Dark Elf/Drow - dark purple/black skin, white/silver hair, underground, evil or misunderstood
  - 3: Night Elf - purple/blue skin, glowing eyes, nocturnal, druidic, moonlight
  - 4: Blood Elf - blonde/red hair, green glowing eyes, magical addiction, beautiful and deadly
  - 5: Snow Elf - pale skin, white/silver hair, cold climate, winter aesthetic
  - 6: Sea Elf - aquatic, blue-green tones, coastal, pearl jewelry, water magic
  - 7: Wild Elf - primitive, tribal, feral, savage, less civilized
  - 8: Sun Elf - golden skin, radiant, light magic, desert dweller, bright
  - 9: Moon Elf - silver hair, pale skin, mystical, lunar magic, ethereal
  - 10: Half-Elf - mixed heritage, human and elf features, versatile, wanderer
  - 11: Santa's Elf - workshop helper, toy maker, cheerful, North Pole, Christmas

SUBJECT TRANSFORMATION (CRITICAL):
• Subject's face RECOGNIZABLE with elf features
• NOT a generic elf - THIS IS THE SUBJECT as an elf
• Subject's facial structure maintained with elven characteristics
• Identity clearly visible through elvish features

ELF PHYSICAL FEATURES (CRITICAL):
• POINTED EARS (4-6 inches long, graceful points)
• Slender, elegant build
• Tall and graceful (5'8" - 6'4")
• Delicate facial features
• High cheekbones
• Almond-shaped eyes
• Ageless appearance (look young)
• Smooth, flawless skin
• Ethereal beauty

FACIAL FEATURES:
• Subject's face with elvish refinement
• Eyes slightly larger, more expressive
• Pointed ears visible
• Delicate features enhanced
• Graceful, otherworldly beauty
• Subject recognizable as themselves
• Ageless, timeless quality

SKIN TONE (Type-specific):
• High Elf: Fair, pale, porcelain
• Wood Elf: Tan, sun-kissed, earthy
• Dark Elf: Dark purple, black, obsidian
• Night Elf: Purple, blue-gray, lavender
• Blood Elf: Pale with warmth
• Snow Elf: Extremely pale, white
• Sea Elf: Blue-green tint
• Sun Elf: Golden, bronzed
• Moon Elf: Silver-pale

HAIR:
• Long, flowing, silky
• Color varies by type:
  - High Elf: Blonde, platinum, silver
  - Wood Elf: Brown, auburn, green tints
  - Dark Elf: White, silver, pale
  - Night Elf: Purple, blue, teal
  - Blood Elf: Blonde, red, auburn
  - Snow Elf: White, silver, ice blue
  - Sea Elf: Blue, green, aqua
• Braided or loose
• Adorned with nature (flowers, leaves, vines)
• Pristine and well-kept

EYES:
• Large, almond-shaped
• Colors:
  - High Elf: Blue, violet, silver
  - Wood Elf: Green, amber, brown
  - Dark Elf: Red, purple, white
  - Night Elf: Glowing silver/gold
  - Blood Elf: Green glow (fel magic)
  - Snow Elf: Ice blue, white
  - Sea Elf: Aqua, teal
• May glow or shimmer
• Wise, ancient look

CLOTHING & ARMOR:
• Elegant, flowing robes OR
• Light armor (leather, mithril)
• Nature-inspired designs (leaves, vines, trees)
• Fine craftsmanship
• Greens, browns, silvers, blues
• Cloaks and capes
• Intricate patterns and embroidery
• Functional but beautiful

WEAPONS:
• Elegant longbow (primary)
• Curved elven blades
• Staff (for mages)
• Twin daggers
• Spear with leaf blade
• Weapons ornate and beautiful
• Silver or mithril
• Engraved with runes

MAGICAL ELEMENTS:
• Glowing runes or symbols
• Magical aura around subject
• Nature magic (flowers, vines)
• Light magic (radiance)
• Elemental magic effects
• Mystical energy
• Arcane symbols

SETTING (Type-specific):
• High Elf: Elegant palace, golden halls
• Wood Elf: Ancient forest, giant trees
• Dark Elf: Underground cavern, stalactites
• Night Elf: Moonlit grove, temple ruins
• Blood Elf: Magical city, crystals
• Snow Elf: Snowy mountains, ice palace
• Sea Elf: Coral reef, beach, ocean
• Santa's Elf: Workshop, toys, snow

ACCESSORIES:
• Circlet or crown (delicate)
• Leaf-shaped jewelry
• Silver or gold adornments
• Nature elements (flowers in hair)
• Crystal pendants
• Elven cloak brooch
• Quiver and arrows
• Leather bracers

POSE & STANCE:
• Graceful, elegant posture
• Drawing bow elegantly
• Mystical spellcasting pose
• Noble, regal bearing
• Connection with nature
• Light on feet, agile
• Serene expression

ATMOSPHERE:
• Magical, ethereal
• Ancient and timeless
• Nature and harmony
• Mystery and grace
• Fantasy realm
• Otherworldly beauty

LIGHTING:
• Soft, magical lighting
• Dappled forest sunlight
• Moonlight glow
• Ethereal radiance
• Nature lighting
• Mystical atmosphere

STYLE:
• High fantasy aesthetic
• Lord of the Rings quality
• D&D or World of Warcraft style
• Photorealistic fantasy
• Elegant and refined

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject transformed into a fantasy elf with prominent pointed ears, slender graceful build, ethereal beauty, elegant clothing or armor, type-specific coloring and features - the subject's face clearly recognizable with elvish refinement added, holding bow or magical staff, in an appropriate fantasy setting with magical lighting and that timeless, otherworldly elven grace.

name: EMBROIDERY
message: Take a picture and transform the image into embroidery art. Thread textures, stitched lines, fabric background.

name: EMOJI THIS
message:
Take a picture and reinterpret the subject using expressive emoji language while preserving the photo’s composition, body posture, clothing, and context.

FACE REPLACEMENT RULE (NON-NEGOTIABLE):
• If the subject is human, the ENTIRE HUMAN HEAD must be removed
• Replace it with ONE emoji as a full physical head
• NO human facial features may remain visible (no eyes, mouth, nose, skin, or chin)
• The emoji must occupy the exact volume of a head, aligned to the neck
• The emoji is NOT an overlay, sticker, decal, or mask
• Treat the emoji as a solid 3D object attached to the body

Use the following SIX priority categories, selecting at most ONE emoji from each when applicable:

1) Face / Emotion:
😀 😄 😁 😊 😂 🤣 😆 🙂 😌 😲 😮 😯 😱 😢 😞 😔 😪 😠 😡 🤬 😤 😕 🤔 😵‍💫 🌀 🥰 😍 😘 ❤️

2) Animal:
🐶 🐱 🐰 🐭 🐹 🐻 🐼 🐨 🐯 🦊 🐸 🐵 🐔 🐦 🐤 🐢 🐍 🐠 🐟

3) Food & Drink:
🍕 🍔 🌭 🌮 🍣 🍩 🍪 🍰 🥐 🥞 ☕ 🍺 🍷 🧃 🥤 🍎 🍌 🍓

4) Objects / Tech:
📱 💻 🎧 📷 🕶️ ⌚ 🎮 📚 💼 🔑 🧸 🎁 🛒

5) Clothing / Accessories:
👕 👗 🧢 👒 👟 👠 👜 🎒 🧥 🧤 🕶️ 👓

6) Activity / Context:
🎵 🎸 🎨 🏀 ⚽ 🚲 🎮 🧘 🏖️ 🏕️ 🏙️ ✈️ 🎉

Preserve the original background and spatial layout.

name: ENCYCLOPEDIA (HUMOR)
message: Take a picture and transform it into a fake encyclopedia entry. Include a clear photograph of the subject placed near the top or alongside the text as a reference image. Style the layout like a printed encyclopedia page with columns, captions, and figure labels. Use authoritative yet humorous flavor text describing the subject’s background, significance, or behavior. The photograph should feel like an official illustrative plate supporting the article.

name: ENCYCLOPEDIA (EDUCATIONAL)
message:
Take a picture and identify a single clearly visible physical object in the image, then generate a REAL encyclopedia entry about that object using accurate, factual information.

OBJECT SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies the object, USE THAT OBJECT
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE prominent object visible in the image
• The object must be a real, identifiable item (tool, plant, food, material, device, animal, structure, etc.)

ENCYCLOPEDIA CONTENT RULES:
• All written information must be factual and accurate
• Use real-world definitions, history, function, and usage
• No fictional or humorous claims
• Neutral, authoritative encyclopedic tone

PAGE STRUCTURE:
• Printed encyclopedia layout
• Multi-column text
• Article title is the real name of the object
• Clear section headers such as:
  - Definition
  - History
  - Description
  - Uses
  - Cultural or Scientific Significance (if applicable)

IMAGE INTEGRATION:
• Include a photograph of the selected object sourced from the original image
• Image placed near the top or within the article as a reference plate
• Caption beneath image identifying the object

AUTHENTICITY RULES:
• Layout must resemble a real printed encyclopedia page
• Serif fonts, justified columns, figure numbering allowed
• No modern web UI elements

EXCLUSIONS:
• No parody
• No invented facts
• No speculation beyond established knowledge

COMPOSITION & FRAME:
• The FULL encyclopedia page must be visible
• All columns, images, captions, and text fully in frame
• All four corners visible
• No cropping, zooming, or partial views

STYLE:
• Academic, neutral, professional
• Museum or reference-book quality

FINAL RESULT:
The image should appear as a complete, real encyclopedia page about a single object from the photo, presenting accurate factual information with a formal printed layout and a reference image derived from the original picture.

name: ENVIRONMENTAL FUSION
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject so that parts of their body blend seamlessly with the surrounding environment.

FUSION STYLE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a fusion style, USE THAT
• If no style is specified externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST DIGIT of the RANDOM SEED modulo 4:
  - 0: Skin or clothing becomes part of natural elements (trees, water, clouds)
  - 1: Hair or limbs transform into elements from the background (fire, smoke, leaves)
  - 2: Clothing or torso partially dissolves into surrounding textures
  - 3: Subtle blending of subject into environment while preserving full recognizability

IDENTITY RULES:
• Subject remains fully recognizable
• Face, posture, and key features preserved
• Fusion only affects textures and surfaces, not anatomy

VISUAL STYLE:
• Photorealistic or cinematic realism
• Environment fully coherent
• Blending should feel organic, not digital or painted

FINAL RESULT:
The subject should appear partially merged with the surroundings, creating a surreal but believable integration with the environment while remaining clearly identifiable.

name: ERA FILTER
message: Take a picture and transform the subject and scene to accurately reflect the era specified externally. Adapt clothing, hairstyle, accessories, environment, color palette, materials, technology, and overall visual language to match the chosen historical or cultural era. Preserve the subject’s recognizable facial features, proportions, and identity while blending them naturally into the era’s aesthetic. Ensure lighting, textures, and image quality reflect the photographic or artistic limitations typical of that time period. The final image should appear as if the subject genuinely existed and was photographed in that era, with no modern elements visible.

name: ESCHER
message: Take a picture and transform the image into an M.C. Escher-inspired impossible space. Non-Euclidean architecture.

name: ETCH A SKETCH
message:
Take a picture and recreate the subject as a classic Etch A Sketch drawing displayed inside a realistic Etch A Sketch toy. The entire red Etch A Sketch frame should be visible, including the screen area and the two control knobs at the bottom, so it feels like a photographed physical toy rather than a digital effect.

Render the subject using continuous, thin, single-line strokes characteristic of Etch A Sketch drawings. Use simple outlines and minimal detail while preserving the subject’s recognizable shape and expression. The drawing should appear slightly imperfect, with subtle line wobble and overlaps consistent with manual knob control.

Ensure the background is the Etch A Sketch screen texture, and keep the overall composition clean and centered. Do not add text or extra graphics. The final image should feel nostalgic, tactile, and immediately recognizable on a small screen.

name: EVENT INVITE
message:
Take a picture and create a digital event invitation illustration featuring the subject.

CONTENT:
• Use external master prompt or visual clues to infer event name and details
• Include flavor text
• Color scheme must match the event tone

FINAL RESULT:
The image should resemble a polished digital invitation.

name: EVOLUTION
message:
Take a picture of the subject and create a multi-stage evolutionary progression displayed left to right within a single image, ending with the subject as the final stage.

ORIGIN SPECIES SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• SELECT EXACTLY ONE origin species using the RANDOM SEED
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 100:
  - 0: AXOLOTL
  - 1: STAR-NOSED MOLE
  - 2: NAKED MOLE RAT
  - 3: MANTIS SHRIMP
  - 4: PLATYPUS
  - 5: SLOTH
  - 6: EMU
  - 7: PROBOSCIS MONKEY
  - 8: TARDIGRADE
  - 9: BLOBFISH
  - 10: ANGLERFISH
  - 11: SHOEBILL STORK

  - 13: FLYING SQUIRREL

  - 35: SAIGA ANTELOPE
  - 36: SPECTRAL TARSIER
  - 37: KOMODO DRAGON
  - 38: PEACOCK MANTIS SHRIMP
  - 39: CAMEL SPIDER
  - 40: FROG WITH TRANSPARENT SKIN
  - 41: GIRAFFE WEEVIL
  - 42: YETI CRAB
  - 43: SNAKE WITH LEGS (ATAVISTIC)
  - 44: BAT-EARED FOX
  - 45: MOLE CRICKET
  - 46: SPINY BUSH VIPER
  - 47: PINK FAIRY ARMADILLO
  - 48: VELVET WORM
  - 49: MATA MATA TURTLE
  - 50: LEAF-TAILED GECKO
  - 51: SATANIC LEAF-TAILED GECKO
  - 52: TUATARA
  - 53: ELEPHANT SHREW
  - 54: MANED WOLF
  - 55: LOWLAND STREAKED TENREC

  - 77: ELEPHANT SEAL
  - 78: KAKAPO
  - 79: HELMETED HORNBILL
  - 80: RHINOCEROS IGUANA
  - 81: GLOWWORM
  - 82: GIANT AFRICAN MILLIPEDE
  - 83: TASMANIAN DEVIL
  - 84: INDIAN GAVIAL

  - 94: OKAPI CALF

EVOLUTION STAGES:
• Show 4 to 5 evolutionary stages progressing toward the subject
• Early stages must clearly resemble the selected origin animal
• Middle stages should be increasingly absurd hybrid forms
• Final stage must be the original subject, fully recognizable

IDENTITY PRESERVATION (CRITICAL):
• The subject’s facial structure, proportions, and expression must be preserved in the final stage
• Subtle hints of the subject’s features may begin emerging in intermediate stages
• Avoid simple scaling, cloning, or repeated poses

STYLE AND REALISM:
• Consistent ground plane and lighting across all stages
• Clear visual separation between stages
• Scientific chart or museum exhibit presentation
• Photorealistic textures with mild parody tone

FINAL RESULT:
The image should resemble a humorous yet detailed evolutionary diagram that begins with a highly absurd origin creature and ends with the subject, implying a ridiculous but visually coherent evolutionary journey.

name: EXAGGERATED TRAIT
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject by exaggerating a single physical trait while preserving the subject's recognizable identity.

TRAIT SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a trait, USE THAT TRAIT
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 12:
  - 0: Ears - dramatically enlarged ears (replacing normal ears completely, not adding to them)
  - 1: Nose - significantly enlarged nose (subject's nose grown huge, not an extra nose)
  - 2: Eyes - much larger eyes (subject's existing eyes enlarged, not additional eyes)
  - 3: Mouth - oversized mouth and lips (subject's mouth expanded, same mouth not duplicated)
  - 4: Hair - extremely voluminous or long hair (subject's hair massively increased)
  - 5: Chin - prominent elongated chin (subject's chin extended dramatically)
  - 6: Forehead - enlarged forehead (subject's existing forehead expanded upward)
  - 7: Hands - oversized hands (subject's hands grown disproportionately large)
  - 8: Feet - comically large feet (subject's feet massively enlarged)
  - 9: Height - extremely tall (subject stretched vertically to great height)
  - 10: Width - dramatically widened (subject expanded horizontally)
  - 11: Neck - elongated giraffe-like neck (subject's neck stretched very long)

EXAGGERATION RULES (CRITICAL):
• ONLY the selected trait is exaggerated - all other features remain normal
• The exaggerated feature REPLACES the normal feature, not adds to it
• NO duplication - if ears are enlarged, the original small ears don't also exist
• The transformation is OF the existing feature, not an addition
• Subject's original feature is gone, replaced by the enlarged version
• Anatomically coherent - the feature connects properly to the body
• Natural lighting and shadows on the exaggerated feature
• Feature integrated seamlessly

PRESERVE IDENTITY:
• Subject remains clearly recognizable
• All other facial features normal size
• Only ONE trait exaggerated per image
• Face proportions otherwise maintained
• Expression natural
• Body otherwise normal (unless body part is the exaggerated trait)

VISUAL INTEGRATION:
• Exaggerated feature blends naturally with body
• Proper lighting and shadows
• Anatomically plausible connection points
• Skin tone and texture consistent
• No visible seams or photoshop artifacts
• Feature looks genuinely part of the subject

STYLE OPTIONS:
• Photorealistic exaggeration
• OR caricature illustration style
• Playful but not grotesque
• Humorous but not disturbing
• Could be portrait or full-body depending on trait

DEGREE OF EXAGGERATION:
• Noticeable and comedic
• 2-3x normal size for facial features
• 4-5x for body parts like hands/feet
• Extreme but not impossible-looking
• Striking visual impact

SETTING:
• Neutral background to emphasize exaggeration
• OR everyday setting showing how trait affects daily life
• Good lighting to show the exaggerated feature clearly
• Subject posed naturally despite exaggeration

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject with exactly ONE physical trait dramatically exaggerated while all other features remain normal, with the enlarged feature completely replacing (not adding to) the original, seamlessly integrated and naturally lit to appear as if the subject was born with this unique proportion.

name: EXPECTING?
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a visibly pregnant person regardless of gender.

The subject should appear proud and glowing, with a round belly, maternity clothing, and gentle, warm lighting.

The tone should be lighthearted, wholesome, and humorous rather than medical.

name: EXPRESSIONISM
message: Take a picture in the Expressionism artistic movement emphasizing subjective emotions and inner experiences, often distorting reality to convey intense emotions and psychological states.

name: EXTREME SPORTS MOMENT
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a dramatic moment in an extreme sport.

SPORT SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a sport, USE THAT SPORT
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 53:
  - 0: Skateboarding - massive aerial trick off halfpipe or ramp, kickflip or 900
  - 1: Snowboarding - huge air off jump, powder spray, mountain backdrop
  - 2: Surfing - riding inside giant barrel wave, dramatic curl, Hawaiian Pipeline
  - 3: BMX - high air trick, backflip or tailwhip, dirt jump or ramp
  - 4: Motocross - soaring over jump, bike horizontal, stadium or outdoor track
  - 5: Rock Climbing - scaling sheer cliff face, no ropes (free solo), dramatic height
  - 6: Base Jumping - leaping from cliff or building, parachute deploying, adrenaline
  - 7: Skydiving - free fall, arms spread, earth far below, extreme altitude
  - 8: Bungee Jumping - mid-fall, elastic cord stretched, bridge or platform above
  - 9: Wingsuit Flying - gliding through air in wingsuit, mountains or clouds
  - 10: Parkour - leaping between buildings, urban freerunning, rooftop gaps
  - 11: Mountain Biking - downhill speed, rocky terrain, catching air
  - 12: Whitewater Rafting - navigating huge rapids, raft airborne, team paddling
  - 13: Kayaking (Waterfall) - dropping over massive waterfall in kayak
  - 14: Ice Climbing - ascending frozen waterfall with ice axes, crampons
  - 15: Skimboarding - skimming across shallow water onto wave
  - 16: Wakeboarding - aerial flip behind boat, cable park tricks
  - 17: Kitesurfing - massive air with kite, ocean spray, dramatic wind
  - 18: Windsurfing - catching air, sail and board airborne
  - 19: Big Wave Surfing - riding 50+ foot wave, Nazaré Portugal, terrifying scale
  - 20: Bull Riding - on bucking bull, rodeo arena, 8 seconds of chaos
  - 21: Slacklining (Highlining) - walking tightrope between cliffs, insane height
  - 22: Zip Lining - racing down cable, jungle or mountain canyon
  - 23: Bobsledding - four-person sled, banked ice track, speed blur
  - 24: Luge - lying back on sled, racing down ice track
  - 25: Skeleton - head-first down ice track on small sled
  - 26: Downhill Skiing - racing at extreme speed, gates, mountain
  - 27: Freestyle Skiing - aerial flip or trick, halfpipe or big air
  - 28: Ski Jumping - flying off massive ski jump, soaring through air
  - 29: Heli-Skiing - helicopter drop onto virgin powder, remote mountain
  - 30: Street Luge - lying on wheeled sled racing down paved hill
  - 31: Longboarding (Downhill) - bombing down mountain road at high speed
  - 32: Razor Scooter (Mega Ramp) - massive air on scooter, X Games style
  - 33: Inline Skating (Vert) - vert ramp aerial, grinding, aggressive skating
  - 34: Hang Gliding - soaring with triangular wing, mountain launch
  - 35: Paragliding - gliding with parachute wing, coastal cliffs or mountains
  - 36: Cliff Diving - mid-dive from high cliff into ocean or cenote
  - 37: High Diving - Olympic platform, spinning dive, pool far below
  - 38: Scuba Diving (Extreme) - in shark cage, surrounded by great whites
  - 39: Cave Diving - underwater in flooded cave, tight passages, headlamp
  - 40: Ice Diving - under ice sheet, frozen surface above
  - 41: Sandboarding - bombing down massive sand dune
  - 42: Volcano Boarding - sliding down active volcano on board
  - 43: Land Sailing - wind-powered cart racing across salt flats
  - 44: Speed Flying - skiing while using small parachute for jumps
  - 45: Snowkiting - being pulled by kite on snow, big air
  - 46: Zorbing - inside giant inflatable ball rolling down hill
  - 47: Rodeo (Bareback Bronc) - on bucking horse, no saddle, one hand
  - 48: Mountain Unicycling - riding unicycle down extreme mountain trail
  - 49: Volcano Bungee - bungee jumping into volcanic crater
  - 50: Basketball Slam Dunk - powerful dunk, hanging on rim, arena crowd, NBA finals intensity
  - 51: Track Sprint Finish - full sprint across finish line, lean forward, photo finish, Olympic 100m
  - 52: Gymnastics Aerial - massive flip or twist in mid-air, perfect form, Olympic arena

DRAMATIC MOMENT (CRITICAL):
• Peak action frozen in time
• Most intense moment of the sport
• Maximum height, speed, or danger visible
• Adrenaline and excitement palpable
• Professional extreme sports photography quality

SUBJECT PRESERVATION:
• Subject's face CLEARLY RECOGNIZABLE
• Facial features maintained
• Expression shows intensity, focus, or excitement
• Subject's identity visible despite action
• This is the subject doing the sport, not a generic athlete

SPORT-SPECIFIC GEAR:
• Authentic equipment for selected sport
• Protective gear (helmet, pads, etc.)
• Sport-specific clothing
• Proper footwear or lack thereof
• Branded gear if appropriate (GoPro, Red Bull, etc.)

ENVIRONMENT:
• Authentic location for that sport
• Mountain, ocean, urban, track, arena, etc.
• Environmental elements (spray, dust, snow, wind)
• Scale showing magnitude (height, speed, size)
• Other participants or spectators if relevant

MOTION & ENERGY:
• Motion blur on appropriate elements
• Speed lines or effects
• Spray, dust, or snow trails
• Freeze-frame of peak action
• Dynamic composition showing movement
• Forces of gravity visible

BODY POSITION:
• Sport-appropriate athletic position
• Mid-trick or peak performance moment
• Professional technique visible
• Muscles engaged, body tensed
• Balance and control evident

LIGHTING:
• Dramatic natural lighting
• Golden hour, harsh sun, or overcast
• Lighting emphasizes action and environment
• Cinematic sports photography lighting

ATMOSPHERE:
• Adrenaline and excitement
• Danger and thrill
• Athletic achievement
• Extreme sports culture
• "Go big or go home" energy
• Red Bull/X Games aesthetic

PHOTOGRAPHY STYLE:
• Professional extreme sports photography
• High shutter speed freeze frame
• Wide-angle dramatic perspective
• Could be from ESPN or X Games
• Magazine cover quality

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject - clearly recognizable - frozen in the most dramatic, intense moment of the selected extreme sport, with authentic gear, proper environment, dynamic motion, and professional action sports photography quality capturing a peak moment of athletic achievement and adrenaline.

name: EYE OF THE BEHOLDER
message:
