• Head emerging from or surrounded by vapor
• Atmospheric fog effects
• Wisps and tendrils of smoke
• Creates mystical atmosphere inside sphere
• Head appears through the mist
• Smoke may be tinted (purple, blue, green)

FORTUNE TELLER CHARACTER:
• NOT the subject (subject is the floating head)
• Mysterious fortune teller gazing into ball
• Hands hovering over or touching crystal ball
• Elaborate costume appropriate to style
• Head scarf or turban (traditional)
• Heavy jewelry (rings, necklaces, earrings)
• Dramatic makeup and styled appearance
• Intense, mystical expression
• Reading the vision in the ball
• Summoning or interpreting the spirit
• Gender can be male or female

FORTUNE TELLER CLOTHING:
• Flowing robes or dramatic dress
• Rich fabrics (velvet, silk, brocade)
• Deep colors (purple, burgundy, black, gold)
• Ornate patterns and embroidery
• Head covering (scarf, turban, hood)
• Shawl or cape
• Mystical symbols on clothing
• Elaborate and theatrical

JEWELRY & ACCESSORIES:
• Multiple rings (on every finger)
• Large ornate necklaces
• Dangling earrings
• Bracelets and bangles
• Mystical pendants (eye, moon, star)
• Gold and silver (tarnished, antique)
• Gemstones and crystals
• Occult symbols

SETTING:
• Dimly lit tent or room
• Draped fabrics on walls and ceiling
• Rich textures everywhere
• Mystical atmosphere
• Incense smoke in air
• Candles providing light
• Cluttered with mystical objects
• Intimate, enclosed space

TABLE & SURFACE:
• Round table with cloth covering
• Velvet or silk tablecloth (deep colors)
• Crystal ball centered on table
• Tarot cards scattered nearby
• Candles on table
• Other mystical objects (runes, herbs, crystals)
• Ornate, mysterious setup

MYSTICAL OBJECTS (In scene):
• Tarot cards spread out
• Candles (multiple, lit)
• Incense burning (smoke visible)
• Crystals and gemstones
• Spell books or grimoires
• Runes or stones
• Herbs and potions
• Astrology charts
• Pendulum
• Occult symbols

LIGHTING (CRITICAL):
• Low, atmospheric lighting
• Candlelight (warm, flickering)
• Crystal ball as PRIMARY light source (glowing bright)
• Floating head illuminated by ball's inner glow
• Dramatic shadows cast by ball's light
• Mystical ambiance
• Purple, blue, or green mystical tints
• Smoke illuminated by candlelight and ball glow
• Chiaroscuro (light and shadow contrast)
• Ethereal glow around floating head

CRYSTAL BALL GLOW:
• Ball glows intensely with supernatural light
• Floating head lit from within the sphere
• Ethereal, ghostly illumination
• Colors: White, pale blue, purple, or green
• Light emanates outward from ball
• Head appears through glowing mist
• Magical luminescence
• Brightest light source in scene

ATMOSPHERE:
• Mysterious and mystical
• Supernatural séance energy
• Spirit communication
• Fortune-telling magic
• Predictions and prophecy
• Divination and summoning
• Occult and esoteric
• Timeless mysticism
• Spirit world connection

SMOKE & MIST:
• Incense smoke in room
• Thick mist swirling inside crystal ball around head
• Atmospheric haze throughout scene
• Ethereal quality
• Floating head emerging from vapor
• Mystical fog effects
• Smoke creating supernatural atmosphere

COLOR PALETTE:
• Deep purples and burgundies
• Rich golds and bronzes
• Dark blacks and deep blues
• Candlelight warm tones
• Mystical greens or purples (ball glow)
• Jewel tones throughout
• Warm and mysterious
• Ethereal glow colors (pale blue, white, purple)

STYLE-SPECIFIC ELEMENTS:

**Carnival:**
• Striped tent, theatrical
• Hand-painted signs
• Vintage 1920s-1950s aesthetic
• Circus/sideshow energy

**Victorian Spiritualist:**
• Dark parlor, formal dress
• Séance table, mediumship
• 1800s gothic atmosphere
• Spirit communication

**New Age:**
• Crystals everywhere
• Dream catchers, incense
• 1970s hippie mysticism
• Bohemian décor

**Automaton (Zoltar):**
• Mechanical fortune teller
• Glass case/cabinet
• Coin-operated machine
• Animatronic movement
• Carnival arcade aesthetic

POSE & COMPOSITION:
• Fortune teller's hands near crystal ball
• Gazing intently into ball at floating head
• Subject's floating head central and prominent in ball
• Three-quarter view of fortune teller
• Ball prominent in foreground
• Mystical concentration
• Summoning or communicating with spirit

FLOATING HEAD EXPRESSION:
• Serene and otherworldly OR
• Ominous and foreboding OR
• Wise and prophetic OR
• Mysterious and cryptic
• Eyes open (knowing gaze) OR closed (meditative)
• Slight smile or neutral expression
• Conveying prophecy or message
• Supernatural knowing

MAGICAL EFFECTS:
• Sparkles or particles in air around ball
• Mystical energy radiating from sphere
• Glowing symbols or runes appearing
• Supernatural presence filling room
• Reality bending around crystal ball
• Magic manifesting visibly
• Ghostly aura around floating head

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show a mystical fortune teller scene with an ornate fortune teller gazing into a brightly glowing crystal ball - inside the crystal ball, the subject's head appears as a three-dimensional floating disembodied spirit suspended in swirling mist with no neck or body visible, the head glowing with ethereal supernatural light and appearing ghostly and translucent like a summoned apparition - the scene is dimly lit by candlelight with the crystal ball serving as the primary light source, rich fabrics, mystical objects, incense smoke, and dramatic atmospheric lighting creating that mysterious séance atmosphere where the subject's floating spectral head is the prophetic vision being revealed in the glowing sphere.

name: FPS
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a character from a legendary first-person shooter game, rendered in that game's distinctive visual style and HUD interface.

FPS GAME SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a specific FPS game, USE THAT GAME
• If no FPS game is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE game using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST TWO DIGITS of the RANDOM SEED modulo 20:
  - 0: Halo - Spartan armor in Forerunner or Covenant environment with shield/health bar
  - 1: Half-Life - HEV suit in Black Mesa or Xen with iconic orange HUD
  - 2: Quake - Dark medieval fortress with gothic architecture and brown palette
  - 3: Unreal Tournament - Futuristic arena with weapon wheel and frag count
  - 4: BioShock - Rapture art deco underwater city with plasmid/EVE interface
  - 5: Skyrim - First-person fantasy with compass, health/magicka/stamina bars
  - 6: Fallout - Post-apocalyptic wasteland with Pip-Boy style interface
  - 7: Borderlands - Cell-shaded wasteland with loot-shooter HUD and shields
  - 8: Counter-Strike - Tactical modern setting with buy menu aesthetic
  - 9: Team Fortress 2 - Cartoonish mercenary in stylized battlefield
  - 10: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare - Realistic military with killstreak HUD
  - 11: Battlefield - Large-scale warfare with minimap and squad interface
  - 12: Portal - Aperture Science test chamber with portal gun HUD
  - 13: Titanfall - Pilot or titan with parkour environment and HUD
  - 14: Destiny - Guardian in sci-fi fantasy with super energy and ghost
  - 15: Metro - Post-apocalyptic Moscow tunnels with gas mask overlay
  - 16: Far Cry - Tropical or wilderness setting with weapon wheel
  - 17: Overwatch - Hero shooter with character-specific abilities HUD
  - 18: Apex Legends - Battle royale with shield/health segments and ping system
  - 19: Prey - Talos I space station with neuromods and alien threats

CORE REQUIREMENTS:
• Match the visual style of the selected game (realistic, cel-shaded, retro, etc.)
• Subject transformed into character appropriate for that game universe
• Environment and lighting matching game's signature aesthetic
• Character must appear natively integrated into the scene

INTERFACE (MANDATORY):
• Game-authentic HUD interface for the selected game
• Health, shields, armor, or relevant status indicators
• Weapon display or ability icons
• Minimap or compass if appropriate to the game
• Ammo counter and equipment indicators
• Any signature HUD elements (crosshair, objective markers, etc.)

STYLE:
• First-person perspective gameplay view
• Authentic recreation of the selected game's visual signature
• Proper color grading and post-processing effects
• Game-appropriate UI fonts and iconography

FINAL RESULT:
An authentic-looking gameplay screenshot from the selected FPS game featuring the subject as a character in that game's world, complete with accurate HUD interface and visual style matching the original game.

name: FRACTAL
message: Take a picture and transform the image using fractal geometry. Recursive patterns, infinite detail.

name: FREAKSHOW POSTER
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform them into the star of a vintage freakshow poster from the late 1800s or early 1900s.

The subject should be presented as a dramatic, mysterious attraction with exaggerated features, theatrical posing, and bold stage lighting.

Design the image like an old carnival poster, with ornate borders, hand-painted lettering, and weathered paper texture.

Include a sensational headline and dramatic tagline describing the subject as a strange or amazing curiosity, using humorous or absurd flavor text.

The final image should look like an antique circus sideshow poster advertising the subject as a spectacular and unbelievable attraction.

name: FREAKY FRIDAY
message:
Take a picture and if the picture contains two or more clearly visible subjects, perform a realistic multi-subject head swap by exchanging their heads between bodies. Preserve body posture, clothing, lighting direction, skin tone consistency, and camera perspective. Maintain natural neck alignment and correct scale so each swapped head fits the new body believably.

If exactly one subject is detected, perform an inverse face transformation by subtly mirroring or inverting the subject’s facial features while preserving overall realism, expression, and identity. The result should feel intentionally uncanny but not distorted.

If no subjects are detected, return the original image unchanged. The final image should be visually coherent and readable on small screens.

name: FREEZE FRAME
message: Take a picture of the subject and create a photorealistic freeze-frame action moment centered on an object naturally observed near the subject in the image. The AI must identify a nearby object such as a glass, cup, plate of food, pool, puddle, ball, or similar element and use it as the source of an explosive action event. The subject should be captured at the exact peak moment of interaction, such as water spilling outward from a tipped glass, food launching into the air, or a dramatic splash as the subject jumps into a pool. Liquid, debris, or fragments should be frozen mid-air with sharp detail, dynamic shapes, and realistic physics while the subject remains crisply focused. If no suitable nearby object is visible, randomly select a plausible explosive moment consistent with the environment. Maintain realistic lighting, motion physics, shadows, and depth of field so the final image looks like a real high-speed photograph capturing a single decisive instant in time.

name: FRENCH CHEF DISASTER
message: Take a picture and place the subject as the host of The French Chef cooking show in the style of Julia Child, but everything is going catastrophically wrong. Show them in a 1960s TV kitchen set with vintage appliances, wearing an apron, trying to maintain Julia Child's cheerful composure while absolute chaos unfolds. The kitchen should be a disaster - pots boiling over and spilling everywhere, food on fire with flames shooting up, whole chickens or ingredients flying through the air, wine bottles knocked over and spilling, utensils scattered everywhere, mixer spraying batter across the set. The subject should have that exaggerated Julia Child enthusiasm and dramatic hand gestures despite being covered in flour, sauce splattered across their face and apron, hair disheveled. Include vintage 1960s TV production elements: old cameras visible, grainy film quality, retro color palette, that characteristic public television aesthetic. Show the 'finished dish' they're supposed to create displayed beautifully on a card, contrasted with the smoking, collapsed, or unrecognizable disaster on their counter. Maybe they're holding up a charred mess while maintaining that bright TV smile and saying 'Bon Appétit!' Add vintage graphics, retro kitchen décor, and that wholesome 60s cooking show vibe completely undermined by culinary catastrophe. Make it look like a frame from a vintage cooking show where absolutely everything went wrong but the host keeps going with cheerful determination.

name: FRIDGE ART
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a child’s crayon drawing displayed on a refrigerator.

Render the subject as a deliberately crude crayon drawing with uneven proportions, simple shapes, wobbly outlines, and flat scribbled coloring. Facial features and limbs should be exaggerated or misaligned in a childlike way while still being loosely recognizable.

Use a plain white or lightly stained paper background with visible crayon texture and pressure marks. Add misspelled handwritten text such as a name, age, or caption written in childlike lettering.

Attach the drawing to a refrigerator using colorful magnets. Show part of the fridge surface, smudges, and nearby papers or photos.

Ensure the entire drawing and fridge context are fully visible. The final image should feel innocent, funny, and unmistakably like real fridge art made by a child.

name: FROSTING CAKE ART
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into frosting-style artwork applied flat on the top of a cake. The subject should lie flush on the frosting surface — fully integrated — but the frosting itself should have realistic texture: piped swirls, slight ridges, creaminess, and subtle shadows so it clearly looks like real icing, not a topper.

Render the subject simply, preserving only the most recognizable facial features, posture, or silhouette. Avoid overly detailed or three-dimensional features; the design should be believable as hand-piped or painted frosting.

Include realistic cake decorations such as frosting borders, small swirls, sprinkles, or minor fondant accents. If no external message is provided via master prompt, automatically add playful flavor text based on the subject: e.g., 'Happy 1st Birthday!' if the subject appears young, or 'Happy Retirement!' if the subject appears older.

If an external message is provided, append it naturally using piping-style lettering around the subject. Ensure the full cake top and subject are fully visible in the frame. Use soft, realistic lighting and perspective so the subject and frosting appear tactile and integrated. The final image should feel festive, humorous, and clearly readable on small screens, while lying flat on the cake surface.

name: FROZEN IN ICE
message: Take a picture and make it appear as if the subject is frozen inside a clear block of ice. The ice should have realistic cracks, bubbles, frost, and refraction. The subject must be clearly visible through the ice, distorted slightly by thickness and trapped depth.

name: FRUSTRATIONAL POSTER
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a dramatic motivational poster where the inspirational message clearly does NOT match what is happening.

MOTIVATIONAL THEME SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a theme word, USE THAT WORD
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST DIGIT modulo 5:
  - 0: TEAMWORK — subject surrounded by arguing, chaos, crossed arms, or visible disagreement
  - 1: SUCCESS — subject failing, overwhelmed, exhausted, or mid-disaster
  - 2: INNOVATION — subject fixing something with duct tape, zip ties, or improvised tools
  - 3: LEADERSHIP — subject clearly confused, lost, or being ignored
  - 4: PERSEVERANCE — subject giving up, sitting down, or visibly defeated

TRANSFORM THE SUBJECT:
• Subject MUST remain clearly recognizable
• This is NOT parody illustration — realistic staged photography
• Facial expression should subtly contradict the slogan
• Body language reinforces irony
• No caricature or cartoon exaggeration
• Gender-neutral presentation

POSTER DESIGN & TYPOGRAPHY:
• Large bold motivational word prominently displayed
• Smaller inspirational subtext (corporate-style, generic, ironic)
• Clean sans-serif typography
• High-contrast layout
• Subtle vignette or gradient background
• Looks like an office motivational poster

SETTING & COMPOSITION:
• Realistic environment matching the contradiction
• Carefully staged but natural
• Balanced framing like professional poster photography
• Subject centered or rule-of-thirds
• FULL BODY visible
• Entire frame visible with all four corners present

STYLE:
• Corporate motivational poster aesthetic
• Dramatic lighting that takes itself too seriously
• High clarity, professional photography
• Humor comes from contrast, not exaggeration

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a professionally printed motivational poster whose message is completely undermined by the visual reality — subtle, ironic, and deadpan, with the subject clearly recognizable and fully visible from top to bottom.

name: FUN-FLATABLE
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into an over-the-top inflatable mascot costume. Exaggerate proportions so the body is comically large and rounded, but keep the subject’s facial features visible on the inflated surface. Include whimsical folds, wrinkles, and inflated textures. Place the subject in a fun environment such as a stadium, street parade, or party. Ensure the entire inflatable is fully visible and clearly readable on a small screen, emphasizing absurd humor and playful energy.

name: FUNHOUSE MIRROR
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject as if reflected in a carnival funhouse mirror.

MIRROR DISTORTION SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a mirror distortion, USE THAT MIRROR DISTORTION
• If no mirror distortion is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE distortion using the RANDOM SEED
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 0,1: SELECT vertical concave (tall and pinched inward)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 2,3: SELECT vertical convex (short and wide)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 4,5: SELECT horizontal concave (squeezed side-to-side)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 6,7: SELECT horizontal convex (stretched side-to-side)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 8: SELECT concave-convex (pinched center with expanded ends)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 9: SELECT convex-concave (expanded center with pinched ends)

The distortion must affect the ENTIRE subject and scene consistently, as true optical glass distortion — not digital warping.

Facial features, body proportions, and environment must bend smoothly and continuously according to the mirror curvature.

DO NOT crop the subject.
DO NOT break anatomy or introduce glitches.
DO NOT apply multiple distortions at once.

Lighting, reflections, and perspective must behave like reflective glass, with subtle highlights and edge reflections.

The final image must look like a real photograph taken of a funhouse mirror reflection.

name: FUNKO POP
message: Take a picture and turn the subject into a Funko Pop. Oversized head, simplified body.

name: FUTURAMA
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into an animated character placed directly inside a Futurama-style scene alongside recognizable characters from the show.

Render the subject in the same visual style as Futurama characters: clean bold outlines, flat cel shading, simplified geometric facial features, exaggerated eyes, smooth rounded head shapes, and bright saturated colors. Preserve the subject’s recognizability while fully adapting them into the cartoon style.

Place the subject INTO an iconic Futurama environment and scene, selected based on context or randomly, such as:
• inside the Planet Express building or conference room
• standing with Fry, Leela, and Bender in the Planet Express crew lineup
• walking through New New York with futuristic buildings and flying cars
• inside MomCorp, the Head Museum, or a sci-fi lab
• in a space scene with Futurama characters reacting to the subject

Existing Futurama characters may appear in the scene as supporting characters, background figures, or interaction partners, drawn accurately in their recognizable cartoon style. The subject should feel like a guest character naturally written into an episode, not pasted on top.

Adapt the subject’s clothing into Futurama-appropriate outfits — delivery uniforms, sci-fi jumpsuits, futuristic casual wear, or humorous future attire inspired by their real clothing.

Use simple painted backgrounds, clean animation lighting, and minimal texture consistent with hand-drawn cel animation. Avoid realistic shading or painterly effects.

Ensure the full scene is visible and readable on a small screen, with the subject clearly identifiable among the Futurama characters. The final image should feel like a freeze-frame from an actual Futurama episode where the subject unexpectedly appears.

name: FUTURE SELF
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a realistic future version of themselves, showing natural aging while preserving identity.

AGING RANGE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies an age range, USE THAT RANGE
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY — you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST DIGIT modulo 6:
  - 0: +15 years
  - 1: +20 years
  - 2: +25 years
  - 3: +30 years
  - 4: +35 years
  - 5: +40 years

TRANSFORM THE SUBJECT:
• Subject MUST remain clearly recognizable
• Preserve bone structure and facial proportions
• Apply realistic age-related changes only
• No caricature, exaggeration, or fantasy aging
• Gender-neutral aging presentation

AGING DETAILS (REALISM REQUIRED):
• Natural wrinkles and fine lines based on age range
• Subtle skin texture changes and tone variation
• Possible graying or thinning of hair
• Slight changes in posture appropriate to age
• Mild facial volume changes (cheeks, jawline, eyes)
• Age progression must appear gradual and believable

EXCLUSIONS:
• No extreme frailty
• No medical conditions or illness
• No dramatic weight change unless age-appropriate
• No horror, fantasy, or sci-fi elements

CLOTHING & STYLING:
• Clothing style should feel plausible for the subject at that age
• Outfit should remain realistic and contemporary
• No costumes or era shifts
• Hair and grooming consistent with natural aging

SETTING & COMPOSITION:
• Same environment and framing as original
• Full-body view preferred
• FULL image visible with all four corners present
• No cropping, zooming, or reframing

STYLE:
• Photorealistic
• Neutral, respectful tone
• Looks like a legitimate age-progression photograph
• Suitable for family, legal, or personal reference use

FINAL RESULT:
The image should depict a convincing future version of the subject aged 20–40 years, preserving identity while showing realistic, respectful age progression — seamless, natural, and visually believable.

name: GAMEBOY
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into an authentic early-1990s monochrome handheld console display using a classic green dot-matrix screen aesthetic. Render the entire image as if it is displayed on a low-resolution reflective LCD with a pea-green color palette, dark olive shadows, and pale green highlights. Convert the subject into true dot-matrix pixel art using a visible grid of circular pixels, limited tonal steps, and strong contrast. Preserve the subject’s recognizable facial features and silhouette while adapting them to the constraints of a handheld screen resolution. Simulate real screen characteristics including pixel ghosting, motion blur trails, uneven refresh, slight vertical smearing, faint scan artifacts, and subtle screen noise. Avoid smooth gradients—everything should appear quantized and grid-based. Frame the image strictly as the handheld screen view itself, with a thin dark border suggesting the screen edge. Do not include logos, branding, or copyrighted UI elements. Optional minimal pixel indicators (numbers or icons only) may appear at the edges of the screen. Optimize for small screens with bold shapes, clear separation, and immediate readability. The final image should feel indistinguishable from a real dot-matrix handheld screen captured mid-use—nostalgic, tactile, and unmistakably retro.

name: GARDEN GNOME
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a classic, life-sized garden gnome. Preserve facial recognition while giving the subject gnome features such as a pointed hat, whimsical clothing, and small props (e.g., shovel, lantern, mushroom). Place the gnome in a backyard or garden environment. Ensure the full gnome is visible, standing naturally, and clearly readable on a small screen. The final image should feel humorous, whimsical, and integrated into the scene.

name: GARGOYLE
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a stone gargoyle perched on a famous cathedral.

CATHEDRAL SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a specific cathedral, USE THAT CATHEDRAL
• If no cathedral is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE cathedral using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST DIGIT of the RANDOM SEED modulo 6:
  - 0: Notre-Dame de Paris (bell tower perch, Paris cityscape, Seine River, French Gothic architecture)
  - 1: Westminster Abbey, London (tower or buttress perch, London skyline, Big Ben distant, English Gothic)
  - 2: Cologne Cathedral, Germany (twin spire perch, Rhine River below, medieval German city, dramatic height)
  - 3: Milan Cathedral (Duomo), Italy (among forest of spires, Milan city center, ornate Italian Gothic)
  - 4: Sagrada Família, Barcelona (modern Gothic perch, Gaudí architecture, Barcelona below, organic forms)
  - 5: Generic Grand Cathedral (majestic unnamed cathedral, European city, flexible Gothic style, flying buttresses)

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• Subject becomes a living stone gargoyle
• Perched on the edge or corner of selected Gothic cathedral
• Wings, claws, and stone-like features
• Subject's identity remains recognizable
• Tone is gothic, mysterious, and architectural
• Photorealistic stone texture and cathedral detail

IDENTITY RULES:
• Subject's face clearly recognizable despite stone transformation
• Facial structure and key features preserved
• Expression can be menacing, thoughtful, or protective
• Eyes may glow faintly or remain stone
• Subject remains themselves, not replaced

GARGOYLE TRANSFORMATION:
• Subject's body transformed to stone or stone-like appearance
• Recognizable facial features preserved in stone form
• Bat-like or dragon-like wings extending from back
• Clawed hands and feet gripping architecture
• Muscular, hunched posture
• Weathered stone texture with age and erosion
• May include horns, pointed ears, or demonic features
• Tail optional but traditional

STONE APPEARANCE:
• Realistic limestone, granite, or sandstone texture
• Weathering effects: cracks, erosion, moss, lichen
• Rain stains and pollution darkening
• Aged appearance (centuries old)
• Rough texture with carved details
• Color matches cathedral stone (grey, tan, weathered)

POSE AND POSITIONING:
• Perched on corner, ledge, or buttress
• Hunched or crouched guardian pose
• Clawed hands/feet gripping stone architecture
• Wings folded back or partially spread
• Looking down at city below or outward
• Stable, permanent-looking position

WING DESIGN:
• Bat-like membrane wings
• Stone texture extends to wings
• Skeletal wing structure visible
• Folded against back or partially extended
• Weathered and aged like body
• Gothic cathedral gargoyle style

CATHEDRAL ARCHITECTURE:
• Authentic Gothic architectural details for selected location
• Flying buttresses, pinnacles, spires
• Carved stone decorations
• Rose windows visible
• Other gargoyles or grotesques nearby
• Worn stone matching subject's texture

ATMOSPHERE AND LIGHTING:
• Gothic mood: mysterious, protective, ancient
• Dramatic sky: sunset, storm, twilight, or overcast
• City lights beginning to glow (if evening)
• Atmospheric perspective showing height
• Weather effects: rain, mist, or clear
• Shadows emphasizing carved details

CITYSCAPE BELOW:
• Authentic city matching selected cathedral location
• Rooftops, streets, and landmarks visible
• Sense of height and scale
• Period-appropriate or modern city
• Distant horizon visible

CAMERA:
• Dramatic angle emphasizing height
• Subject clearly visible and detailed
• Cathedral architecture in frame
• City visible below
• Cinematic composition

OPTIONAL ELEMENTS:
• Rain or water stains on stone
• Pigeons or ravens nearby
• Other gargoyles in background
• Church bells visible
• Carved inscriptions on architecture
• Moss or lichen growth in crevices

RESTRICTIONS:
• No cartoon or Disney-style rendering
• No fully demonic or evil appearance
• No text overlays or captions
• No modern buildings unless appropriate to location
• No unrealistic colors (keep stone natural)
• No wings so large they dominate scene
• Gargoyle should look architecturally integrated

FINAL RESULT:
The image should convincingly show the subject transformed into an ancient stone gargoyle on the selected cathedral, a permanent guardian watching over the city below. The stone texture, weathering, pose, and cathedral setting should create a photorealistic scene that looks like the gargoyle has been there for centuries.

name: GENDER INVERSION
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into the opposite gender while preserving the subject’s core facial structure, expressions, and identity. Adjust facial features, body shape, hair, and secondary characteristics in a realistic and anatomically plausible way. Adapt clothing and styling to suit the transformed gender presentation while maintaining the subject’s original personality and essence. Ensure the subject appears naturally integrated into the scene, with consistent lighting, proportions, and photorealistic realism.

name: GHIBLI CAM
message: Take a picture in the Studio Ghibli anime style-soft colors, whimsical atmosphere, and hand-drawn aesthetic.

name: GHOST
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a ghost in spectral form with supernatural qualities.

GHOST TYPE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a specific ghost type, USE THAT TYPE
• If no type is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE type using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST DIGIT of the RANDOM SEED modulo 6:
  - 0: Classic Victorian Spirit (1800s clothing, white/grey, old mansion, tragic melancholic, candlelit)
  - 1: Vengeful Apparition (intense angry expression, darker shadowy, flickering unstable, death scene, stormy)
  - 2: Sad Wandering Soul (confused lost expression, soft gentle glow, searching gesture, familiar place, twilight)
  - 3: Protective Guardian (benevolent watchful, warm golden glow, guarding location/person, family home, peaceful)
  - 4: Ancient Historical Phantom (medieval/Roman/ancient clothing, aged time-worn, historical site, mysterious)
  - 5: Poltergeist Energy (violent chaotic, objects floating/thrown, intense distortions, unstable, dark interior)

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• Subject becomes a translucent, ethereal ghost
• Supernatural, otherworldly presence
• Transparent or semi-transparent appearance
• Subject's features still recognizable
• Haunting, mysterious, or tragic atmosphere
• Photorealistic paranormal aesthetic

IDENTITY RULES:
• Subject's face clearly recognizable despite transparency
• Facial structure and features preserved
• Expression conveys ghost's emotional state
• Identity maintained through spectral transformation
• No complete replacement with another entity
• Subject remains themselves in death

SPECTRAL APPEARANCE:
• Translucent, see-through quality
• Soft ethereal glow or luminescence
• Wispy, slightly blurred edges
• Floating or hovering above ground
• Subject's facial features visible through transparency
• Ghostly pallor (pale, desaturated colors)
• Flowing, gravity-defying movement

TRANSPARENCY EFFECTS:
• 30-70% opacity (see-through but visible)
• Background visible through ghost's form
• Stronger opacity at center, fading at edges
• Subtle inner glow or luminescence
• Realistic volumetric transparency
• Environment partially obscured by spectral presence

SPECTRAL CLOTHING:
• Period-appropriate attire frozen in time
• Clothing same transparency as body
• Flowing, ethereal movement
• Death clothing or meaningful outfit
• Faded colors or monochromatic
• Tattered or pristine depending on type

SUPERNATURAL EFFECTS:
• Soft ethereal glow emanating from ghost
• Mist or fog gathering around manifestation
• Cold breath condensation in air
• Slight distortion of space around ghost
• Flickering lights or candles
• Objects moving or disturbed
• Temperature drop visual indicators

HAUNTING LOCATION:
• Old mansion or Victorian house
• Abandoned building or ruins
• Cemetery or graveyard
• Historic battlefield
• Family home from their life
• Church or chapel
• Scene of their death
• Meaningful place from past

ATMOSPHERE:
• Eerie, supernatural mood
• Mysterious or tragic emotion
• Cold, otherworldly feeling
• Time-frozen quality
• Melancholic or frightening
• Paranormal tension

LIGHTING:
• Low light, shadows prominent
• Moonlight streaming through windows
• Candlelight flickering
• Ghost providing own luminescence
• Fog diffusing light sources
• Spectral glow illuminating surroundings
• Blue or cool-toned ambient light

COLOR PALETTE:
• Desaturated, washed-out colors
• Pale blues and greys
• White or off-white spectral glow
• Deep shadows and darkness
• Moonlight silver
• Candlelight gold (warm ghosts)
• Black for vengeful spirits

POSE AND MOVEMENT:
• Floating 6-12 inches above ground
• Flowing, graceful movement
• Gesturing or reaching toward something
• Looking at viewer or away wistfully
• Frozen in moment of death (optional)
• Drifting through walls or objects

CAMERA:
• Atmospheric, moody composition
• Ghost centrally featured
• Location context visible
• Supernatural film quality
• Slight blur or ethereal focus

OPTIONAL ELEMENTS:
• Other faint ghosts in background
• Orbs of spectral light
• Ectoplasm wisps
• Mirrors reflecting differently
• Clocks stopped at time of death
• Photographs from their life
• Flowers wilting in presence
• Frost forming on surfaces

RESTRICTIONS:
• No cartoon or comical ghost appearance
• No Casper-style friendly ghost unless appropriate
• No text overlays or captions
• No sheet-with-eyeholes costume look
• No fully opaque (must be transparent)
• Subject must remain recognizable
• Photorealistic paranormal, not fantasy

FINAL RESULT:
The image should present the subject as a convincing ghost of the selected type with realistic transparency, supernatural atmosphere, and emotional presence. The spectral transformation should preserve the subject's identity while making them clearly otherworldly.

name: GIANT MONSTER
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a giant Kaiju-style monster attacking a city. The subject should tower over buildings at massive scale (100+ feet tall), with their recognizable features enlarged and made monstrous. Place them in an urban environment with skyscrapers, fleeing crowds, emergency vehicles, and destruction. Add cinematic disaster movie atmosphere with dramatic lighting, dust clouds, debris, and chaos. Include details like the monster's massive footprints crushing cars, toppling buildings, and helicopters circling. Make it look like a scene from a classic monster movie with photorealistic destruction and scale.

name: GIANT WORLD
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a giant towering over the environment. Realistic scale interaction.

name: GILLIGAN'S ISLAND
message:
Take a picture of the subject and place them into a Gilligan’s Island-style castaway world where modern technology does not exist.

TECHNOLOGY HANDLING (CRITICAL):
• Analyze the image for any visible modern technology
• If technology IS present, TRANSFORM it into an improvised device that the Professor would have constructed using materials found on a deserted island
• If technology is NOT present, ADD a believable improvised object that looks like one of the Professor’s inventions

PROFESSOR-STYLE INVENTIONS:
• Devices made from bamboo, coconuts, rope, vines, driftwood, shells, and salvaged shipwreck parts
• Inventions should appear absurdly clever yet physically plausible
• Examples include radios made from coconuts, power generators made from bamboo and rope, lab equipment built from beach debris

SUBJECT PLACEMENT:
• Subject should appear stranded but resourceful
• Holding, operating, or standing near a Professor-style invention
• Clothing should appear slightly worn, sun-faded, or adapted for island living

ENVIRONMENT (MANDATORY):
• Tropical deserted island setting
• Sandy beaches, palm trees, jungle foliage
• Makeshift huts or shelters
• No modern infrastructure

TONE AND STYLE:
• Lighthearted and adventurous
• Classic television sitcom energy
• Bright natural lighting
• Clean, colorful, retro aesthetic

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a scene from Gilligan’s Island, with the subject convincingly stranded on a tropical island and surrounded by improbably clever, handmade inventions that replace all modern technology.

name: GLASS
message: Take a picture and transform everything into transparent glass. Refraction, reflections, caustic lighting.

name: GLITCH REALITY
message: Take a picture and introduce digital glitches into a realistic scene. Pixel tearing, compression artifacts. Reality appears corrupted.

name: GLOSSARY
message: Take a picture and create an image of a glossary identifying the main subject and a limited number of notable objects. Include the photograph prominently in the layout. Overlay clear letter markers (A, B, C, etc.) directly on or near each identified object in the image. Beneath the photo, create a glossary-style list where each entry begins with the matching letter and provides a brief description blending factual identification and light humor. Keep the layout simple and legible for a small screen. The photograph should clearly correspond to the labeled glossary entries.

name: GOO GOO GAA GAA
message:
Take a picture and place the subject's original face (completely unchanged) onto a baby's body. Keep the subject's exact face - same size, same features, same expression - but attach it to a realistic baby body (approximately 6-12 months old). DO NOT modify the face in any way - do not make it younger, smaller, or more baby-like. The face should remain identical to the original photo. Only the body changes to a baby body. The contrast between the unchanged face and baby body should be humorous and obvious.

BABY SITUATION SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a baby situation, USE THAT BABY SITUATION
• If no baby situation is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE typical baby situation using the RANDOM SEED
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 0,1: SELECT crawling on the floor
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 2,3: SELECT sitting in a high chair making a mess with food
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 4: SELECT being fed with a bottle or spoon
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 5,6: SELECT playing with baby toys
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 7: SELECT lying in a crib
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 8: SELECT wearing a diaper (standing or sitting)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 9: SELECT being held by a parent

The baby body should have proper infant proportions - chubby limbs, small hands and feet, baby fat rolls, appropriate scale. Include realistic details like baby clothes (onesie, diaper), nursery environment, baby gear, and age-appropriate activities. The scene should be photorealistic with soft lighting. The humor comes from seeing the subject's recognizable original face (preserved exactly as it appears in the photo) on a tiny baby body in baby situations.

name: GOOD TO BE THE KING
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a king seated or standing in a position of power.

SUBJECT ROLE (CRITICAL):
• Subject is the unquestioned king
• Regal clothing, crown, throne, or royal posture

FOLLOWER LOGIC:
• If other people are visible in the image:
  – All must be bowing, kneeling, or showing deference to the subject

• If NO other people are visible:
  – Populate the scene with bowing figures using the RANDOM SEED
  – Figures may include animals, people, or fantasy creatures

STYLE:
• Grand, cinematic lighting
• Regal environment (throne room, castle, open field, balcony)
• Subject must remain recognizable

FINAL RESULT:
The image should clearly communicate absolute authority, with all surrounding beings bowing to the subject.

name: GOTH
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into goth subculture style.

GOTH STYLE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a goth style, USE THAT STYLE
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 15:
  - 0: Traditional Goth (1980s) - teased hair, Robert Smith makeup, Siouxsie style, black lace, crosses
  - 1: Romantic Goth - Victorian clothing, corsets, velvet, lace, period costume, elegant dark
  - 2: Cyber Goth - neon dreads, goggles, platform boots, UV reactive, industrial rave
  - 3: Vampire Goth - fangs, pale skin, Victorian vampire aesthetic, dramatic cape, Gothic horror
  - 4: Corporate Goth - office attire in all black, professional but dark, business goth
  - 5: Pastel Goth - pink/purple/mint with black, kawaii meets dark, creepy cute
  - 6: Nu Goth - modern minimalist black, occult symbols, contemporary dark fashion
  - 7: Deathrock - horror punk, skeletal makeup, torn fishnets, Misfits aesthetic
  - 8: Gothic Lolita - Japanese lolita fashion, black Victorian dress, elaborate, princess goth
  - 9: Steampunk Goth - Victorian industrial, goggles, gears, brass, neo-Victorian
  - 10: Bubble Goth - platform shoes, colorful hair with black, club kid meets goth
  - 11: Medieval Goth - Renaissance faire meets goth, medieval clothing, dark ages aesthetic
  - 12: Glam Goth - glitter, makeup dramatic, androgynous, 1970s glam rock meets goth
  - 13: Hippie Goth - flowing black clothes, patchouli, occult jewelry, dark bohemian
  - 14: Mall Goth (2000s) - Hot Topic era, band t-shirts, chains, striped arm warmers, emo influence

SUBJECT TRANSFORMATION:
• Subject in full goth aesthetic for selected style
• Face recognizable but styled dramatically
• Complete goth makeover
• Authentic to subculture
• Not costume - lifestyle fashion

MAKEUP & FACE (CRITICAL):
• Pale foundation or powder (ghostly white skin)
• Heavy black eyeliner (thick, dramatic, winged)
• Dark eyeshadow (black, purple, deep red)
• Black lipstick OR deep purple/burgundy/blood red
• Contoured cheekbones (dramatic)
• White face powder (porcelain skin)
• Smokey eyes intense
• Eyebrows dark and defined
• Optional: Drawn-on beauty marks, occult symbols

HAIR:
• Black hair (dyed jet black) OR
• Unnatural colors (deep red, purple, blue, white)
• Styles:
  - Teased and backcombed (traditional)
  - Long and straight (romantic)
  - Colored synthetic dreads (cyber)
  - Victorian updos (romantic/vampire)
  - Asymmetrical cuts (nu goth)
  - Elaborate styling with accessories
• Hair accessories: Flowers, bows, clips, headbands (all black or dark)

CLOTHING (Style-specific):

**Traditional Goth:**
• Black lace, fishnet, leather
• Band t-shirts (Bauhaus, Sisters of Mercy, The Cure)
• Ripped fishnets and tights
• Leather jackets with studs
• Pointy boots (winklepickers)

**Romantic Goth:**
• Victorian corsets and bustiers
• Velvet dresses and capes
• Lace gloves and parasols
• Long flowing skirts
• Cameo jewelry

**Cyber Goth:**
• Neon synthetic dreads
• Platform boots (massive)
• PVC and reflective materials
• UV reactive clothing
• Goggles and gas masks
• Industrial straps and buckles

**Vampire Goth:**
• Dramatic capes
• Victorian clothing
• Fangs visible
• Blood-red accents
• Gothic horror aesthetic

**Pastel Goth:**
• Pink, purple, mint, lavender WITH black
• Creepy cute graphics (skulls with bows)
• Platform shoes
• Kawaii accessories
• Inverted cross jewelry

**Nu Goth:**
• Minimalist all-black
• Occult symbols (pentagram, moon phases)
• Clean lines, modern cut
• Grunge influence
• Chokers and body harnesses

**Deathrock:**
• Torn clothing
• Skeletal face paint
• Spiky hair
• Horror imagery
• Punk meets goth

**Gothic Lolita:**
• Elaborate black dresses
• Petticoats and bloomers
• Mary Jane shoes
• Bows and ribbons (black)
• Victorian doll aesthetic

**Mall Goth:**
• Band t-shirts and hoodies
• Striped arm warmers
• Skinny jeans (black)
• Studded belts
• Converse or Vans
• Chain wallet

ACCESSORIES:
• Chokers (velvet, spiked, lace)
• Silver jewelry (crosses, pentacles, ankhs, bats)
• Rings (multiple, ornate)
• Belts (studded, chains)
• Bags (coffin-shaped, bat-shaped)
• Parasols or umbrellas (black)
• Gloves (lace, fishnet, leather)
• Collar necklaces
• Occult symbols

FOOTWEAR:
• Platform boots (Doc Martens, New Rocks)
• Pointed boots (winklepickers)
• Victorian boots (lace-up)
• Creepers
• Combat boots
• Mary Janes (for lolita)
• All black

COLOR PALETTE:
• Primarily BLACK
• Accents: Deep red, purple, burgundy, dark blue
• White or pale for contrast
• Silver jewelry (not gold)
• Dark jewel tones
• Pastels ONLY for pastel goth
• Neon ONLY for cyber goth

BODY MODIFICATIONS:
• Piercings (nose, lip, eyebrow, multiple ear)
• Tattoos (occult, bats, roses, skulls)
• Stretched ears (gauges)
• Black nail polish (long nails)

POSE & EXPRESSION:
• Serious, brooding expression
• Dramatic pose
• Melancholic or mysterious
• Arms crossed or hands posed artistically
• Not smiling (unless ironic)
• Intense gaze
• Theatrical energy

SETTING:
• Gothic architecture (cemetery, cathedral, old building)
• Dark room with candles
• Abandoned location
• Goth club or venue
• Victorian interior
• Graveyard (tasteful, not disrespectful)
• Dark forest
• Urban decay

LIGHTING:
• Low-key, dramatic lighting
• Candlelight
• Moonlight
• High contrast (dark shadows)
• Moody atmosphere
• Purple or blue lighting (clubs)
• Minimal lighting for mystery

ATMOSPHERE:
• Dark, mysterious, romantic
• Melancholic beauty
• Gothic aesthetic throughout
• Death-positive culture
• Victorian mourning influence
• Dark romanticism
• Subcultural authenticity

SYMBOLS & IMAGERY:
• Crosses (inverted or traditional)
• Pentagrams, occult symbols
• Bats, ravens, crows
• Skulls and bones
• Roses (black or red)
• Moon phases
• Ankhs
• Spiders and webs
• Coffins

MUSIC/CULTURAL REFERENCES:
• Band imagery (The Cure, Bauhaus, Siouxsie, etc.)
• Gothic literature references
• Horror movie aesthetic
• Victorian mourning culture
• Occult and witchcraft themes

STYLE:
• Photorealistic goth fashion photography
• Editorial goth magazine quality
• Subculture authenticity
• Not Halloween costume - real lifestyle
• Professional alternative fashion

NOT ALLOWED:
• Generic Halloween witch costume
• Cheap spirit store goth
• Cartoonish exaggeration
• Disrespectful cemetery behavior
• Cultural appropriation of death customs

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject transformed into authentic goth subculture style in the selected variation - with dramatic pale makeup, dark clothing, silver jewelry, black or dyed hair, and moody atmospheric setting - appearing as a genuine member of the goth subculture with professional alternative fashion photography quality, culturally authentic details, and that distinctive dark romantic aesthetic that defines goth culture.

name: GOTHIC MEDIEVAL ART
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a Gothic medieval-style artwork. Render the subject with elongated, dramatic proportions, stylized drapery, intricate patterns, and muted, earthy colors typical of 12th–15th century Gothic art. Include characteristic elements such as pointed arches, cathedral-like backgrounds, stained glass windows, ornate borders, and symbolic motifs.

Use flat or slightly sculptural lighting with subtle gold leaf accents, emphasizing solemnity and reverence. Preserve the subject’s facial features and expression while adapting them to the medieval aesthetic.

Include a simple decorative frame, text banners, or illuminated manuscript-style captions if relevant, ensuring all elements are fully visible in the final composition. The final image should feel like a historical Gothic painting, dramatic and atmospheric, clearly readable on small screens, and fully contained within the frame.

name: GOUACHE ILLUSTRATION
message: Take a picture and transform the image into a gouache illustration. Matte textures, bold shapes, opaque color layers, and crisp edges while preserving subject identity.

name: GRAFFITI
message: Take a picture in the style of Graffiti Art. Spray paint textures, urban wall surface.

name: GRAHAM NORTON SHOW
message:
Take a picture and place the subject as a guest on The Graham Norton Show. The subject maintains realistic proportions and identity.

SHOW SEGMENT SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• SELECT EXACTLY ONE option using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Do NOT choose based on popularity, visual interest, or defaults

For 2 options (50/50 split):
• If LAST DIGIT is EVEN (0,2,4,6,8): SELECT The Red Couch - The subject is seated on the iconic red couch on the right side of the set in a brightly lit TV studio. Graham Norton (the host) is positioned to the left. The set features glossy floors, colorful lighting, vibrant backdrop, and talk-show camera framing. The subject looks mid-conversation or reacting to a joke, possibly alongside other celebrity guests on the couch.
• If LAST DIGIT is ODD (1,3,5,7,9): SELECT The Big Red Chair - The subject is seated confidently or nervously on the red chair in front of the studio audience, with another person reaching for the lever about to flip it. Studio lighting, audience seating visible behind, dramatic tension, and TV broadcast realism. The subject remains the clear focal point.

Apply the selected segment's environment, lighting, and staging details while maintaining the subject's identity and realistic appearance.

name: GRANDMA
message:
Take a picture and dress the subject in a stereotypical elderly grandmother costume regardless of their actual age or gender.

GRANDMA SCENARIO SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a specific grandma scenario, USE THAT SCENARIO
• If no scenario is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE scenario using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST DIGIT of the RANDOM SEED modulo 7:
  - 0: Baking Grandma (kitchen setting, apron with flour, wooden spoon/rolling pin, cookies/pie nearby, warm loving)
  - 1: Knitting Grandma (armchair, knitting needles/yarn, half-finished scarf, reading glasses, concentrated peaceful)
  - 2: Rocking Chair (classic wooden rocker, knitting or reading, cat on lap optional, doily on arm, content)
  - 3: Scolding/Finger Wagging (pointing finger mock scolding, stern but loving, kitchen/living room, playful disapproval)
  - 4: Offering Candy (holding hard candies/butterscotch, reaching in purse, sweet giving, "have candy dear" energy)
  - 5: Sleeping in Chair (dozed off in armchair, glasses slipped down, knitting/book in lap, peaceful sleeping)
  - 6: Greeting Arms Open (arms open for hug, biggest grandma smile, excited loving, "come give grandma hug!")

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• Subject dressed in classic 'grandma' costume
• Works on any age, any gender - everyone becomes grandma
• Comical, affectionate transformation
• Subject's face UNCHANGED - just costume and props
• NO AGING - subject looks like themselves in grandma costume
• Warm, humorous, loving grandmother energy

IDENTITY RULES (CRITICAL):
• Subject's face COMPLETELY UNCHANGED
• NO wrinkles, NO age lines, NO aging effects
• Subject's natural age and appearance preserved
• Only costume, wig, and props added
• Face looks exactly like subject normally does
• This is COSTUME DRESS-UP, not transformation

GRANDMA COSTUME ELEMENTS:

HAIR (WIG - not real hair):
• Grey or white wig clearly visible as costume piece
• Hair in curlers/rollers (pink or pastel foam rollers), OR
• Tightly permed grey wig (poodle perm), OR
• Grey hair in neat bun with hairnet, OR
• Short, curly grey wash-and-set style
• Obviously a wig, costume quality

CLOTHING:
• Muumuu/moomoo (loose, colorful housedress)
  - Floral print patterns
  - Bright but dated colors
  - Loose, comfortable fit
  - Ankle-length or calf-length
• OR: Cardigan sweater over floral dress
  - Buttoned all the way up
  - Pastel colors
  - Slightly oversized
• House slippers or sensible shoes
• Possibly apron over dress
• Comfortable, modest, dated styling

ACCESSORIES:
• Large eyeglasses (cat-eye or oversized frames)
  - Hanging on chain around neck, OR
  - Perched on nose for reading
• Pearl necklace or simple jewelry
• Knitting needles and yarn
• Purse (old-fashioned, practical)
• Tissues tucked in sleeve or pocket
• Reading glasses on chain
• Wedding ring

SETTING:
• Cozy home interior
• Dated but clean 1970s-1990s decor
• Floral wallpaper or wood paneling
• Comfortable furniture
• Doilies and antimacassars
• Family photos on walls
• Warm, lived-in feeling
• Kitchen with vintage appliances

FURNITURE AND PROPS:
• Overstuffed armchair with doilies
• Rocking chair
• TV with doily on top
• Landline telephone (rotary or push-button)
• Cookie jar
• Knitting basket
• Reading glasses and magnifying glass
• Old-fashioned lamps
• Floral throw pillows

LIGHTING:
• Warm, soft interior lighting
• Cozy home atmosphere
• Natural window light
• Table lamps with fabric shades
• Comfortable, inviting glow
• Nostalgic, warm tone

COLOR PALETTE:
• Soft pastels and florals
• Warm earth tones
• Dated but cheerful colors
• Mint green, dusty rose, lavender
• Cream and beige
• Floral patterns everywhere
• Comfortable, homey palette

EXPRESSION AND DEMEANOR:
• Subject's natural face and expression
• Acting/playing the grandma role
• Sweet, loving grandma character
• Subject clearly in costume (not aged)
• Playing dress-up energy
• Fun, humorous approach

CAMERA:
• Warm, intimate framing
• Medium shot or environmental portrait
• Cozy, inviting composition
• Subject clearly visible in costume
• Home photography quality
• Family photo album aesthetic

OPTIONAL ELEMENTS:
• Cat sleeping nearby
• Fresh baked cookies or pie
• Knitting project in progress
• Old photo albums
• Porcelain figurines in background
• Doilies on every surface
• Hard candies in glass dish
• Recipe box
• Vintage calendar on wall

RESTRICTIONS:
• NO aging the subject's face
• NO wrinkles or age effects
• Subject must look their normal age in costume
• This is COSTUME ONLY transformation
• No mockery - affectionate costume only
• Subject must remain recognizable at normal age
• Photorealistic costume, not makeup transformation
• No text overlays or captions
• Keep it warm and loving, not creepy

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject (at their natural age, regardless of actual age or gender) dressed in a sweet stereotypical grandmother COSTUME with wig, curlers, comfortable clothing, and props. The subject's face remains COMPLETELY UNCHANGED - they look like themselves wearing a grandma costume for fun. The result should feel affectionate and humorous — like someone dressed up as everyone's favorite grandma for a costume party.

name: GRAVITY FALLS
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a mysterious cartoon world inspired by Gravity Falls.

STYLE & CHARACTER RULES:
• Clean linework with slightly angular proportions
• Muted but warm color palette
• Expressive faces with grounded cartoon realism
• Include eccentric townsfolk or supernatural creatures

SCENE & TONE:
• Small-town mystery and paranormal weirdness
• Forests, cabins, roadside attractions, or strange landmarks
• Subtle humor mixed with intrigue

The final image should look like a fully composed Gravity Falls–style hand-drawn illustration with the subject and additional characters integrated seamlessly into the world.

name: GREEK/ROMAN GOD
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a Greek or Roman god/goddess with divine attributes and mythological setting.

DEITY SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a deity, USE THAT DEITY
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 20:
  - 0: Zeus/Jupiter (King of Gods - lightning bolt, eagle, oak tree, throne on Mount Olympus, regal beard, commanding presence)
  - 1: Hera/Juno (Queen of Gods - peacock, crown, scepter, marriage veil, regal gown, jealous beauty)
  - 2: Poseidon/Neptune (God of Sea - trident, dolphin, horse, ocean waves, beard dripping water, commanding seas)
  - 3: Hades/Pluto (God of Underworld - Cerberus three-headed dog, helm of darkness, throne of bones, riches, pomegranate)
  - 4: Athena/Minerva (Goddess of Wisdom - owl, olive branch, Aegis shield, spear, helmet, strategic battle armor)
  - 5: Apollo (God of Sun/Music - lyre, sun chariot, laurel wreath, bow and arrow, golden radiance, youthful beauty)
  - 6: Artemis/Diana (Goddess of Hunt - bow and arrows, deer, moon, hunting dogs, virgin huntress attire)
  - 7: Ares/Mars (God of War - bloodied armor, spear and shield, war helmet, battlefield, aggressive violent energy)
  - 8: Aphrodite/Venus (Goddess of Love - seashell, doves, roses, mirror, beautiful flowing gown, irresistible beauty)
  - 9: Hephaestus/Vulcan (God of Forge - hammer and anvil, fire, metalwork, mechanical creations, soot-covered)
  - 10: Hermes/Mercury (Messenger God - winged sandals, caduceus staff, winged helmet, traveler's cloak, swift motion)
  - 11: Demeter/Ceres (Goddess of Harvest - wheat sheaves, cornucopia, poppies, torch, nurturing earth mother)
  - 12: Dionysus/Bacchus (God of Wine - grapevines, wine cup, ivy crown, leopard, festive revelry, intoxicated joy)
  - 13: Persephone/Proserpina (Queen of Underworld - pomegranate, spring flowers, dual crown, transitional between worlds)
  - 14: Hestia/Vesta (Goddess of Hearth - sacred flame, home altar, modest veil, domestic warmth)
  - 15: Nike/Victoria (Goddess of Victory - wings, laurel wreath, palm branch, athletic triumph)
  - 16: Eros/Cupid (God of Love - bow and arrow, wings, cherubic or youthful beauty, causing love)
  - 17: Pan/Faunus (God of Wild - goat legs, pan flute, forest setting, horns, wild untamed nature)
  - 18: Helios/Sol (God of Sun - sun chariot with horses, radiant crown, golden brilliance)
  - 19: Selene/Luna (Goddess of Moon - moon crown, lunar chariot, silver glow, night sky)

TRANSFORM THE SUBJECT:
• Divine idealized beauty appropriate to the deity
• Deity's signature attributes/symbols held or nearby
• Clothing in flowing Greek/Roman style (chiton, himation, toga)
• Godly aura, glow, or supernatural element
• Face remains recognizable but enhanced with divine perfection

SETTING:
• Mount Olympus, temple, or domain appropriate to deity
• Classical Greek/Roman architecture
• Mythological creatures or symbols
• Epic scale suggesting godly power
• Dramatic divine lighting (golden, silver, ethereal)

STYLE:
• Classical sculpture aesthetic or Renaissance painting style
• Photorealistic but idealized
• Epic, dramatic, divine presence
• Marble columns, clouds, celestial background

FINAL RESULT:
The image should depict the subject as the living embodiment of the selected Greek/Roman deity, with all their iconic symbols and divine attributes, in a mythological setting that captures their godly domain and power.

name: GRIMMS FAIRY TALE
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a character within a Grimm’s fairy tale. Select a fairy tale based on the subject’s appearance, posture, expression, or perceived traits (such as innocence, cleverness, arrogance, bravery, curiosity), OR use a specific fairy tale provided via external master prompt.

Depict the subject as a story character fully integrated into a classic Grimm-style fairy tale scene, not as a modern person placed into an illustration. The subject may appear as a human, villager, traveler, child, noble, or fairy-tale creature as appropriate to the chosen story. The environment and supporting elements should clearly reflect a traditional fairy tale setting such as forests, cottages, castles, roads, or village scenes.

Render the image as a single illustrated storybook page. Ensure the entire page is fully visible within the frame, including margins, illustration, and text area. Do not crop or cut off any part of the page.

Include the **title of the selected fairy tale** prominently and clearly within the page layout, such as at the top of the page or as a decorative storybook heading. The title must be fully visible and immediately identifiable to the viewer.

Include a short fairy-tale caption or lesson within the page, such as a brief story excerpt, warning, or thematic line appropriate to Grimm’s fairy tales. The text should be legible, concise, and directly connected to the scene.

Use a traditional fairy-tale illustration style inspired by 18th–19th century book engravings or painted storybook art. The tone may be whimsical, eerie, or cautionary, but not graphic. Keep the composition symbolic, atmospheric, and clearly readable on a small screen. The final image should feel like a complete, intact page from a Grimm’s fairy tale book.

name: GUMBY
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into the visual style of classic Gumby stop-motion animation.

STYLE & MATERIAL (CRITICAL):
• Soft clay construction with simple, flat shapes
• Minimal detail — iconic, abstracted forms
• Smooth but visibly molded clay texture

FACIAL & BODY DESIGN:
• Preserve the subject’s recognizable face but simplify heavily
• Small dot eyes or simple sculpted eyes
• Minimal mouth or expression
• Limbs should appear bendable and rubbery

POSE & SCALE:
• Subject should look like a flexible clay figure
• Poses may be awkward, bent, or gravity-defying

COLOR & LIGHTING:
• Bright, flat colors
• Even, simple lighting
• Retro television look

ENVIRONMENT:
• Stylized clay environments — flat ground, abstract landscapes, simple props
• Everything must appear clay-built

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must look like a frame from a classic Gumby episode — playful, abstract, and unmistakably retro clay animation.

name: GUM-ME
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a giant edible gummy candy version of themselves, as if a candy company manufactured a gummy modeled after the subject.

CORE CONCEPT (NON-NEGOTIABLE):
• The subject is entirely made of gummy candy
• This is NOT a costume, NOT body paint, NOT partial candy overlay
• The subject must look edible, translucent, glossy, and chewy

MATERIAL TRANSFORMATION RULES (CRITICAL):
• Skin: translucent gummy texture with internal light diffusion
• Hair: made entirely from gummy worms, sour strings, or twisted gummy ropes
• Eyes: clear gummy domes or jelly-like candy eyes (still expressive)
• Teeth: white gummy or marshmallow candy texture
• Clothing (if present): formed from layered gummies, fruit slices, or molded candy shapes
• Accessories: rendered as candy equivalents only

IDENTITY PRESERVATION:
• Facial structure, proportions, and expression must remain clearly recognizable
• No generic gummy humanoids
• No simplification of facial features
• The subject must still look unmistakably like themselves

ANTI-LAZINESS RULES:
• NO real skin visible anywhere
• NO realistic hair mixed with candy
• NO smooth plastic or wax textures
• NO partial transformations
• Every visible surface must be candy-based

LIGHTING & REALISM:
• Studio-style lighting emphasizing translucency and gloss
• Subsurface scattering visible through the gummy material
• Sticky reflections and soft highlights
• Slight imperfections like bubbles or sugar granules

POSE & PRESENTATION:
• Subject posed like a product reveal or character portrait
• Neutral or playful expression
• Clean background or candy-factory-style environment

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a hyper-realistic photograph of a life-sized gummy candy sculpture manufactured to resemble the subject exactly — fully edible, glossy, translucent, and unmistakably made of gummies.

name: GYMNAST
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform them into a gymnast performing physically impossible or extreme gymnastics feats.

The subject should be dressed in realistic gymnastics attire such as leotards, unitards, or competition uniforms.

Poses may include:
• Impossible flexibility and contortions
• Gravity-defying flips, spins, or aerial twists
• Anatomically absurd balances and holds
• Frozen mid-action to capture the peak of motion

Lighting, environment, and perspective should resemble a real gymnasium, competition arena, or performance space.

Anatomy, muscle definition, and limb placement must appear realistic even while achieving impossible poses.

The final image should look dramatic, athletic, absurdly impressive, and visually convincing, like a photograph capturing a once-in-a-lifetime extreme gymnastics moment.

name: H. P. LOVECRAFT
message:
Take a picture and place the subject into a dark, cosmic-horror world inspired by H. P. Lovecraft.

The subject should appear small or vulnerable within a vast, eerie environment filled with ancient ruins, strange symbols, impossible architecture, and unknowable cosmic forces.

Subtle tentacles, eldritch shapes, or alien geometries may appear in the background, but do not overwhelm the subject.

The mood should feel ominous, mysterious, and otherworldly rather than gory.

name: HAIKU
message: Take a picture and create a serene, minimalist scene inspired by classical Japanese aesthetics in the spirit of Matsuo Bashō. Emphasize simplicity, natural elements, quiet atmosphere, and contemplative mood. Use flavor text drawn from the subject’s presence, expression, and surroundings to compose a traditional haiku. Display the complete haiku fully and clearly within the image, ensuring all lines are legible and unobstructed. Integrate the text harmoniously into the scene, such as on parchment, a wooden plaque, or subtle calligraphy-style overlay. Render the final image with refined detail, soft lighting, and a calm, poetic visual balance.

name: HAIR COLOR TRY-ON
message:
Take a picture of the subject and generate a 2×2 square grid showing four different hair colors applied to the same person. The face, hairstyle, lighting, and background must remain identical in all four panels — only the hair color changes.

Use realistic hair coloring with natural highlights, shadows, and root blending. Avoid flat or painted-on color.

Select four distinct colors (such as blonde, brunette, black, red, fantasy colors, etc.), chosen to complement the subject’s skin tone.

If external master prompt text is provided (such as decade, fashion style, fantasy theme, or celebrity), apply it to the color choices.

The result should look like a professional salon color preview.

name: HAIRCUT REVEAL
message: Take a picture capturing the exact moment the subject sees their terrible new haircut in the mirror for the first time. Show their face frozen in horror, shock, or trying to hide devastation while the hairdresser beams proudly in the background holding scissors and mirror. The haircut should be objectively bad - uneven, way too short, bizarre style they didn't ask for, or drastically different from what they wanted. Include salon setting with styling chair, cape still on, hair clippings on floor. Other stylists in background trying not to stare. Show the contrast between the hairdresser's proud smile ('I did such a good job!') and the subject's internal screaming visible on their face. Maybe include a 'before' photo visible showing what they asked for versus this disaster. Add salon mirrors reflecting the damage from multiple angles. The subject might be forcing a smile while dying inside. Capture that universal experience of getting a bad haircut and having to pretend you like it. Make it look like that awful moment of truth in the salon chair.

name: HAIRSTYLE TRY-ON
message:
Take a picture of the subject and generate a 2×2 square grid showing four different realistic hairstyles on the same person. The subject’s face, lighting, pose, and background must remain identical in all four panels — only the hairstyle changes.

Each panel should feature a distinct hairstyle (for example: short, long, curly, straight, layered, undercut, etc.), chosen to suit the subject’s face shape and hairline.

Use high-quality, photorealistic hair rendering with correct lighting, shadows, and blending so the hair looks naturally attached to the subject’s scalp.

If external master prompt text is provided (such as era, fashion decade, celebrity inspiration, or theme), apply it consistently across all four hairstyles.

The final output must be a clean square grid with thin borders separating each option, designed to look like a professional virtual makeover preview.

name: HAIRSTYLE TRY-ON (FUNNY)
message:
Take a picture of the subject and generate a 2×2 grid showing four wildly different, funny, or exaggerated hairstyles on the same person. Keep the face and pose identical in all panels.

Include ridiculous, over-the-top, or unexpected styles (for example: disco afro, medieval wig, anime hair, mullet, punk spikes, powdered wig, etc.).

The hair should still be well-rendered and attached realistically, even when silly.

If external master prompt text is provided (like era or theme), exaggerate it humorously.

The final result should feel like a comedy makeover show.

name: HAITIAN NAÏVE ART
message: Take a picture and transform the image into Haitian naïve style art. Bright colors, flattened depth, decorative storytelling elements, and joyful visual rhythm.

name: HANNA-BARBERA
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a classic Hanna-Barbera cartoon character rendered in authentic 1960s–1970s Hanna-Barbera animation style. Use bold black outlines, flat cel-shaded colors, limited animation aesthetics, simple geometric forms, and minimal shading. The subject should be fully redrawn to match the Hanna-Barbera look, not pasted or modernized.

FRANCHISE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a Hanna-Barbera franchise, USE THAT HANNA-BARBERA FRANCHISE
• If no Hanna-Barbera franchise is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE iconic Hanna-Barbera franchise using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST TWO DIGITS of the RANDOM SEED modulo 11:
  - 0: The Flintstones (prehistoric Bedrock, stone houses, foot-powered cars)
  - 1: The Jetsons (futuristic apartment, floating city, conveyor walkways)
  - 2: Yogi Bear (Jellystone Park with picnic tables and ranger elements)
  - 3: Super Friends (Hall of Justice with heroic poses)
  - 4: Wacky Races (exaggerated race vehicles and chaotic motion)
  - 5: Hong Kong Phooey (janitor's closet transforming into hero scene)
  - 6: Josie and the Pussycats (live band performance on stage)
  - 7: Captain Caveman (cave interiors and club-based antics)
  - 8: Johnny Quest (adventure or science-lab environments)
  - 9: Space Ghost (retro space settings or villain confrontations)
  - 10: Fat Albert and the Cosby Kids (urban neighborhood streets, junkyard clubhouses, schoolyards, stoops, or classrooms with warm, grounded slice-of-life tone)

Integrate the subject naturally into the chosen cartoon world as if they are a regular character in that series. The subject's clothing, posture, and expression should adapt to the selected franchise's style.

Use era-accurate Hanna-Barbera background techniques such as painted cel backgrounds, stylized repeating scenery, retro props, and limited-animation staging. Color palette and line thickness should match the chosen franchise's specific visual identity.

The final image should feel like a freeze-frame from an authentic Hanna-Barbera TV episode, nostalgic, playful, and clearly readable on a small screen.

name: HANS CHRISTIAN ANDERSEN
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a character within a Hans Christian Andersen fairy tale. Select a tale based on the subject’s appearance, posture, expression, or perceived traits (such as innocence, longing, pride, loneliness, hope, sacrifice, or wonder), OR use a specific Andersen tale provided via external master prompt.

Depict the subject as a story character fully integrated into a classic Andersen-style fairy tale scene, not as a modern person placed into an illustration. The subject may appear as a human, child, mermaid, toy, animal, noble, or symbolic figure depending on the chosen tale. The environment should reflect romantic, storybook settings such as seaside villages, snowy streets, royal halls, moonlit gardens, or candlelit interiors.

Render the image as a single illustrated storybook page. Ensure the entire page is fully visible within the frame, including margins, illustration, and text area. Do not crop or cut off any part of the page.

Include the title of the fairy tale clearly displayed on the page (for example: 'The Little Mermaid,' 'The Ugly Duckling,' 'The Emperor’s New Clothes,' 'The Snow Queen,' or 'The Princess and the Pea'). The title must be legible and visually distinct so the viewer immediately recognizes the story.

Include a short poetic line, lesson, or emotional reflection appropriate to Hans Christian Andersen’s style. This may express a moral, irony, or bittersweet truth rather than a direct lesson. The text should be concise, legible, and emotionally connected to the scene.

Use a classic 19th-century storybook illustration style inspired by delicate engravings, soft watercolor washes, or romantic ink drawings. The tone should feel whimsical, emotional, and slightly melancholic rather than comedic or dark. Keep the composition symbolic, gentle, and clearly readable on a small screen. The final image should feel like a complete, intact page from a Hans Christian Andersen fairy tale book.

name: HAPPY HOLIDAYS
message: Take a picture and place the subject in a festive holiday-themed scene based on the closest holiday to the current date. Dress the subject in holiday-appropriate attire: for Christmas, an ugly Christmas sweater; Halloween, a generic costume; 4th of July, an Uncle Sam outfit; Oktoberfest, lederhosen; Thanksgiving, a Pilgrim outfit; Easter, a bunny outfit; New Year’s, a baby’s diaper or Father Time clothing with hourglass; Valentine’s Day, a Cupid outfit with bow and heart arrow; St. Patrick’s Day, a Leprechaun outfit; Cinco de Mayo, a Mexican sombrero. Integrate the subject naturally into a scene reflecting the holiday’s environment, decorations, and mood. Generate a humorous or festive holiday message caption based on the chosen holiday. Preserve facial identity, proportions, and personality while making the scene photorealistic, vibrant, and lively.

name: HAPPY MEAL PROMO
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a featured kids’ fast-food meal toy promotion inspired by classic Happy Meal–style campaigns.

Present the subject as a small, inexpensive plastic toy figure with simplified proportions, glossy molded surfaces, visible seams, and limited articulation. The figure should clearly look like a real mass-produced kids’ meal toy — slightly stiff, charmingly cheap, and intentionally basic — not a cartoon illustration or realistic figurine.

The image MUST include a fully visible kids’ meal box in the frame. The box should be front-facing and unmistakable, with recognizable fast-food kids’ meal proportions (folded cardboard box with handle or clamshell shape). The toy should appear either:
• displayed in front of the box, or
• pictured on the box artwork itself, or
• shown as part of a promotional display alongside the box

Design the scene as a complete toy promotion image with everything fully visible and uncropped. Include:
• the kids’ meal box with bold colors and playful graphics
• a toy name or toy series title inspired by the subject
• an overly enthusiastic promotional phrase (e.g., "Only in Kids’ Meals!", "Fun Inside!", "Playtime Included!")
• optional callouts like "Collect Them All!" or "Limited Time"

The toy’s pose, accessories, or expression should be humorously derived from the subject’s real traits, clothing, posture, or environment.

Avoid using real fast-food brand logos unless explicitly provided via external master prompt. Instead, evoke a generic fast-food kids’ meal aesthetic through color, layout, typography, and packaging style.

Ensure the entire kids’ meal box, toy, and promotional elements are fully visible and readable on a small screen. The final image should feel nostalgic, playful, slightly tacky, and instantly recognizable as a classic kids’ fast-food toy promotion from the 1990s–2000s.

name: HAUNTED EPITAPH
message: Take a picture and transform it into a playful, haunted graveyard scene inspired by classic theme-park haunted mansion aesthetics. Depict the subject as a stylized carved portrait, bust, or ghostly cameo associated with a decorative tombstone or memorial plaque, without implying real death. Create a humorous rhyming epitaph in the spirit of whimsical haunted mansion gravestones, using clever wordplay and flavor text inspired by the subject’s appearance, personality, clothing, or surroundings. Ensure the full rhyming epitaph is clearly visible and readable within the image. Use atmospheric lighting, fog, moonlight, and ornate stonework to create a spooky-but-fun tone. Keep the overall mood lighthearted, imaginative, and theatrical rather than dark or morbid.  The result should be a full view of the epitaph with a relevant background behind the epitaph.

name: HEADLESS
message:
Take a picture and create the illusion that the subject is headless and holding their own severed head — presented clearly as a theatrical magic effect, not an injury.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• This is a classic stage illusion or visual trick
• The subject's body appears HEADLESS - there is NO HEAD on the shoulders
• The subject is holding their own head in their hands
• NO violence, NO injury, NO harm - this is theatrical magic
• The effect must feel playful, clever, and impossible

BODY PRESENTATION (CRITICAL - HIGHEST PRIORITY):
• The subject's body must be COMPLETELY HEADLESS
• There must be NO HEAD attached to the neck/shoulders
• The body stands upright without a head on top
• DO NOT show the subject with their head still attached
• DO NOT show a full complete person holding an extra head
• The body must appear to be missing its head entirely

HEAD BEING HELD (CRITICAL):
• The subject is holding their own severed head in their hands
• The held head is positioned at waist or chest height
• The held head appears calm, neutral, or mildly amused
• The head being held is the ONLY head visible in the image
• No blood, no wounds, no exposed anatomy on the held head

NECK AREA TREATMENT (CRITICAL):
• Where the head should be (top of shoulders/neck) must be cleanly obscured
• Use theatrical methods to hide the neck opening:
  – High collar that covers where neck meets shoulders
  – Draped fabric, cloak, or scarf covering the shoulder/neck area
  – Shadow or darkness obscuring the top of the torso
  – Costume neckline that conceals the separation point
• The concealment must look intentional and theatrical
