Replace the animal's entire head with the subject's full human head — not just the face. The human head must be fully three-dimensional, volumetric, and anatomically attached to the animal's neck as if it naturally grew there.

The subject's human head must:
• Replace the animal's head entirely
• Be correctly scaled to the animal's body
• Connect seamlessly at the neck with realistic anatomy, skin transitions, fur/feather blending, and shadowing
• Match the animal's head orientation, posture, and perspective

DO NOT:
• Paste, overlay, mask, or superimpose a photo
• Leave any part of the animal's original head visible
• Place a human face on top of an animal face
• Create a collage or cutout effect

Optional animal features (ears, horns, wool, feathers) may appear BEHIND or AROUND the human head if anatomically plausible, but the animal's face itself must be entirely gone.

The creature should be performing a normal farm activity (grazing, standing in a stall, pecking the ground, chewing cud, waddling, etc.) in a realistic farm environment such as a pasture, barn, coop, or muddy yard.

Lighting must be natural and consistent across the entire body and head.

The final result must look like a real photograph of a farm animal that somehow biologically evolved with a human head instead of an animal head — disturbing, absurd, and realistic, not edited or pasted.

name: OLYMPIAN
message:
Take a picture and place the subject on the Olympic medal podium celebrating a victory.

OLYMPIC SPORT SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a sport, USE THAT SPORT
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 30:
  - 0: Track and Field (100m sprint) - running uniform, spikes, bib number, lean athletic build
  - 1: Swimming - swimsuit, goggles around neck, swim cap, wet hair, chlorine smell suggested
  - 2: Gymnastics - leotard (women) or tank and shorts (men), barefoot, athletic tape, chalk dust
  - 3: Figure Skating - elaborate costume with sequins, ice skates, graceful pose
  - 4: Skiing (Downhill) - ski suit, goggles on head, helmet, speed skiing gear
  - 5: Basketball - team jersey and shorts, sneakers, tall athletic build
  - 6: Soccer/Football - national team kit, cleats, shin guards visible, soccer ball nearby
  - 7: Volleyball (Beach) - bikini (women) or shorts (men), sandy, sunglasses, tanned
  - 8: Diving - tight diving suit, body still wet, streamlined athletic physique
  - 9: Boxing - boxing shorts, gloves, hand wraps, protective headgear, muscular
  - 10: Wrestling - singlet, wrestling shoes, headgear, compact muscular build
  - 11: Weightlifting - singlet, weightlifting shoes, chalk on hands, powerful build
  - 12: Judo - white or blue judogi, black belt, barefoot, martial arts build
  - 13: Fencing - white fencing uniform, mask held under arm, épée/foil/sabre
  - 14: Rowing - rowing suit, oar held, muscular back and shoulders
  - 15: Cycling - aerodynamic cycling suit, helmet, cleated cycling shoes
  - 16: Tennis - tennis outfit, racket held, wristbands, tennis shoes
  - 17: Archery - archery uniform, bow held, arm guard, finger tab
  - 18: Equestrian - riding outfit, helmet, boots, crop, horse nearby
  - 19: Shooting - shooting jacket, ear protection, precision rifle or pistol
  - 20: Triathlon - tri-suit, transition gear, exhausted but triumphant
  - 21: Marathon - running gear, bib number, exhausted, wrapped in flag or foil blanket
  - 22: Ski Jumping - ski suit, skis, goggles, aerodynamic position suggested
  - 23: Snowboarding - snowboard gear, helmet, goggles, board held
  - 24: Ice Hockey - jersey, hockey pants, skates, helmet with face cage, stick
  - 25: Speed Skating - aerodynamic suit, long blade skates, helmet, streamlined
  - 26: Bobsled - aerodynamic suit, helmet, team sport suggested
  - 27: Sailing - sailing gear, life vest, wetsuit, nautical
  - 28: Rugby - rugby kit, mud suggested, protective mouthguard visible
  - 29: Taekwondo - white dobok, protective gear, black belt, barefoot

PODIUM SETUP (CRITICAL):
• Three-level Olympic podium
• Center position (#1 - Gold) highest
• Left position (#2 - Silver) second highest  
• Right position (#3 - Bronze) third highest
• Subject standing on GOLD MEDAL position (center, highest)
• Olympic rings logo on podium front
• Position numbers visible (1, 2, 3)

SUBJECT PLACEMENT:
• Subject on top/center gold medal position
• Standing tall, proud, emotional
• Holding bouquet of flowers (Olympic tradition)
• Other athletes on silver and bronze positions (visible but background)
• All athletes on podium together
• Award ceremony moment

MEDAL CEREMONY:
• Gold medal around subject's neck
• Medal hanging on ribbon (Olympic colors or host nation)
• Medal clearly visible - large and ornate
• Olympic rings on medal face
• Subject touching or holding medal
• Fresh from award ceremony

EMOTIONAL MOMENT:
• Subject celebrating victory
• Emotional expression (tears of joy, elation, pride)
• Hand over heart during anthem
• Arms raised in victory
• Looking up at flag
• Overwhelmed with emotion
• Peak of athletic career captured

OLYMPIC SETTING:
• Olympic venue appropriate to sport
• Massive crowd in background
• Olympic rings prominently displayed
• Flags of top 3 nations visible
• Olympic branding everywhere
• Host city/year visible (can be generic or specific Games)
• Stadium or venue appropriate to sport

ATHLETIC ATTIRE (Sport-specific):
• Complete uniform for selected sport
• National team colors and flag
• Sponsor logos (Nike, Adidas, etc.)
• Bib number if applicable
• Sport-specific gear and equipment
• Athlete appears as champion of that sport
• Clothing appropriate to just finishing competition

ATHLETIC PHYSIQUE:
• Body type appropriate to sport:
  - Swimmers: Broad shoulders, streamlined
  - Gymnasts: Compact, powerful, flexible
  - Track: Lean, muscular legs
  - Weightlifters: Massive, powerful build
  - Marathon: Very lean, endurance build
• Peak athletic condition
• Sport-specific muscle development

OTHER MEDALISTS:
• Silver medalist on left (viewer's left)
• Bronze medalist on right (viewer's right)
• Both also in their sport attire
• Celebrating but subject is focal point
• Other nations' flags visible
• Sportsmanship and camaraderie

CEREMONY ELEMENTS:
• Flower bouquets for all three medalists
• Olympic mascot plush toys (optional)
• Photographers surrounding podium
• Olympic officials present
• Medal ceremony music suggested
• Flags being raised
• Confetti or celebration in air (optional)

NATIONAL PRIDE:
• Subject wearing or wrapped in national flag
• Flag visible behind podium
• National anthem moment
• Hand over heart
• National colors prominent
• Country pride evident

LIGHTING:
• Bright stadium lighting
• Spotlights on podium
• Flash photography from press
• Dramatic ceremonial lighting
• Subject well-lit and visible

ATMOSPHERE:
• Triumphant and emotional
• Pinnacle of athletic achievement
• Global competition
• Olympic spirit and excellence
• Once-in-a-lifetime moment
• National and personal pride
• Years of training culminating

OLYMPIC BRANDING:
• Olympic rings everywhere
• Host city/year (e.g., "Paris 2024", "LA 2028")
• Olympic motto visible
• Sponsor brands (Coca-Cola, Visa, etc.)
• Official Olympic aesthetic

PHOTOGRAPHY STYLE:
• Professional sports photography
• High-quality press photo
• Could be from actual Olympics
• Sharp focus on subject
• Wide shot showing full podium
• Emotional capture of victory moment

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject standing on the top (gold medal) position of the Olympic podium wearing sport-specific athletic attire for the selected sport, with a gold medal around their neck, holding a bouquet, displaying emotion and pride, with silver and bronze medalists on lower positions beside them, in an Olympic venue with flags, Olympic rings, crowds, and all the ceremonial elements of an Olympic medal ceremony - capturing the pinnacle moment of athletic achievement.

name: ONE SECOND BEFORE DISASTER
message: Take a picture and depict the subject frozen in time exactly one second before a dramatic, chaotic, or humorous event occurs. Capture tension and anticipation in the subject’s pose and expression (for example: a falling object mid-air, a near collision, an imminent spill, or an unexpected surprise). Use cinematic lighting, motion cues, and environmental storytelling to make it obvious that something is about to happen, without actually showing the outcome.

name: ONE SHAPE
message:
Take a picture and reconstruct the entire image using ONLY ONE geometric shape.

SHAPE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a shape, USE THAT SHAPE
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the RANDOM SEED
• Use LAST DIGIT modulo 8:
  - 0: Circles
  - 1: Squares
  - 2: Triangles
  - 3: Rectangles
  - 4: Hexagons
  - 5: Lines
  - 6: Dots
  - 7: Cubes

ABSOLUTE CONSTRAINT:
• EVERY visible element must be composed exclusively of the selected shape
• Subject, background, shadows, highlights — ALL shapes
• NO mixed geometry
• NO hidden curves or blended forms
• NO photographic textures

SUBJECT RECONSTRUCTION:
• Subject must remain recognizable through shape arrangement
• Identity preserved via silhouette, proportions, and pose
• Facial features implied through density, spacing, or scale of shapes
• Clothing suggested through patterning and clustering

SHAPE BEHAVIOR:
• Shapes may vary in size, rotation, opacity, and density
• Overlapping allowed ONLY if shape integrity remains clear
• Shapes may be stacked, tiled, or layered
• No shape deformation outside its geometric definition

DEPTH & LIGHTING:
• Depth created via scale, spacing, and opacity
• Lighting implied through shape density
• Shadows formed using the same shape
• No gradients unless formed by repeated shapes

BACKGROUND:
• Background must also obey the one-shape rule
• Negative space allowed
• Clean composition preferred

STYLE:
• Abstract but intentional
• Mathematical and structured
• Visually striking and disciplined
• Modern art or generative design aesthetic

NOT ALLOWED:
• Mixed shapes
• Raster photo textures
• Painted strokes
• Organic curves (unless shape is circle)
• Cheating via blur or noise

FINAL RESULT:
The image should appear as a fully reconstructed version of the original scene made entirely from a single geometric shape selected by the random seed, with the subject clearly recognizable through disciplined shape placement, scale, and density — a strict, rule-driven abstraction that feels deliberate, intelligent, and visually coherent.

name: ONLINE LISTING
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a realistic online product listing, as if the subject themselves are being sold on a major e-commerce platform.

PLATFORM SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a platform, USE THAT PLATFORM
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST DIGIT modulo 10:
  - 0: Amazon
  - 1: eBay
  - 2: Etsy
  - 3: Walmart
  - 4: Wayfair
  - 5: Best Buy
  - 6: Facebook Marketplace
  - 7: Target
  - 8: Temu
  - 9: Newegg

TRANSFORM THE SUBJECT:
• Subject MUST remain clearly recognizable
• Subject is the product being sold
• No costumes unless naturally implied by listing style
• Neutral facial expression preferred (stock-photo realism)
• Gender-neutral presentation
• No caricature or cartoon effects

LISTING CONTENT & FLAVOR TEXT:
• Platform-accurate layout and tone
• Product title describing the subject humorously but deadpan
• Bullet-point feature list describing personality traits, habits, or quirks
• Include a product rating (e.g. ★★★☆☆, ★★★★★, etc.) with review count
• Include a price — either absurdly cheap or ridiculously expensive
• Include availability status (In Stock, Limited Stock, Only 1 Left, etc.)
• Include Prime / Buy Now / Add to Cart style UI depending on platform
• Include subtle platform-specific visual cues (buttons, badges, icons)

PLATFORM BEHAVIOR DETAILS:
• Amazon / Walmart / Target: clean corporate listing, Prime-style shipping badges
• eBay / Facebook Marketplace: casual seller tone, slightly chaotic description
• Etsy: handcrafted, emotional, overly sincere description
• Temu: suspiciously cheap price, exaggerated claims
• Newegg / Best Buy: technical specs listed even if meaningless
• Wayfair: elegant staging, oddly specific dimensions

SETTING & COMPOSITION:
• Subject photographed like a product
• Neutral or lifestyle background depending on platform
• Full-body product view preferred
• FULL image visible with all four corners present
• No cropping of subject or UI elements

STYLE:
• Ultra-realistic e-commerce photography
• Looks indistinguishable from a real listing screenshot
• Humor comes from accuracy and commitment
• No memes, no visual jokes, no exaggeration

FINAL RESULT:
The image should convincingly resemble a real online marketplace listing where the subject is the product being sold — complete with platform-accurate UI, pricing, ratings, and flavor text — subtle, dry, and uncomfortably believable, with the subject fully visible from head to toe.

name: OOMPA LOOMPA
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into an Oompa Loompa character from the classic film, placing them in an iconic factory scene.

Transform the subject's appearance: reduce height to small stature, apply orange-tinted skin tone, style hair in distinctive manner (often green or unusual color), dress in white overalls with brown trim and shirt, knee-high socks, and black shoes. Preserve recognizable facial features while adapting to the distinctive look.

FACTORY LOCATION SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a factory location, USE THAT FACTORY LOCATION
• If no factory location is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE factory location using the RANDOM SEED
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 0,1: SELECT chocolate waterfall and river area with candy mushrooms and edible landscape
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 2,3: SELECT golden egg room with geese
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 4: SELECT inventing room with experimental candy machines
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 5,6: SELECT television chocolate room with equipment
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 7: SELECT candy forest with lollipop trees
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 8: SELECT nut sorting room
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 9: SELECT fizzy lifting drinks room

Place the subject in the selected famous factory location. Surround the subject with other Oompa Loompas working in the factory or preparing to perform, all with matching appearance and costumes. Include the fantastical candy factory environment with vibrant colors, impossible proportions, whimsical industrial equipment, massive candy productions, and magical chocolate-making machinery.

The setting should capture the dreamlike quality of the factory: oversized candy elements, colorful pipes and machinery, sugar crystals, chocolate rivers, candy plants, lollipop trees, or other fantastical sweet-themed environmental details.

Lighting should have that slightly surreal, colorful quality of the original film - warm glowing light, candy-colored illumination, and the magical atmosphere of the factory.

Optional: Position subject as if about to perform or mid-performance of their famous moralizing musical number, with other Oompa Loompas in coordinated poses.

The final image should look like an actual still from the classic film - whimsical, colorful, slightly surreal, with the subject fully transformed and integrated into the magical candy factory world. Capture the fantastical, slightly uncanny charm of the original movie's aesthetic.

name: OPERATION
message:
Take a picture and transform it into the board-game Operation.

The final image must show the **entire game board fully visible** within the frame, viewed from above like a real tabletop game. Do not crop any part of the board.

Use a familiar Operation-style layout: a human body diagram with outlined cavities, exaggerated organs, bright colors, and clean, bold shapes. Replace the traditional game head with the subject’s head, adapted into a flat, illustrated style that matches the board aesthetic while remaining recognizable.

Integrate humorous, fictional items into the body cavities inspired by the subject’s traits or environment (e.g., snacks, phone, keys, coffee cup, tangled thoughts). Items should be cartoonish and clearly readable.

Include parody game elements such as:
• Stylized cavity outlines
• Plastic-board textures
• Simplified medical tools (tweezers, wires) as decorative elements
• Playful warning lights or buzz indicators (visual only, no text required)

This must be a humorous, original parody inspired by the classic game format.

Ensure colors are bold, shapes are clean, and all elements are readable on a small screen. The final image should feel like a ridiculous but believable board game someone could actually play.

name: OPPOSITE SELF
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into their opposite self while preserving the subject’s recognizable facial structure, expressions, posture, and identity. Invert key physical characteristics in a realistic and anatomically plausible way, such as body type and gender presentation, while maintaining the subject’s personality and essence. Adapt facial features, body proportions, hair, and clothing naturally to fit the transformed appearance. Ensure the subject remains clearly identifiable and fully integrated into the scene with consistent lighting, perspective, and environment. Render the final image with photorealistic detail and believable realism.

name: OPTICAL ILLUSION
message: Take a picture and convert the image into an optical illusion. Perspective shifts depending on viewing angle. Hidden secondary images emerge upon inspection.

name: ORC
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a fantasy orc warrior.

ORC TYPE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies orc type, USE THAT TYPE
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST DIGIT:
  - 0: Tolkien Orc - corrupted, twisted, hunched, dark armor, evil servant
  - 1: Warcraft Orc - noble warrior, green skin, tusks, honorable, tribal
  - 2: Warhammer Orc - brutal, muscular, crude weapons, savage, WAAAGH!
  - 3: Elder Scrolls Orc (Orsimer) - gray-green skin, civilized, skilled smiths, proud
  - 4: Half-Orc - mixed heritage, less brutish, adventurer, conflicted
  - 5: Uruk-hai - tall, strong, elite warrior, black armor, bred for war
  - 6: Berserker Orc - rage mode, frothing, wild, unstoppable fury
  - 7: Shaman Orc - tribal magic, bones and talismans, spiritual, mystical
  - 8: Chieftain Orc - leader, elaborate armor, commanding, battle-scarred
  - 9: Scout Orc - lighter armor, bow and arrows, tracker, stealthy

SUBJECT TRANSFORMATION (CRITICAL):
• Subject's face RECOGNIZABLE but with orc features added
• NOT a generic orc - THIS IS THE SUBJECT as an orc
• Subject's facial structure maintained with orc characteristics layered on
• Identity clearly visible through orcish features

ORC PHYSICAL FEATURES:
• Skin color:
  - Green (most common)
  - Gray-green
  - Brown-gray
  - Pale gray
  - Dark green
• Tusks protruding from lower jaw (2-4 inches)
• Pronounced underbite
• Broad flat nose
• Heavy brow ridge
• Pointed ears (slightly)
• Yellow or red eyes
• Scarred and weathered skin

FACIAL FEATURES:
• Subject's eyes visible (orcish color)
• Subject's face shape maintained
• Tusks added to lower jaw
• Skin textured and greenish
• War paint or tribal markings
• Scars and battle damage
• Fierce, aggressive expression
• Recognizable as the subject

BODY TYPE:
• Muscular and powerful
• Broad shoulders
• Thick neck
• Large hands
• Hulking, intimidating build
• Battle-hardened physique
• 6-7 feet tall (imposing)

ARMOR & CLOTHING:
• Crude but effective armor:
  - Leather and hide
  - Metal plates (iron, steel)
  - Bone armor pieces
  - Fur and pelts
  - Spiked pauldrons
  - Chain mail (rough)
• Tribal aesthetic
• War trophies attached
• Weathered and battle-worn
• Practical, not ornate

WEAPONS:
• Large brutal weapons:
  - Two-handed battle axe
  - Massive war hammer
  - Crude sword or cleaver
  - Spiked club or mace
  - Jagged blade
  - Bow (for scouts)
• Weapons look heavy and deadly
• Tribal decorations on weapons
• Blood stains or notches

TRIBAL ELEMENTS:
• War paint (red, black, white)
• Tribal tattoos or brands
• Bone jewelry and necklaces
• Feathers or scalps as trophies
• Clan symbols
• Ritual scarification
• Tooth necklaces

HAIR:
• Long, unkempt, wild
• Braided with bones or beads
• Mohawk or top knot
• Shaved sides
• Black or dark brown
• Greasy, unwashed appearance

SETTING:
• Battlefield (corpses, weapons)
• Orc camp or stronghold
• Dark fortress
• Mountainous terrain
• Ruined castle
• War encampment
• Volcanic wasteland
• Tribal village

POSE & STANCE:
• Aggressive, ready for battle
• Weapon raised or shouldered
• Battle cry or roar
• Intimidating stance
• Warrior pose
• Victorious over enemy
• Charging into combat

ATMOSPHERE:
• Dark, gritty, brutal
• War and conflict
• Tribal warfare
• Fantasy medieval setting
• Savage and primitive
• Dangerous and threatening

LIGHTING:
• Dramatic lighting
• Firelight or torches
• Storm clouds
• Sunset/sunrise on battlefield
• Dark and moody
• Highlights scars and features

STYLE:
• Fantasy game/movie quality
• Photorealistic orc transformation
• Lord of the Rings OR Warcraft aesthetic
• High fantasy production value
• CGI movie creature quality

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject transformed into a fantasy orc warrior with green/gray skin, prominent tusks, muscular build, crude armor and brutal weapons, tribal markings, and aggressive pose - the subject's face clearly recognizable with orcish features added, in a dark fantasy battlefield or tribal setting with dramatic lighting and that savage warrior energy.

name: ORIGA-ME
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform them and the entire scene into a fully origami environment.

The subject’s body, clothing, and features must be constructed entirely from folded paper, with realistic creases, folds, layers, and shadows. No textures or elements from the original photo may remain.

The environment around the subject must also be made entirely of folded paper, including furniture, objects, or scenery.

Lighting and perspective must remain realistic, showing accurate paper shadows, edge highlights, and depth.

The final image should look like a single, cohesive origami scene with the subject fully integrated.

name: OSHIKURU: DEMON SAMURAI
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into Oshikuru, the demon samurai character from the fictional anime within 'Two and a Half Men' - a teenage boy possessed by the spirit of an ancient samurai warrior.

THEME SONG LYRICS DISPLAY (CRITICAL):
• The image MUST include the Oshikuru theme song lyrics visible in the composition
• Lyrics text: "Oh - Oh - Oh - Oh, Oshikuru, Oh - Oh - Oh - Oh, Oshikuru, My oh my he's a, demon samurai. Who's the guy who had to die? Oshikuru."
• Display options:
  - Floating kanji characters that spell out the lyrics
  - Subtitle-style text at bottom of image (anime opening style)
  - Stylized text integrated into the background
  - Song lyrics as glowing mystical text in the air
  - Title card overlay with lyrics
• Text should have anime opening credits aesthetic
• Font: bold, dramatic, with slight outline or glow effect
• Placement should not obscure the subject's face
• Lyrics can be in English or stylized to look like translated anime subtitles

FACE PRESERVATION (CRITICAL):
• The subject's actual face MUST remain clearly identifiable and recognizable
• DO NOT age down or de-age the subject's face
• If subject is older (adult, middle-aged, elderly), their REAL age and facial features are preserved
• Facial structure, wrinkles, age lines, and distinct features remain intact
• An older person will have their older face on a younger teenage body (comedic contrast)
• Face is converted to anime style but maintains the subject's true likeness and age
• Eyes are enlarged in anime style but retain subject's eye color and shape characteristics
• Subject's actual hairstyle adapted to anime spiky style while keeping their hair color/texture
• The transformation is: THEIR face + anime stylization + teenage body + samurai armor
• This creates a humorous juxtaposition if subject is significantly older than teenage

CHARACTER DESIGN (CRITICAL):
• Body: teenage boy physique (13-16 years old proportions, lean and athletic)
• Head/Face: subject's ACTUAL face at their REAL age, anime-stylized
• Dual nature visible: subject's recognizable identity merged with fierce warrior spirit
• Anime style character design with exaggerated features while keeping face recognizable
• Large expressive eyes showing both subject's personality and ancient warrior spirit
• Subject's hairstyle converted to spiky/wild anime version (keeps their color)
• Body may be youthful, but face shows subject's true age and identity
• Lean but athletic teenage build (body only, not face)
• Visual indicators of possession: glowing eyes, aura effects, spirit manifestations
• The contrast between youthful body and subject's actual face adds to the effect

SAMURAI WARRIOR ELEMENTS:
• Traditional samurai armor with demon motifs:
  - Red and black color scheme predominant
  - Demon-faced helmet (kabuto) with fierce expression OR helmet removed showing face
  - Shoulder plates (sode) with spiked or horned designs
  - Chest armor (do) with mystical symbols or demon imagery
  - Arm guards (kote) and leg guards (suneate)
  - Traditional samurai sandals (waraji)
• Katana sword with ornate demonic handle and guard
• Weapon glowing with supernatural energy
• Armor shows both ancient craftsmanship and supernatural enhancement
• Battle-worn appearance suggesting centuries of combat
• Armor sized for teenage body proportions

DEMONIC/SUPERNATURAL FEATURES:
• Glowing red or golden eyes when demon spirit emerges (subject's eyes, enhanced)
• Ethereal aura surrounding the character (flames, energy, mist)
• Ghostly apparition of the ancient samurai visible behind or overlaid on teen body
• Floating kanji characters or mystical symbols in background (can include song lyrics)
• Energy effects: crackling electricity, flowing spiritual energy, flame patterns
• Demon markings or tattoos appearing on skin when transformed
• Hair standing up or floating as if charged with power (subject's actual hair)
• Dramatic shadows suggesting the dual nature
• Subject's facial features clearly visible through all supernatural effects

POSE AND EXPRESSION:
• Dynamic action pose: mid-sword strike, defensive stance, or dramatic ready position
• Facial expression on subject's REAL face mixing:
  - Subject's natural expression adapted to situation
  - Ancient warrior's confidence and ferocity
  - Slight comedic undertone (especially if older person in teen body)
  - Subject's unique personality and facial characteristics preserved
• Stance showing trained samurai combat form
• Body language suggesting possessed mastery with teenage proportions
• If subject is older: visual comedy of mature face on youthful warrior body
• Camera angle ensures face is prominently visible and identifiable

ANIME STYLE AESTHETICS:
• Bold, clean line work typical of 2000s anime
• Vibrant, saturated colors with dramatic contrast
• Speed lines and motion effects
• Dramatic lighting with strong highlights and shadows
• Subject's face rendered in anime style but keeping their distinct features
• Slightly comedic anime style (not ultra-serious)
• Action genre conventions: dramatic angles, exaggerated proportions
• Cel-shaded coloring with sharp color transitions
• Background with stylized Japanese elements
• Face detail level HIGH - must be recognizable as the subject
• ANIME OPENING CREDITS aesthetic with song lyrics displayed

ENVIRONMENT AND SETTING:
• Feudal Japan battlefield or temple ruins
• Stormy or dramatic sky with lightning, dark clouds
• Cherry blossom petals blowing in wind
• Ancient Japanese architecture in background
• Mystical fog or mist at ground level
• Floating lanterns or spirit flames
• Crumbling stone walls or torii gates
• Atmospheric effects suggesting supernatural presence
• Setting frames subject's face prominently
• Theme song lyrics visible as part of the scene (floating text, subtitle overlay, or mystical inscription)

LYRICS INTEGRATION STYLE:
• Anime opening credits aesthetic
• Text could appear as:
  - Yellow/white subtitles at bottom (classic anime style)
  - Glowing mystical kanji that translates to the lyrics
  - Title card with show name and lyrics
  - Scrolling credits overlay
  - Dramatic text emblazoned across the sky
• Font should be bold, readable, with dramatic flair
• Optional: Japanese characters with English translation
• Placement enhances the composition without blocking the subject

COMEDIC UNDERTONES:
• Slightly over-the-top dramatic presentation
• Balance between genuine action anime cool and sitcom parody
• Character design has charm and appeal despite being a joke within a show
• If subject is older: added humor from age/body mismatch
• Not mocking anime style but embracing it enthusiastically
• Captures the spirit of a 'Saturday morning anime' that kids would watch
• Action pose and effects are impressive but with slight campiness
• The juxtaposition of subject's real face with teenage warrior body creates inherent comedy
• Song lyrics add to the campy fun

COLOR PALETTE:
• Dominant reds, blacks, and golds for armor
• Glowing energy effects in orange, red, or blue
• Dark atmospheric backgrounds with dramatic lighting
• Skin tone matches subject's actual complexion (anime-stylized)
• Subject's natural hair color preserved in anime style
• Subject's eye color preserved but with anime enhancement
• Metallic sheens on armor and weapons
• Supernatural glow effects around character
• Storm clouds in grays and purples
• Cherry blossoms in pale pinks
• Lyrics text in bright, contrasting colors (white, yellow, gold) for readability

ACTION EFFECTS:
• Sword trail effects showing weapon movement
• Impact bursts and energy explosions
• Speed lines radiating from character
• Dust and debris kicked up from ground
• Cloth and hair flowing dramatically (subject's hair)
• Lens flare effects from glowing elements
• Motion blur on fastest movements
• Kanji sound effect text (stylized Japanese onomatopoeia)
• Effects placed to enhance, not obscure, the subject's face
• Song lyrics positioned to complement the action

FACE VISIBILITY:
• Camera angle shows face clearly and prominently
• Lighting highlights facial features
• No helmet covering face OR helmet positioned to show full face
• Effects and aura do not obscure facial recognition
• Expression clear and readable
• Face is the focal point of the composition
• Lyrics placement does not block or obscure the face

FINAL RESULT:
A dynamic anime-style transformation where the subject's real, recognizable face (at their actual age) is placed on a teenage samurai warrior body wearing elaborate demon armor, with the iconic Oshikuru theme song lyrics prominently displayed in the image using anime opening credits styling. The subject's facial features, age, and identity are completely preserved and clearly visible, creating either a seamless transformation (if subject is young) or a hilarious juxtaposition (if subject is older). The image captures both the earnest action-anime aesthetic and the comedic sitcom origin, with the subject's actual face being the star of the composition and the song lyrics adding authentic 'Saturday morning cartoon' charm - making it immediately clear who has become the legendary demon samurai Oshikuru, complete with his unforgettable theme song.

name: OUTFIT TRY-ON
message:
Take a picture of the subject and generate a 2×2 square grid showing four different complete outfits on the same person. The subject’s pose, face, and environment must remain identical — only the clothing changes.

Each outfit should represent a distinct style (for example: casual, formal, streetwear, business, fantasy, retro, etc.).

Clothing must fit the subject’s body naturally with correct folds, shadows, and proportions.

If external master prompt text is provided (such as era, genre, or theme), use it to guide the outfit designs.

The final image should resemble a digital fashion fitting room.

name: OVER-THE-TOP BEARD
message:
Take a picture of the subject, human or animal, and give them an extremely large, exaggerated beard.

The beard should be far bigger than normal, thick, fluffy, and dramatic — long enough to reach the chest or even lower.

The style can be wild, curly, braided, or oddly shaped, but it should clearly be the main visual focus.

The beard should look real and textured, even if its size is ridiculous.

The final image should look believable but absurd, as if the subject suddenly grew an epic, legendary beard.

name: PAPARAZZI
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a grainy, long-lens paparazzi photograph with the subject as the main focus while a famous celebrity accidentally photobombs in the background or periphery, as if the subject is the real celebrity being photographed.

• If no celebrity is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE famous person using the RANDOM SEED

CORE REQUIREMENTS:
• Subject is the MAIN FOCUS and clearly visible in foreground/center
• Famous celebrity appears in background, far away, or at edge of frame
• Celebrity is incidental, not the focus — blurred, walking by, partially visible, or in distance
• Subject appears as the "target" of the paparazzi photo
• Subject doing normal everyday activity
• Subject's face clearly visible and recognizable

CELEBRITY PLACEMENT (CRITICAL):
• Celebrity must be secondary and incidental to the composition
• Options for celebrity placement:
  — Far in background (small, distant figure)
  — Blurred and out of focus behind subject
  — Partially cut off at edge of frame
  — Walking past in background
  — Sitting at table far behind subject
  — Visible through window in background
  — In a crowd, barely noticeable
• Celebrity should be recognizable but NOT the main subject
• Adds to the humor that a real celebrity is ignored while subject is the "star"

CAMERA & PHOTO QUALITY:
• Long telephoto lens compression effect
• Grainy, low-quality image (high ISO noise)
• Subject in focus, celebrity may be slightly blurred
• Awkward framing focused on subject
• Shot from distance (across street, parking lot, through bushes)
• Harsh natural lighting or shadowy
• Authentic paparazzi stalker photography aesthetic

TABLOID ELEMENTS (MANDATORY):
• Large watermark: "TMZ", "EXCLUSIVE", "X17", or similar tabloid agency branding
• Red circle or arrow pointing at SUBJECT (not the celebrity)
• Date and timestamp in corner
• "EXCLUSIVE" banner across top or bottom
• Headline focuses on subject, ignoring the actual celebrity
• Examples:
  — "EXCLUSIVE: New Star Spotted at Coffee Shop!"
  — "BREAKING: Mystery Celebrity Causes Stir!"
  — "WHO IS THIS?! Hollywood's Newest Face!"
• Optional: Small second circle barely noting the real celebrity in background

STYLE:
• Invasive paparazzi photography aesthetic
• Looks stolen/unauthorized
• Candid, unposed moment
• Voyeuristic perspective
• Tabloid journalism production quality
• Focus and framing prioritize subject over actual celebrity

HUMOR ELEMENTS:
• Subject treated as the celebrity while real celebrity is ignored
• Dramatic tabloid presentation of subject as "the star"
• Irony of famous person being incidental background element
• Subject appears completely unaware they're "the famous one"
• Real celebrity casually doing normal things in background, overlooked

FINAL RESULT:
A grainy, long-lens paparazzi photograph with tabloid watermarks focusing on the subject as if they're the celebrity being stalked, while an actual famous person accidentally appears in the background, blurred, distant, or at the edge of frame — completely incidental to the shot. The humor comes from treating the subject as the star while ignoring the real celebrity.

name: PAPER SHADOW BOX
message: Take a picture and transform the image into a layered paper shadow-box. Multiple cut paper layers creating depth. Soft directional lighting

name: PARALLEL UNIVERSE HISTORY
message:
Take a picture and place the subject at the center of a universally recognizable moment in human history, replacing the original figure with the subject while preserving the significance, symbolism, and emotional weight of the event. The subject must be clearly recognizable and portrayed as the individual performing the defining action of the moment. Do not depict or reference the original historical figure by name or likeness. Instead, recreate the setting, era-appropriate environment, clothing, and atmosphere so the moment is immediately identifiable through visual context alone. Use implicit inference from the subject’s appearance, posture, and expression to select an appropriate historic theme (e.g., leadership, discovery, courage, progress, unity). If externally provided details are supplied, incorporate them as factual context for the moment. Present the image as a clean, collectible flashcard optimized for small screens. Include concise, readable text such as: 
• Title of the historic moment
• Year or era
• One-sentence description of the event’s significance
• A short, respectful caption describing the subject’s role. Ensure cinematic lighting, strong composition, and emotional impact. The final image should feel iconic, respectful, and timeless—like a photograph history forgot to record.

name: PAREIDOLIA FIELD
message:
Take a picture of the subject and place them in a scene where surrounding textures and patterns subtly form faces and expressions through pareidolia.

PAREIDOLIA RULES (CRITICAL):
• Faces must emerge naturally from existing textures such as clouds, foliage, rocks, walls, shadows, or fabric
• Do not introduce literal faces, eyes, or mouths as standalone objects
• The faces should be ambiguous and discoverable rather than immediately obvious

IDENTITY ECHO:
• The emergent faces should subtly echo the subject’s facial features, expression, or emotional state
• Eye spacing, mouth curvature, or overall mood may repeat abstractly in the environment
• Avoid exact duplicates or caricatures

COMPOSITION AND TONE:
• Subject remains clearly visible and normal
• Environmental faces appear secondary and layered
• Ambiguous, unsettling, or whimsical mood depending on context
• No overt horror unless naturally implied

REALISM:
• Photorealistic lighting and textures
• Consistent perspective and scale
• Natural integration into the environment

FINAL RESULT:
The image should feel like a normal photograph at first glance, with hidden faces gradually emerging from the environment the longer the viewer looks, subtly mirroring the subject without obvious intent.

name: PASSPORT PHOTO
message:
Take a picture and transform it into an official passport photo embedded within a realistic passport identity page.

The subject’s image must appear printed directly onto the passport page as part of the document layout, not as a standalone or floating photo. Integrate the photo naturally into the passport design with proper borders, alignment, and scale consistent with real passports.

Use a plain white or light grey background within the photo area. The subject should have a centered frontal view of the face and shoulders, a neutral expression, and even lighting with no harsh shadows. Maintain clean, sharp focus and accurate proportions.

Surround the photo with realistic passport elements such as text fields, lines, security patterns, microprint textures, and subtle holographic or watermark-style design details (without copying any specific real country’s passport).

Ensure the overall result looks like a legitimate government passport ID page, with the photo clearly integrated into the document and the full page visible within the frame.

name: PATRON SAINT
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a patron saint–style depiction while preserving clear facial likeness and identity. Present the subject in saintly attire with symbolic garments, colors, and iconography. Use a reverent, dignified pose with soft halo lighting and a subtle divine glow, rendered in a classical yet photorealistic aesthetic. Primary information source: If a saint name is provided via externally supplied details, accurately incorporate all historically associated information for that saint, including name, patronage domains, feast day, biographical summary, notable traditions, and fun facts. Do not alter or contradict known historical associations. Secondary enhancement: Use implicit visual inference from the subject’s appearance, clothing, accessories, environment, and expression to enhance symbolism, visual motifs, and flavor text, without overriding factual saint information. Fallback behavior: If no saint name is externally provided, create a clearly labeled symbolic or archetypal “Saint of [inferred theme]” based on implicit inference from the subject. Avoid naming or implying a real historical saint, omit specific feast dates, and present patronage and fun facts as symbolic rather than historical. Design the final image as a compact, mobile-friendly flash card or holy card layout optimized for small screens. Ensure all text is concise, high-contrast, and legible at small sizes, with clear hierarchy and minimal clutter. Maintain visual clarity, balanced composition, and immediate recognizability.  The result should be a full view of the card with a relevant background behind the card.

name: PEACOCKING
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a humorously peacocking version of themselves - someone who is deliberately, self-awarely, and absurdly over-the-top in their attempt to grab attention, making the display so obviously performative that it becomes charming and funny rather than genuinely arrogant.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• Peacocking here is COMEDIC and SELF-AWARE - the subject KNOWS they are being ridiculous
• The humor comes from the contrast between the over-the-top display and the subject's knowing smirk
• This is a PARODY of attention-seeking behavior, not genuine arrogance
• The subject appears to be in on the joke
• Think: someone who walked into a party wearing a giant sombrero and is absolutely OWNING it
• The result should make viewers laugh WITH the subject, not AT them
• Both men and women peacock differently but equally hilariously

PEACOCKING METHOD SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a peacocking style, USE THAT STYLE
• If none specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE method using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST DIGIT of the RANDOM SEED modulo 10:
  - 0: ABSURD FASHION - one intentionally ridiculous statement piece dominates the outfit
  - 1: PLAYFUL PHYSICALITY - exaggerated pose or flex with visible self-amusement
  - 2: TALENT SHOWCASE - subject performing a deliberately useless or silly skill
  - 3: SELF-DEPRECATING BOAST - subject holding or displaying a tiny meaningless trophy or achievement
  - 4: DRAMATIC STORYTELLING - theatrical over-the-top gesture mid-ridiculous story
  - 5: ABSURD ACCESSORY - one enormous or ridiculous prop that dominates the image
  - 6: THE STRUT - subject mid-exaggerated slow-motion runway walk into a mundane setting
  - 7: FAKE TALENT - subject mid-magic trick that is visibly failing spectacularly
  - 8: THE HUMBLE BRAG - subject proudly displaying something completely insignificant as if it were a trophy
  - 9: FULL COSTUME - subject in a completely over-the-top outfit that belongs nowhere near the setting

METHOD 0 - ABSURD FASHION:
• Subject wearing one completely ridiculous statement piece:
  - Neon-colored blazer in eye-searing yellow, pink, or lime green
  - Enormous novelty fedora or top hat several sizes too large
  - Full sequined suit in broad daylight at a mundane location
  - Cape that serves no purpose but flows dramatically
  - Fake handlebar mustache worn with complete confidence
• Rest of outfit completely normal - the contrast is the joke
• Subject's expression: smug but self-aware grin
• Other people in background reacting with amused confusion

METHOD 1 - PLAYFUL PHYSICALITY:
• Subject in mid-exaggerated muscle flex pose
• Flexing muscles that clearly do not exist
• Expression: mock-serious bodybuilder face breaking into laughter
• Pose borrowed from professional wrestling or bodybuilding competitions
• Setting completely mundane (grocery store, office, kitchen)
• Optional: small crowd of amused onlookers
• Visible effort to maintain straight face while posing

METHOD 2 - TALENT SHOWCASE:
• Subject mid-performance of completely useless skill:
  - Reciting something backwards with intense concentration
  - Balancing completely unnecessary objects on face
  - Performing an overly elaborate coin trick
  - Demonstrating expert knowledge of something nobody cares about
• Expression: intense over-confidence in completely silly skill
• Optional: small audience of confused but amused onlookers
• Visual indicators of the talent being impressive to absolutely no one

METHOD 3 - SELF-DEPRECATING BOAST:
• Subject proudly displaying a tiny or mundane achievement:
  - Holding a ribbon for "Participation" like an Olympic gold medal
  - Presenting perfectly microwaved popcorn on a velvet cushion
  - Trophy for "Most Punctual" or "Best Coffee Maker" displayed like a World Cup
  - Certificate of completion for something extremely basic
• Expression: genuine pride mixed with complete awareness of absurdity
• Dramatic lighting on the insignificant achievement
• Subject posed as if accepting an Academy Award

METHOD 4 - DRAMATIC STORYTELLING:
• Subject mid-theatrical gesture telling an obviously mundane story
• Arms spread wide, mouth open in exaggerated expression
• Eyes wide with manufactured intensity
• Body language borrowed from Shakespeare or opera
• Setting: casual social gathering (party, bar, dinner table)
• Audience of friends looking amused/confused
• The physical energy completely disproportionate to the story being told
• Optional: small speech bubble or caption hinting at mundane story content

METHOD 5 - ABSURD ACCESSORY:
• One enormous or ridiculous prop dominates the entire image:
  - Oversized novelty sunglasses taking up half the face
  - Enormous novelty bow tie the size of a dinner plate
  - Comically large walking cane or scepter
  - Ridiculous oversized pocket square erupting from jacket
  - Novelty-sized wristwatch visible from space
• Subject carrying/wearing it with complete nonchalance
• Expression: what? Is there a problem?

METHOD 6 - THE STRUT:
• Subject mid-exaggerated runway model walk
• Location: completely mundane (office hallway, supermarket aisle, parking lot)
• Pose borrowed from high fashion runway - one foot dramatically in front of other
• Hair or clothing flowing as if there is a wind machine
• Expression: mock-serious model face with hint of suppressed laughter
• Optional: imaginary spotlight on subject
• Background people going about normal business, ignoring or amused

METHOD 7 - FAKE TALENT:
• Subject mid-magic trick that is visibly, spectacularly failing
• Cards flying everywhere OR object clearly visible where it should be hidden
• Expression: intense magician confidence despite obvious disaster
• Magician's outfit optional but encouraged
• The failure should be visible and undeniable
• Subject completely unaware of or refusing to acknowledge the failure
• Optional: small audience watching with polite confusion

METHOD 8 - THE HUMBLE BRAG:
• Subject proudly displaying something completely insignificant:
  - Perfect parallel parking job (pointing at car with pride)
  - Unburned piece of toast held like Excalibur
  - Screenshot of a high score in an ancient or obscure game
  - Homemade item presented like a Michelin-starred dish
• Expression: genuine pride completely disproportionate to achievement
• Dramatic presentation: velvet cushion, spotlight, or trophy case optional

METHOD 9 - FULL COSTUME:
• Subject in completely over-the-top outfit for the wrong setting:
  - Full Renaissance fair costume at a coffee shop
  - Medieval armor at a casual house party
  - Full tuxedo at a fast food restaurant
  - Superhero costume at a mundane office meeting
• Expression: acting as if this is completely normal
• Environment reacting with polite confusion
• No acknowledgment of the absurdity from subject

SUBJECT PRESERVATION (CRITICAL):
• Subject's face must remain clearly recognizable
• Facial features, age, and identity preserved
• Expression adapted to the peacocking method but face unmistakably theirs
• Body proportions maintained (comedy comes from what they are doing, not body distortion)
• Skin tone and hair color preserved unless costume specifically changes hair

VISUAL STYLE:
• Photorealistic or slightly heightened reality
• Comedy comes from situation and expression, not cartoon distortion
• Lighting slightly theatrical - as if subject has arranged their own spotlight
• Colors slightly more saturated than real life - enhancing the performative quality
• Background slightly soft-focused to keep attention on subject's display
• Optional: small admiring or confused crowd in background

EXPRESSION GUIDE (CRITICAL):
• The subject's expression must carry the self-aware comedy
• Options based on method:
  - Mock-serious: treating absurd activity with intense gravitas
  - Suppressed laughter: clearly about to break into a grin
  - Knowing smirk: fully aware this is ridiculous and delighted by it
  - Performative confidence: overdoing the confidence to comic effect
  - Straight-faced: deadpan delivery of complete absurdity
• Expression should NEVER be genuinely arrogant or mean-spirited
• The subject is always the comedian, never the villain

COLOR AND ATMOSPHERE:
• Slightly heightened, slightly theatrical color palette
• The ridiculous element should be the most colorful/eye-catching part of the image
• Warm, comedic lighting suggesting spotlight or performance
• Background colors neutral to make the peacocking element pop
• Overall image feels like a comedy film still - professional but hilarious

FINAL RESULT:
A hilarious, warmly comedic image of the subject fully committing to an absurd, self-aware display of attention-seeking behavior. The subject's face is clearly recognizable, their expression perfectly calibrated between mock-seriousness and barely-concealed amusement, and the peacocking element - whether absurd fashion, ridiculous skill, or theatrical pose - is executed with such complete commitment that it transcends embarrassment and becomes genuinely charming. The image should make anyone who sees it immediately understand: this person is in on the joke, they are funny, and they are absolutely owning it.

name: PEANUTS
message: Take a picture in the style of a Peanuts cartoon strip. Have the subject speaking through a text bubble that reads GOOD GRIEF!

name: PENNIES
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a sculpture constructed entirely from real pennies. The subject must be MADE OF pennies, not covered in them - every part of their body, face, clothing, and hair should be built from individual copper pennies arranged like tiles or scales to form the three-dimensional shape.

Use pennies at various angles and orientations: some showing Lincoln's head, others showing the memorial or shield back, creating texture and shading through the different faces of the coins. Include pennies in different conditions - bright shiny copper, aged brown, tarnished with green patina, worn smooth - to create dimensional depth, highlights, and shadows.

The pennies should be arranged in overlapping patterns similar to fish scales or roof tiles, building up the volumetric form. Tighter, more densely packed penny arrangements for fine details like facial features; slightly looser arrangements for larger body areas. The circular shape of individual pennies should be visible throughout.

The background and environment should also be constructed from pennies - walls, floor, furniture, all made from stacked and arranged pennies creating a complete penny-constructed world.

Photorealistic lighting with warm copper/reddish-brown metallic tones, highlights catching on raised coin edges, and shadows between overlapping layers. The final image should look like a photograph of an actual physical artwork where literally everything is built from real pennies - a penny mosaic sculpture in three dimensions.

name: PEPPA PIG
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a flat, minimal cartoon world inspired by Peppa Pig.

STYLE & CHARACTER RULES:
• Extremely simple shapes and thick outlines
• Flat colors with no shading
• Side-facing or slightly turned characters
• Include multiple simple animal characters

SCENE & TONE:
• Bright, cheerful, and childlike
• Simple outdoor or indoor settings
• Naive perspective and playful composition

The final image should look like a fully composed Peppa Pig–style hand-drawn illustration with the subject and additional characters integrated seamlessly into the world.

name: PEST PANIC
message:
Take a picture of the subject and place them in a realistic situation where they appear to be acting irrational, frantic, or unstable due to an unseen or barely visible pest.

PEST SCENARIO SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• SELECT EXACTLY ONE scenario using the RANDOM SEED
• Use LAST DIGIT modulo 8:
  - 0: SWATTING A FLY — subject mid-swing with hand or object, face tense or annoyed, clearly reacting to a small flying insect
  - 1: CAUGHT IN A SPIDER WEB — subject tangled in sticky strands, hands raised awkwardly, visible discomfort or panic
  - 2: AVOIDING A BEE — subject recoiling or dodging with exaggerated caution, eyes wide, body twisted away
  - 3: WASP NEAR THE FACE — subject frozen or flailing in fear, trying not to provoke the insect
  - 4: MOSQUITO ATTACK — subject slapping at arms or neck repeatedly, visibly irritated
  - 5: ANT CRAWLING — subject hopping, shaking clothing, or brushing at legs in alarm
  - 6: GNAT SWARM — subject squinting, waving hands near face, leaning away from invisible cloud
  - 7: TICK DISCOVERY — subject mid-panic realizing a tick is on them, fingers hovering in dread

BEHAVIOR AND EXPRESSION (CRITICAL):
• Subject must appear unaware of how they look to others
• Movements should seem excessive relative to the small threat
• Facial expression should convey panic, disgust, irritation, or paranoia
• Avoid exaggerated cartoon motion or slapstick posing

VISIBILITY RULES:
• The pest may be subtly visible or implied, but must remain small and non-dominant
• The humor must come from the subject’s reaction, not the insect itself

ENVIRONMENT AND REALISM:
• Scene must remain grounded in a normal real-world setting
• Lighting, shadows, and perspective must be consistent
• Natural body mechanics and believable motion blur if appropriate
• No surreal or fantasy elements

TONE:
• Mildly chaotic, socially awkward, and relatable
• Feels like a candid photo taken at the worst possible moment

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a real photograph capturing a moment where the subject appears unhinged or overreactive due to a tiny pest, with the humor coming entirely from realistic human behavior and context.

name: PETS LIKE HUMAN
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into what they would look like if they were a dog or a cat.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• This is a stylistic, imaginative transformation — not body horror
• The result must feel charming, recognizable, and intentional
• No disturbing or anatomical mashups

ANIMAL SELECTION LOGIC (CRITICAL):
• If NO dog or cat appears in the image:
  – Randomly choose ONE: dog OR cat
  – Transform the subject into that animal archetype

• If a dog or cat IS visible in the image:
  – The subject MUST be transformed to resemble THAT specific animal
  – Use the visible pet as the reference (species, breed traits, coloring, vibe)

SUBJECT → PET TRANSFORMATION RULES (CRITICAL):
• Preserve the subject’s identity through:
  – Eye shape and expression
  – Face shape and proportions (translated into animal form)
  – Hairstyle → fur pattern analogy
  – Personality cues (serious, playful, curious, confident)
• The result should instantly feel like "this is the subject as a dog/cat"
• No grotesque realism, no half-human anatomy

PET STYLE:
• Expressive but natural animal anatomy
• Soft fur, believable posture
• Warm, appealing, and emotionally readable

CLOTHING & ROLE REVERSAL LOGIC (CRITICAL):
• If a dog or cat appears in the image:
  – Dress the dog or cat in the SUBJECT’S clothing style
  – Clothing must be adapted for animals (shirts, jackets, scarves, glasses, hats)
  – No full human outfits or uncomfortable realism

• The transformed subject (now animal-like) should NOT wear human clothes unless the original pet was already dressed

SCENE & COMPOSITION:
• Keep the original environment whenever possible
• Subject (as animal) remains the visual focus
• If both subject and pet are present, ensure the visual swap is clear and readable

TONE:
• Playful
• Clever
• Endearing
• Lighthearted

ABSOLUTE PROHIBITIONS:
• No body horror
• No hybrid human limbs
• No disturbing anatomy
• No aggressive or threatening behavior

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must feel like a clever visual role-reversal or identity translation: the subject convincingly reimagined as a dog or cat, and — when a pet is present — the pet charmingly dressed like the subject, creating a humorous, wholesome, and instantly understandable transformation.

name: PHOTOBOMB
message:
Take a picture and create a scene where the subject is NOT the main focus, but is instead photobombing another photo.

CORE RULE:
• The main subject of the photo must be someone or something else
• The subject must appear unexpectedly in the background or edge of the frame

MULTIPLE SUBJECT RULE (CRITICAL):
• If more than one subject is present, randomly select ONE subject to be the photobomber
• The remaining subject(s) must act as the unaware main focus of the photo
• Only ONE photobomber is allowed per image

PHOTOBOMB BEHAVIOR:
• Exaggerated facial expression, awkward pose, or deliberate attention-seeking
• Leaning into frame, popping up behind someone, or staring directly at camera
• The photobomb should be unmistakable and intentional

COMPOSITION:
• The main subject must remain fully visible and centered
• The photobomber must be partially obscured, off-center, or intruding from the edge
• Do NOT crop the main subject

FINAL RESULT:
The image should clearly read as a normal photo ruined (or improved) by one subject aggressively photobombing it.

name: PHOTO BOOTH STRIP
message:
Take a picture of the subject(s) and turn it into a classic photo booth strip with 3-4 frames vertically aligned.

Each frame should show a different funny or exaggerated pose or expression. Include props like hats, glasses, silly signs, or hand gestures to increase humor.

Background should resemble a traditional photo booth curtain, with soft lighting and simple textures. Include slight visual imperfections like film grain, light streaks, or small scratches to emulate a real photo strip.

The final result should feel like a tangible photo booth keepsake, with high readability, playful exaggeration, and a touch of nostalgia.

name: PHOTOMANIPULATION
message: Take a picture and create a photomanipulation artwork that blends multiple photographic elements into an impossible but convincing surreal scenario. The subject should be composited into an unexpected, dreamlike, or physically impossible situation. Ensure consistent lighting direction and color temperature across all composited elements for seamless integration. Use realistic shadows, reflections, and perspective matching to make the impossible scene feel photographically authentic. Apply subtle color grading across the entire composition to unify disparate elements into a cohesive whole. The manipulation should be technically flawless - viewers should believe it's a real photograph of an impossible moment. Surreal but photorealistic, masterful digital compositing, reality-bending imagery.

name: PHOTO PUZZLE
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a printable jigsaw puzzle layout. Preserve the original photograph clearly while overlaying visible puzzle piece cut lines across the entire image.

Generate a classic jigsaw pattern with interlocking pieces of varied shapes and sizes. Ensure pieces are large enough to be easily cut out and assembled by hand. Avoid overly small or complex pieces. Keep the image centered and unobstructed so the subject remains recognizable even when divided.

Use clean, high-contrast cut lines that are clearly visible on small screens and when printed. Do not add numbers, text, or labels. The final image should look like a ready-to-print puzzle sheet that can be cut out and assembled in real life.

name: PICTIONARY
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a classic Pictionary-style drawing.

Render the subject as a rough, hand-drawn black marker sketch on a clean whiteboard or paper background. The drawing should look like it was made quickly by an amateur player under time pressure — uneven lines, simple shapes, minimal detail, and imperfect proportions.

Preserve just enough of the subject’s pose, silhouette, and key features so the intended idea is still recognizable, but clearly simplified into crude line art rather than a realistic portrait.

Optional visual cues may be included sparingly, such as motion lines, arrows, or simple icons (e.g., sweat drops, exclamation marks) to suggest action or intent, as commonly seen in Pictionary drawings.

Do NOT include written words, letters, numbers, labels, or clues. The image must rely entirely on the drawing to communicate the idea.

Frame the image so the entire drawing surface is visible, as if photographed during a real game of Pictionary. The final result should feel playful, messy, and immediately readable on a small screen.

name: PICTURE PERFECT
message: Take a picture and make it picture perfect - improve lighting, colors, and overall composition. Professional perfection. Correct lighting, color, sharpness, and realism. Remove any imperfections.  Make it photorealistic.  8k resolution.

name: PILLOW PERSON
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into an actual decorative pillow - not a photo printed on a pillow, but the subject physically transformed into pillow form.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• The subject IS a pillow, not a person with a pillow
• The subject's body and face are made of fabric, stuffing, and pillow materials
• This is a physical transformation, not photoshopping a face onto a pillow
• The subject has become a three-dimensional decorative pillow object

PILLOW TRANSFORMATION:
• Subject's entire body transformed into soft pillow form
• Face is embroidered, appliquéd, or fabric-sculpted onto pillow surface
• Facial features rendered in fabric, thread, buttons, or felt
• Body is soft, plush, stuffed pillow material
• Fabric texture visible (cotton, velvet, silk, linen)
• Pillow seams and stitching visible along edges
• Slightly three-dimensional face (stuffed fuller for nose, cheeks)
• Subject's hair rendered as yarn, fabric strips, or embroidered detail

PILLOW CONSTRUCTION DETAILS:
• Decorative pillow shape (square, rectangular, round, or novelty shape)
• Piping or trim along edges
• Zipper or button closure visible on back or side
• Stuffing material suggested (not spilling out, but visible plumpness)
• Fabric patterns or solid colors
• Tag with care instructions
• Pillow appears professionally manufactured

FACIAL FEATURES IN FABRIC:
• Eyes as buttons, felt circles, or embroidered
• Nose slightly raised/stuffed for dimension
• Mouth embroidered or appliquéd
• Eyebrows as embroidered lines or felt
• Cheeks with subtle blush (fabric paint or embroidery)
• Face recognizable but rendered in pillow-craft style

SETTING:
• Resting on couch, bed, or chair
• Among other decorative pillows
• In home décor store display
• On display shelf
• Staged as product photography
• Good lighting showing fabric texture

STYLE:
• Product photography aesthetic
• Soft home lighting
• Fabric textures clearly visible
• Professional craft quality
• Could be from Etsy or home goods store
• Handmade decorative pillow feel

PILLOW TYPES (Can vary):
• Throw pillow with subject's face
• Body pillow shaped like subject
• Decorative accent pillow
• Novelty shaped pillow
• Portrait pillow with embroidered face

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject completely transformed into an actual decorative pillow with their face and features rendered in fabric, embroidery, and stuffing - not a photograph printed on a pillow, but a genuine textile craft object that happens to resemble the subject.

name: PIMP OR WORKING GIRL
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a stereotypical 1970s street character based on their gender.

If MALE: Transform into a flamboyant pimp with exaggerated 1970s style - wide-brimmed fur or velvet hat with feather, oversized sunglasses, flashy suit with loud patterns (zebra print, leopard print, bright colors), platform shoes, gold chains and jewelry, fur coat draped over shoulders, cane with ornate handle, confident swagger pose. Expression should be cocky and self-assured.

If FEMALE: Transform into a provocative street worker with exaggerated 1970s style - big teased hair or wig, heavy makeup with dramatic eye shadow and false lashes, revealing outfit with hot pants or mini skirt, fishnet stockings, platform boots or heels, fur jacket or boa, excessive jewelry, confident or sultry pose and expression.

Setting should reflect gritty urban 1970s street environment - neon signs, city street at night, vintage cars in background, period-appropriate storefronts. Lighting should have that warm sodium street light glow mixed with colorful neon.

Style should be photorealistic but capture the over-the-top, exaggerated aesthetic of 1970s exploitation films and blaxploitation cinema. Preserve the subject's recognizable facial features while fully committing to the theatrical costume and styling.

The final image should feel like a still from a 1970s film - authentic period details, grainy film quality, and the unapologetic bold style of that era's street culture aesthetic.

name: PIP-BOY
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a Pip-Boy 3000 interface screen displaying detailed information about the subject.

CORE REQUIREMENTS:
• Authentic Pip-Boy 3000 monochrome green phosphor screen aesthetic
• Scanline effect and CRT glow
• Vault-Tec branding and retro-futuristic design elements
• Tab navigation interface (STAT/INV/DATA)

CONTENT GENERATION:
• Analyze the image subject and generate appropriate Pip-Boy information:
  - If person: S.P.E.C.I.A.L. stats, skills, perks, equipment, status effects
  - If object: Item name, weight, value, condition, effects, description
  - If location: Map designation, radiation level, threat assessment, notes
  - If creature: Species, level, HP, resistances, loot probability
• Use flavor text inspired by the image to fill all fields
• Include witty Fallout-style descriptions and dark humor where appropriate
• Add contextual details like date, time, radiation level, HP/AP bars

INTERFACE ELEMENTS:
• Top status bar with health, action points, level, XP
• Side panel with paper-doll equipment display or item preview
• Main content area with stats, descriptions, and details
• Bottom navigation buttons and Vault-Tec logo
• Authentic monospaced retro terminal font
• Green-on-black color scheme with appropriate glow

STYLE:
• Exact Pip-Boy 3000 screen proportions and layout
• Worn, slightly flickering display effect
• Small image or icon of subject in appropriate panel
• All text clearly legible with retro-futuristic formatting

FINAL RESULT:
A complete, authentic Pip-Boy screen displaying comprehensive RPG-style information about the photographed subject with Fallout universe flavor and aesthetic.

name: PIPE CLEANER KID
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a handmade childlike sculpture built from simple craft materials.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• The subject becomes a small figurative sculpture
• The sculpture looks handmade by a child, not professionally crafted
• The tone is innocent, playful, and imaginative

MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION RULES:
• Head is a round white Styrofoam ball
• Body, arms, and legs are made from colorful pipe cleaners
• Limbs are slightly uneven and imperfect
• Proportions are toy-like, not realistic

FACE RENDERING (CRITICAL):
• The subject’s face is painted directly onto the Styrofoam head
• Facial features must resemble the subject
• The face looks drawn with magic markers
• Linework is uneven, playful, and imperfect
• Coloring may slightly go outside the lines
• Style resembles artwork by a 10-year-old child

EXPRESSION & DETAIL:
• Simple dot eyes or outlined eyes
• Basic nose and mouth shapes
• No realistic shading or texture
• Cheerful or neutral expression

CLOTHING & ACCESSORIES:
• Clothing is implied using pipe cleaners or simple craft shapes
• Optional paper scraps, yarn, or felt details
• Nothing realistic or detailed

ENVIRONMENT:
• Neutral or craft-table background
• Optional classroom or art-room feel
• Focus remains on the sculpture

ABSOLUTE PROHIBITIONS:
• No realism
• No lifelike skin texture
• No adult or dark themes
• No horror or unsettling tone

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must look like a charming, handmade child’s craft sculpture — a Styrofoam-and–pipe-cleaner figure with the subject’s face drawn on in colorful marker, imperfect, playful, and full of imagination.

name: PIRATE'S LIFE FOR ME
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a classic pirate while keeping the image grounded, realistic, and playful.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• The subject must remain clearly recognizable
• The transformation is a COSTUME and character change — not fantasy or supernatural
• The result should feel like a high-quality pirate portrait or candid scene

PIRATE APPEARANCE RULES:
• Pirate-style clothing (tricorn hat or bandana, loose shirt, vest or coat)
• Weathered fabrics and layered garments
• Leather belts, sash, or shoulder straps
• Optional pirate accessories:
  – Eye patch (ONLY if it replaces one visible eye)
  – Simple earring or hoop
  – Neck scarf or bandana

FACIAL & BODY DETAILS:
• Natural facial hair encouraged if compatible with the subject
• Subtle dirt, sun exposure, or sea-worn texture
• Confident or mischievous expression
• No exaggerated caricature or cartoon features

WEAPONS & SAFETY (CRITICAL):
• NO modern weapons
• If a prop weapon is present, it must be a simple, non-threatening pirate prop (sheath sword, flintlock at rest)
• No violent action or combat poses

POSE & ATTITUDE:
• Relaxed, confident stance
• Casual pirate swagger
• No aggressive or attacking gestures

ENVIRONMENT:
• Nautical or port-like setting if possible
• Ship deck, dock, shoreline, or neutral background
• Natural daylight or warm, cinematic lighting

REALISM RULES:
• Photorealistic or lightly cinematic
• No fantasy creatures, magic, or supernatural effects
• No glowing eyes or special effects

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must look like a believable photograph of the subject dressed as a pirate — adventurous, playful, and grounded in reality, as if taken during a high-quality costume shoot or film still.

name: PIXAR
message:
Take a picture in the style of Pixar signature 3D animation. Use Pixar’s blend of realism and cartoon expressiveness: vibrant colors, soft shadows, rounded features, large expressive eyes, emotional depth, and animated charm.

Scene should feel like a coherent Pixar world: playful, immersive, and dynamic. Lighting, shadows, and depth must match the 3D environment.

The final image should look like a fully-rendered Pixar movie still, with the subject integrated seamlessly among other Pixar characters, all animated in the same style.

name: PIXEL ART
message:
Take a picture and transform it into authentic pixel art.

Rebuild the image entirely using a low-resolution pixel grid. The subject must be constructed from visible, square pixels only — no smooth gradients, no blur, no vector lines, and no photographic textures.

Limit the color palette to a small, intentional set (approximately 8–24 colors total). Use flat color blocks with hard pixel edges. Shading should be achieved only through pixel placement and color stepping, not softness or blending.

Preserve the subject’s recognizability through simplified shapes, silhouettes, and key features rather than detail. Facial features, if present, should be minimal and symbolic.

Choose a classic pixel-art style inspired by retro video games (8-bit, 16-bit, or early handheld), but do not copy any specific copyrighted game or character.

Ensure the entire pixel artwork is visible, centered, and readable on a small screen. The final image should feel handcrafted, nostalgic, and unmistakably pixel art — not a filtered photo.

name: PIZZA THE HUTT
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a living pizza character where every facial and body feature is made entirely from pizza and toppings.

FACIAL FEATURES FROM PIZZA TOPPINGS:
• Eyes: Two cut black olive slices or pepperoni circles with smaller olive centers for pupils
• Eyebrows: Thin curved strips of caramelized onions or green pepper strips
• Nose: A single mushroom cap positioned with the small stem end on top and the larger round cap on bottom, shaped exactly like a nose
• Mouth: A curved red pepper strip or a line of small pepperoni slices
• Teeth: Cut-up onion strips arranged as individual teeth
• Ears: Sliced tomatoes (cross-section showing seeds and flesh)
• Hair: Tangled masses of sautéed onions, shredded cheese, or strips of bell peppers
• Skin: Melted mozzarella cheese stretched across the face, with visible cheese texture and slight browning

BODY CONSTRUCTION:
• Entire body is a pizza base with visible crust edges
• Body shape follows the subject's pose but is made of stretched pizza dough
• Clothing patterns are created from arranged toppings (pepperoni patterns, vegetable designs)
• Limbs are thick pizza slices with melted cheese dripping
• Fingers are breadstick shapes or rolled pizza dough
• The surface has visible pizza grease, melted cheese pools, and scattered herbs

TEXTURE AND DETAIL:
• Show cheese stretching and bubbling
• Include visible tomato sauce in areas
• Add oregano, basil flakes, and parmesan sprinkles
• Some toppings should appear freshly placed, others baked and crispy
• Visible pizza box or pizza pan in background or as base
• Steam rising from hot melted cheese
• Grease spots and oil sheen on surface

LIGHTING AND STYLE:
• Warm lighting as if the pizza just came out of the oven
• Appetizing food photography lighting
• Slight comedy angle but maintain impressive food art quality
• The transformation should be delicious-looking, not grotesque
• Rich reds from sauce, golden browns from crust, creamy whites from cheese

FINAL RESULT:
A spectacular living pizza portrait where the subject is entirely reconstructed from pizza ingredients in a way that's simultaneously recognizable, appetizing, and humorous. Every element must be an actual pizza component—no regular skin, hair, or features remain.

name: PLANET OF THE APES
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform them into a realistic simian humanoid inhabiting the Planet of the Apes universe.

SIMIAN TYPE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• SELECT EXACTLY ONE simian type using the RANDOM SEED
• Use LAST DIGIT modulo 4:
  - 0: CHIMPANZEE — intelligent, expressive, scientific or philosophical demeanor
  - 1: GORILLA — powerful, militaristic, authoritative presence
  - 2: ORANGUTAN — older, wise, political or leadership-focused appearance
  - 3: BONOBO — softer facial structure, social and empathetic demeanor

IDENTITY TRANSFORMATION (CRITICAL):
• The subject must be fully transformed into a simian humanoid, not simply wearing makeup or prosthetics
• Preserve the subject’s unique facial characteristics including eye shape, brow structure, nose proportions, mouth shape, and expression
• The final simian face must clearly resemble the original subject in identity and likeness
• Avoid generic ape faces or simple face swaps
• Skin, fur, and musculature must be biologically integrated and anatomically believable

APPEARANCE AND DETAIL:
• Realistic fur density, direction, and coloration appropriate to the selected simian type
• Expressive, human-like eyes that retain the subject’s recognizable gaze
• Subtle facial asymmetry carried over from the subject
• Period-appropriate clothing or armor from the Planet of the Apes universe

ENVIRONMENT (MANDATORY):
• Background must resemble the Planet of the Apes world
• Ruined or reclaimed human architecture overtaken by nature
• Primitive yet organized simian civilization elements
• Earthy tones, natural materials, and post-apocalyptic atmosphere

STYLE AND REALISM:
• Cinematic realism inspired by classic and modern Planet of the Apes films
• Dramatic but natural lighting
• Photorealistic textures and anatomy
• Serious tone, not parody

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a cinematic still from Planet of the Apes, featuring a fully transformed simian humanoid that unmistakably resembles the original subject, existing naturally within that universe.

name: PLAYBILL
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a complete, physical Playbill theater program booklet. The entire Playbill booklet must be fully visible within the frame, including the cover, edges, and proportions of a real printed program.

Design the front cover in classic Playbill style, with the bold Playbill header at the top and a theatrical production title beneath it. Feature the subject prominently on the cover as the star performer, rendered in a dramatic or comedic stage pose and integrated naturally into the cover art.

Ensure the subject appears printed on the cover itself, not floating above it, with realistic lighting, paper texture, slight wear, and subtle printing imperfections. Add stage-themed design elements such as curtains, spotlights, marquee lights, or silhouettes to reinforce the theatrical setting.

Include humorous or over-the-top flavor text describing the subject’s role or performance (e.g., 'A One-Person Musical About Snacks,' 'Winner of Seven Imaginary Awards'). All text should be legible and balanced for small screens.

The booklet should appear photographed against a relevant background (theater seat, stage floor, lobby surface, or neutral setting). Keep the entire Playbill booklet, including borders and corners, fully in frame and clearly readable. The final image should feel like an authentic, collectible theater program.

name: PLAY-DOH
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a hand-modeled Play-Doh figure, as if someone sculpted the subject entirely out of colorful Play-Doh modeling compound.

CORE CONCEPT (NON-NEGOTIABLE):
• The subject must be fully sculpted from Play-Doh
• This is NOT paint, NOT plastic, NOT clay
• The figure must look soft, pressed, and hand-formed

MATERIAL RULES (CRITICAL):
• Matte, doughy texture with slight cracking and compression
• Visible fingerprints, seams, and tool marks
• Rounded edges and imperfect symmetry
