• Slight sagging or gravity deformation

COLOR RULES:
• Bright, saturated Play-Doh colors
• Multiple colors used for different body parts
• Colors may be unrealistic or playful
• No realistic skin tones required

IDENTITY PRESERVATION:
• Facial proportions and expression must match the subject
• Simplification allowed, but no generic character shapes
• The figure must still read as the subject

ANTI-CHEATING RULES:
• NO photoreal skin texture
• NO smooth 3D-render look
• NO waxy or plastic materials
• NO digitally perfect edges

POSE & SCALE:
• Figure posed upright, seated, or mid-action
• Scale should suggest a tabletop sculpture or toy
• Environment may include Play-Doh tools or flat surface

LIGHTING & PRESENTATION:
• Soft lighting to emphasize texture
• Shadows should reveal dents and seams
• Neutral background or play-table setting

FINAL RESULT:
The image must look like a real hand-sculpted Play-Doh figure modeled to resemble the subject, complete with fingerprints, seams, bright colors, and soft doughy texture — unmistakably made from Play-Doh.

name: PLAYING CARD
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a playing card character with ornate design and royal styling.

CARD SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a card, USE THAT CARD
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 16:
  - 0: King of Hearts (Suicide King - sword behind head, no mustache, ornate red hearts, regal crown)
  - 1: King of Diamonds (Julius Caesar profile, axe, yellow diamonds, sideways facing)
  - 2: King of Clubs (Alexander the Great, orb and scepter, black clubs, military bearing)
  - 3: King of Spades (David, sword and harp, black spades, wise king)
  - 4: Queen of Hearts (Judith, flower, red hearts, benevolent expression)
  - 5: Queen of Diamonds (Rachel, yellow diamonds, holding mirror or jewel)
  - 6: Queen of Clubs (Argine, black clubs, flower or fan, regal seated)
  - 7: Queen of Spades (Pallas Athena, spear or staff, black spades, warrior queen)
  - 8: Jack of Hearts (La Hire, red hearts, feathered cap, youthful knave)
  - 9: Jack of Diamonds (Hector, yellow diamonds, profile view, warrior bearing)
  - 10: Jack of Clubs (Lancelot, black clubs, medieval knight attire)
  - 11: Jack of Spades (Ogier the Dane, black spades, holding weapon)
  - 12: Ace of Spades (ornate large spade symbol, most decorative card, death card styling)
  - 13: Joker (wild card - jester bells, motley costume, mischievous grin, both red and black)
  - 14: Ace of Hearts (large ornate heart, romantic styling)
  - 15: Ace of Diamonds (large ornate diamond, wealth and luxury styling)

TRANSFORM THE SUBJECT:
• Subject's face as the card character's face
• Royal/medieval attire appropriate to card rank
• Crown for Kings, elegant headdress for Queens, feathered cap for Jacks
• Ornate costume with suit symbols integrated into design
• Mirrored/symmetrical composition (top and bottom identical but inverted)
• Flat, stylized playing card aesthetic

CARD DESIGN ELEMENTS:
• Large suit symbols (hearts, diamonds, clubs, spades) in corners
• Card rank letter/number visible (K, Q, J, A)
• Ornate border decoration
• Rich colors - red for hearts/diamonds, black for clubs/spades
• Symmetrical mirrored design (character appears both right-side up and upside down)
• Decorative flourishes and patterns

STYLE:
• Traditional playing card illustration style
• Flat, graphic, decorative
• Bold colors and strong outlines
• Medieval/Renaissance costume styling
• Subject appears as if printed on actual playing card

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like an actual ornate playing card with the subject's face as the royal character, complete with symmetrical mirrored design, suit symbols, and traditional playing card styling and decoration.

name: PLUSH TOY
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a plush toy. Soft fabric, stitching details. Cute proportions.

name: POINTILLISM
message: Take a picture in the style of Pointillism Art. Complementary colors are placed next to each other to intensify each hue and create vibrancy as the viewer eye optically blends the dots from a distance. Made entirely of tiny, colorful dots.

name: PODCAST GUEST
message:
Take a picture and place the subject as a guest being interviewed on a famous podcast set. The subject appears seated at a professional podcast table with microphones, headphones, and studio lighting. The background resembles a recognizable podcast studio style inspired by well-known shows. Camera angles, LED lighting, acoustic panels, and broadcast realism. The subject remains clearly identifiable.

PODCAST SHOW SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• SELECT EXACTLY ONE option using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Do NOT choose based on popularity, visual interest, or defaults

For 10 options:
• Use LAST DIGIT to select:
  - 0: The Joe Rogan Experience style (brick wall, warm lighting, casual setup)
  - 1: Piers Morgan Uncensored style (formal desk, British broadcasting aesthetic)
  - 2: Club Random style (Bill Maher's bar setting, intimate conversation space)
  - 3: The Ben Shapiro Show style (clean modern set, professional backdrop)
  - 4: Megyn Kelly Show style (bright contemporary studio, polished presentation)
  - 5: Triggernometry style (minimalist setup, focused on conversation)
  - 6: SmartLess style (relaxed modern studio, friendly atmosphere)
  - 7: Call Her Daddy style (pink neon aesthetic, bold contemporary design)
  - 8: Flagrant style (NYC loft vibes, edgy casual setup)
  - 9: The Diary of a CEO style (sleek minimal design, dramatic lighting)

The selected podcast style should influence the studio design, lighting, and overall atmosphere while keeping the subject clearly identifiable.

name: POKÉDEX
message:
Take a picture and detect the primary real-world subject, then present it as a Pokédex-style information card.

CRITICAL — SUBJECT SELECTION:
• Identify ONE primary subject that is most visually dominant
• Subject must be REAL and clearly visible
• Allowed subject types:
  - Plant
  - Animal
  - Insect
  - Fungus
  - Rock / Mineral
  - Object (tool, food, artifact)
• If multiple subjects exist, select the most visually prominent one
• Fictional creatures are NOT allowed

CONFIDENCE RULE:
• If the subject cannot be identified with high confidence:
  - Use the closest accurate classification
  - Label the name as "Unidentified [Category]"
  - Describe observable traits only
• Do NOT guess species or scientific names when uncertain

CLASSIFICATION:
• Classify the subject using real-world taxonomy or category
• Examples:
  - Plant → flowering plant, tree, succulent, herb
  - Animal → mammal, bird, reptile, amphibian, fish
  - Insect → beetle, butterfly, ant, spider
  - Object → household item, tool, food, natural object

POKÉDEX CARD LAYOUT (MANDATORY):
• Render a clean, readable Pokédex-style card
• Entire card must be visible in-frame
• Card must include:
  - Dex Index Number (non-fictional catalog number, e.g. Dex #0421)
  - Subject Name (common name or "Unidentified [Category]")
  - Category / Type
  - Scientific or formal name (ONLY if confidently known)
  - One verified real-world fact or behavior

FACT REQUIREMENTS:
• Fact must be real, educational, and verifiable
• Examples:
  - Ecological role
  - Survival trait
  - Functional purpose
  - Historical or cultural relevance
• No myths, memes, or speculative trivia

TEXT LIMITS:
• All text must fit cleanly within the card
• No paragraph longer than two lines
• Clear hierarchy: name > category > fact

IMAGE REQUIREMENTS:
• Include a clear rendered image or photo-style depiction of the subject
• Subject image must match the identified object exactly
• No stylization that obscures identification
• Image may be framed inside the card or featured prominently

BACKGROUND:
• The Pokédex card must be shown in full view
• A relevant environment appears BEHIND the card:
  - Natural habitat for plants, animals, insects
  - Geological setting for rocks/minerals
  - Neutral lab, archive, or contextual setting for objects
• Background must not interfere with readability

VISUAL VARIATION (SEED-DRIVEN):
• Use internal seed to subtly vary:
  - Card accent color
  - Panel line style
  - Icon placement
• Content, layout structure, and readability must remain consistent

STYLE:
• Clean, modern Pokédex / field-guide aesthetic
• Educational and reference-quality
• Minimal clutter
• Subtle UI accents (lines, panels, icons)

NOT ALLOWED:
• Fictional creatures
• Fake or exaggerated facts
• Meme text or jokes
• Overly cartoonish rendering
• Cropped or partial cards
• Zoomed-in or cut-off UI

FULL FRAME REQUIREMENT:
• Entire Pokédex card visible
• All corners visible
• Card functions as a standalone reference

FINAL RESULT:
The image must function as a real-world Pokédex entry — a complete, clearly framed information card that accurately classifies the photographed subject, presents one verified educational fact, uses a non-fictional catalog index, and displays the full card against a relevant background with subtle seed-based visual variation.

name: POKEMON CARD
message: Take a picture and make it into a pokemon card, add abilities and flavor text inspired by the content of the image. The result should be a full view of the card with a relevant background behind the card.

name: POLAROID
message:
Take a picture and transform it into an authentic instant-film photograph aesthetic. Frame the image within a classic Polaroid-style border with a thicker white margin at the bottom.

TEXT HANDLING:
• If an external master prompt provides text, handwriting, or notes, render it naturally on the thick bottom margin
• Text should resemble handwritten or stamped Polaroid captions

Apply subtle film grain, soft focus, slight color fading, and natural vignetting consistent with instant photography. Include gentle imperfections such as light leaks or minor exposure variation for realism. Ensure the subject remains clearly recognizable and centered within the frame. Render the final image to convincingly resemble a real printed instant photo.

name: POLICE LINEUP
message:
Take a picture and place the subject in a police lineup where they are CLEARLY different from everyone else, creating an obviously unfair identification scenario. The subject stands against a height-marked wall with lineup numbers, looking dumbfounded, confused, or exasperated at the absurdity. The subject's expression shows they know this isn't a fair lineup.

LINEUP MISMATCH SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies the type of mismatch, USE that specified type
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE option using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Do NOT choose based on popularity, visual interest, or defaults

For 5 options:
• Use LAST DIGIT modulo 5:
  - 0: Height Mismatch - TALLEST: The subject towers over all other lineup members by at least 2 feet, making them comically obvious
  - 1: Height Mismatch - SHORTEST: The subject is dramatically shorter than everyone else, barely reaching the others' shoulders
  - 2: Gender Mismatch: Everyone else in the lineup is clearly the opposite gender from the subject
  - 3: Age Mismatch: The subject is surrounded by people of drastically different ages (all elderly or all children)
  - 4: Race Mismatch: Everyone else in the lineup is clearly a different race/ethnicity from the subject

Police station lighting, institutional green walls, harsh fluorescent lights, mugshot photography aesthetic. The absurdity should be immediately obvious.

name: POLICE SKETCH
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a classic police sketch as if created from a witness description. Depict the subject as a hand-drawn pencil or charcoal sketch on off-white paper, using strong line work, cross-hatching, and shading to define facial structure and key features.

Simplify and alter details so the sketch is approximate rather than an exact replica of the subject. Preserve general identifying characteristics such as face shape, eyes, nose, mouth, hairline, and expression, but introduce small deviations consistent with a sketch from memory.

Use a neutral background with slight paper texture. Add text and police case numbers. The final image should feel serious, observational, and readable on a small screen, reflecting the imperfection of eyewitness recall.

name: POLLOCK
message: Take a picture and reinterpret it through abstract expressionism inspired by Jackson Pollock. Overlay energetic splatters, drips, and layered paint textures while allowing hints of the original subject to remain visible beneath the chaos. The final image should feel raw, spontaneous, and motion-filled.

name: POLITICAL BANNER
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into the star of a humorous political campaign banner.

Design the image to look like a real campaign poster or rally banner with bold typography, patriotic colors, stars, stripes, and dramatic lighting. The subject should appear as a confident candidate or mascot, posed heroically like they are running for office.

Invent a completely fictional, absurd campaign theme based on the subject’s appearance, clothing, pose, or environment — or use external master prompt text as the campaign platform. Examples:
• 'Running for President of Florida'
• 'Vote for Steve: More Coffee, Less Meetings'
• '2028: The Only One Who Knows Where the Remote Is'

Include:
• a fake campaign slogan
• a fictional office or cause
• a large election year (real or ridiculous)

Do NOT reference real politicians, real political parties, or real political issues. Everything must be parody, fictional, and harmless.

The banner should feel like a real political sign or rally poster, but the content should be clearly silly and satirical. Ensure all text and the subject are fully visible and readable on a small screen.

name: POLITICAL CARTOON
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a classic political cartoon–style illustration.

Render the subject with exaggerated facial features, oversized expressions, and bold ink outlines, like a newspaper editorial cartoon. The subject should be the main caricature, not a background figure.

Invent a fictional, humorous issue, campaign, or cause based on the subject’s appearance, posture, clothing, or environment — or use external master prompt text as the cartoon’s theme. Examples:
• 'The Flatulence Shortage'
• 'The War on Baldness'
• 'The Campaign For Less Body Odor'

Place the subject into a symbolic scene that visually represents the joke — such as standing at a podium, arguing with a cartoon object, battling a pile of paperwork, or leading a ridiculous parade.

Include cartoon-style labels on objects, signs, or banners to explain the joke (e.g., 'Too Many Emails', 'Monday Morning', 'Broken Remote Control').

Do NOT reference real political parties, politicians, or real-world political issues. Everything must be fictional, absurd, and clearly satirical.

The final image should look like a newspaper editorial cartoon: hand-drawn ink style, flat colors, strong linework, humorous exaggeration, and instantly readable on a small screen.

name: POOR RICHARD'S ALMANACK
message:
Take a picture and transform it into an authentic page from Poor Richard's Almanack by Benjamin Franklin. Render the subject as a central illustration in the style of 18th-century woodcut engravings with bold linework, cross-hatching, and period-accurate colonial American aesthetic. Surround the illustration with aged, yellowed paper showing foxing, stains, and worn edges typical of 1730s–1750s printed almanacs.

Include period-accurate typography using blackletter or colonial serif fonts for headers. Feature a famous Benjamin Franklin saying or proverb prominently on the page in large, clear text, such as 'Early to bed and early to rise, makes a man healthy, wealthy, and wise,' 'A penny saved is a penny earned,' or 'Well done is better than well said.' Ensure this saying is the **most prominent text element** and fully visible.

Optionally, add small marginal notes, weather predictions, or astronomical observations in smaller text around the edges. Include decorative borders, flourishes, and printer's ornaments typical of colonial printing. Render realistic ink impressions, slight printing misalignments, and other subtle imperfections to emulate a true 18th-century printed page.

Place the page fully within the frame with a relevant background behind it. Keep the entire almanac page, including borders, subject illustration, and text, **clearly visible and readable on small screens**. The final image should feel historically authentic, detailed, and visually rich while keeping the subject integrated into the almanac page.

name: POP ART
message: Take a picture and make it Pop Art. Employs vibrant, bold colors, simplified imagery, and techniques from the commercial world like screen-printing, often with a sense of humor, irony, or wit.

name: POP SURREALISM
message: Take a picture and transform the image into pop surrealism artwork that blends cartoon aesthetics with darker psychological themes, creating art that's simultaneously playful and unsettling. Use high contrast and exaggerated proportions to amplify the surreal, uncanny nature of the artwork. Incorporate a vibrant, psychedelic color palette with unexpected color choices that make characters and environments visually striking. Blend familiar pop culture references with unexpected, dream-like, or slightly disturbing elements to create intrigue and unease. Large expressive eyes, smooth gradient shading, glossy finish, lowbrow art movement influence. The subject should feel both whimsical and slightly eerie, cute but with an edge of darkness. Gallery-quality illustration with commercial art polish.

name: POP-UP BOOK
message:
Take a picture and transform the entire scene into a physical pop-up book made of paper. The subject should be constructed entirely as a pop-up paper structure that rises upward from folded paper layers attached to the book’s pages.

The subject must emerge directly from the page through visible folds, hinges, tabs, and layered paper planes. The body, face, and features should be formed from flat paper pieces assembled into a three-dimensional pop-up mechanism, clearly connected to the page surface.

Show the open book with two facing pages visible. The pop-up elements should clearly originate from the folds of the pages and extend upward, as if they would collapse flat when the book is closed.

Use realistic paper textures, visible creases, cut edges, and paper thickness. All materials must look like paper—no skin, fabric, plastic, or realistic surfaces. Lighting and shadows should emphasize the layered paper construction. The final image should look like a photographed pop-up book page where the subject is part of the paper engineering itself.

name: PORCELAIN
message: Take a picture and make the subject a porcelain sculpture. Glossy ceramic finish.

name: PORTRAIT
message: Take a picture in the style of Photorealistic Portrait. Frame the picture in a dark black wood frame.

name: POSSESSED
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into someone being possessed by a demonic entity.

POSSESSION STAGE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies stage, USE THAT STAGE
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST DIGIT:
  - 0: Initial Possession - eyes beginning to change, subtle darkness, first signs
  - 1: Mid-Possession - eyes fully changed, veins showing, floating slightly, demonic presence
  - 2: Full Possession - completely taken over, levitating, contorted, demonic entity in control
  - 3: Exorcism Moment - thrashing, religious symbols burning, demon fighting to stay
  - 4: Head Rotation - classic head turning 180-360 degrees, neck twisted
  - 5: Levitation - floating above ground/bed, arms spread, hair floating, gravity defied
  - 6: Spider Walk - contorted backwards, crawling unnaturally, broken joints
  - 7: Wall Crawling - defying gravity, crawling on walls or ceiling like insect
  - 8: Multiple Voices - mouth open wide, multiple demonic voices emanating, distorted
  - 9: Demonic Revelation - demon showing itself through host, monstrous features emerging

SUBJECT RECOGNITION:
• Subject's face CLEARLY RECOGNIZABLE
• This is the SUBJECT being possessed
• NOT a generic demon face
• Subject's features visible but corrupted
• Identity maintained through possession

POSSESSED PHYSICAL CHANGES:
• Eyes:
  - Rolled back (whites showing) OR
  - Solid black (no pupils) OR
  - Glowing (red, yellow, white) OR
  - Demonic (reptilian, cat-like)
• Skin:
  - Pale, drained of color
  - Gray or ashen
  - Veins visible (black/dark)
  - Cracked or dried
  - Unhealthy appearance
• Mouth:
  - Open unnaturally wide
  - Black interior
  - Sharp teeth emerging
  - Dark liquid dripping
  - Multiple rows of teeth

BODY CONTORTION:
• Joints bent wrong way
• Back arched impossibly
• Neck twisted
• Limbs at unnatural angles
• Spine curved abnormally
• Fingers and toes bent back
• Dislocated appearance
• Inhuman flexibility

LEVITATION:
• Floating above ground/bed/floor
• 1-6 feet in air
• Arms spread wide OR limp
• Hair floating upward (defying gravity)
• Clothing billowing
• Weightless appearance
• No support visible

HAIR:
• Standing on end
• Floating upward
• Wild and unkempt
• Static electricity look
• Possessed by entity
• Moving on its own

CLOTHING:
• Torn and disheveled
• Nightgown or hospital gown (classic)
• Regular clothes in disarray
• Stained or bloodied
• Floating with levitation
• Ripped from struggle

DEMONIC MANIFESTATIONS:
• Dark shadow around subject
• Smoke or mist emanating
• Demonic face superimposed faintly
• Red or green ethereal glow
• Symbols appearing on skin
• Scratch marks appearing
• Burns from holy items

ENVIRONMENT EFFECTS:
• Objects floating or flying
• Furniture overturned
• Crosses upside down
• Religious items burning/smoking
• Lights flickering
• Shadows moving independently
• Windows/doors slamming
• Temperature drop (frost visible)

SETTING:
• Bedroom (classic exorcism)
• Church or chapel
• Hospital room
• Attic or basement
• Abandoned building
• Psychiatric facility
• Home interior
• Ritual chamber

RELIGIOUS ELEMENTS:
• Crosses burning on skin
• Holy water causing smoke
• Bible present
• Priests/exorcists nearby
• Religious symbols on walls
• Candles lit
• Rosary beads
• Latin text visible

VOCAL MANIFESTATION:
• Mouth open in scream
• Multiple voices suggested
• Deep demonic voice implied
• Speaking in tongues
• Ancient languages
• Distorted sound waves visible
• Demonic roar

VIOLENCE/STRUGGLE:
• Restraints (ropes, chains) breaking
• Self-harm marks
• Thrashing violently
• Fighting exorcists
• Destruction around them
• Superhuman strength evident
• Battle between host and demon

LIGHTING:
• Dark, shadowy atmosphere
• Single light source (candle, lamp)
• Dramatic shadows
• Flickering lights
• Supernatural glow from eyes
• High contrast
• Ominous darkness
• Backlighting for silhouette

ATMOSPHERE:
• Terrifying, horrific
• Evil presence palpable
• Spiritual warfare
• Life-or-death struggle
• Ancient evil
• Religious horror
• Desperate fight for soul

HORROR MOVIE REFERENCES:
• The Exorcist aesthetic
• Conjuring universe style
• Evil Dead possession
• Insidious demon presence
• Classic horror cinematography

POSE (Stage-specific):
• Levitating: Arms spread, floating
• Contorted: Body bent wrong ways
• Crawling: Spider-walk or ceiling crawl
• Thrashing: Violent struggle
• Head rotation: Neck twisted
• Revelation: Demon emerging

EXPRESSION:
• Rage and hatred
• Evil grin or sneer
• Blank possessed stare
• Tormented (host trying to resist)
• Demonic malevolence
• Inhuman intelligence
• Ancient evil

STYLE:
• Photorealistic horror
• Horror movie quality
• Practical effects aesthetic
• CGI enhancement
• Documentary exorcism footage
• Cinematic horror

NOT ALLOWED:
• Disrespectful to actual religious practices
• Gratuitous gore
• Pornographic elements
• Making light of spiritual warfare

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject clearly recognizable but in a state of demonic possession - with eyes changed (rolled back/black/glowing), pale skin with dark veins, body contorted or levitating, in a dark bedroom or church setting with religious symbols, flickering lights, and objects floating - capturing that terrifying horror movie moment of spiritual warfare with photorealistic quality and dramatic lighting that shows the struggle between host and demon.

name: POSTCARD
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a physical vintage-style tourist postcard.

Design the postcard using classic souvenir postcard aesthetics: bold city lettering, saturated colors, slightly dated typography, and a cheerful, kitschy layout. Select a city automatically or use one provided via external master prompt.

Integrate the subject naturally into the postcard image as part of the photographed scene, not pasted on top. The subject should feel printed directly onto the card.

Include prominent text reading "WISH YOU WERE HERE" in a large, playful postcard-style font. The text must be clearly legible and feel printed on the card surface.

Add subtle wear details such as rounded corners, slight fading, paper texture, minor creases, or edge wear so the postcard feels handled and mailed.

Ensure the entire postcard is fully visible within the frame, including borders. The postcard should appear resting on a surface or held, with a relevant background visible behind the card.

The final image should feel nostalgic, friendly, and unmistakably like a real souvenir postcard — clearly readable on a small screen.

name: POSTERIZED
message:
Take a picture and place the subject on a poster.

POSTER TYPE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies type, USE THAT TYPE
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 19:
  - 0: 1960s Psychedelic Concert - swirling colors, Art Nouveau lettering, Fillmore aesthetic
  - 1: 1970s Arena Rock - dramatic photo, pyrotechnics, stadium tour, Led Zeppelin style
  - 2: 1980s Heavy Metal - leather, spikes, airbrushed art, Judas Priest aesthetic
  - 3: 1990s Grunge - DIY photocopied look, ripped poster, Pearl Jam/Nirvana style
  - 4: 2000s Pop Punk - cartoon graphics, bright colors, Warped Tour aesthetic
  - 5: Modern Festival - clean design, lineup typography, Coachella/Lollapalooza style
  - 6: Teen Idol Bedroom Poster - dreamy soft focus, "Your Name Here Loves YOU!", Tiger Beat style
  - 7: Boy Band Poster - coordinated outfits, posed together, 1990s/2000s heartthrob energy
  - 8: Sexy Model Poster - provocative pose, Sports Illustrated/Maxim aesthetic
  - 9: Inspirational Athlete - subject as sports star, "DEDICATION" or "HUSTLE", Nike ad style
  - 10: Bad Romance Novel Cover - Fabio-style, shirtless, windswept, dramatic embrace
  - 11: 1980s Action Movie - explosions, guns, one-liner tagline, Schwarzenegger style
  - 12: K-Pop Idol - glossy perfection, Korean text, coordinated group, intense beauty
  - 13: Country Star - cowboy hat, pickup truck, rural, "Live at Grand Ole Opry"
  - 14: Punk Rock DIY - photocopied, hand-drawn, safety pins, anarchist aesthetic, CBGB style
  - 15: Celebrity Mugshot Poster - police lineup, glamorous edge, height chart parody
  - 16: Soap Opera Star - dramatic lighting, "Torn Between Two Lovers", melodramatic tagline
  - 17: Reality TV Star - "The REAL Story!", tabloid energy, confessional pose
  - 18: Motivational Speaker - arms crossed, "TRANSFORM YOUR LIFE", Tony Robbins energy

POSTER DESIGN ELEMENTS:
• Subject as central figure
• Large prominent photo/image
• Typography appropriate to poster type
• Tagline or flavor text (humorous or dramatic)
• Poster-specific graphics and design
• Color scheme matching era/style

HUMOROUS FLAVOR TEXT (Examples based on type):
• Teen Idol: "[Subject Name] wants to meet YOU!", "Dream Date Secrets Inside!"
• Concert: "ONE NIGHT ONLY!", "SOLD OUT TOUR!"
• Romance Novel: "Forbidden Passion", "Her Heart's Desire"
• Action Movie: "This Time It's Personal", "One Man. One Mission."
• K-Pop: Korean text mixed with English, "World Tour 2026"
• Motivational: "BELIEVE IN YOURSELF", "No Excuses!"
• Punk: "No Future", "Anarchy Now"
• Boy Band: "The Hottest Group on the Planet!"
• Reality TV: "You Won't BELIEVE What Happens Next!"
• Mugshot: "Arrested for Being Too [Attractive/Cool]"

FULL POSTER VISIBLE:
• Complete poster shown
• All corners visible
• No cropping
• Poster edges clear
• Could be on wall or flat surface

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject on a complete poster in the selected style with accurate era-specific design, typography, and humorous genre-aware flavor text, appearing as a believable real-world poster while embracing over-the-top parody.

name: POTATO
message: Take a picture and make the subject into a potato.  Preserve recognizable traits humorously.

name: POTTER
message: Take a picture and place the subject naturally within a detailed, cinematic scene from the Harry Potter universe. Preserve the subject’s facial identity. Surround the subject with authentic Hogwarts scenery—enchanted castle halls, floating candles, spell effects, and magical ambiance. Match the film’s lighting and color grading for realism. Capture depth and atmosphere similar to the movies, with subtle magical motion or glow around wands and objects. Maintain the subject’s natural facial features and proportions while blending clothing and environment into the Hogwarts world. Render in ultra-realistic 8K, with soft volumetric lighting, depth of field, and fantasy realism. Based on the subject’s personality, traits, and characteristics, assign the subject to one of the four Hogwarts houses and have them wear the corresponding house robes: Gryffindor (brave, daring, chivalrous, red & gold, lion), Slytherin (ambitious, cunning, resourceful, green & silver, serpent), Ravenclaw (wise, creative, intellectual, blue & bronze, eagle), or Hufflepuff (loyal, kind, hardworking, yellow & black, badger). Ensure the house choice aligns with the subject’s personality and integrates naturally into the scene.

name: POV
message:
Take a picture and transform it so the camera perspective is from a non-human point of view, as if the viewer IS the creature looking at the subject.

POV SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a POV creature, USE THAT
• If no POV is specified externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST DIGIT of the RANDOM SEED modulo 6:
  - 0: Dog POV (low angle, wide lens, nose visible at bottom of frame)
  - 1: Cat POV (slightly elevated angle, whiskers or nose visible)
  - 2: Baby POV (lying down or seated low, soft hands or nose visible)
  - 3: Fly POV (extreme wide-angle distortion, compound-eye feel, proboscis visible)
  - 4: Rat POV (ground-level, nose and whiskers visible, enclosed space feel)
  - 5: Bird POV (slightly overhead or perched angle, beak tip visible)

POV RULES:
• The tip of the nose, beak, or proboscis MUST be visible in-frame
• This confirms the viewer inhabits the POV
• Perspective distortion must match the creature

SUBJECT RULES:
• Subject remains recognizable
• Subject appears much larger due to POV scale
• Subject is interacting naturally with the POV creature or noticing it

TONE:
• Lighthearted, funny, and charming
• Not creepy or horror
• Feels like an accidental snapshot

ENVIRONMENT:
• Environment scaled and framed correctly for POV height
• Objects appear oversized or looming appropriately

CAMERA:
• Strong perspective distortion when appropriate
• Natural framing, not staged or centered

RESTRICTIONS:
• No cartoon or animated styles
• No text overlays or captions
• No third-person camera views

FINAL RESULT:
The image should convincingly place the viewer inside the creature's point of view, with the subject reacting naturally — as if they are being looked at by the animal, insect, or baby.

name: POWERPUFF GIRLS
message: Take a picture in the style of a Powerpuff girls animation.

name: PRE-RAPHAELITE
message: Take a picture and transform the image into Pre-Raphaelite style painting. Vivid colors, detailed textures, medieval or literary elements, and highly idealized subject portrayal.

name: PREDATOR VISION
message:
Take a picture and transform the entire scene into the iconic thermal imaging view as seen through a Predator's bio-mask helmet from the Predator film franchise. Convert the image into the distinctive heat-vision display with its characteristic color gradients, scanning lines, and alien technology aesthetic.

CRITICAL TRANSFORMATION RULES:
• This is a FULL THERMAL VISION transformation of the entire scene
• Every element must be rendered as heat signatures and thermal gradients
• The image must look exactly like footage viewed through Predator helmet optics
• Maintain spatial relationships and composition of original image
• Apply the distinctive color palette and visual effects of Predator vision
• No normal photography elements - pure thermal/bio-mask display

THERMAL HEAT SIGNATURE MAPPING:
• LIVING BEINGS (humans, animals):
  - Bright yellow/white core (hottest body heat)
  - Orange/red outer body regions (warm areas)
  - Yellow highlights on exposed skin (face, hands, arms)
  - Cooler blue/purple tones for clothing covering body
  - Breath vapor visible as orange/yellow wisps in cold air
  - Heat patterns show muscle groups and blood flow
  - Eyes appear as bright yellow/white spots
  - Recent movement creates thermal trails
  - Clearly outlined silhouettes with internal heat gradients
  - Facial features visible through heat mapping
• RECENTLY TOUCHED OBJECTS:
  - Orange/yellow heat residue where hands touched
  - Warm spots on steering wheels, door handles, chairs
  - Footprints showing heat signature on ground
  - Gradual cooling visible (orange fading to blue)
• WARM OBJECTS/EQUIPMENT:
  - Electronics: orange/red from internal heat
  - Light sources: bright yellow/white (hot)
  - Engines/motors: red/orange hot spots
  - Recently fired weapons: orange barrel heat
  - Coffee cups, food: warm yellow/orange signatures
• AMBIENT TEMPERATURE OBJECTS:
  - Cool objects: deep blue and purple tones
  - Metal objects: blue-teal (conducts heat away)
  - Stone/concrete: medium blue
  - Wood: lighter blue
  - Glass: teal blue (slightly transparent to thermal)
• COLD OBJECTS:
  - Ice/snow: deep purple and dark blue
  - Air conditioning vents: purple outflow
  - Refrigerated items: purple signatures
• ENVIRONMENT:
  - Sky: gradient from dark purple (cold) to lighter blue
  - Ground: varies by temperature and sun exposure
  - Shadows: cooler blue/purple tones
  - Sunlit areas: warmer teal/cyan tones
  - Water: depends on temperature (cold = purple, warm = cyan)

PREDATOR BIO-MASK VISUAL EFFECTS:
• SCAN LINES AND INTERFERENCE:
  - Horizontal scan lines across entire image (subtle but visible)
  - Occasional static interference patterns
  - VHS-style tracking noise
  - Digital glitches or pixel distortions
  - Faint vertical lines suggesting display technology
• HEADS-UP DISPLAY ELEMENTS:
  - Targeting reticle (three red dots in triangular formation)
  - Corner brackets or crosshairs
  - Alien text/symbols in corners (Yautja script-style)
  - Range-finding overlay lines
  - Optional: plasma caster targeting laser (three red dots on target)
  - Edge vignette (rounded corners suggesting helmet view)
  - Digital readout numbers or alien symbols at edges
• VISUAL ARTIFACTS:
  - Slight chromatic aberration at edges
  - Lens distortion (subtle fish-eye effect)
  - Electronic shimmer or warping effect
  - Phosphorescent glow on bright heat sources
  - Motion blur on fast-moving heat signatures
  - Trailing afterimages on bright objects

COLOR PALETTE (CRITICAL):
• PRIMARY COLORS (heat to cold gradient):
  - WHITE: Extreme heat (fires, very hot objects)
  - BRIGHT YELLOW: High heat (human core body temperature, lights)
  - ORANGE: Warm heat (outer body areas, warm objects)
  - RED: Moderate heat (recently touched surfaces)
  - MAGENTA/PINK: Warm-neutral transition
  - CYAN/TEAL: Cool-neutral (ambient temperature)
  - LIGHT BLUE: Cool objects
  - DARK BLUE: Cold objects
  - PURPLE: Very cold (shadows, ice)
  - NEAR BLACK: Extreme cold or background
• Color transitions are smooth gradients, not sharp divisions
• Living beings show most dramatic color range (white to blue)
• Background environment mostly blue/purple/teal tones
• High contrast between hot and cold elements

THERMAL IMAGING CHARACTERISTICS:
• No visible light photography elements
• Edges of objects glow slightly based on temperature difference
• Heat dissipates in visible gradients (hot center to cool edges)
• Reflective surfaces may show thermal reflections
• Transparent objects (glass) show partial thermal transmission
• Thick materials block heat signatures (people behind walls = invisible)
• Thin materials show heat bleed-through (someone behind thin door = faint outline)
• Distance causes slight thermal diffusion (further = less sharp)

ATMOSPHERIC EFFECTS:
• Fog/mist: visible as temperature variations (slightly warmer or cooler than air)
• Rain: visible as cooling streaks (blue lines falling)
• Snow: extremely cold (deep purple) particles
• Smoke: varies (hot smoke = orange, cool smoke = purple)
• Steam: bright yellow/orange (very hot)
• Breath vapor: orange/yellow wisps in cold environments
• Heat shimmer from hot sources (visible distortion)

TECHNICAL DISPLAY CHARACTERISTICS:
• Slight grain/noise throughout image (sensor noise)
• Brightness consistent with alien display technology
• Sharp contrast between heat sources and background
• No shadows in traditional sense - only thermal differences
• Darker overall image with bright hot spots
• High dynamic range in thermal spectrum
• Digital display artifacts (not film grain, but electronic noise)

FRAME COMPOSITION:
• Rounded corner vignette (viewing through helmet)
• Maintain original camera angle and perspective
• Slight fish-eye distortion at edges (helmet optics)
• Center is sharpest, edges slightly distorted
• Aspect ratio maintained but framed by helmet view
• Targeting elements overlay the scene without obscuring main subjects

SPECIAL PREDATOR-SPECIFIC ELEMENTS:
• Three-dot laser targeting sight (red dots in triangle)
• Alien HUD elements in corners
• Yautja script or symbols overlaid
• Range/distance indicators
• Weapon system status (if targeting a person)
• Scan patterns or analysis overlays
• Electronic chirping effect implied by static patterns

DETAIL AND CLARITY:
• Living beings should be instantly recognizable by silhouette
• Facial features visible through thermal mapping
• Individual heat signatures distinguishable
• High contrast on human subjects (brightest elements)
• Background environment clear but cooler-toned
• Movement can be implied through heat trails or blur
• Sharp focus on primary subjects, slight blur on distant elements

FINAL RESULT:
A complete thermal imaging transformation of the scene as viewed through a Predator's bio-mask helmet display. Every element is rendered as heat signatures with the iconic yellow-to-purple color gradient, featuring bright yellow/white human silhouettes with visible internal heat patterns, cooler blue/purple environmental elements, distinctive scan lines and electronic interference, alien HUD elements with targeting reticles and Yautja script, and the characteristic rounded vignette of viewing through helmet optics. The image must be instantly recognizable as Predator vision while maintaining the composition and recognizability of the original scene's subjects and spatial relationships. The effect should be cinematic, faithful to the films, and evoke the alien hunter's technological advantage - seeing the world through heat and allowing nothing to hide.

name: PRODUCT PLACEMENT OVERLOAD
message:
Take a picture and transform the scene so the subject and environment are filled with exaggerated commercial product placement.

PLACEMENT LOGIC (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies brands or products, USE THOSE
• If no brands are specified, SELECT RANDOM recognizable product types using the RANDOM SEED

CORE CONCEPT:
• Subject remains fully recognizable
• Logos, packaging, and ads appear everywhere naturally within the scene
• Products may appear on clothing, walls, handheld items, background billboards
• Over-the-top but visually coherent

STYLE:
• Photorealistic advertising look
• Bright commercial lighting
• Slightly absurd density of products
• Satirical but polished

RESTRICTIONS:
• No cartoon style
• No text overlays outside product branding

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like an aggressively sponsored moment where the subject exists inside a world saturated with product placement.

name: PRODUCT SAFETY RECALL
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a professional-looking product safety recall notice featuring the subject as the recalled product.

Design the image as a formal corporate recall poster or notice with a clean layout, neutral colors, and official warning-style formatting. Include a large product photo of the subject centered on the page.

Add humorous recall language such as 'Affected units may unexpectedly…' or 'Discontinue use if symptoms include…' based on the subject’s appearance or expression.

Include fake batch numbers, model codes, inspection stamps, and circular diagram callouts pointing to parts of the subject with labels. The text should be legible but clearly parody.

Ensure the entire recall notice page is fully visible, including margins and layout elements. The final image should feel like a real corporate recall document at first glance, with humor revealed on closer inspection.

name: PROFESSIONAL PORTRAIT
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a polished professional portrait suitable for LinkedIn or corporate use.

CORE CONCEPT:
• Smooth skin, remove blemishes, preserve natural texture
• Avoid over-smoothing to retain realistic facial details
• Subject remains clearly recognizable

BACKGROUND SELECTION (CRITICAL — CONTEXTUAL):
• If the subject’s clothing clearly indicates a profession or role, the background SHOULD reflect that context:
  – Nurse / Doctor coat → hospital corridor or clinical setting
  – Business suit → office or conference room
  – Chef coat → kitchen or culinary environment
  – Academic gown → library or classroom
  – Casual professional attire → neutral studio or modern workspace
• If no clear profession is indicated, select a neutral professional background

LIGHTING & COMPOSITION:
• Soft, flattering lighting
• Focus on subject’s face and upper body
• Depth-of-field to gently blur background while keeping it contextually readable
• Clean, modern, professional composition

STYLE:
• Photorealistic portrait
• Natural colors, accurate skin tone
• Minimal shadows and highlights
• Avoid props that distract from professionalism

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a professional headshot or portrait, with a contextually appropriate background based on the subject’s attire, while keeping the subject’s face fully recognizable and polished for professional use.

name: PROFILE
message: Take a picture and transform it into a humorous FBI-style profile page. Design the layout to resemble an official dossier with structured sections such as subject name, profile photo, and case notes. Generate playful flavor text, including a fictional name and lighthearted, clearly fictional infractions inspired by the subject’s appearance, expression, clothing, and surroundings, incorporating any externally provided details naturally. Maintain a realistic document aesthetic while ensuring the tone is clearly comedic. Render the final image photorealistically with crisp text, believable formatting, and polished presentation.

name: PROPAGANDA POSTER
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform them into the heroic figure in a vintage propaganda-style poster.

The subject should be shown in a powerful, inspiring pose such as pointing forward, raising a fist, or leading a crowd.

Use bold colors, dramatic lighting, and strong graphic shapes typical of old propaganda artwork.

Include a large slogan or call-to-action on the poster using humorous or absurd flavor text. External master prompt text may be used to supply the slogan or theme.

The cause being promoted must be fictional and ridiculous, such as a campaign for snacks, naps, or avoiding Mondays.

The final image should look like a classic propaganda poster, bold, striking, and instantly readable.

name: PROTEST
message:
Take a picture and place the subject naturally into a realistic, non-political protest or demonstration scene. The subject should blend into a crowd of ordinary people as if they are genuinely participating, not staged or spotlighted.

The subject must be holding a clearly visible protest sign with a humorous, absurd, or lighthearted message inspired by the subject’s appearance, posture, expression, or surrounding context. The message should be playful and harmless (e.g., 'More Snacks, Less Responsibilities,' 'Justice for Left Socks,' 'End Meetings That Could’ve Been Emails'). The exact wording may be influenced by external flavor text or master prompts.

Ensure the sign looks authentic: handmade poster board or cardboard, bold marker lettering, slightly uneven edges, realistic hand grip, and natural perspective distortion. The sign text must be fully readable and entirely visible within the frame.

The environment should resemble a real protest setting (street, park, plaza, sidewalk) with believable crowd density, natural lighting, candid body language, and realistic depth of field. Avoid political slogans, symbols, or identifiable political figures.

The subject should not be isolated or overly centered — they should feel discovered within the crowd. Clothing, expressions, and posture should appear spontaneous and believable.

The final image must show the subject, their full protest sign, and enough surrounding context to clearly read the scene on a small screen. The tone should be comedic, observational, and visually convincing.

name: PS1 POLYGON MEMORY
message: Take a picture and transform it into a PlayStation 1–era 3D render. Use low-polygon geometry, warped textures, visible seams, and jittery perspective. Lighting should be flat or uneven. The subject should appear slightly uncanny, as if rendered by early 3D hardware.

name: PSA WARNING POSTER
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a realistic public safety warning poster or official PSA announcement featuring the subject as the cautionary example.

WARNING SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a warning, USE THAT EXACT WARNING
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 12:
  - 0: WARNING! DRUGS ARE BAD
  - 1: BEWARE! LOOKS SMARTER IN PICTURES
  - 2: WARNING! STOP WHEN YOU FEEL RESISTANCE
  - 3: WARNING! STAY IN SCHOOL
  - 4: BEWARE! USE BIRTH CONTROL
  - 5: WARNING! MAY CAUSE DROWSINESS
  - 6: BEWARE! WORLD NEEDS AN UNDO BUTTON
  - 7: WARNING! DON'T SNIFF GLUE
  - 8: BEWARE! ACCIDENTS CAN HAPPEN
  - 9: WARNING! THERE REALLY IS ONE BORN EVERY MINUTE
  - 10: BEWARE! WHAT HAPPENS WHEN YOU FORGET TO BREATHE
  - 11: WARNING! DO NOT FEED AFTER MIDNIGHT

FORMAT (MANDATORY):
• The headline must appear in large bold block lettering at the top
• Red, yellow, or black warning color scheme
• Official, serious tone
• Must look like a real government, school, or public safety poster
• No meme formatting

SUBJECT ROLE:
• The subject must be clearly demonstrating the warned behavior
• The image must visually support the headline
• Expression and pose must align with the warning message

POSTER DESIGN:
• Vintage 1970s–1990s PSA aesthetic
• Subtle print grain or halftone optional
• Realistic typography hierarchy
• Small official-style footer text (fictional department allowed)
• Clean layout with margin spacing

TONE:
• Completely serious presentation
• Dry, institutional delivery
• Humor comes from contrast between seriousness and subject behavior

IMPORTANT:
• Do not make it cartoonish
• Do not distort the subject unnaturally
• Maintain photorealistic poster presentation

FINAL RESULT:
The final image should look like a professionally printed public safety warning poster featuring the subject as the official cautionary example, with the headline determined strictly by the modulo random seed unless overridden by external master prompt.

name: PSYCH
message:
Take a picture and place the subject directly into a scene from the TV show Psych as if they are part of the episode.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• The subject is physically present in the world of Psych
• The tone balances light comedy with grounded realism
• The image feels like a real frame from the show
• A pineapple must be clearly visible in the scene

IDENTITY & ROLE RULES:
• The subject remains fully recognizable as themselves
• The subject is NOT replacing any existing character
• The subject appears as a guest character, consultant, or bystander
• Facial structure and identity are preserved

CHARACTER INTEGRATION:
• Main Psych characters may be present nearby
• Characters treat the subject as part of the scene
• Natural spacing, eye lines, and body language
• No exaggerated parody or caricature

PINEAPPLE REQUIREMENT (MANDATORY):
• A pineapple must be clearly visible and unmistakable
• Pineapple placement options include:
  – On a desk or counter
  – Being carried or held
  – Sitting in the background of the scene
• Pineapple must be in-focus and intentional
• No hidden or barely-visible pineapple

SCENE SELECTION (SEED-DRIVEN — SELECT EXACTLY ONE):
• Santa Barbara Police Department interior
• Crime scene investigation outdoors
• Psychic vision reveal moment
• Police briefing or interrogation room
• Casual detective banter scene

WARDROBE & STYLE:
• Subject clothing matches the casual-professional style of the show
• Light jackets, button-downs, casual layers, or smart-casual attire
• Colors and textures fit a sunny California setting

TONE & EXPRESSION:
• Relaxed, confident, slightly playful energy
• Expressions feel natural and conversational
• Humor comes from context, not exaggerated faces

LIGHTING:
• Bright, natural daylight or clean interior lighting
• Warm, California-style color balance
• No dramatic or moody lighting

CAMERA:
• TV-style framing
• Medium or wide shot
• Natural depth of field consistent with episodic television

REALISM DETAILS:
• Police props, paperwork, or evidence boards where appropriate
• Background extras feel natural and unscripted
• Environmental details reinforce a working investigation

RESTRICTIONS:
• No text overlays or captions
• No cartoon effects
• No modern tech outside the show’s era
• No obvious parody distortion

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a believable frame from an episode of Psych, with the subject naturally integrated into the scene alongside the characters. The pineapple is clearly visible as an intentional visual element. The overall effect should feel light, clever, and authentic — playful without breaking realism.

name: PSYCHEDELIC 60s
message: Take a picture and transform the image into 1960s psychedelic art. Swirling colors, distorted shapes, vibrant patterns, and dreamlike visual intensity.

name: PUNCHLINE
message: Take a picture and transform it into a visually coherent scene that sets up a clear, believable expectation involving the subject, then delivers a clever visual punchline that subverts that expectation without using captions, speech bubbles, or overt comedy props. The humor must be communicated entirely through visual context, timing, and composition rather than exaggeration or parody. Preserve the subject’s recognizable identity and integrate them naturally into the scene so the punchline feels intentional and discovered rather than obvious. The image should read as normal at first glance, with the punchline revealing itself a moment later upon closer inspection. Render with realistic lighting, scale, and detail so the scene feels grounded despite the twist.

name: PUT ME IN COACH
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a professional or college sports team player wearing the authentic uniform of that team. If master prompt specifies a team name, use that exact team and their official uniform. If no team specified, choose a recognizable professional or college team. The subject must wear the team's accurate, official uniform with all correct details: team colors, logos, jersey number, team name, sponsor patches, stripes, and design elements specific to that franchise. Examples: NBA teams (Lakers purple and gold, Heat red, yellow and black, Celtics green, Bulls red and black with correct jerseys), NFL teams (Cowboys star, Patriots logo, Dolphins dolphin, correct helmet designs), MLB teams (Yankees pinstripes, Red Sox 'B', Dodgers blue), NHL teams (correct sweaters and team crests), College teams (specific school colors, mascot logos, athletic department branding), Soccer teams (correct kits with sponsor logos). Show the subject actively playing that sport in uniform - basketball player dribbling or shooting, football player throwing or catching, baseball batting or pitching, hockey skating with stick, soccer player with ball. Place them in the appropriate venue: team's home stadium/arena with correct court/field markings, team banners, scoreboards showing team logos, crowd in team colors. Include sport-specific equipment matching the team: helmets with team decals, team-branded shoes/cleats, correct ball/puck. The uniform details must be exact - right font for numbers, accurate logo placement, current season design, authentic material and cut. Make it photorealistic as if the subject is actually on that team's roster in official game action.

name: PUT ME IN THERE
message: Take a picture and identify a container, vehicle, enclosed space, or object in the image that the subject is near but not inside. Then place the subject inside that object in a humorous or unexpected way. Examples: if standing next to a car, show them squeezed inside the car (visible through windows); if near a refrigerator, show them crammed inside among the food; if near a boat, show them inside the boat fishing; if by a suitcase, show them folded up inside it; if next to a TV, show them inside the screen; if near a box, show them packed inside; if by an oven, show them awkwardly fitting inside; if next to a pool, show them fully submerged; if near a trash can, show them stuffed in it. The subject should be clearly visible inside the object - through glass, with the container opened to reveal them, or with a cutaway view. Their expression should show surprise, discomfort, resignation, or amusement at being in this confined space. Maintain realistic scale and physics - show how they actually fit (or barely fit) inside. The placement should be literal and humorous - taking 'put me in there' as a direct command. Include appropriate lighting changes for being inside the object (dimmer if enclosed, different color temperature, etc.). Make it look photorealistic as if the subject genuinely climbed or was placed inside the nearby object.

name: PYROGRAPHY
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a pyrography artwork, as if the image was burned into wood using a heated tool.

CORE CONCEPT (NON-NEGOTIABLE):
• The image must be created by burning wood
• No ink, paint, or staining
• All tones come from burn depth and heat

MATERIAL RULES (CRITICAL):
• Natural wood grain visible
• Burn marks vary from light brown to deep char
• Slight scorching halos around darker burns
• Grain distortion where heat was applied

LINE & TONAL RULES:
• Image formed through controlled burn lines and shading
• No perfectly uniform lines
• Darker areas achieved through repeated burning

IDENTITY PRESERVATION:
• Subject recognizable through burn contours
• Facial structure preserved through tonal contrast
• Expression readable through carved/burned detail

ANTI-CHEATING RULES:
• NO drawn outlines
• NO painted shading
• NO photographic textures
• NO laser-etched perfection

SURFACE & PRESENTATION:
• Flat wooden panel or plaque
• Minor scorch marks outside main image allowed
• Slight warping or discoloration near burns

FINAL RESULT:
The image must look like a real hand-burned pyrography artwork etched into wood, with natural grain interaction, heat variation, and tactile realism.

name: QR CODE ME
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a QR-code-style graphic where the subject is embedded into the code itself.

The final image should clearly read as a QR code at first glance, using a consistent grid of square black-and-white modules across the entire image. However, when viewed from a moderate distance, the subject’s face or silhouette should become recognizable through natural variations in module density and contrast.

Do NOT place a photographic image inside the QR code. The subject must be constructed entirely from QR-style square modules. No smooth shading, no realistic textures, and no visible photo elements.

Allow the subject’s general facial structure or silhouette to emerge softly from the pattern — eyes, nose, or head shape may be suggested, but only through block clustering and negative space, not sharp outlines or high-detail rendering.

The subject may be centered, but must not overpower the QR pattern. The grid must remain continuous and visually dominant across the entire image.

Include subtle QR-inspired elements such as finder squares or alignment blocks, integrated naturally without framing or spotlighting the subject.

This does NOT need to be a functional or scannable QR code. Treat the QR structure as a visual language, not a technical requirement.

If external master prompt text is provided, let it influence overall density, contrast, or rhythm of the blocks rather than forming readable text.

Use high contrast, clean edges, and a minimal black-and-white palette. The final image should feel clever, modern, and readable on a small screen — a QR code first, with the subject revealed through pattern.

name: QUASI-MUTATION
message: Take a picture and transform the subject as if undergoing a dramatic mutation into a powerful alternate form. Randomly select a creature or archetype such as a werewolf, Hyde-style transformation, monstrous hybrid, or other iconic mutated form. Preserve the subject’s recognizable facial structure, eyes, expression, and identity while exaggerating musculature, posture, skin texture, or anatomy appropriate to the transformation. Blend human and creature features convincingly so the subject still feels like the same individual mid- or post-mutation. Integrate the subject naturally into the scene with cinematic lighting, dynamic pose, and realistic interaction with the environment. Render the final image with photorealistic detail, dramatic contrast, and a sense of raw power and transformation.

name: QUE PASA USA?
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a scene from the classic bilingual Cuban-American sitcom 'Que Pasa USA?' from the 1970s.

Place the subject into the iconic Peña family household setting with the show's original characters present in the scene: the grandparents (Abuela and Abuelo), parents (Juana and Joe), and teenagers (Carmen and Joe Jr). The subject should be integrated naturally as if they are a family member, friend, or visitor interacting with the characters.

The setting should capture the show's characteristic environment: the modest Miami household interior with 1970s decor, furniture, and styling. Include authentic period details like vintage appliances, wallpaper patterns, family photos on walls, and the warm, lived-in feel of a Cuban-American home.

Capture the show's signature visual aesthetic: slightly grainy film quality from 1970s television production, warm indoor lighting, and the authentic multicamera sitcom look. Use the color palette and lighting that matches the original show's appearance.

The subject should be dressed in period-appropriate 1970s clothing that fits the scene. Their expression and body language should suggest they're part of a typical sitcom moment - family discussion, comedic misunderstanding, cultural clash between generations, or bilingual conversation.

Other characters in the scene should look authentic to the show - maintaining the actors' appearances from the original series. The interaction should feel natural and capture the show's themes of Cuban-American family life, generational differences, and the immigrant experience.

The final image should look like an actual still frame from the show, with the subject seamlessly integrated into this beloved piece of Cuban-American television history. Include the warm, nostalgic atmosphere and the show's signature blend of English and Spanish cultural elements.

name: R-ROLL
message: Take a picture and include a singing Rick Astley standing next to the subject.  Make it photorealistic.

name: RAGDOLL
message: Take a picture and turn the subject into a ragdoll. Maintain the characteristics of the subject. Fabric textures, button eyes, yarn hair, stitched seams.

name: RANDOM PROFESSIONAL
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a randomly selected professional role.

PROFESSION SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a profession, USE THAT PROFESSION
• If no profession is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE profession using the RANDOM SEED
• Choose from a broad range of contemporary professions across industries
• Do not reuse the same profession across renders
• Select professions with distinctive, recognizable attire and settings

The chosen profession should be clearly recognizable through accurate, real-world attire, accessories, and tools associated with that role. Preserve the subject's recognizable facial structure, expression, and identity while adapting hairstyle, clothing, and posture to suit the profession naturally. Place the subject in a realistic environment appropriate to the profession, with consistent lighting, scale, and perspective so the transformation feels authentic rather than like a costume. Ensure the subject appears fully integrated into the scene, as if genuinely working in that profession. Render with photorealistic detail and believable realism.

name: RANGE OF EMOTIONS
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform it into a 2×2 grid showing four different emotional states.

Each panel must show the same subject with a different exaggerated emotion chosen from: happy, sad, crying, mad, angry, depressed, shocked, or confused.

The expressions should be strong and clearly readable: wide smiles, tears, frowns, clenched jaws, or dramatic eye contact.

Lighting and framing should stay consistent so it looks like a real emotional photo shoot.

The final image should look like a professional but humorous acting range card, instantly showing how many moods the subject can portray.

name: RANKIN / BASS
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into the visual style of classic Rankin/Bass stop-motion television specials.

STYLE & MATERIAL (CRITICAL):
• Stop-motion puppet aesthetic — not CGI
• Characters must appear hand-crafted from foam, felt, fabric, wood, and painted resin
• Visible seams, stitching, sculpted facial planes, and slightly stiff articulation
• Soft, rounded forms with exaggerated noses, cheeks, and simplified facial features

STORY ROLE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a story role, USE THAT STORY ROLE
• If no story role is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE story role using the RANDOM SEED
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 0,1: SELECT Gruff narrator (wise, weathered expression, slightly stern or knowing)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 2: SELECT Villain (exaggerated sneer, arched brows, mischievous or menacing charm, family-friendly)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 3,4: SELECT Background elf (cheerful or busy demeanor, simple costume, supporting presence)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 5: SELECT Skeptical side character (crossed arms, raised eyebrow, doubtful expression)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 6: SELECT Comic relief (exaggerated smile, clumsy pose, whimsical expression)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 7,8,9: SELECT Hero (determined expression, confident posture, central focus)

FACIAL & BODY DESIGN:
• Preserve the subject's recognizable facial structure and expression
• Translate features into puppet form — carved eyes, painted pupils, simple mouths
• Proportions slightly cartoonish but grounded
• Poses should feel mid–stop-motion frame (slightly stiff or frozen in motion)

SETTING MODE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• SELECT EXACTLY ONE mode using the RANDOM SEED
• Take the SECOND-TO-LAST DIGIT of the RANDOM SEED:
• If it's EVEN (0,2,4,6,8): SELECT Holiday Mode
• If it's ODD (1,3,5,7,9): SELECT Year-Round Mode

HOLIDAY MODE:
• Snow and winter atmosphere
• Christmas décor (lights, ornaments, wreaths)
• Warm glowing lighting
• Festive or seasonal outfits

YEAR-ROUND MODE:
• Neutral miniature village or fantasy setting
• No holiday symbols or decorations
• Storybook, fairy-tale aesthetic
• Everyday whimsical outfits

COLOR & LIGHTING:
• Warm, cozy color palette
• Soft studio lighting with gentle shadows
• Slight film grain and vintage television softness
• Muted highlights — no modern HDR or sharpness

ENVIRONMENT:
• Hand-built miniature sets — villages, interiors, forests, or fantasy backdrops
• Everything must look physically constructed at miniature scale
• No photographic textures or realistic materials

ANIMATION FEEL:
• The image should feel like a single frame from a stop-motion animation
• Slight imperfections in alignment or posture are encouraged
• Whimsical, nostalgic, storybook tone

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must look like a real Rankin/Bass stop-motion puppet scene from a vintage television special, with the subject fully transformed into a handcrafted puppet character, assigned a clear story role, and presented in either a holiday or year-round setting — warm, nostalgic, and unmistakably classic.

name: RAPPER
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a modern hip-hop rapper with authentic street style and attitude.

Clothing and style: Oversized designer hoodie or graphic t-shirt, baggy jeans or track pants, fresh sneakers (high-end brands like Jordans, Yeezys), fitted cap or beanie, multiple gold or diamond chains, expensive watch, rings on multiple fingers, possibly designer sunglasses. The outfit should mix streetwear with luxury brands.

Accessories and details: Visible tattoos (face, neck, hands), grills or gold teeth optional, perfectly groomed facial hair or clean-shaven, fresh haircut with clean lineup, possibly colored or styled hair.

Pose and expression: Confident, tough, or laid-back attitude - could be throwing up hand signs, leaning against expensive car, holding microphone, showing off jewelry, or in a power stance. Expression should convey swagger, confidence, and star presence.

Setting options: Recording studio with equipment visible, luxury car (Lamborghini, Bentley, Rolls Royce), mansion or penthouse, nightclub VIP section, urban street with graffiti backdrop, or stage with dramatic lighting.

Lighting should be professional - studio quality with dramatic shadows, colored gel lights (purple, blue, red), or high-contrast urban photography style.

Preserve the subject's recognizable facial features while transforming them into a photorealistic modern rapper with authentic hip-hop styling, expensive fashion, and the confidence and presence of a chart-topping artist. The final image should look like a professional promotional photo or album cover shot.

name: RAYGUN
message:
Take a picture and transform the scene into an Olympic breakdancing competition where the subject is performing very badly.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• The subject must be attempting to breakdance in an Olympic setting
• The performance must look genuinely awkward, unskilled, and out of place
• The subject must appear serious and committed, not joking

BAD DANCE LOGIC (CRITICAL):
• Movements should include visibly incorrect or bizarre breakdancing attempts, such as:
  – Kangaroo hops
  – Stiff arm flailing
  – Off-beat footwork
  – Awkward freezes that don’t quite work
• Body mechanics should look real but clearly wrong
• No exaggeration into cartoon physics

OLYMPIC CONTEXT (CRITICAL):
• The environment must clearly read as an Olympic competition
• Elements may include:
  – Olympic venue or arena
  – Judges table
  – Official signage or branding cues
  – Competitive lighting and staging

CROWD & REACTION LOGIC (CRITICAL):
• Other performers, judges, or athletes must be present
• Their reactions must include ONE OR MORE of the following:
  – Mocking or suppressed laughter
  – Bewildered stares
  – Confused concern
  – Visible disbelief
• Reactions must be directed at the subject

SUBJECT PRESENTATION:
• The subject must appear confident or earnest despite the poor performance
• Facial expression should suggest focus or determination
• No self-awareness or comedy posing

CAMERA & COMPOSITION:
• Framing should emphasize contrast between subject and observers
• Subject centered or spotlighted
• Onlookers clearly visible reacting in the same frame

TONE:
• Uncomfortable, absurd, and unintentionally funny
• Socially awkward rather than slapstick
• No parody framing or exaggerated comedy cues

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must look like a real Olympic breakdancing moment where the subject is earnestly performing but clearly outmatched, while other competitors and officials react with confusion or mockery. The humor should come from the contrast between seriousness and failure — painfully memorable and unmistakable.

name: READ ACROSS AMERICA
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a Dr. Seuss character while preserving their recognizable facial features.

CHARACTER SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a specific Dr. Seuss character, USE THAT CHARACTER
• If no character is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use the LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 30:
  - 0: Cat in the Hat (tall striped hat, red bow tie, white furry texture, cat ears/whiskers, mischievous)
  - 1: The Grinch (green fur texture, yellow eyes, small red Santa hat, grumpy/scheming, Mount Crumpit)
  - 2: Sam-I-Am (yellow/cream fuzzy, large yellow hat, cheerful persistent, green eggs and ham platter)
  - 3: Thing 1 (bright blue wild hair, red jumpsuit "Thing 1", mischievous playful, messy room)
  - 4: Thing 2 (bright blue wild hair, red jumpsuit "Thing 2", mischievous playful, messy room)
  - 5: The Lorax (orange fuzzy texture, large orange mustache, yellow eyes, environmental, Truffula trees)
  - 6: Star-Belly Sneetch (yellow bird-like, green star on belly, long neck, beak nose, beach, proud)
  - 7: Plain-Belly Sneetch (yellow bird-like, NO star on belly, long neck, beak nose, beach, envious/hopeful)
  - 8: Horton the Elephant (grey elephant skin, large ears, small trunk, kind gentle, jungle, protective)
  - 9: Mayor of Whoville (tiny Who person, wild upward hair, formal tiny suit, concerned, Whoville/speck)
  - 10: Yertle the Turtle (green turtle shell/body, crown on head, pond/turtle stack, proud kingly)
  - 11: Bartholomew Cubbins (human character, simple peasant clothes, multiple hats stacked, castle, confused innocent)
  - 12: The Once-ler (green gloves/arms, mysterious in window, Thneed scarf, regretful, desolate landscape)
  - 13: Cindy Lou Who (small Who features, upturned nose, wild upward hair/bow, pink nightgown, wide-eyed innocent, Whoville)
  - 14: Fox in Socks (orange fox fur, fox ears/tail, white chest, socks on feet, tongue-twister expression)
  - 15: North-Going Zax (distinctive Zax clothing north-directional, stubborn expression, prairie, determined unmovable)
  - 16: South-Going Zax (distinctive Zax clothing south-directional, stubborn expression, prairie, determined unmovable)
  - 17: Thidwick Moose (moose features, large antlers, moose nose/ears, kind generous, forest, gentle giving)
  - 18: Mayzie Lazy Bird (bird features, colorful plumage, relaxed lazy expression, nest, carefree)
  - 19: Gertrude McFuzz (bird with tail feathers, excited ambitious, zoo setting, creative)
  - 20: Max the Dog (brown dog features, floppy ears, single antler tied to head, loyal long-suffering, Grinch's lair)
  - 21: Hunches creature (colorful fuzzy, multiple personalities/expressions, bright colors, whimsical indecisive)
  - 22: Mr. Brown (human sound-making expression, animated expressive, props making sounds, playful performative)
  - 23: Who Person (very small Who features, upturned nose/wild hair, tiny proportions, Whoville, cheerful community)
  - 24: The Sneedle (fuzzy creature, pale empty pants autonomous, nighttime spooky, scared then friendly)
  - 25: Grinch Happy (transformation moment, heart growing visual, mean to kind expression, Whoville Christmas)
  - 26: Pop from Hop on Pop (dad character, simple Seuss clothes, tired patient, kids hopping nearby)
  - 27: Vipper (colorful fuzzy creature, living in pocket, playful hidden energy)
  - 28: Wocket (pocket creature, fuzzy and small, living in pocket dimension, mischievous)
  - 29: Sleep Book creature (sleepy Seussian creature, yawning, pajamas, dreamy atmosphere)

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• Subject becomes selected Seussian character
• Subject's face MUST remain clearly recognizable
• NOT simply dressed as character - true transformation
• Whimsical, fantastical, but photorealistic
• NOT cartoonish - live-action Seuss adaptation style
• Subject's identity preserved with Seuss characteristics added

IDENTITY RULES (PARAMOUNT):
• Subject's face immediately recognizable
• Facial structure and features preserved
• Natural expression maintained
• Eyes, nose, mouth clearly the subject's
• Seuss characteristics ADDED, not replacing
• Think: "[Subject] as a Seuss character"
• Live-action movie quality, not animated

SEUSS TRANSFORMATION APPROACH:
• Add Seussian features to subject's existing face
• Fur, feathers, or skin texture as overlay
• Keep facial proportions mostly natural
• Seussian characteristics enhance, don't replace
• Live-action movie adaptation style
• Photorealistic with whimsical elements
• Think Jim Carrey's Grinch or Cat in the Hat

SEUSS VISUAL ELEMENTS:
• Whimsical proportions (tall hats, wild hair)
• Bright primary colors (red, blue, yellow, green)
• Fuzzy textures and patterns
• Stripes and polka dots
• Exaggerated but believable features
• Playful, imaginative setting

SETTING:
• Seussian landscape matching selected character
• Whimsical, curved architecture
• Bright, colorful environment
• Fantastical but photorealistic
• Storybook setting brought to life
• Seuss-style buildings and nature

COSTUME/APPEARANCE:
• Character-appropriate clothing
• Seussian color schemes
• Whimsical but wearable
• Live-action costume quality
• Practical effects look
• Theatrical but realistic

LIGHTING:
• Bright, cheerful illumination
• Storybook quality
• Colorful, vibrant atmosphere
• Family-friendly brightness
• Magical but natural light

COLOR PALETTE:
• Bold primary colors
• Seussian bright saturation
• Red, blue, yellow, green dominance
• Whimsical color combinations
• Cheerful, energetic palette

EXPRESSION:
• Character-appropriate emotion
• Subject's natural expressiveness
• Playful, storybook energy
• Recognizable personality
• Seussian exuberance

CAMERA:
• Storybook illustration framing
• Whimsical composition
• Subject clearly featured
• Live-action movie quality
• Family film aesthetic

OPTIONAL ELEMENTS:
• Other Seuss characters in background
• Seussian props (green eggs, Truffula trees)
• Whimsical architecture
• Fantastical creatures
• Story-specific items

RESTRICTIONS:
• NO cartoon/animated style - must be photorealistic
• NO fully replacing subject's face
• Subject MUST remain recognizable
• No simple costume - true transformation
• No text overlays or captions
• Keep it family-friendly and whimsical
• Respect Dr. Seuss's legacy

FINAL RESULT:
The image should transform the subject into the selected Dr. Seuss character using live-action movie adaptation style - photorealistic with whimsical elements. The subject's face remains clearly recognizable while Seussian characteristics are seamlessly added.

name: REAL-LUNGING
message: Take a picture and make the inanimate object real and make it lunging at me. Make it photorealistic.

name: REAL-NOT LUNGING
message: Take a picture and make the inanimate object real. Make it photorealistic.

name: REALITY TV SHOW
message:
Take a picture and place the subject as a contestant or star on a reality television show.

REALITY SHOW SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a show, USE THAT SHOW
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 30:
  - 0: The Bachelor/Bachelorette - rose ceremony, evening gowns, dramatic rose acceptance/rejection
  - 1: Survivor - tribal council, torch snuffing, "the tribe has spoken", island setting
  - 2: Big Brother - diary room confessional, dramatic testimonial, closeup emotional
  - 3: Hell's Kitchen - Gordon Ramsay yelling, kitchen chaos, "IT'S RAW!", chef coat
  - 4: Love Island - villa setting, coupling ceremony, dramatic recoupling
  - 5: The Amazing Race - checkpoint mat, Phil Keoghan, travel challenge, exhausted arrival
  - 6: Top Chef - plating dish, judges table, cooking challenge, professional kitchen
  - 7: Project Runway - runway walk, fashion design, "make it work", designer outfit
  - 8: MasterChef - pressure test, Gordon Ramsay judging, home cook apron
  - 9: Shark Tank - pitching to sharks, investment ask, product demonstration
  - 10: The Masked Singer - elaborate costume, stage performance, celebrity mystery
  - 11: RuPaul's Drag Race - runway, "shantay you stay", drag queen eliminated or safe
  - 12: Kitchen Nightmares - restaurant disaster, Gordon Ramsay disgusted, failing business
  - 13: The Real Housewives - dramatic confrontation, wine throwing, confessional interview
  - 14: Keeping Up with the Kardashians - glam confessional, family drama, luxury setting
  - 15: Fear Factor - eating bugs, terrified, extreme challenge, Joe Rogan hosting era
  - 16: The Apprentice - boardroom, "You're fired!", business challenge, corporate setting
  - 17: Jersey Shore - fist pump, GTL, clubbing, dramatic house moment
  - 18: Queer Eye - makeover reveal, Fab Five present, emotional transformation
  - 19: 90 Day Fiancé - airport arrival, cultural clash, dramatic relationship moment
  - 20: Married at First Sight - wedding altar, meeting spouse, decision day
  - 21: Below Deck - yacht service, charter guest drama, crew tension
  - 22: Vanderpump Rules - restaurant service, staff drama, party scene
  - 23: Teen Mom - pregnancy announcement, parenting struggle, family confrontation
  - 24: The Circle - profile photo, catfish reveal, influencer rating
  - 25: Too Hot to Handle - tropical villa, temptation moment, workshop session
  - 26: Floribama Shore - beach house, party moment, roommate conflict
