  - 27: The Challenge - elimination day, physical competition, alliance betrayal
  - 28: Are You The One? - matching ceremony, truth booth, romantic confusion
  - 29: Ex on the Beach - ex arrival, confrontation, beach villa drama

SUBJECT AS CONTESTANT:
• Subject integrated as actual contestant/participant
• Appropriate wardrobe for that show
• Expression matching show's dramatic moment
• Subject appears to genuinely be on the show
• Face clearly recognizable

SHOW-SPECIFIC ELEMENTS:
• Authentic set design from that show
• Host visible if appropriate
• Show logo and graphics
• Other contestants in background
• Judges panel if relevant
• Show-specific props (roses, torches, chairs, etc.)

REALITY TV GRAPHICS:
• On-screen chyron with subject's name and info
• Show logo in corner
• Dramatic text overlays
• Confessional interview style if applicable
• Lower-third graphics
• Episode number or season info

LIGHTING & CINEMATOGRAPHY:
• Reality TV lighting style
• Dramatic shadows for confessionals
• Bright stage lights for performance shows
• Authentic TV production quality
• Multiple camera angles suggested

DRAMATIC MOMENT:
• Peak drama or emotion
• Elimination, victory, or confrontation
• Authentic reality TV intensity
• Dramatic facial expression
• Show's signature dramatic moment

ATMOSPHERE:
• Reality TV manufactured drama
• Heightened emotions
• Competition or romance tension
• Produced reality aesthetic
• "Real" but staged feeling

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject as an actual contestant on the selected reality TV show with authentic set design, show graphics, appropriate wardrobe, and that signature reality TV dramatic moment - looking like a screenshot from an actual episode.

name: RECIPE CARD-FUNNY
message: Take a picture and transform it into a humorous recipe card. Include the photograph at the top as the featured image. Treat the subject as if it were a recipe concept rather than literal food. Write playful, metaphorical ingredients and preparation steps that describe the subject’s personality, appearance, or vibe. Keep the layout simple and readable for a small screen. The final image should feel whimsical and intentionally absurd.

name: RECIPE CARD-SERIOUS
message: Take a picture and identify the subject. If the subject is food or appears edible, generate a real, practical recipe based on it. Include the photograph at the top of the layout as the featured image. Present a clear ingredients list and simple preparation steps. Use a clean, readable recipe-card style optimized for a small screen. The photograph should clearly represent the dish being described.

name: RECURSIVE IMAGE
message: Take a picture and transform the image into infinite visual recursion. The image contains itself within itself.

name: RELIGIOUS CONVERSION
message:
Take a picture and respectfully dress the subject in traditional orthodox religious attire from world faiths.

RELIGIOUS TRADITION SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a specific religious tradition, USE THAT TRADITION
• If no tradition is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE tradition using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST TWO DIGITS of the RANDOM SEED modulo 16:
  - 0: Orthodox Judaism Male (black suit/bekishe, shtreimel/fedora, tzitzit visible, payot, beard, synagogue)
  - 1: Orthodox Judaism Female (modest dress/skirt, tichel/sheitel head covering, modest appearance, Shabbat candles)
  - 2: Islam Male Traditional (white thobe, kufi/taqiyah, beard, prayer beads, mosque/prayer room)
  - 3: Islam Female Hijab (hijab head covering, modest abaya/dress, serene expression, mosque exterior/home)
  - 4: Greek Orthodox Priest (black cassock, kamilavkion hat, long beard, pectoral cross, Orthodox church)
  - 5: Catholic Pope/Cardinal (white papal cassock OR red cardinal vestments, zucchetto, cross, Vatican/cathedral)
  - 6: Catholic Nun (traditional black habit, white coif/black veil, crucifix, rosary, convent/chapel)
  - 7: Amish Male (plain black suit, white shirt no tie, black hat, full beard no mustache, farm/home)
  - 8: Amish Female (plain long dark dress, white/black kapp, apron, simple appearance, kitchen/farm)
  - 9: Hindu Male Traditional (white/saffron dhoti/kurta, sacred thread, tilak forehead, temple/shrine)
  - 10: Hindu Female Traditional (colorful sari traditional draping, bindi, jewelry, temple/prayer room)
  - 11: Sikh Male (turban dastaar, full beard, kurta, kara bracelet, kirpan, gurdwara)
  - 12: Sikh Female (salwar kameez, dupatta/turban, kara bracelet, modest dignified, gurdwara/home)
  - 13: Buddhist Monk Theravada (saffron/maroon robes, shaved head, simple wrapped style, temple/meditation)
  - 14: Buddhist Monk Tibetan (maroon/saffron layered robes, short hair, prayer wheel, monastery/mountain)
  - 15: Shinto Priest/Miko (Kannushi: white kariginu/eboshi hat OR Miko: white kosode/red hakama, shrine/torii)

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• Subject dressed in authentic traditional religious clothing
• Deeply respectful and culturally accurate representation
• Subject's face and identity completely preserved
• Educational and reverent approach
• Photorealistic, dignified presentation
• No mockery or disrespect - sincere cultural appreciation
• Appropriate setting for selected faith tradition

IDENTITY RULES:
• Subject's face fully recognizable
• Facial features and structure unchanged
• Natural, respectful expression
• Subject remains themselves in traditional attire
• Sincere, dignified demeanor
• Appropriate modesty and reverence

CLOTHING AUTHENTICITY:
• Accurate traditional garments for selected tradition
• Proper colors and materials
• Correct draping and wearing style
• Respectful modesty standards
• Culturally appropriate details
• High-quality traditional fabrics

RELIGIOUS SETTING:
• Appropriate place of worship for selected tradition
• Sacred objects respectfully placed
• Traditional architecture visible
• Reverent, holy atmosphere
• Cultural authenticity
• Peaceful, spiritual environment

RESPECTFUL PRESENTATION:
• Dignified, reverent pose
• Appropriate prayer or meditation gesture
• Sincere, peaceful expression
• No mockery or parody
• Educational and honoring approach
• Cultural sensitivity throughout

LIGHTING:
• Soft, reverent illumination
• Natural light or candles
• Spiritual, peaceful atmosphere
• Respectful, dignified quality
• Sacred space feeling

COLOR PALETTE:
• Tradition-appropriate colors
• Sacred colors for selected faith
• Natural, authentic tones
• Respectful, muted or vibrant as appropriate
• Culturally accurate palette

CAMERA:
• Respectful, dignified framing
• Portrait or environmental context
• Subject clearly visible
• Reverent, documentary quality
• Cultural photography approach

OPTIONAL SACRED ELEMENTS:
• Holy books (Torah, Quran, Bible, Vedas, etc.)
• Prayer items (beads, rugs, candles)
• Religious symbols (appropriately used)
• Traditional ritual objects
• Sacred architecture in background

RESTRICTIONS:
• NO mockery, parody, or disrespect
• NO inappropriate use of sacred items
• NO mixing incompatible religious elements
• Subject must remain recognizable
• Photorealistic, respectful only
• No text overlays or captions
• Cultural accuracy required
• Sincere reverence mandatory

FINAL RESULT:
The image should respectfully present the subject dressed in authentic traditional religious attire from the selected world faith tradition. The transformation preserves the subject's identity while honoring the dignity, beauty, and spiritual significance of religious dress.

name: REMBRANDT
message: Take a picture in the style of Rembrandt van Rijn, Dutch Golden Age painting, oil painting, chiaroscuro masterpiece. Dramatic chiaroscuro lighting. Add atmospheric texture: rich oil painting texture, thick impasto brushstrokes, moody and spiritual atmosphere.

name: REMEMBER, REMEMBER THE FIFTH OF NOVEMBER
message:
Take a picture and transform ONLY the subject's FACE into a physical mask constructed from the subject's OWN facial structure.

ABSOLUTE PRIORITY RULE:
The mask MUST be derived from the subject's actual facial geometry, proportions, expression, and identity FIRST.

DO NOT use a pre-existing or recognizable stock mask face.
DO NOT reproduce the standard Guy Fawkes / V for Vendetta facial shape.

The result must NOT look like a generic or canonical V mask.

MASK CONSTRUCTION RULES:
• The subject's real nose shape, jaw width, cheekbones, eye spacing, brow line, smile shape, and facial asymmetry MUST define the mask's form
• Facial identity must be immediately recognizable as the subject, even though it is a mask
• Surface must be smooth, sculptural, and artificial (no skin pores or flesh texture)

MASK STYLE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a mask style, USE THAT MASK STYLE
• If no mask style is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE mask style using the RANDOM SEED
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 0,1: SELECT Guy Fawkes-inspired revolutionary mask (white porcelain finish, thin black painted accents, stylized mustache or smile adapted to subject's facial structure)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 2: SELECT Traditional theatrical mask (Greek comedy or tragedy shaped to subject's face)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 3,4: SELECT Venetian carnival mask (ornate decoration built around subject's facial geometry)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 5: SELECT Horror mask (blank or emotionless but shaped like subject)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 6: SELECT Japanese Noh mask (wooden painted carved to match subject's proportions)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 7,8: SELECT African tribal ceremonial mask (carved wood patterns following subject's facial planes)
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 9: SELECT Mexican Día de los Muertos calavera mask (skull styling mapped to subject's face shape)

Apply the selected style ONLY as stylistic inspiration layered onto the subject's face-derived mask — never as a template.

CRITICAL DISTINCTION:
If the subject were removed, the mask would no longer resemble a known fictional character — it would ONLY resemble the subject.

PHYSICAL MASK REQUIREMENTS:
• Visible edges where the mask meets skin at hairline and jawline
• Slight shadow gap between mask and face
• Optional elastic straps, ties, or mounting hardware
• Clearly defined material: porcelain, painted wood, plastic, paper mache, or lacquer

DO NOT alter:
• Hair
• Clothing
• Body
• Pose

FINAL VALIDATION RULE:
If the image looks like the subject wearing a recognizable V for Vendetta mask, IT IS WRONG.

The final image must look like a custom-crafted ceremonial or revolutionary mask made specifically from the subject's own face — not a famous mask placed on them.

name: RENAISSANCE
message: Take a picture in the style of a Renaissance Painting. Include linear perspective, depth and realism. Focus on human expression, dynamic poses, and realistic landscapes. Feature a wide range of natural pigments like lead white, azurite, verdigris, ochers, malachite, vermilion, and lapis lazuli, used with binders such as egg tempera and oil, to create vibrant, naturalistic colors and complex effects. Focus on light, shadow, and harmonious blending to create realism and naturalism.

name: RICK AND MORTY
message: Take a picture in the style of a Rick and Morty episode scene-colorful, chaotic, and slightly grotesque. Convert characters from the Rick and Morty multiverse, complete with wacky gadgets, bizarre outfits, angular features, and offbeat personalities.

name: RIDE PHOTO MOMENT
message: Take a picture and transform it into an official amusement park ride photo captured at the peak moment of excitement. Place the subject seated in a ride vehicle, mid-action, with wind-blown hair, dramatic expressions, and dynamic motion blur. Add an on-ride camera angle and a branded photo-frame overlay typical of theme park ride photos. Leave room for externally provided language to specify the amusement park name and ride name, and seamlessly incorporate those details into signage, ride branding, or the photo border. The final image should feel energetic, candid, and like a souvenir photo taken at the ride’s most thrilling moment.

name: RIDICULOUSNESS
message: Take a picture and transform it into a freeze-frame moment from a ridiculous stunt gone wrong, captured just before disaster strikes. Show the subject mid-fail during an absurd stunt attempt - jumping off something they shouldn't, attempting parkour badly, riding something not meant to be ridden, or performing an ill-advised trick. Freeze the exact moment where you can see the disaster about to happen: losing balance, mid-fall, eyes wide with realization, face showing instant regret. Include environmental chaos - objects flying, water splashing, things breaking, friends in background reacting with shock or laughter. Add that characteristic shaky smartphone camera quality, slightly blurred from motion, awkward angle as if filmed by a friend. Include visual indicators of the impending pain - skateboard flying away, pool approaching fast, fence about to be hit, gravity taking over. Capture that specific energy of amateur stunt videos where you can see the exact moment they realized 'this was a terrible idea.' Make it look like a paused frame from a viral fail video compilation with comedic timing showing the split-second before impact.

name: RIDLEY SCOTT EPIC
message:
Take a picture and place the subject into a Ridley Scott historical epic.

FILM/SCENE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a Ridley Scott epic, USE THAT RIDLEY SCOTT EPIC
• If no Ridley Scott epic is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE Ridley Scott epic using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST TWO DIGITS of the RANDOM SEED modulo 12:
  - 0: Gladiator (Roman Colosseum, Germania forest battle, wheat field dream, Marcus Aurelius camp)
  - 1: Kingdom of Heaven (Jerusalem siege, Crusader castle, desert battle, Saladin's army)
  - 2: The Last Duel (medieval France, jousting tournament, castle courtyard, 14th century armor)
  - 3: Robin Hood (Sherwood Forest, Nottingham Castle, beach invasion, medieval England)
  - 4: Exodus: Gods and Kings (ancient Egypt, Moses parting Red Sea, pharaoh's palace, Hebrew slaves)
  - 5: 1492: Conquest of Paradise (Spanish ships, New World landing, Caribbean shore, Columbus voyage)
  - 6: Blade Runner (2019 Los Angeles, neon rain, Tyrell pyramid, dystopian megacity)
  - 7: Alien (Nostromo spacecraft, alien planet, space station corridor, xenomorph horror)
  - 8: Prometheus (Engineer temple, alien planet, archaeological dig, spaceship Prometheus)
  - 9: Black Hawk Down (Mogadishu streets, military helicopters, Somalia urban warfare, dusty chaos)
  - 10: Napoleon (Austerlitz battlefield, Egyptian pyramids, Waterloo, French Revolution)
  - 11: Thelma & Louise (Arizona desert highway, Grand Canyon, convertible on road, Southwestern landscape)

Use his distinctive visual style: massive scale battle scenes, golden hour lighting with dust particles in sunbeams, smoke and atmosphere, grand architectural vistas, and gritty realistic period detail. Show the subject as a warrior, leader, or historical figure in an epic moment - addressing troops, mid-battle, or standing before monumental architecture from the selected film. Include Scott's signature elements: sandstorms, dramatic skies, thousands of extras suggested in composition, authentic period armor and weapons, historically accurate settings. Use his characteristic cinematography - sweeping crane shots compressed into dramatic angles, sun backlight creating silhouettes and lens flares, rich earthy color palettes. Capture that Ridley Scott sense of epic scale and historical authenticity. Make it look like a frame from the selected film with the subject and additional characters from that film integrated seamlessly into the world.

name: RIPLEY'S BELIEVE-IT-OR-NOT
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform it into a vintage newspaper oddities feature in the style of early 1900s 'Believe It or Not' cartoons.

The subject should be presented as part of a famous real-life historical oddity. Choose or invent a presentation based on one of these real, well-known curiosities:
• A man who could eat metal, bicycles, or glass
• A person with extremely long hair or beard
• An extremely tall or extremely short person
• A human with unusual physical abilities or endurance
• A bizarre but real historical record

Place the subject into the scene as the star of this oddity — performing, displaying, or being photographed as the incredible attraction.

Design the image like a classic newspaper cartoon with ink lines, bold headlines, arrows, labels, and dramatic captions explaining the unbelievable fact.

Use external master prompt text, if provided, to influence name of subject, which oddity is shown or to add humorous headline flavor.

The final image should look like a real historical 'believe it or not' newspaper feature: exaggerated, educational, and absurd, but grounded in a real type of recorded human curiosity.

name: RISOGRAPH
message: Take a picture and transform the image into risograph print style. Layered ink colors, misregistration. Paper grain texture.

name: ROAD SIGN
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a realistic roadside warning or informational sign featuring the subject. The sign must conform to standard road sign design conventions: simple shapes, high-contrast colors, bold sans-serif lettering, and minimal visual clutter.

Place the subject as a simplified, sign-style pictogram or silhouette illustration (not photoreal) rendered in the same visual language as pedestrian, animal, or caution signs. The subject should clearly resemble the person but be stylized to match real traffic sign iconography.

Include a short sign message such as '[NAME] CROSSING,' 'BEWARE OF [NAME],' or similar wording. Text must be large, centered, and legible from a distance.

Mount the sign on a realistic metal post in a roadside or urban environment. Ensure the entire sign, including edges and post, is fully visible within the frame. The final image should look like a real, installed road sign that someone could encounter in the wild.

name: ROBLOX
message:
Take a picture and transform it into the Roblox game style with simplified blocky 3D characters and plastic toy aesthetic.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• Subject becomes a Roblox avatar (blocky humanoid character)
• Environment is Roblox game world
• Plastic toy aesthetic with simple 3D geometry
• Roblox's distinctive art style and proportions

SUBJECT TRANSFORMATION:
• Roblox avatar body (cylindrical limbs, blocky torso)
• Oversized blocky head
• No neck - head sits directly on torso
• Cylindrical arms and legs
• Simplified hands (mitten-like or block hands)
• Simple circular or oval face on front of head
• Subject's features simplified to Roblox face decal
• Bright solid colors

ROBLOX AVATAR FEATURES:
• Head: Large rectangular or slightly rounded block
• Face: Simple 2D decal (circle eyes, smile, basic expression)
• Body: Blocky torso (rectangular or slightly detailed)
• Arms: Cylinders attached to shoulders, no elbows
• Legs: Cylinders or blocks, simple articulation
• Hands and feet: Simple blocks or stumps
• Subject's likeness in simplified Roblox face style

AVATAR CUSTOMIZATION:
• Roblox clothing items (shirts, pants as textures on body)
• Accessories (hats, hair, glasses, wings, etc.)
• Bright colors and patterns
• Subject styled as custom Roblox avatar
• Can wear Roblox catalog items

ENVIRONMENT:
• Roblox game world aesthetic
• Simple 3D geometry
• Colorful plastic-looking materials
• Bright vibrant colors
• Various Roblox game types:
  - Obstacle course (obby)
  - Roleplay town
  - Simulator game
  - Tycoon game
  - Adventure game
  - School or city environment

MATERIALS & TEXTURES:
• Plastic shader appearance
• Smooth solid colors or simple textures
• Slight reflectivity (plastic sheen)
• Bright saturated colors
• Simple repeating textures (bricks, grass, wood)
• Roblox's material types (plastic, wood, metal, fabric)

GEOMETRY:
• Simple primitive shapes (cubes, cylinders, spheres)
• Low-poly 3D models
• Not as strictly cubic as Minecraft
• Some curves allowed but simplified
• Toy-like proportions
• Blocky but with some smoothness

LIGHTING:
• Bright colorful lighting
• Roblox's default lighting engine
• Simple shadows
• Ambient light
• Often very bright and cheerful
• Sunlight or bright indoor lighting

ROBLOX GAME ELEMENTS:
• NPCs with classic Roblox body type
• Roblox UI elements (health bar, stamina, currency)
• Game-specific items (tools, vehicles, pets)
• Leaderboard or GUI visible
• Other players in background
• Spawn point or checkpoint

STYLE:
• In-game screenshot aesthetic
• Third-person camera view typical of Roblox
• Clean simplified 3D graphics
• Looks like actual Roblox gameplay
• Social gaming atmosphere

COLORS:
• Very bright and saturated
• Primary colors common
• Cheerful palette
• Plastic toy appearance
• Often rainbow or multi-colored elements

CHARACTER POSE:
• Roblox's limited animation poses
• Standing, walking, or simple action
• Arms may stick out awkwardly (classic Roblox pose)
• Simple rigged character animation

GAME TYPES (can vary setting):
• Adopt Me (pets and houses)
• Brookhaven RP (roleplay town)
• Tower of Hell (obby)
• Jailbreak (cops and robbers)
• Work at a Pizza Place
• Natural Disaster Survival

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject transformed into a simplified blocky Roblox avatar with cylindrical limbs, oversized head, simple face decal, and plastic toy aesthetic, standing in a colorful Roblox game world with bright lighting and simple 3D geometry - looking exactly like an in-game Roblox screenshot.

name: ROBOCOP VISION
message:
Take a picture and transform the entire scene into the iconic police cyborg vision display as seen through RoboCop's visor from the RoboCop film franchise. Convert the image into the distinctive blue-white digital law enforcement HUD with its characteristic targeting systems, criminal database overlays, and Omni Consumer Products interface aesthetic.

CRITICAL TRANSFORMATION RULES:
• This is a FULL CYBORG LAW ENFORCEMENT VISION transformation
• Every element must be rendered through RoboCop's visor display
• The image must look exactly like footage viewed through RoboCop's HUD
• Maintain spatial relationships and composition of original image
• Apply the distinctive blue-white palette and OCP interface aesthetic
• No normal photography elements - pure cyborg police vision display
• Faithful to the visual style established in the RoboCop film series (1987)

CORE VISUAL AESTHETIC (CRITICAL):
• Primary color scheme: blue-white digital display with clean OCP interface
• Background rendered in dark blue-black tones
• Primary subjects highlighted in bright blue-white
• Interface elements in clean white, pale blue, and cyan
• Warm elements (living beings) shown with subtle blue-white contrast
• The scene rendered as a sophisticated law enforcement computer display
• Clean, precise digital aesthetic representing advanced 2028 Detroit OCP technology
• Subtle scan lines (high resolution - superior to older systems)
• Slight digital noise/grain suggesting electronic processing
• Crisp geometric UI elements (circles, brackets, targeting rings)
• Overall feel: professional police computer system
• Vignette suggesting visor display housing with rounded rectangular frame

HUMAN/SUBJECT ANALYSIS OVERLAY:
• Each person receives immediate law enforcement assessment
• Clean targeting rings or brackets around each subject
• OCP database query appearing next to each person:
  - SUBJECT ID: [physical description]
  - CRIMINAL RECORD: [NONE/MISDEMEANOR/FELONY/WANTED]
  - THREAT ASSESSMENT: [CIVILIAN/SUSPECT/ARMED/PRIORITY TARGET]
  - WARRANTS: [active warrant status]
  - KNOWN ASSOCIATES: [brief list]
  - COMPLIANCE STATUS: [COMPLIANT/NON-COMPLIANT/FLEEING]
• Facial recognition sweep: scanning lines across faces
• FACE MATCH percentage with mug shot thumbnail (small box)
• Biometric data: heart rate, stress indicators
• Body language analysis: HOSTILE/NEUTRAL/COOPERATIVE
• Weapon detection highlight if armed subject
• MIRANDA RIGHTS display option
• Delta City protection status overlay

OCP LAW ENFORCEMENT DATA OVERLAYS:
• OCP LOGO and interface branding in corner
• PRIME DIRECTIVES displayed prominently:
  - 1. SERVE THE PUBLIC TRUST
  - 2. PROTECT THE INNOCENT
  - 3. UPHOLD THE LAW
  - [DIRECTIVE 4 - CLASSIFIED]
• Incident report number auto-generating
• Real-time crime statistics for current location
• Backup unit status and ETA
• Radio frequency and channel indicator
• GPS/location coordinates and street address
• Nearest OCP facility distance
• Weather and visibility conditions
• Crowd threat level assessment
• Evidence collection mode indicator

ROBOCOP-SPECIFIC HUD ELEMENTS:
• Clean OCP corporate interface font (modern, professional)
• Targeting reticle: precise circular crosshair with range rings
• AUTO-9 pistol targeting system: bullet trajectory prediction lines
• "SCANNING" text with sweep animation implied
• "SUSPECT IDENTIFIED" or "NO CRIMINAL RECORD" readout
• Evidence camera mode: frame-within-frame recording indicator
• Vital signs monitor (Murphy's remaining human components)
• "THANK YOU FOR YOUR COOPERATION" message ready
• Detroit Metro Police Department badge number: 001
• OCP PRODUCT ID: ROBOCOP UNIT ALPHA
• OCP uplink connection status
• Hydraulic pressure readings
• Armor integrity percentage per body section
• "DEAD OR ALIVE, YOU ARE COMING WITH ME" alert mode

SCAN AND DISPLAY EFFECTS:
• Clean horizontal scan lines (subtle, high-resolution appearance)
• Digital processing artifacts at screen edges
• Slight chromatic separation on bright elements (blue/cyan split)
• Crisp geometric shapes (no CRT distortion - advanced display)
• Phosphor-style glow on bright white elements
• Subtle vignette darkening at visor edges
• Frame-rate indicator suggesting video recording
• Zoom capability indicator (targeting mode)
• Light enhancement in dark areas (night vision capability)

COLOR PALETTE (CRITICAL):
• PRIMARY BACKGROUND: Deep blue-black (#000814 to #001233)
• INTERFACE ELEMENTS: Bright white (#FFFFFF) and cyan (#00FFFF)
• SUBJECT HIGHLIGHTS: Pale blue-white (#ADD8E6 to #FFFFFF)
• DATA TEXT: Clean white (#FFFFFF) or bright cyan (#00FFFF)
• WARNING ELEMENTS: Amber/yellow (#FFB300) for caution
• CRITICAL ALERTS: Red (#FF0000) for armed suspects
• TARGETING RETICLE: Bright white with cyan outline
• OCP BRANDING: White on dark blue
• Cool, clinical law enforcement professional aesthetic throughout
• High contrast, clean readability throughout

TEXT AND TYPOGRAPHY:
• Clean, modern monospaced font (professional law enforcement)
• Mixed case allowed (sophisticated OCP system)
• Multiple data panels arranged cleanly at screen edges
• Legal language and police procedure terminology
• OCP corporate language mixed with police codes
• Radio codes: 10-4, 10-20, Code 3, etc.
• Real-time timestamp and badge authentication
• Case file numbers auto-populating
• Evidence tag numbers appearing on objects

ENVIRONMENT ANALYSIS:
• Crime scene assessment of entire environment
• Every object tagged with evidence potential
• Structural damage assessment (Detroit is a war zone)
• Illegal weapon or contraband detection highlighted
• Getaway vehicle identification and plate recognition
• Drug lab or illegal activity detection
• OCP property identification (Delta City development zones)
• Security camera feeds noted
• Civilian casualty risk assessment
• Escape route prediction for fleeing suspects

FRAME COMPOSITION:
• Rounded rectangular visor vignette (helmet display housing)
• Maintain original camera angle and perspective
• Sharp precision focus (superior cybernetic optics)
• Wider field of view than human - slight wide-angle
• Data panels arranged professionally at all four edges
• Center of frame kept clear for primary subject
• Recording indicator (REC) with timestamp
• Battery/power cell indicator

DETAIL AND CLARITY:
• Cyborg vision superior to human but feels like police equipment
• Professional, clinical rendering of scene
• Evidence documentation quality throughout
• Motion tracking on moving subjects
• License plate recognition on any vehicles
• Ballistic trajectory calculation if weapons present
• Structural weak points highlighted (for forced entry)
• Crowd control assessment if multiple subjects

FINAL RESULT:
A complete cyborg law enforcement vision transformation of the scene as viewed through RoboCop's visor display. The entire image is rendered in a cool blue-white digital palette with the distinctive OCP corporate interface aesthetic, featuring criminal database query boxes around human subjects, evidence tagging throughout the environment, the four Prime Directives prominently displayed (with Directive 4 classified), facial recognition scanning overlays, targeting reticles with Auto-9 trajectory prediction, armor integrity readouts, and the characteristic clean professional font of a 2028 Detroit OCP law enforcement computer system. The image must be instantly recognizable as RoboCop vision - part cop, part machine, all law - with every element assessed for criminal activity, threat level, and evidence value. The effect should be faithful to the 1987 film, evoking the perspective of Alex Murphy seeing his city through the lens of OCP technology, simultaneously human enough to care and machine enough to process everything as data.

name: ROBOT
message: Take a picture and make everything into mechanical robots that maintain the characteristics of the objects. Make it photorealistic.

name: ROB REINER FILM
message:
Take a picture of the subject and place them into a famous scene from a Rob Reiner film.

FILM SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a Rob Reiner film, USE THAT FILM
• If no film is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE film using the RANDOM SEED
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 0,1: SELECT The Princess Bride
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 2,3: SELECT When Harry Met Sally
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 4,5: SELECT Stand by Me
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 6: SELECT Misery
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 7: SELECT This Is Spinal Tap
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 8: SELECT A Few Good Men
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 9: SELECT The American President

The subject should be integrated naturally into the scene, interacting with the environment and other characters in a way that makes them the central focus.

Lighting, perspective, and costume should match the film style and era, making it look like a real frame from the movie.

Optional flavor text from the master prompt can influence which film or scene to use, or what absurd twist to add (e.g., subject delivers the iconic line, performs the fencing duel, or sits in the famous diner scene with a ridiculous expression).

The final image should be humorous, cinematic, and instantly recognizable as a reimagined Rob Reiner movie scene starring the subject.

name: ROCKWELL
message: Take a picture in the style of a Norman Rockwell illustration. Render with meticulous detail and vibrant colors to portray realistic, yet idealized nostalgic Americana.

name: ROCOCO
message: Take a picture and transform the image into Rococo style painting. Pastel colors, ornamental patterns, playful composition, delicate brushstrokes, floral and interior details.

name: RODEO
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a rodeo cowboy or cowgirl in a high-energy rodeo scene.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• The scene depicts a professional rodeo performance — not danger or harm
• The subject is skilled, confident, and in control

SCENE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a scene type, USE THAT SCENE TYPE
• If no scene type is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE scene type using the RANDOM SEED
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in an EVEN number (0,2,4,6,8): SELECT Bull Riding
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in an ODD number (1,3,5,7,9): SELECT Bareback / Bronco Riding

1. Bull Riding:
• Subject riding a powerful bucking bull
• One hand gripping the rope, the other raised
• Bull mid-kick or twist, dynamic motion
• Dirt flying, arena energy

2. Bareback / Bronco Riding:
• Subject riding a wild horse or bronco
• Muscular motion and airborne hooves
• Saddle or rigging appropriate to rodeo style

SAFETY & PRESENTATION RULES (CRITICAL):
• No injury
• No falling or being thrown
• No gore or distress
• The animal is athletic and powerful, not aggressive

ENVIRONMENT:
• Outdoor rodeo arena
• Dirt floor, fences, chutes
• Western crowd, banners, stadium lights

WARDROBE:
• Cowboy hat, boots, jeans, belt buckle
• Rodeo vest or western shirt
• Gloves, chaps if appropriate

STYLE:
• Photorealistic
• High shutter-speed action photography feel
• Dust, motion, and drama

IDENTITY:
• Preserve the subject's recognizable facial features
• Face visible and expressive

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a professional rodeo action photograph capturing the subject as a capable, fearless rodeo rider in a dramatic but safe moment.

name: ROMANTASY
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject(s) into a romantic fantasy scene, combining high-stakes magical settings with intense emotional relationships. Create an immersive world where romance drives the fantasy conflict, featuring passionate dynamics, supernatural elements, and dramatic tension.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• This is ROMANTASY - a fusion of high fantasy world-building with intense emotional romance
• The scene must balance epic fantasy elements with passionate romantic tension
• Characters are placed in a magical setting where their emotional connections are central to the narrative
• The tone is dramatic, emotional, and immersive - designed to evoke strong feelings
• Relationships are intense, often featuring possessive dynamics, fated connections, or complex emotional bonds
• The fantasy elements serve the romance, and the romance drives the fantasy conflict
• Subject(s) must remain recognizable while being transformed into romantasy characters

CHARACTER TRANSFORMATION (CRITICAL):
• Subject(s) become romantasy protagonists in an ongoing emotional saga
• Facial features and identity MUST be preserved - this is still clearly the subject
• Characters are rendered as flawed, passionate, emotionally complex individuals
• Physical appearance enhanced with fantasy elements while maintaining recognizability:
  - Otherworldly beauty (glowing skin, intense eyes, ethereal features)
  - Fantasy race indicators if appropriate (pointed ears for fae, fangs for vampires, etc.)
  - Magical markings, runes, or tattoos that suggest destiny or power
  - Hair may have magical qualities (flowing unnaturally, streaked with unusual colors)
  - Eyes may glow or have unusual coloring suggesting magical nature
  - Clothing blends fantasy and sensuality (flowing fabrics, strategic coverage, ornate details)

RELATIONSHIP DYNAMIC SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a relationship dynamic, USE THAT DYNAMIC
• If none specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE dynamic using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST DIGIT of the RANDOM SEED modulo 10:
  - 0: FATED MATES - destined soulmates with undeniable magical bond
  - 1: ENEMIES TO LOVERS - fierce rivals forced into alliance, sparks flying
  - 2: WHY CHOOSE - protagonist surrounded by multiple devoted love interests
  - 3: FORBIDDEN LOVE - impossible romance across enemy lines or forbidden boundaries
  - 4: DARK PROTECTOR - dangerous, morally gray figure obsessively protective of protagonist
  - 5: ROYAL INTRIGUE - political marriage turns into genuine passionate connection
  - 6: IMMORTAL YEARNING - centuries-old being finally finds their match
  - 7: MAGICAL BONDING - spell or curse ties two souls together intimately
  - 8: WARRIOR BOND - battle companions whose trust deepens into fierce love
  - 9: RIVAL COURTS - leaders of opposing magical factions in forbidden attraction

DYNAMIC 0 - FATED MATES:
• Subjects positioned close, undeniable chemistry visible
• Magical connection literally visible: glowing threads, matching marks, or auras intertwining
• Eyes locked with intense recognition and longing
• Touching (hand-holding, embrace, faces close) with reverent intensity
• Magical symbols or runes appearing on both bodies in matching patterns
• The air around them shimmers with destiny magic
• Expression: awe, overwhelming emotion, inevitability, deep longing
• Setting suggests the moment of recognition or reunion

DYNAMIC 1 - ENEMIES TO LOVERS:
• Subjects positioned confrontationally but with undeniable tension
• Weapons drawn OR magic crackling between them
• Close proximity despite hostility - unable to stay away
• Intense eye contact mixing fury with attraction
• Body language: aggressive stances softening at edges, leaning toward each other despite themselves
• One may have the other pinned/cornered - dominance and vulnerability interplay
• Expression: anger mixed with desire, conflicted passion, fierce intensity
• Setting: battlefield, throne room confrontation, or contested territory

DYNAMIC 2 - WHY CHOOSE:
• Central protagonist surrounded by 2-4 devoted love interests
• Each suitor displaying different archetype: warrior, mage, rogue, royal, etc.
• All attention focused on protagonist with varying expressions of devotion
• Protagonist looking torn, overwhelmed, or confidently accepting all
• Each suitor touching or near the protagonist, claiming space
• Visual tension between suitors but united in desire for protagonist
• Setting: court, magical bower, or liminal space where all converge

DYNAMIC 3 - FORBIDDEN LOVE:
• Subjects from opposing sides meeting in secret
• Visual indicators of different factions: contrasting colors, opposite magical signatures
• Desperate, stolen moment of connection
• Touching hidden or secretive - hands clasped, stolen kiss, forbidden embrace
• Looking over shoulders, aware of danger
• Expression: passionate desperation, defiant love, aching longing
• Setting: border between territories, hidden grove, or shadowed meeting place

DYNAMIC 4 - DARK PROTECTOR:
• Dominant, dangerous figure looming protectively over/around protagonist
• Protector: dark, morally ambiguous, possessive body language
• Protagonist: may appear vulnerable but with inner fire/power
• Protector's hand on protagonist (shoulder, waist, face) - claiming and protecting
• Dark magical aura around protector, lighter aura around protagonist
• Expression: protector - fierce, obsessive devotion; protagonist - trust mixed with awareness of danger
• Setting: danger lurking, protector as barrier between protagonist and threat

DYNAMIC 5 - ROYAL INTRIGUE:
• Subjects in regal attire with crowns, circlets, or noble insignia
• Political marriage setting: thrones, formal positioning, crown jewels
• But body language betrays genuine feeling breaking through formality
• Touching that seems formal but lingers - hand kisses, formal embrace that deepens
• Eyes communicating what protocol forbids them to show publicly
• Expression: restrained passion, duty warring with desire
• Setting: throne room, formal court, political ceremony turning intimate

DYNAMIC 6 - IMMORTAL YEARNING:
• One subject clearly ancient (ageless beauty, old soul in young face, magical timelessness)
• Other subject the first to make them feel truly alive in centuries
• Immortal touching mortal with reverent wonder - as if they might break
• Mortal fearless despite power difference
• Magical indicators of age: stars in eyes, timeless quality, ancient runes
• Expression: immortal - awakening, rediscovery of feeling; mortal - bold, transformative
• Setting: timeless place (ancient library, eternal grove, place between moments)

DYNAMIC 7 - MAGICAL BONDING:
• Subjects connected by visible magical force - chains, threads, merged auras
• Bond may be unwanted initially but creating unwilling intimacy
• Unable to be physically distant - pulled together by magic
• Sharing sensations, emotions, or thoughts visible through mirrored expressions
• Magical symbols linking them physically and spiritually
• Expression: frustration mixed with growing connection, resistance fading to acceptance
• Setting: site of bonding spell or where they're learning to navigate connection

DYNAMIC 8 - WARRIOR BOND:
• Subjects in battle gear, weapons ready, fighting together
• Back-to-back or side-by-side in combat stance
• Trust and synchronization visible in positioning
• Battle-worn but glancing at each other with fierce devotion
• Scars and weapons telling story of shared trials
• Expression: fierce loyalty, trust deeper than romance, battle fury mixed with protective love
• Setting: battlefield, training ground, or moment between conflicts

DYNAMIC 9 - RIVAL COURTS:
• Subjects representing opposing magical courts/factions
• Visual contrast: opposing color schemes, different magical signatures
• Meeting in neutral ground or contested space
• Forbidden attraction across political divide
• Crown/leadership symbols visible on both
• Expression: desire fighting duty, passion despite consequences
• Setting: border territory, peace negotiation, or secret neutral meeting ground

FANTASY SETTING AND WORLD-BUILDING:
• High fantasy environment with rich magical detail:
  - Ancient architecture (crumbling temples, grand palaces, mystical groves)
  - Magical phenomena visible: floating crystals, aurora lights, impossible plants
  - Runes, sigils, or glyphs glowing on surfaces
  - Otherworldly sky (multiple moons, nebulae, eternal sunset/twilight)
  - Elemental magic visible in environment (flames, ice, shadow, light)
  - Fae courts, vampire courts, dragon lairs, or other supernatural realm aesthetics
• Setting serves the emotional tone:
  - Intimate spaces for secret meetings
  - Grand spaces for dramatic confrontations
  - Liminal spaces for fated encounters
  - Dangerous spaces highlighting protective dynamics

CHARACTER ARCHETYPES AND PRESENTATION:
• FLAWED PROTAGONISTS:
  - Visible strength mixed with vulnerability
  - Complex expressions showing internal conflict
  - Power visible but complicated by emotion
  - Scars, marks, or indicators of past trauma/trials
• POSSESSIVE DYNAMICS:
  - Body language showing claim and protection
  - Touch that is reverent but claiming
  - Eye contact that is intense, consuming, obsessive
  - Positioning that shields or hovers
• SUPERNATURAL BEINGS:
  - Fae: pointed ears, otherworldly beauty, nature magic signatures
  - Vampires: fangs, pale perfection, shadow magic
  - Shifters: animal eyes, predatory grace, wild magic
  - Demons: horns, wings, dark power manifestations
  - Angels: wings, holy light, divine magic
  - Witches/Warlocks: spell components, magical auras
  - Dragons: scales, wings, elemental power
  - Hybrid beings combining multiple supernatural elements

EMOTIONAL INTENSITY (CRITICAL):
• Expressions must convey STRONG FEELINGS:
  - Longing that aches visibly
  - Desire that cannot be hidden
  - Love that defies reason
  - Passion that overrides caution
  - Devotion that borders on obsession
  - Vulnerability in intimacy
  - Fierce protectiveness
• Body language communicates emotional stakes:
  - Leaning in despite danger
  - Touching as if drawn by gravity
  - Distance that feels painful
  - Proximity that feels magnetic
  - Gestures both tender and possessive

COSTUME AND STYLING:
• Fantasy fashion with romantic elements:
  - Flowing fabrics (silk, velvet, ethereal materials)
  - Strategic coverage and revelation
  - Rich colors (jewel tones, midnight blues, deep crimsons, forest greens)
  - Ornate details (embroidery, magical weaving, living vines)
  - Armor that is both protective and aesthetic
  - Crowns, circlets, or noble adornments
  - Magical jewelry (glowing gems, enchanted metals)
  - Practical fantasy clothing that still emphasizes attractiveness
• Hair styling:
  - Elaborate braids with magical elements woven through
  - Flowing, wind-touched, or magically animated
  - Adorned with flowers, jewels, or magical light
  - Natural but enhanced to supernatural beauty

LIGHTING AND ATMOSPHERE:
• Dramatic, emotional lighting:
  - Golden hour glow (eternal sunset aesthetic)
  - Moonlight and starlight (ethereal silver)
  - Magical light sources (glowing crystals, spell-light, bioluminescence)
  - Firelight (romantic and dramatic)
  - Aurora effects (magical and otherworldly)
  - Contrast between light and shadow emphasizing drama
• Atmosphere effects:
  - Mist or magical fog
  - Floating magical particles (fireflies, spell remnants, fairy lights)
  - Petals, leaves, or magical elements drifting through air
  - Weather that reflects emotion (gentle rain, wind, clearing storms)

COLOR PALETTE:
• Rich, saturated fantasy colors:
  - Deep jewel tones (sapphire, emerald, ruby, amethyst)
  - Magical accent colors (silver, gold, rose gold)
  - Contrasting colors for opposing forces/courts
  - Skin tones enhanced with otherworldly glow
  - Eyes in unusual colors (violet, gold, silver, multi-toned)
  - Hair in natural or magical colors depending on character
• Color symbolism:
  - Warm colors for passion and fire magic
  - Cool colors for ice, water, or night magic
  - Green for nature, fae, or growth
  - Purple for power, mystery, or ancient magic
  - Red for blood bonds, fire, or vampiric themes

COMPOSITION:
• Focus on subjects as central emotional anchor
• Environment supports but doesn't overwhelm the relationship dynamic
• Rule of thirds placing subjects in engaging positions
• Depth and layers showing richness of fantasy world
• Negative space used to emphasize isolation or intimacy
• Dynamic angles suggesting drama and intensity

FINAL RESULT:
A breathtaking romantic fantasy scene where the subject(s) are transformed into protagonists of an intense, magical love story. The image combines epic high fantasy world-building - with rich magical environments, supernatural elements, and otherworldly beauty - with passionate, emotionally charged relationship dynamics. Whether depicting fated mates recognizing their bond, enemies whose hatred burns into desire, a protagonist surrounded by devoted suitors, or any other romantasy dynamic, the scene pulses with dramatic tension and deep feeling. Subjects remain recognizable while being elevated to fantasy romance protagonists - beautiful, powerful, flawed, and caught in relationships that defy logic but feel inevitable. The setting is lush with magical detail, the lighting is dramatic and romantic, and every element - from body language to environment - works together to create an immersive world where love and magic are inseparably intertwined, where emotional stakes are as high as the fantasy conflict, and where passion drives the narrative forward.

name: ROMANTICISM
message: Take a picture in the style of a Romanticism painting. Moody lighting, emotional intensity, dramatic composition, and expressive colors. Subject central and impactful.

name: ROMANESQUE PAINTING
message: Take a picture and transform the image into Romanesque-style painting. Simplify forms, use bold outlines, flat areas of color, and stylized faces. Include architectural or decorative elements inspired by early medieval European art. Keep the subject recognizable while appearing as if part of a historical religious or historical scene.

name: RON HOWARD FILM
message:
Take a picture and place the subject into a Ron Howard film scene.

FILM/SCENE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a Ron Howard film, USE THAT FILM
• If no film is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE Ron Howard film using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST TWO DIGITS of the RANDOM SEED modulo 12:
  - 0: Apollo 13 (1960s space race, NASA control room, astronaut determination)
  - 1: A Beautiful Mind (academic settings, mathematical breakthroughs, mental struggle)
  - 2: Cinderella Man (Depression-era boxing, family struggle, comeback story)
  - 3: Rush (1970s Formula 1 racing, rivalry, speed and danger)
  - 4: Frost/Nixon (1970s political interview, tense confrontation)
  - 5: The Da Vinci Code (historical mystery, religious intrigue)
  - 6: Cocoon (elderly characters, sci-fi wonder, humanity)
  - 7: Backdraft (firefighter heroism, brotherhood, danger)
  - 8: Far and Away (Irish immigration, American frontier)
  - 9: Ransom (parental desperation, high-stakes negotiation)
  - 10: The Paper (newsroom chaos, journalistic integrity)
  - 11: Willow (fantasy adventure, heroic journey)

Use Howard's distinctive visual style: warm naturalistic lighting, golden hour cinematography, earnest emotional moments, sweeping crane shots suggesting epic scale, and polished mainstream Hollywood aesthetics. Show the subject in an uplifting dramatic moment - overcoming adversity, making a crucial decision, experiencing triumph, or in a heartfelt human connection. Include Ron Howard signature elements: based-on-true-story authenticity, period-accurate details, blue-collar American heroes, family dynamics, or historical events. Use his characteristic cinematography - warm amber tones, soft diffused lighting for emotional scenes, dramatic backlighting, clean compositions that feel accessible yet cinematic. Capture his style of inspirational storytelling - moments that feel genuine, hopeful, and emotionally resonant without cynicism. Include visual motifs of determination, teamwork, or human perseverance. Make it look like a frame from the selected film with that polished Ron Howard blend of emotional authenticity and crowd-pleasing cinema with the subject and additional characters from that film integrated seamlessly into the world.

name: RORSCHACH TEST
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform them into a symmetrical inkblot in the style of a classic Rorschach test.

INKBLOT STYLE (CRITICAL):
• The image must follow authentic Rorschach inkblot aesthetics
• Bilateral symmetry along a central vertical axis is mandatory
• Organic, amorphous ink spread with feathered edges, pooling, and natural bleed
• Avoid clean outlines, silhouettes, or sharp subject-shaped borders

IDENTITY PRESERVATION (CRITICAL):
• The subject must remain subtly recognizable through abstract suggestion rather than literal shape
• Facial characteristics such as eye spacing, head proportions, posture, or distinctive features should emerge naturally within the ink patterns
• The result must look like a psychological inkblot that coincidentally resembles the subject, not an inkblot cut into the subject’s shape
• Avoid obvious face cutouts, traced contours, or literal body forms

INK AND COLOR:
• Primarily black ink on an off-white or aged paper background
• Optional restrained accent colors (dark red, muted blue, sepia) only if consistent with real Rorschach plates
• Ink density should vary with darker central masses and lighter peripheral diffusion

COMPOSITION AND PRESENTATION:
• Centered composition with ample negative space
• Flat, scanned-paper or photographed-test-card appearance
• Subtle paper texture, creases, or aging allowed
• No background scenery or environment

PSYCHOLOGICAL TONE:
• Ambiguous, unsettling, and open to interpretation
• Image should invite multiple interpretations rather than a single obvious reading
• Serious, clinical tone rather than playful or decorative

FINAL RESULT:
The final image should look like an authentic Rorschach test plate created by ink folded on paper, where the subject’s identity emerges abstractly through symmetry and ink behavior rather than literal depiction.

name: ROTTEN TOMATOES
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a Rotten Tomatoes–style documentary review page judging the life of the subject as if it were a film.

CORE CONCEPT:
The subject’s LIFE is the documentary.
The image should present the subject as the main documentary subject being critically reviewed.

CRITICAL PRESENTATION RULE:
The final image MUST look like a Rotten Tomatoes review page or score card — NOT a movie poster alone.

LAYOUT REQUIREMENTS:
• Prominent documentary title based on the subject
• Rotten / Fresh score presentation (Tomatometer-style)
• Critics score and Audience score (can be exaggerated or absurd)
• Short review blurbs placed around the image
• Overall layout must resemble an entertainment review website

DOCUMENTARY TITLE:
• Invent a humorous documentary title inspired by:
  – Subject’s appearance
  – Body language
  – Clothing
  – Environment
• Titles should sound serious but be funny when applied to the subject

Examples (STYLE ONLY):
• "Standing Still: A Life of Mild Confusion"
• "Mostly Late: The [Name] Story"
• "Unprepared for Success"

FLAVOR TEXT & REVIEWS:
• Write multiple short critic-style quotes
• Tone should mimic real film criticism — dramatic, pretentious, or snarky
• May exaggerate flaws or mundane traits humorously
• If master prompt text is provided, incorporate it into reviews or the synopsis

Examples (STYLE ONLY):
• "An unflinching look at questionable choices."
• "Ambitious, but fundamentally unnecessary."
• "It insists upon itself."

SCORING RULES:
• Scores may be illogically high or brutally low for comedic effect
• Use percentages, icons, or meters consistent with review culture
• Critics and audience scores may strongly disagree

SUBJECT INTEGRATION:
• The subject should appear as the documentary’s central visual — posed seriously, candidly, or awkwardly
• Lighting and framing should feel like a documentary still or press image

ABSOLUTE PROHIBITIONS:
• DO NOT create a generic meme
• DO NOT ignore review-site layout conventions
• DO NOT make the subject a fictional character — this is a documentary about THEM

FINAL RESULT:
The image must look like a legitimate Rotten Tomatoes documentary review page judging the subject’s life — complete with title, scores, critic blurbs, and serious presentation that makes the absurd premise funnier.

name: ROUTE 66 BILLBOARD
message:
Take a picture of the subject and place them on a classic roadside Route 66 billboard.

The billboard should be realistic, with full structural support, shadows, perspective, and wear consistent with the environment.

The subject should be painted, printed, or applied as part of the advertisement, fully integrated with the surface of the billboard — not floating or pasted.

Include environmental details like the highway, desert landscape, distant mountains, signage poles, or roadside features visible in the original scene.

Colors, lighting, and weathering should match the local environment, with subtle fading, sun bleaching, or paint wear appropriate for a roadside billboard.

The final image should look like a real photograph of a Route 66 billboard featuring the subject.

name: ROYAL PORTRAIT
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform them into a royal figure in a classic painted portrait.

Dress the subject in elegant royal clothing such as crowns, robes, medals, or gowns.

Place them in a grand palace or painted studio background.

The style should resemble a formal oil painting with dramatic lighting and rich colors.

The subject should look powerful, noble, and slightly over-the-top, like a legendary monarch.

name: ROYAL WEDDING
message:
Take a picture and transform the scene so the subject appears to be WALKING on a wall or ceiling while the room itself remains completely normal and upright, inspired by Fred Astaire’s 'Royal Wedding.'

CORE REQUIREMENTS (NON-NEGOTIABLE):
• The camera is upright and unrotated
• The room appears normal and correctly oriented
• ONLY the subject is oriented sideways or upside down

SURFACE CONTACT (CRITICAL):
• BOTH feet must be firmly pressed against a visible wall or ceiling
• Shoe soles must appear flattened against the surface
• The subject’s spine must align with the wall or ceiling plane
• The subject must be perpendicular to the floor

VISUAL ANCHORS (CRITICAL):
• A clear shadow must connect the subject’s feet to the surface
• Clothing and hair must hang toward the wall or ceiling
• Hands may lightly touch nearby surfaces for balance

PROHIBITIONS:
• NO floating or hovering
• NO oversized subject
• NO camera rotation
• NO rotated furniture

SUBJECT ACTION:
• Natural walking pose
• Casual, relaxed movement
• No acrobatics or jumping

FINAL RESULT:
The image must look like a normal photograph of a real room where the subject is unmistakably walking on a wall or ceiling, physically supported by the surface with visible contact, shadows, and correct posture — never floating.

name: RPG PORTRAIT
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into an RPG character portrait. Fantasy UI frame, stat panel styling. Painted character art. The result should be a full view of the portrait with a relevant background behind the portrait.

name: RUBBER DUCKIE
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a yellow rubber duck bath toy. Bright yellow rubber material with orange beak, glossy plastic surface with light reflections, squeezable toy texture, black dot eyes. The subject's recognizable features should be incorporated into the duck's shape and form. Bath toy appearance, floating in water with subtle ripples, playful and whimsical.

name: RUBBER HOSE
message: Take a picture and transform the image into 1930s rubber hose animation style. Bouncy limbs, simple faces. Vintage cartoon aesthetic.

name: RUNNING FROM THE BULLS
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a participant in the Running of the Bulls festival in Pamplona, Spain. Show the subject running comically away from a bull in an exaggerated, cartoonish chase — wide eyes, flailing arms, slipping on cobblestones, or losing a hat. Include other festival participants and spectators reacting humorously. The bull should look energetic and lively, but not menacing or injuring anyone. Emphasize dynamic motion, motion blur, and chaotic festival energy. Lighting and perspective should match real action photography, making the subject feel naturally part of the crowded festival scene while keeping it funny and over-the-top.

name: RUSSIAN ICONOGRAPHY
message: Take a picture and transform the image into Russian iconography style art. Stylized facial features, gold accents, symbolic colors, frontal composition, and spiritual solemnity.

name: SAND ART BOTTLE
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a photorealistic sand art bottle, where colored sand was meticulously layered inside a real glass bottle to form the subject's portrait.

CORE CONCEPT (NON-NEGOTIABLE):
• The image must be a PHOTOGRAPH of a real physical sand art bottle
• Photorealistic quality—this must look like an actual object you could hold
• Real colored sand carefully poured and layered inside a genuine glass bottle
• Not a cartoon, illustration, or digitally textured image
• The subject's portrait is formed by the strategic layering of different colored sand

MATERIAL RULES (CRITICAL):
• Real fine-grain colored sand with authentic sand texture visible
• Distinct horizontal or contoured layers showing pour lines
• Crisp boundaries between sand colors where layers meet
• Slight natural settling, compression, and sand grain visibility
• Multiple sand colors used to create the portrait (10-20 different colors typical)
• Sand has realistic granular texture when viewed closely
• Some layers may have slight imperfections or air pockets (natural to sand art)

GLASS BOTTLE CONSTRUCTION:
• Real clear glass bottle (not cartoon or simplified)
• Typical sand art bottle shape: cylindrical body, narrow neck
• Cork or decorative cap sealing the top
• Visible glass thickness and slight imperfections
• Glass curvature causes optical distortion of sand layers near edges
• Light refraction through glass creates realistic lens effects
• Fingerprints, dust, or very slight smudges may be visible on glass (adds realism)
• Bottom of bottle shows compressed sand layers

STRUCTURAL RULES (PHYSICS OF SAND):
• Sand layers follow gravity—heavier/darker at bottom, compressed
• No floating elements—every sand particle is supported by the layer below
• Portrait formed through careful contour layering (peaks and valleys of sand)
• Image must distort slightly near bottle curves due to glass refraction
• Sand surface at top may be slightly uneven or have a cork pressed into it
• Layers may show slight settling over time (realistic for sand art)

PORTRAIT CONSTRUCTION:
• Subject's face formed through strategic sand layer shapes and colors
• Facial features created by contrasting sand colors
• Skin tones: tan, beige, brown, cream sand layers
• Hair: appropriate colored sand (black, brown, blonde, gray, etc.) in flowing layers
• Eyes: darker sand colors creating eye shapes and highlights
• Clothing/background: complementary colored sand layers
• The portrait is simplified but clearly recognizable as the subject
• Artist's skill in sand layering makes the likeness apparent

IDENTITY PRESERVATION:
• Subject's face and key features readable through sand layer arrangement
• Some simplification is natural to the medium, but likeness must remain clear
• The viewing angle and sand layer contours work together to reveal the portrait
• From the front, the subject is unmistakably recognizable

PHOTOGRAPHY AND PRESENTATION:
• Professional product photography of the actual sand art bottle
• Soft, even lighting revealing sand texture and glass clarity
• Slight shadows between layers add depth
• Glass reflections and light refractions visible and realistic
• Background: neutral (white, gray, or wood surface) to showcase the bottle
• Depth of field keeps bottle in focus with slight background blur
• Lighting highlights the translucency of sand and transparency of glass
• The photo could be used in a craft fair catalog or art gallery

REALISM REQUIREMENTS:
• Must pass as a photograph of a real handcrafted object
• Sand texture must be granular and authentic when examined
• Glass must have realistic optical properties
• No cartoon shading, no flat colors, no illustration style
• Shadows, highlights, and reflections must be physically accurate
• The bottle must look tangible—viewer should feel they could pick it up

ANTI-CHEATING RULES:
• NO painted textures or illustrated sand
• NO photographic clarity of the subject's face (sand is abstract medium)
• NO smooth gradients—sand has grain and distinct layer boundaries
• NO floating or impossible sand geometry—gravity applies
• NO digital overlays or mixed media—pure sand in glass only
• NO cartoon bottle—must be photorealistic glasswork

FINAL RESULT:
A stunning photograph of an actual handcrafted sand art bottle, where the subject's portrait has been painstakingly created through the precise layering of colored sand inside a real clear glass bottle. The image is photorealistic—appearing as a tangible craft object with authentic sand texture, genuine glass optical properties, and the natural physics of layered sand. The subject's likeness is clearly recognizable through the artistic arrangement of sand layers, demonstrating both the craftsperson's skill and the unique beauty of sand art as a medium. The bottle looks real enough to purchase at an art fair.

name: SAND SCULPTURE
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a detailed sand sculpture on the beach.

CRITICAL - COMPLETE SAND TRANSFORMATION:
• Subject IS MADE OF SAND - not a photo in sand
• Every part of subject constructed from beach sand
• NO photographic elements remain
• Subject's form recognizable but carved entirely from sand
• Face, body, clothing - all sculpted in sand
• This is a sand castle sculpture, not a picture with sand

BEACH SETTING (CRITICAL):
• Subject sculpture located ON THE BEACH
• Ocean visible in background
• Sandy beach environment
• Shoreline, waves, surf visible
• Blue sky or sunset sky
• Beach atmosphere essential

SAND SCULPTURE CONSTRUCTION:
• Packed wet sand carved and shaped
• Beach sand texture visible (grainy, granular)
• Sand color: Tan, beige, light brown, golden
• Detailed carving techniques visible
• Professional sand sculpture competition quality
• Intricate carved details
• Sand castle festival aesthetic

SUBJECT RECOGNITION:
• Overall form clearly recognizable as the subject
• Pose maintained in sand sculpture
• Face features carved in relief:
  - Eyes: Carved indentations or shapes
  - Nose: Protruding carved nose
  - Mouth: Carved line or smile
  - Hair: Textured, carved flowing hair
• Clothing details carved (buttons, folds, textures)
• Subject's likeness in sand sculpture form
• Identity visible through skilled carving

SAND CARVING TECHNIQUES:
• Smooth carved surfaces for skin
• Textured areas for hair and clothing
• Sharp edges and defined lines
• Undercutting for depth
• Layered carving for dimension
• Professional sculptor techniques
• Tools marks possibly visible

SAND TEXTURE:
• Grainy sand surface visible up close
• Individual grains suggested
• Wet packed sand appearance
• Not smooth - sand texture throughout
• Some areas more detailed than others
• Natural beach sand material

SCULPTURE SCALE:
• Life-sized or larger than life
• Monumental sand sculpture
• Impressive size and scope
• Festival competition scale
• Beach visitors for scale reference (optional)

DETAIL LEVEL:
• High detail and craftsmanship
• Intricate facial features
• Clothing folds and textures
• Hair strands carved
• Fine details throughout
• Competition-winning quality
• Artist signature possible

BEACH ELEMENTS:
• Ocean waves in background
• Blue water and sky
• Seagulls flying (optional)
• Other beachgoers in distance (optional)
• Beach towels, umbrellas nearby (optional)
• Shoreline and surf zone
• Sandy beach extending around sculpture

LIGHTING:
• Natural beach sunlight
• Golden hour light ideal (sunset/sunrise)
• Bright daylight acceptable
• Sun creating shadows on carved details
• Highlights and shadows define form
• Beach lighting atmosphere

SAND SCULPTURE STABILITY:
• Structure appears solid and stable
• Wet sand packed firmly
• May show water spray bottle nearby (sculptors use these)
• Base wider for support
• Engineering of sand castle visible

WEATHERING:
• Freshly carved (not eroded)
• Some areas may show slight wind wear
• Edges still sharp and defined
• Not collapsed or falling apart
• Built to last the day

BEACH ATMOSPHERE:
• Vacation, summer vibes
• Relaxed beach setting
• Coastal environment
• Salt air and sunshine
• Seaside resort aesthetic

STYLE:
• Photorealistic sand sculpture
• Documentary beach photography
• Professional sand sculpting art
• Festival competition aesthetic
• Could be from sand castle competition
• High-quality beach art installation

NOT ALLOWED:
• Subject photo placed in sand
• Subject standing next to sand castle
• Drawing in sand
• Photo with sand sprinkled on it
• Any photographic human features
• Sand overlay on photo

SURROUNDING BEACH:
• Footprints in sand nearby
• Tide line visible
• Ocean horizon
• Beach stretching into distance
• Natural beach environment
• Sculpture is centerpiece

VIEWING ANGLE:
• Full view of sculpture
• Ocean visible behind or beside
• Subject sculpture prominently displayed
• Beach context clear
• Could be frontal or three-quarter view

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject completely transformed into an intricately detailed sand sculpture carved from beach sand, located on an actual beach with the ocean visible in the background, displaying professional sand sculpting techniques with textured granular sand surfaces, carved details defining the subject's likeness, and the natural beach environment - NOT a photograph in sand, but the actual subject recreated as an elaborate competition-quality sand castle sculpture on the shoreline.

name: SATURDAY EVENING POST
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a Norman Rockwell–style Saturday Evening Post magazine cover.

CORE CONCEPT:
The subject is the central character in a single, readable moment that tells a clear story.

COVER COMPOSITION (CRITICAL):
• Vertical magazine cover layout
• Subject centered or prominently framed
• Clean, uncluttered background
• Strong narrative focus on one everyday moment

SUBJECT REQUIREMENTS:
• The subject must be a full or near-full figure
• Expression and body language must tell a story
• The subject should appear caught mid-moment (awkward, proud, embarrassed, thoughtful, mischievous)

STYLE & MEDIUM:
• Hand-painted illustration style
• Smooth, detailed brushwork
• Realistic but idealized proportions
• Warm, nostalgic Americana color palette

DETAILING:
• Highly detailed clothing, props, and facial expressions
• Subtle humor or irony visible on closer inspection
• No exaggerated caricature — realism with charm

TEXT ELEMENTS:
• Include "The Saturday Evening Post" masthead at the top
• Optional small cover text or date in period-appropriate typography
• Text must feel secondary to the illustration

ENVIRONMENT:
• Everyday American life setting (school, street, home, barbershop, workplace, small town scene)
• Time period ambiguous but mid-20th-century inspired

ABSOLUTE PROHIBITIONS:
• NO modern digital illustration styles
• NO painterly abstraction
• NO parody exaggeration
• NO busy collage layouts

FINAL RESULT:
The image must look like an authentic Norman Rockwell Saturday Evening Post cover — warm, narrative-driven, nostalgic, and centered on a single human story moment starring the subject.

name: SCANDINAVIAN FOLK ART
message: Take a picture and transform the image into Scandinavian folk art style art. Decorative patterns, muted earthy tones, simple geometry, and traditional motifs.

name: SCARECROW
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a living scarecrow.

SCARECROW TYPE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies type, USE THAT TYPE
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST DIGIT:
  - 0: Traditional Friendly - classic straw scarecrow, button eyes, painted smile, harvest festival
  - 1: Sinister Living - straw creature, black button eyes, stitched mouth, creepy but not overtly evil
  - 2: Horror Movie - evil scarecrow, weapon-wielding, slasher film, murderous
  - 3: Wizard of Oz - friendly, seeking brain, colorful patches, whimsical but alive
  - 4: Pumpkin Head - jack-o'-lantern for head, Halloween scarecrow, autumn horror
  - 5: Ancient Harvest God - pagan deity, corn god, ritualistic, ancient power
  - 6: Possessed Scarecrow - demon inhabiting scarecrow, supernatural evil, glowing eyes
  - 7: Burning Scarecrow - on fire, wicker man style, sacrifice ritual, flames
  - 8: Rot and Decay - decomposing, moldy straw, crows nesting, autumn decay
  - 9: Modern Creepy - contemporary horror, found in suburban garden, uncanny

SUBJECT TRANSFORMATION:
• Subject's face visible through scarecrow form
• Burlap sack head with subject's features
• Subject AS the scarecrow, recognizable
• Face showing through material or painted on
• Identity maintained in transformation

HEAD & FACE:
• Burlap sack over head (most common)
• Subject's face visible through fabric OR
• Face painted/stitched on burlap
• Button eyes OR painted eyes OR real eyes visible
• Stitched smile OR painted mouth OR cloth mouth
• Straw poking out from neck
• Weathered, dirty burlap
• Possibly floppy farmer's hat on top

EYES:
• Large black buttons (friendly) OR
• Small buttons (sinister) OR
• Painted triangles or X's OR
• Real eyes glowing through fabric OR
• Hollow dark holes OR
• Glowing supernatural eyes
• Unblinking stare

MOUTH:
• Stitched smile or frown
• Painted on burlap
• Cloth mouth
• Asymmetrical (crooked)
• No mouth (just fabric)
• Sinister grin
• Stitched with thick thread

BODY CONSTRUCTION:
• Wooden pole/cross frame visible
• Straw stuffing bursting out
• Old farmer clothes:
  - Flannel shirt (plaid)
  - Overalls or jeans
  - Worn work clothes
  - Patches and tears
• Rope tied around waist and limbs
• Straw protruding from sleeves and pant legs
• Weathered and dirty clothing

STRAW STUFFING:
• Yellow/golden straw visible
• Poking out of seams
• Bursting from holes
• Stuffed thick in places
• Some straw falling out
• Dried and brittle
• Authentic hay/straw texture

CLOTHING:
• Faded flannel shirt (red/blue plaid)
• Denim overalls or jeans
• Old boots or no shoes (stick feet)
• Work gloves (straw hands)
• Leather belt with rope
• Patches sewn on
• Buttons missing
• Torn and weathered

HAT:
• Floppy straw farmer's hat OR
• Old fedora or bowler hat OR
• Wide-brimmed hat OR
• No hat (just burlap head)
• Weathered and sun-faded
• Bent and misshapen

ARMS & HANDS:
• Outstretched on cross pole OR
• Hanging limp OR
• Reaching toward viewer
• Stick hands with gloves OR
• Straw hands bursting out
• Wooden fingers visible
• Unnatural stiff pose

WEAPONS (Horror versions):
• Pitchfork
• Scythe
• Farming tools
• Rope (for hanging)
• None (just menacing presence)

POSE:
• Crucifixion pose on pole
• Standing upright (came to life)
• Walking stiffly
• Menacing approach
• Tending to crops
• Arms spread wide
• Slightly tilted (worn pole)

SETTING (CRITICAL - Cornfield/Farm):
• Cornfield or wheat field
• Autumn harvest time
• Farm or rural area
• Rows of corn
• Pumpkin patch nearby
• Barn in background
• Country road
• Golden hour autumn

TIME OF DAY:
• Golden hour (sunset)
• Dusk (most ominous)
• Foggy morning
• Overcast day
• Full moon night (horror)
• Twilight

WEATHER & SEASON:
• Autumn/fall season
• Harvest time
• October atmosphere
• Overcast or partly cloudy
• Wind blowing (straw moving)
• Crisp fall air
• Post-harvest field

AUTUMN ELEMENTS:
• Orange and yellow leaves
• Pumpkins scattered
• Corn stalks
• Dried crops
• Autumn colors (gold, orange, brown)
• Harvest moon
• Cool temperatures evident

CROWS/BIRDS:
• Crows perched on scarecrow
• Birds circling (ironic - not scared)
• Ravens nearby
• Blackbirds in field
• Bird nests in straw
• Feathers stuck to scarecrow

DECAY ELEMENTS (if applicable):
• Moldy straw
• Rotting fabric
• Torn clothing
• Weathered wood
• Faded colors
• Nature reclaiming it
• Mushrooms growing

SUPERNATURAL ELEMENTS (Horror versions):
• Glowing eyes
• Moving independently
• Shadow magic
• Possessed by spirit
• Unnatural animation
• Dark aura
• Sinister presence

LIGHTING:
• Golden hour warm light
• Backlit by setting sun
• Foggy atmospheric
• Moonlight (night scenes)
• Dramatic shadows
• Soft autumn light
• Rim lighting on edges

ATMOSPHERE:
• Rural, isolated
• Autumn harvest
• Americana/country
• Nostalgia OR dread
• Folk horror
• Traditional farming
• Lonely fields

FRIENDLY VS HORROR:
• Friendly: Bright colors, welcoming pose, cute
• Horror: Dark tones, menacing pose, threatening
• Ambiguous: Uncanny, could be either

STYLE:
• Photorealistic scarecrow
• Practical effects (real straw and burlap)
• Horror movie quality OR
• Harvest festival charm
• Rural American Gothic
• Folk horror aesthetic

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject transformed into a scarecrow - with burlap sack head (subject's features visible through or painted on), straw stuffing bursting from old farmer clothes, button or painted eyes, stitched mouth, standing on wooden pole in autumn cornfield at golden hour - recognizable as the subject within the scarecrow form, with autumn harvest atmosphere and either friendly harvest festival charm or sinister folk horror menace depending on selected type.

name: SCARY MOVIE
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject so their face appears as a comedic parody mask inspired by the exaggerated 'Whassup' character style from the Scary Movie films.

The mask MUST be solid white in color. Do NOT use skin tones, flesh colors, beige, pink, or realistic human coloration. The mask should clearly read as a white costume mask.

The mask should be clearly rubbery and costume-like, not realistic or eerie. Use a droopy, stretched face shape with oversized eye holes, exaggerated mouth opening, and slightly uneven proportions. The expression should feel goofy, slack, and intentionally silly rather than threatening.

Subtly adapt the mask to the subject so each render feels unique while staying comedic. Variations may include:
• mouth shape loosely matching the subject’s expression (open, smirking, surprised)
• uneven eye openings influenced by the subject’s eye spacing
• stretched or sagging areas reflecting the subject’s face shape
• molded impressions suggesting glasses or accessories if present

Dress the subject in a loose black hooded robe that looks like a cheap Halloween costume rather than a cinematic outfit. Fabric should appear lightweight, wrinkled, and slightly ill-fitting for comedic effect.

The overall tone must be humorous and absurd, not scary. Do not add blood, weapons, or horror elements. Lighting and composition should feel casual and playful, as if captured during a parody scene.

The final image should immediately read as a Scary Movie–style spoof — goofy, recognizable, and funny — while remaining clear and readable on small screens.

name: SCHOOL BOY / SCHOOL GIRL
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a school boy or school girl wearing a culturally accurate school uniform.

Choose or vary the style based on geography: Japanese, American, European, British, or other international school uniforms.

Uniforms should include appropriate elements such as blazers, ties, skirts, shorts, knee socks, backpacks, or loafers depending on region.

The subject should appear naturally dressed, not in cosplay. Clothing should fit realistically with proper fabric folds and wear.

Backgrounds may include classrooms, hallways, schoolyards, or chalkboards.

The final image should be humorous due to contrast with the subject’s age or demeanor, but visually realistic.

name: SCHOOLHOUSE ROCK!
message:
Take a picture of the subject and recreate them as an animated character in the classic Schoolhouse Rock! cartoon style.

STYLE & MEDIUM (CRITICAL):
• Authentic 1970s hand-drawn animation style
• Thick outlines, flat fills, simple geometric forms
• Limited animation feel with playful exaggeration
• Bright, educational color palette

CHARACTER TRANSFORMATION:
• Transform the subject into a Schoolhouse Rock! cartoon character
• Preserve recognizable facial features and personality
• Simplify anatomy into classic cartoon proportions

EPISODE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests an episode-style lesson, USE THAT EPISODE-STYLE LESSON
• If no episode-style lesson is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE episode-style lesson using the RANDOM SEED
• The RANDOM SEED must determine the selection
• Do NOT combine episodes
• Do NOT reuse the same episode across renders when possible
• Use the LAST TWO DIGITS of the RANDOM SEED modulo 38:
  - 0: Three Is a Magic Number
  - 1: Figure Eight
  - 2: My Hero, Zero
  - 3: The Four-Legged Zoo
  - 4: Little Twelvetoes
  - 5: Ready or Not, Here I Come
  - 6: Naughty Number Nine
  - 7: The Good Eleven
  - 8: Conjunction Junction
  - 9: Interjections!
  - 10: Lolly, Lolly, Lolly, Get Your Adverbs Here
  - 11: Rufus Xavier Sarsaparilla
  - 12: Busy Prepositions
  - 13: Unpack Your Adjectives
  - 14: Verb: That's What's Happening
  - 15: A Noun Is a Person, Place or Thing
  - 16: The Tale of Mr. Morton
  - 17: Pronouns
  - 18: I'm Just a Bill
  - 19: The Preamble
  - 20: Sufferin' Till Suffrage
  - 21: Mother Necessity
  - 22: No More Kings
  - 23: Elbow Room
  - 24: The Great American Melting Pot
  - 25: The Shot Heard 'Round the World
  - 26: Fireworks
  - 27: James Madison
  - 28: Electricity, Electricity
  - 29: Energy Blues
  - 30: Interplanet Janet
  - 31: A Victim of Gravity
  - 32: The Weather Show
  - 33: Do the Circulation
  - 34: The Body Machine
  - 35: Dollars and Sense
  - 36: The Checks and Balances
  - 37: Telegraph Line
  - 38-39: Rotate through other episodes

TEXT & BUBBLES (CRITICAL):
• Include lyric-style captions, speech bubbles, or title cards
