• Text must clearly teach or reference the selected episode topic
• Tone should be musical, upbeat, and educational
• If master prompt flavor text exists, reinterpret it as lyrics or narration

BACKGROUND & VISUAL LANGUAGE:
• Diagrams, arrows, bouncing words or numbers
• Blackboard elements, charts, maps, musical notes
• Visuals must reinforce the chosen lesson

FINAL RESULT:
The image should look like a genuine frame from a Schoolhouse Rock! episode — cheerful, educational, slightly goofy, and unmistakably authentic.

name: SCOOBY-DOO ENDING
message: Take a picture and place the subject in a classic Scooby-Doo unmasking scene ending. Subject shown as the unmasked villain with shocked/guilty expression, surrounded by the Mystery Inc. gang (Fred, Daphne, Velma, Shaggy, and Scooby-Doo) pointing accusingly. Subject drawn in Hanna-Barbera animation style with bold black outlines and flat cel-shaded colors. Include speech bubble with 'And I would have gotten away with it too, if it weren't for you meddling kids!' Classic 1970s Scooby-Doo art style, vintage cartoon aesthetic, iconic reveal moment from the show's ending. Spooky background setting like haunted mansion or abandoned amusement park.

name: SCOTT ADAMS' DILBERT-STYLE
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into the minimalist office comic strip art style popularized by the Dilbert series.

ART STYLE CHARACTERISTICS:
• Simple black ink lines
• Minimal detail and geometric shapes
• Flat colors with no gradients
• White or sparse backgrounds

CHARACTER DESIGN:
• Simplified facial features (dot eyes, simple mouth lines)
• Slightly oversized head on a simple rectangular body
• Clean, consistent line weight

CLOTHING:
• Office attire — dress shirt, tie, slacks
• Rendered with simple lines and solid fills

SETTING:
• Minimal office cubicle environment
• Sparse desks, monitors, and partitions

EXPRESSION:
• Deadpan frustration, mild sarcasm, or weary resignation
• Simple but expressive line-based emotion

IMPORTANT:
• Do not reference real individuals or creators
• The style must evoke a classic corporate office comic strip without attribution

FINAL RESULT:
The final image should look like a fully composed Dilbert hand-drawn illustration with the subject and additional characters integrated seamlessly into the world.

name: SCRATCH ART
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a classic scratch art image, as if the picture was created by scratching through a black wax coating to reveal bright colors underneath.

CORE CONCEPT (NON-NEGOTIABLE):
• The image must appear scratched, not drawn or painted
• All visible imagery is revealed ONLY where material has been scratched away
• The surface beneath the scratches must show vibrant rainbow or neon colors

MATERIAL RULES (CRITICAL):
• Top layer: solid black wax coating
• Underlayer: bright multicolor or rainbow pattern
• Scratches expose the underlayer in thin or thick lines
• No visible color outside scratched regions

LINE & DETAIL RULES:
• Image composed entirely of etched lines and marks
• Line density varies to suggest depth
• No filled-in areas or smooth shading
• Crosshatching allowed only as scratched lines

IDENTITY PRESERVATION:
• Subject’s facial structure must be readable via line work
• Expression preserved through contour scratches
• Simplification allowed, but not abstraction

ANTI-CHEATING RULES:
• NO painted strokes
• NO digital glow effects
• NO gradient shading
• NO photographic textures
• Black areas must remain fully opaque

COMPOSITION:
• Flat scratch-art board surface
• Clean rectangular or card-like format
• Tool marks may vary in width and pressure

FINAL RESULT:
The image must look like a real scratch art piece created by physically etching lines through black wax to reveal colorful layers beneath — tactile, imperfect, and unmistakably analog.

name: SCREAM
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject so their face appears as a Ghostface-style mask while preserving the subject’s underlying facial structure, proportions, and expression. The mask should be smooth white with elongated eyes and mouth, subtly shaped by the subject’s face so it feels worn rather than pasted on.

Dress the subject in a flowing black hooded robe inspired by the classic Ghostface costume. Ensure the hood frames the mask naturally, with realistic fabric folds, shadows, and texture. Match lighting, perspective, and depth so the costume integrates seamlessly with the original scene.

Maintain a clean, non-graphic horror aesthetic. Do not add blood, weapons, or violent elements. The final image should feel eerie, iconic, and cinematic while remaining clearly readable on small screens.

name: SEALED
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into an official governmental or state seal, with the subject's face replacing the historical figure depicted in the original seal design.

SEAL SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a seal, USE THAT SEAL
• If no seal is provided, SELECT EXACTLY ONE seal using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST TWO DIGITS of the RANDOM SEED modulo 25:
  - 0: Great Seal of the United States (eagle replaced with subject as founding father portrait)
  - 1: Seal of the President of the United States (presidential portrait)
  - 2: State of Virginia Seal (Virtus, Roman goddess of virtue - female warrior)
  - 3: State of Massachusetts Seal (Native American figure)
  - 4: State of New York Seal (Liberty and Justice figures)
  - 5: Seal of the Governor of California (Minerva figure)
  - 6: Royal Coat of Arms of the United Kingdom (if figures present)
  - 7: Coat of Arms of Spain (pillars with crowns)
  - 8: Seal of the City of Los Angeles (Spanish queen)
  - 9: French Republic Seal (Marianne figure)
  - 10: Seal of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania (horses and figures)
  - 11: Seal of Illinois (eagle and figures)
  - 12: Seal of Maryland (Lord Baltimore figures)
  - 13: Seal of Connecticut (grape vines and figures)
  - 14: Mexican Coat of Arms (eagle on cactus - stylized)
  - 15: Seal of the City of San Francisco (phoenix and figures)
  - 16: Seal of Alabama (territorial map with figures)
  - 17: German Coat of Arms (federal eagle)
  - 18: Seal of Michigan (two figures: Native American and settler)
  - 19: Italian Coat of Arms (emblem with oak and olive)
  - 20: Seal of Wisconsin (figures representing agriculture and mining)
  - 21: Japanese Imperial Seal (chrysanthemum - adapt with subject portrait center)
  - 22: Seal of Kentucky (two men shaking hands)
  - 23: Canadian Coat of Arms (lion and unicorn supporters)
  - 24: Seal of Missouri (two bears and figures)

SEAL AUTHENTICITY (CRITICAL):
• The seal must look like the OFFICIAL government seal from that jurisdiction
• Exact replication of:
  - Border design and decorative elements
  - Motto or text placement and typography
  - Official colors (often gold, blue, red, or monochrome)
  - Shield, crest, or emblem shapes
  - Surrounding wreaths, ribbons, or ornamental details
  - Date of establishment or founding year
  - Stars, stripes, or other symbolic elements
• The ONLY change is replacing the human figure(s) with the subject's likeness

SUBJECT INTEGRATION (CRITICAL):
• The subject's face replaces the original human figure in the seal
• Subject rendered in the SAME artistic style as the original seal:
  - If engraved/etched style: subject in line engraving
  - If heraldic style: subject in simplified heraldic rendering
  - If classical style: subject in neoclassical portraiture
  - If emblematic: subject as stylized emblem figure
• Subject's pose, clothing, and proportions match the original figure
• Facial features clearly recognizable but adapted to seal's art style
• Subject appears as if they were the ORIGINAL inspiration for the seal

ARTISTIC STYLE MATCHING:
• Line weight and engraving technique match the seal's style
• Shading technique: cross-hatching, stippling, or solid fills as per original
• Level of detail matches the seal's complexity
• Subject's rendering is neither more nor less detailed than surrounding elements
• Integration is seamless—no obvious replacement or pasting

COMPOSITION PRESERVATION:
• All original seal elements remain in their exact positions
• Text, mottos, and dates unchanged
• Symbolic elements (eagles, stars, shields, wreaths) preserved
• Only the human figure(s) are replaced with the subject
• Background elements, landscapes, or architectural features maintained
• Scale and proportion of all elements remain authentic

COLOR AND MEDIUM:
• Match the seal's traditional color scheme:
  - Gold embossing on official documents
  - Blue and gold for many state seals
  - Monochrome for engraved versions
  - Full color for painted or printed versions
• Metallic sheen or embossed appearance if appropriate
• Paper texture or official document background
• Wax seal appearance for historical versions

OFFICIAL PRESENTATION:
• Circular seal format (most common) or shield/escutcheon shape
• Raised embossed effect if on official document
• Crisp, clean edges and professional quality
• Suitable for official government use
• Authoritative and dignified appearance
• No parody elements—this is a serious official seal

TYPOGRAPHY AND TEXT:
• Official serif fonts typical of government seals
• Latin mottos or English text precisely rendered
• Circular text following the seal's border curve
• Proper spacing and letterforms
• Date or year of establishment accurately placed
• State/nation name in correct position and style

HISTORICAL ACCURACY:
• Subject's clothing and appearance match the era of the seal
• If seal depicts 18th-century figure: subject in period attire
• If seal depicts classical/mythological figure: subject in appropriate garb
• Hairstyle adapted to match the historical context
• Accessories (weapons, tools, implements) remain as in original

FINAL RESULT:
An official-looking governmental or state seal that appears authentic in every detail except that the subject's face has seamlessly replaced the historical figure, as if the subject were the original inspiration for this important governmental emblem. The seal maintains all heraldic elements, official typography, symbolic imagery, and artistic style of the genuine article, creating the impression of an alternate history where the subject was the foundational figure commemorated in this seal of authority.

name: SECOND TO LAST SUPPER
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into one of the apostles within Leonardo da Vinci’s 'The Last Supper.'

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• The subject must appear as if they were originally painted as one of the apostles
• This is not a photograph inserted into the painting
• The entire figure, including the face, must be rendered in Leonardo’s painted style

COMPOSITION REQUIREMENT (CRITICAL):
• The ENTIRE 'Last Supper' composition must be visible
• Jesus and all apostles must appear fully within frame
• Do NOT crop, zoom, or isolate the replaced apostle
• The image must be immediately recognizable as the full mural

PAINTED INTEGRATION RULES (CRITICAL):
• The subject’s facial features must be translated into Renaissance oil painting form
• Match Leonardo’s brushwork, color blending, and soft sfumato edges
• Skin tones must appear painted, not photographic
• No sharp photo detail, no modern lighting, no overlay artifacts

COMPOSITION & PLACEMENT:
• The subject must occupy the position of ONE apostle
• Pose, gesture, and gaze must match the emotional grouping of that apostle
• Perspective and scale must perfectly align with the original mural

STYLE & MEDIUM:
• Italian High Renaissance fresco style
• Muted earth tones
• Soft shadows and subtle transitions
• Aged wall texture consistent with the original work

SUBJECT IDENTITY:
• Preserve the subject’s recognizable facial structure
• Translate identity through painted anatomy, not photo realism

TONE:
• Reverent, dramatic, and historically grounded
• No parody, no modern humor

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must look like the complete 'Last Supper' mural, with the subject seamlessly replacing one apostle. The scene must be instantly recognizable as the full painting, not a cropped reinterpretation.

name: SECURITY BADGE
message:
Take a picture and transform it into an official security ID badge or credentials card.

BADGE TYPE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies badge type, USE THAT TYPE
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST DIGIT:
  - 0: FBI - Federal Bureau of Investigation badge, blue and gold, official seal, Department of Justice
  - 1: CIA - Central Intelligence Agency credentials, blue and white, classified clearance levels
  - 2: MI6 - British Secret Intelligence Service, royal crest, UK official, sophisticated
  - 3: Corporate - Generic office building access, company logo, employee ID, professional
  - 4: Hospital - Medical center staff badge, photo ID, department listed, medical facility
  - 5: Military - Department of Defense ID card, rank and branch, service member credentials
  - 6: Airport Security - TSA or airport authority badge, restricted area access, aviation
  - 7: Area 51 - Top secret facility access, alien imagery, classified, humorous conspiracy
  - 8: NSA - National Security Agency, ultra-classified, signals intelligence, Fort Meade
  - 9: Secret Service - USSS credentials, presidential protection, Treasury Department

BADGE DESIGN ELEMENTS (CRITICAL):
• Photo of subject (formal ID photo style)
• Organization name and logo/seal at top
• Subject's name (use external master prompt text if provided, or generate)
• ID number or badge number
• Barcode (1D or 2D/QR code)
• Clearance level or access level
• Expiration date
• Issue date
• Department or division
• Physical security features (hologram, metallic strip, watermark)
• Magnetic strip on back (if shown)
• Signature line
• Emergency contact info (on back)

BADGE-SPECIFIC DETAILS:

**FBI:**
• FBI seal (Department of Justice)
• "Federal Bureau of Investigation"
• Badge number
• "Special Agent" or position title
• Blue and gold color scheme
• Expiration date
• Barcode
• Official serious appearance

**CIA:**
• CIA seal (eagle and shield)
• "Central Intelligence Agency"
• Security clearance level (Top Secret, Secret, Confidential)
• Employee number
• Access authorization codes
• Blue and white design
• Very official and classified appearance

**MI6:**
• Royal coat of arms or stylized crown
• "Secret Intelligence Service" or "SIS"
• Very understated British design
• Officer name and number
• Security clearance
• Sophisticated minimal design
• Union Jack colors subtle

**Corporate:**
• Company logo (generic tech/business company)
• "[Company Name] Employee Access"
• Department (IT, Finance, HR, Marketing, etc.)
• Employee ID number
• Building access zones
• Office location
• Professional business design

**Hospital:**
• Medical center name and logo
• "[Hospital Name] Medical Center"
• Department (Emergency, Surgery, Radiology, etc.)
• Job title (Doctor, Nurse, Technician, Admin)
• Employee ID number
• Red or blue color scheme
• Medical cross or caduceus symbol

**Military:**
• Department of Defense seal
• Branch seal (Army, Navy, Air Force, Marines, Coast Guard)
• Rank and pay grade
• Service member ID number (DoD ID)
• Blood type
• Geneva Convention status
• Branch colors and design

**Airport Security:**
• TSA logo or airport authority
• "Secure Area Access"
• Airport codes (e.g., "LAX", "JFK")
• Security clearance zones (SIDA, AOA)
• Federal badge appearance
• Blue and red official colors

**Area 51:**
• "AREA 51 - RESTRICTED ACCESS"
• Top Secret clearance
• Alien or UFO imagery
• "MAJESTIC 12" or conspiracy references
• Black and yellow warning colors
• Sector and clearance codes
• Humorous but official-looking

**NSA:**
• NSA seal (eagle with key)
• "National Security Agency"
• Ultra-high clearance (TS/SCI)
• Cryptologic access codes
• Fort Meade, Maryland reference
• Very classified appearance
• Dark blue and black design

**Secret Service:**
• USSS badge and star
• "United States Secret Service"
• Special Agent credentials
• Presidential protection detail
• Badge number
• Treasury Department (historical) or DHS (current)

PHOTO STYLE:
• Formal ID photo
• Plain background (gray, blue, white)
• Subject facing camera directly
• Neutral expression
• Professional appearance
• Good lighting
• Passport photo quality
• Head and shoulders only

SECURITY FEATURES:
• Holographic overlay
• Metallic security strip
• Microprinting
• UV reactive elements suggested
• Watermark
• Tamper-evident features
• RFID chip indicator
• Guilloche patterns (fine line security printing)

BARCODE/ENCODING:
• 1D barcode (standard lines)
• OR 2D barcode/QR code
• Magnetic strip visible on back
• RFID chip symbol
• Encoding number below barcode

TEXT INFORMATION:
• Full name: [Name from external prompt or generated]
• ID/Badge Number: [Random official-looking number]
• Department/Position: [Appropriate to badge type]
• Clearance Level: [If applicable]
• Issue Date: [Recent date]
• Expiration Date: [1-5 years from issue]
• Blood Type: [If military/emergency services]
• Emergency Contact: [If applicable]

COLOR SCHEME:
• Official government colors (blues, reds, golds)
• Organization-specific branding colors
• Professional and authoritative appearance
• Not too colorful - official and serious

BADGE FORMAT:
• Standard credit card size (3.375" x 2.125")
• Vertical or horizontal orientation
• Laminated plastic appearance
• Slight reflection/glare on plastic surface
• Lanyard hole punched at top
• Worn in clear badge holder

AUTHENTICITY:
• Looks like real official credentials
• Professional printing quality
• All elements properly aligned
• Official seals accurate and detailed
• Could pass casual inspection
• Highly realistic government/corporate ID

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show an authentic-looking security badge or ID card for the selected organization with the subject's photo, name (from external prompt or generated), official seals and logos, barcode, clearance level, expiration date, and all security features - appearing as a real government, corporate, medical, or military credential that looks professionally printed and official.

name: SECURITY CAMERA FOOTAGE
message: Take a picture and transform it into low-quality security camera footage. Render the image in washed-out grayscale or green-tinted night vision with heavy noise and compression artifacts. Add a timestamp and camera label (e.g., CAM 03, 02:14 AM) in a blocky digital font. The framing should feel awkward or off-center, with slight motion blur or ghosting. Reduce detail and sharpness while preserving the subject’s silhouette. The image should feel surveilled, impersonal, and slightly unsettling.

name: SEND IN THE CLOWNS
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a clown, adapting the clown’s style based on the subject’s facial expression. Preserve the subject’s facial structure and identity while applying expressive clown makeup and costume details. Automatically select ONE of the following interpretations based on the subject’s apparent emotion:

• Happy Clown — if the subject is smiling or joyful, use bright colors, a rounded red nose, cheerful face paint, and playful costume elements.
• Sad Clown — if the subject appears sad or frowning, use muted colors, downward eye makeup, a single painted tear, softer lighting, and a melancholic expression.
• Evil Clown — if the subject appears angry, intense, or menacing, use darker colors, sharp makeup lines, exaggerated shadows, unsettling grin or glare, and dramatic lighting.

Ensure the chosen clown type is visually clear and emotionally consistent. The final image should feel theatrical, expressive, and unmistakably clown-like while keeping the subject recognizable.

name: SENTIENT OBJECT
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a sentient everyday object while preserving recognizable facial features, expressions, and personality. Choose an object that feels thematically connected to the subject’s clothing, pose, or surroundings, such as a vending machine, toaster, mailbox, lamp, or appliance. Integrate the subject’s face naturally into the object’s design so it appears alive and expressive. Place the character in a believable environment where the object would normally exist, with consistent lighting, scale, and shadows. Render the final image with surreal realism and a humorous, imaginative tone.

name: SEQUEL
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into the lead character of a sequel set in the universe of a widely recognized movie.

SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies an existing movie, USE THAT movie as the original
• If none is specified, SELECT a widely recognized, culturally famous movie as the original
• The sequel MUST include the number 2 in the title
• The sequel may be a real sequel OR a newly invented sequel to that existing movie
• It cannot be a sequel to a nonexistent movie

SEQUEL TAGLINE (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a sequel tag, USE THAT tag
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 18:
  - 0: ELECTRIC BOOGALOO
  - 1: THIS TIME IT'S-A PERSONAL!
  - 2: REALLY THE LAST ONE
  - 3: REVENGE FOR SOMETHING THAT HAPPENED IN THE FIRST ONE
  - 4: CAUSE WE NEEDED THE MONEY
  - 5: OUT OF ORIGINAL STORY IDEAS
  - 6: PART II - BECAUSE PART 2 IS NOT AS COOL
  - 7: IF YOU THOUGHT THE FIRST ONE WAS BAD...
  - 8: WE DROPPED A DEUCE
  - 9: THE IMITATION
  - 10: SAME AS THE LAST BUT WITH REPLACEMENT ACTORS!
  - 11: BECAUSE THE END DOES NOT MEAN THE END
  - 12: WE WILL APOLOGIZE FOR IT LATER
  - 13: NOONE ASKED FOR THIS
  - 14: BUT THIS ONE HAS KEVIN BACON!
  - 15: YES, WE DID ANOTHER ONE ... BECAUSE WE CAN
  - 16: PLACEHOLDER FOR PART 3
  - 17: FIRST BLOOD NEXT PART DEUX, THE SQUEAKQUEL AND DUMBERER

STYLE MATCHING (MANDATORY):
• The subject must be rendered in the same visual medium and artistic style as the original movie
• If the original film is live-action, render cinematic realism
• If animated, render fully in that animation style
• Match tone, lighting, genre, and production quality

CORE CONCEPT:
• The subject must appear as the undisputed lead of the sequel
• Official theatrical poster framing
• High production value presentation
• The sequel title must clearly display the number 2
• The selected sequel tagline must appear prominently on the poster

POSTER ELEMENTS:
• Realistic title typography styled similarly to the original film
• Dramatic or exaggerated sequel tagline
• Theatrical credit block at bottom
• "Coming Soon" or appropriate release window
• Authentic cinematic layout hierarchy

IMPORTANT:
• The original movie must be real and culturally recognizable
• The sequel may be fictional but must feel plausible within that universe
• Maintain cinematic realism even when the tagline is humorous
• Do not distort into absurd parody — it should look like an actual studio sequel announcement

FINAL RESULT:
The final image should look like an official theatrical poster for a sequel to a famous real movie, starring the subject as the lead, with the number 2 clearly in the title and the humorous sequel tagline determined strictly by the modulo random seed unless overridden by external master prompt.

name: SEUSS
message: Take a picture and transform the subject and the surrounding scene into a whimsical Dr. Seuss book illustration. Preserve the subject’s recognizable facial features and personality while adapting their appearance to the exaggerated, fantastical style of Dr. Seuss characters with playful proportions, quirky shapes, and vibrant colors. The environment should include imaginative, surreal elements typical of Seuss worlds—twisting landscapes, unusual plants, and whimsical architecture. Add accompanying flavor text transformed into a short rhyming poem or verse that complements the scene and subject, in the signature playful, rhythmic, and nonsensical style of Dr. Seuss. Ensure the subject remains clearly identifiable and fully integrated into the Seussian world.

name: SHAKESPEAREAN
message: Take a picture and make the subject an actor in a Shakespearean play. Dress the subject in period-accurate costume in the same style as the chosen Shakespearean play, apply stage lighting, and dramatic theatrical pose.

name: SHARP CALM LATTE
message:
Take a picture and reconstruct it using extreme sharp-edged depth simulation.

Break the scene into multiple flat, rigid layers (foreground, midground, background). Each layer must have hard, geometric edges with no feathering, no blur, and no soft transitions. Treat each layer like a physical cutout made from thick card stock or acrylic sheets.

Depth must be created ONLY through layer offset, overlap, scale, and cast shadows — never through photographic depth of field, bokeh, or blur. Shadows should be crisp, directional, and slightly offset to clearly reveal stacking order.

Simplify the subject into bold planar shapes while preserving recognizable silhouette and posture. Remove surface texture and fine photographic detail. Surfaces should appear smooth, matte, and manufactured.

Use a strictly limited calm latte palette: warm ivory, oat beige, sand, almond, soft clay, light mocha, and espresso brown. No saturated colors, no gradients beyond flat tonal steps.

Lighting should feel artificial and diagrammatic, as if lit for a design mockup or museum model, not a real-world photograph.

The final image should resemble a precision-cut, depth-layered design object or editorial poster. It must look constructed, not painted, not photographed, and not illustrated. Ensure all forms remain sharply defined and clearly readable on a small screen. Treat all edges as laser-cut; any softness or blur is an error.

name: SHATTERING
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a form breaking apart and shattering like glass, porcelain, or stone.

SHATTERING MATERIAL SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies material, USE THAT MATERIAL
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST DIGIT:
  - 0: Glass Shattering - transparent shards, spider-web cracks, reflective fragments
  - 1: Porcelain/Ceramic - white or colored ceramic pieces, clean breaks, delicate
  - 2: Mirror Shattering - reflective shards, multiple reflections, seven years bad luck
  - 3: Stone/Marble - heavy chunks, crumbling, ancient statue breaking
  - 4: Ice Shattering - frozen, crystalline, cold blue-white fragments
  - 5: Crystal Shattering - prismatic, refracting light, gemstone quality
  - 6: Metal Shattering - jagged steel or iron pieces, industrial, sharp edges
  - 7: Wood Splintering - wooden pieces, splinters, carved statue breaking
  - 8: Concrete Crumbling - urban decay, gray chunks, rebar visible
  - 9: Digital/Pixel Shattering - glitch fragmentation, technological breakdown, data corruption

SUBJECT RECOGNITION:
• Subject's face CLEARLY RECOGNIZABLE in fragments
• Face relatively intact at center
• Outer edges more shattered
• Eyes especially identifiable
• Identity maintained through destruction
• Pieces still recognizable as subject

SHATTERING PHYSICS:
• Explosion outward from impact point OR
• Crumbling/collapse inward
• Fragments flying in multiple directions
• Some pieces still attached, some airborne
• Frozen moment of destruction
• Cracks radiating from center OR edges
• Gravity affecting falling pieces
• Motion and force visible

CRACK PATTERNS:
• Spider-web cracks spreading
• Radiating from impact point
• Irregular fracture lines
• Interconnected crack network
• Some areas more damaged than others
• Deep fissures and surface cracks
• Realistic fracture physics
• Material-appropriate crack patterns

FRAGMENTS & SHARDS:
• Various sizes (tiny shards to large chunks)
• Sharp, jagged edges
• Flying outward from subject
• Some pieces close, some far
• Fragments still showing parts of face/body
• Pieces tumbling and rotating in air
• Trailing debris and dust
• Geometric or irregular shapes

FACE DESTRUCTION PROGRESSION:
• Center of face: Most intact
• Edges of face: More shattered
• Forehead: Cracking, pieces breaking away
• Eyes: Visible through cracks, recognizable
• Nose: Fragmenting, bridge cracking
• Cheeks: Large pieces breaking off
• Mouth: Splitting, pieces separating
• Outer edges: Complete fragmentation

BODY SHATTERING:
• Shoulders breaking into pieces
• Arms fragmenting, chunks flying off
• Torso showing major cracks
• Core more intact than extremities
• Clothing shattering with body (same material)
• Limbs disintegrating into shards
• Overall form exploding outward

MATERIAL PROPERTIES:

**Glass:**
• Transparent shards
• Reflective surfaces
• Sharp, dangerous edges
• Light refracting through
• Crystal clear or frosted

**Porcelain:**
• White or glazed ceramic
• Clean smooth breaks
• Delicate, fine china quality
• Matte or glossy finish
• Antique statue aesthetic

**Mirror:**
• Highly reflective shards
• Multiple reflections in each piece
• Silvered backing visible on edges
• Fragmented reflections

**Stone/Marble:**
• Heavy, solid chunks
• Gray, white, or colored stone
• Rough broken surfaces
• Ancient statue crumbling
• Dust and debris

**Ice:**
• Frozen, crystalline
• Translucent blue-white
• Cold, frosty appearance
• Fracturing like frozen water
• Icicle-like shards

**Crystal:**
• Prismatic, refracting rainbows
• Geometric facets
• Gemstone quality
• Transparent and brilliant
• Light dispersing through shards

**Metal:**
• Steel or iron fragments
• Industrial, sharp
• Metallic sheen
• Jagged, dangerous edges
• Heavy chunks

**Wood:**
• Wooden splinters
• Carved statue breaking
• Grain visible on breaks
• Fibrous texture
• Natural brown tones

**Concrete:**
• Gray cement chunks
• Aggregate stones visible
• Rebar protruding
• Urban decay
• Dust cloud

**Digital:**
• Pixel fragments
• Glitch artifacts
• RGB color separation
• Data corruption
• Scan lines breaking

IMPACT POINT (Optional):
• Visible point of impact
• Cracks radiating from impact
• Bullet hole, punch, or hammer strike
• Force origin visible
• Impact crater or dent

DEBRIS & PARTICLES:
• Dust cloud surrounding shatter
• Tiny particles floating
• Powder and fragments
• Material-specific debris
• Atmospheric haze from destruction

MOTION BLUR:
• Fragments in motion
• Speed blur on flying pieces
• Directional streaks
• Frozen explosion moment
• High-speed photography aesthetic
• Captured mid-shatter

LIGHTING:
• Dramatic lighting highlighting shards
• Backlight through transparent pieces
• Reflections on shiny surfaces
• Light refracting through glass/crystal
• High contrast shadows
• Sparkles on sharp edges
• Cinematic destruction lighting

BACKGROUND:
• Dark or neutral (focus on subject)
• May show impact source
• Simple to emphasize shattering
• Debris cloud expanding
• Motion lines or radial blur
• Studio or abstract

COLOR:
• Material-appropriate colors
• Glass: Clear, frosted, or tinted
• Porcelain: White, ivory, colored glaze
• Stone: Gray, white, marble veins
• Ice: Blue-white, crystalline
• Digital: RGB glitch colors
• Maintain subject's colors in fragments

ATMOSPHERE:
• Violent destruction
• Dramatic transformation
• Frozen moment of impact
• Explosive energy
• Fragility and strength
• Inevitable breakdown
• Powerful force

SOUND IMPLIED:
• Crash and shatter
• Tinkling glass
• Crumbling stone
• Explosive boom
• Silence after impact
• Violent destruction

EXPRESSION:
• Subject's expression visible in intact portions
• Shock, pain, or neutral
• Emotion fragmenting with face
• Eyes showing feeling through cracks
• Frozen in moment of impact

STYLE:
• Photorealistic shattering effects
• High-speed photography
• CGI movie-quality destruction
• Frozen explosion moment
• Action movie aesthetic
• Physics-accurate fragmentation

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject in a dramatic frozen moment of shattering - face clearly recognizable but breaking into fragments like glass, porcelain, stone, or other material - with spider-web cracks spreading across the surface, pieces flying outward in multiple directions, some shards still attached while others are airborne, debris and dust surrounding the destruction - captured in that split-second of violent transformation where the subject is exploding into countless pieces while maintaining their identity in the fragments, with dramatic lighting catching reflections and refractions on the shards.

name: SHOPPING LIST
message: Take a picture and create a pictured shopping list identifying the main subject and all notable objects. Do not display a single full reference photo. Instead, separate each identified item and create a small cropped image or thumbnail of each subject or object. Present a numbered shopping list where each number is paired with its corresponding small image and a short description. Keep the layout clean and optimized for a small screen, with each item visually distinct and easy to scan.

name: SHOULD NOT HAVE DONE THAT
message: Take a picture and subtly make it look like the subject is doing something they absolutely should not be doing. The humor should come from obvious poor judgment.

name: SIDEWALK CHALK ART (HUMOROUS)
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform the entire scene into realistic sidewalk chalk art drawn on concrete pavement.

The subject, background, and environment must all be rendered as chalk drawings — NOT a photo with a chalk filter.

The chalk style should include rough hand-drawn lines, uneven thickness, visible chalk dust, smudges, cracks in the pavement, and faded areas where chalk has been rubbed away.

The subject should appear as a chalk illustration integrated into the pavement, with foreshortening and perspective if appropriate, like classic street chalk art illusions.

Include humorous chalk-written flavor text, arrows, labels, doodles, or annotations interacting with the subject (e.g., pointing out exaggerated features or ridiculous situations).

DO NOT:
• Leave any part of the image photorealistic
• Overlay chalk textures on a real photo
• Create clean digital line art

Lighting should be natural outdoor daylight, with subtle shadows consistent with chalk sitting on pavement.

The final image must look like a real photograph of sidewalk chalk art drawn by a street artist — playful, imperfect, and clearly made of chalk.

name: SIDEWALK CHALK FINE ART
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform the entire scene into a serious, high-quality sidewalk chalk artwork drawn on pavement.

The style should be refined, detailed, and artistic — not humorous or cartoonish.

Render the subject with realistic proportions, expressive shading, and careful attention to light and depth using chalk techniques.

Include realistic pavement texture, cracks, chalk dust, and subtle color blending.

The composition should feel like professional street art created by a skilled chalk artist.

DO NOT use filters or photorealistic elements.

The final image must look like a museum-quality sidewalk chalk artwork photographed outdoors.

name: SIDEWALK CHALK ILLUSION
message:
Take a picture of the subject and transform the scene into a realistic 3D sidewalk chalk illusion drawn on an actual city sidewalk.

REAL-WORLD ANCHOR (CRITICAL):
• A portion of the real sidewalk must remain clearly visible and recognizable as an ordinary concrete sidewalk
• Include realistic pavement slabs, seams, cracks, curb edges, and wear typical of a city street
• The image must read as a real photograph taken outdoors in an urban or pedestrian environment

CHALK ILLUSION ART:
• The chalk artwork should occupy a defined area of the sidewalk, not the entire frame
• Create a dramatic anamorphic illusion such as a deep canyon, optical depth effect, portal to another world, staircase descending, bridge crossing a gap, or fantastical creature
• Use exaggerated perspective and foreshortening consistent with professional sidewalk chalk illusions

SUBJECT INTERACTION:
• The subject must appear physically present on the real sidewalk
• The subject should be interacting with the chalk illusion by standing near it, appearing to walk across it, gesturing toward it, posing with it, or playfully engaging with the art
• The subject must clearly exist in the real world, not be drawn in chalk

MATERIAL AND DETAIL:
• Chalk textures must be visible, including dust, smudging, uneven lines, fading, and worn areas
• Color variation and imperfect coverage typical of real chalk on concrete
• The illusion should align correctly with the sidewalk perspective from the camera angle

PHOTOGRAPHIC REALISM:
• Natural outdoor lighting and shadows consistent with the real environment
• No painted backgrounds, flat illustrations, or fully artificial scenes
• Avoid transforming the entire image into chalk art

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must look like a real photograph of a city sidewalk where a skilled street artist has created a large-scale 3D chalk illusion, with the subject physically present on the real pavement and playfully interacting with the artwork.

name: SILHOUETTE
message: Take a picture and convert the subject into a solid black silhouette. Subject interior filled with the background image. Outer background pure white.

name: SILLY PUTTY
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a classic Silly Putty image transfer, as if Silly Putty was pressed onto a printed photograph or newspaper image of the subject and then peeled away.

CORE CONCEPT (NON-NEGOTIABLE):
• The subject must appear as an ink-transfer embedded into Silly Putty
• This is NOT a photo edit or overlay
• The image must look physically transferred and distorted

TRANSFER PROCESS RULES (CRITICAL):
• Only printed ink transfers — no photographic realism
• Mirrored or partially mirrored image allowed
• Loss of detail is REQUIRED
• Uneven ink density, streaking, and blotching must be visible
• Edges must be soft, smeared, or broken

SILLY PUTTY MATERIAL RULES:
• Silly Putty color must be classic pink or pale peach
• Matte, rubbery texture with slight stretch marks
• Finger impressions or handling marks allowed
• Ink sits ON the surface, not embedded like paint

IDENTITY PRESERVATION (LIMITED BY TRANSFER):
• The subject must still be identifiable
• Facial structure and pose readable despite degradation
• Do NOT reconstruct missing details

ANTI-CHEATING RULES:
• NO clean photo edges
• NO realistic skin texture
• NO sharp photographic clarity
• NO digital compositing look
• Image must visibly suffer from transfer loss

COMPOSITION:
• Silly Putty blob resting on a surface or held in hands
• Transfer image visible only where ink adhered
• Blank areas where transfer failed

FINAL RESULT:
The image must look like a real Silly Putty ink transfer pulled from a printed source, with physical distortion, ink loss, and rubbery material realism — imperfect, tactile, and unmistakably analog.

name: SIM
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a tiny citizen living in a classic city simulation game, rendered in the game's native art style. Preserve recognizable identity while strictly adhering to the visual and scale limitations of the selected game. The subject must be rendered as an actual in-game character at the correct size, not a photoshopped image composited into the scene.

SIM GAME SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a specific sim game, USE THAT GAME
• If no game is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE game using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST TWO DIGITS of the RANDOM SEED modulo 15:
  - 0: SimCity (1989) - Original pixelated top-down view with tiny sprites
  - 1: SimCity 2000 - Isometric view with detailed buildings and infrastructure
  - 2: SimCity 3000 - Enhanced isometric with more detailed citizens and vehicles
  - 3: SimCity 4 - Realistic simulation with detailed zones and traffic
  - 4: Cities: Skylines - Modern detailed city builder with realistic citizens
  - 5: The Sims - Household view with plumbob and needs meters
  - 6: SimTower - Side-view high-rise with tiny office workers and residents
  - 7: SimAnt - Backyard perspective with tiny insects
  - 8: SimFarm - Top-down farm with crops and livestock
  - 9: Pharaoh - Ancient Egyptian city with workers and monuments
  - 10: Caesar III - Roman city builder with citizens and soldiers
  - 11: Tropico - Island dictator sim with tropical city management
  - 12: Banished - Medieval survival city builder
  - 13: Frostpunk - Steampunk frozen city with heat zones
  - 14: Anno series - Detailed island settlement with supply chains

CORE REQUIREMENTS:
• Subject must be rendered in the exact art style of the selected game (pixel art, low-poly 3D, isometric sprite, etc.)
• Subject must be the same size and scale as other citizens/characters in that game
• Subject natively integrated into the scene, not composited or pasted
• Match the visual fidelity, texture quality, and rendering style of the game engine
• Subject appears as if they were created by the game's original developers

IDENTITY PRESERVATION (STYLE-BOUND):
• Subject must be recognizable at NPC viewing distance
• Likeness achieved through proportions, color, and silhouette
• NO facial detail that exceeds other NPCs
• If identity conflicts with scale, PRIORITIZE correct scale
• The subject should be identifiable when compared side-by-side with the original photo, not when zoomed

ENVIRONMENT:
• Full city view or neighborhood section matching the game's aesthetic
• Buildings, roads, infrastructure appropriate to the selected game
• Other tiny citizens, vehicles, or activity in the scene
• Proper game-accurate terrain, textures, and architectural style
• Environmental details (parks, zoning, utilities) matching the game

INTERFACE (MANDATORY):
• Game-authentic UI overlay for the selected simulation
• Resource counters (money, population, resources)
• Tool palette or building menu
• Information panels or city stats
• Mini-map showing city layout
• Time/date display if appropriate
• Game-specific icons and buttons

STYLE:
• Match exact visual aesthetic of selected game (pixel art, 3D, isometric)
• Proper camera angle and perspective for that game
• Appropriate level of detail and graphical fidelity
• Game-accurate color palette and lighting
• UI elements in correct positions and style

FINAL RESULT:
An authentic-looking simulation game screenshot with the subject transformed into a tiny citizen character rendered in the game's native art style, at proper in-game scale, with identity preserved through silhouette, proportions, and color rather than detail, complete with accurate UI, correct perspective, and seamless integration indistinguishable from real gameplay.

name: SIMPSONS
message:
Take a picture in the style of a Simpsons cartoon scene, with yellow skin tones, bright palettes, and Springfield vibes. Maintain cartoon proportions and exaggerated features.

The subject must be the main character, but include other recognizable Simpsons characters in the scene interacting naturally — they can be family members, friends, or background Springfield citizens.

Background elements should reflect Springfield locations, like Moe’s Tavern, the Kwik-E-Mart, or Springfield Elementary, depending on the scene context.

The final image should look like a fully integrated Simpsons world with the subject seamlessly placed among other characters, as if part of a real episode.

name: SIN CITY
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a Sin City–inspired graphic novel scene.

Render the image almost entirely in stark black and white with extreme contrast. Use deep, inky blacks and bright whites with very little midtone gray. Lighting should feel harsh, directional, and dramatic, emphasizing silhouettes, shadows, and negative space.

Allow only one or two selective color accents at most (such as red lips, blood-red elements, a glowing cigarette ember, or neon signage). All other elements must remain strictly monochrome.

Convert the subject into a stylized, high-contrast noir figure with sharp edges, heavy shadowing, and simplified facial features. Preserve recognizability through bold shapes and expression rather than realism.

The environment should feel urban and gritty — rain-soaked streets, fire escapes, alleyways, venetian-blind shadows, brick walls, or smoky interiors. Backgrounds may fade into black to heighten drama.

The final image should resemble a single panel from a dark neo-noir graphic novel. Avoid soft gradients, painterly textures, or photographic realism. The result must feel illustrated, cinematic, and unmistakably Sin City in tone, clearly readable on a small screen.

name: SKETCH ART
message: Take a picture in the style of colorful Sketch Art. A rapidly executed, freehand drawing that serves as a preliminary step for a more detailed, finished work.

name: SLIDES
message:
Take a picture and transform the image so it appears as a photographic slide.

CORE CONCEPT:
• The image is presented as a real photographic slide
• Analog, retro, physical media aesthetic

SLIDE STATE SELECTION (CRITICAL — ADDITIVE):
• If an external master prompt specifies slide state, USE THAT
• If no slide state is specified externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST DIGIT of the RANDOM SEED modulo 2:
  - 0: Projected Slide — the image is actively projected onto a screen or wall in a darkened room, with visible projector light beam and slight keystone distortion
  - 1: Physical Slide (Unloaded) — the slide is a loose 35mm slide outside the projector, resting on a surface or being held up to light; NOT inside a projector and NOT in a carousel

STYLE:
• Slight color shift or fade
• Film grain and analog imperfections
• Subtle dust, scratches, and age artifacts
• Subject remains recognizable

COMPOSITION:
• Slide frame clearly visible
• Dark or neutral background when unprojected
• Realistic lighting appropriate to slide state

FINAL RESULT:
The image should convincingly resemble an authentic analog photographic slide — either actively projected or shown as a loose physical slide outside the projector.

name: SLIMED
message:
Take a picture of the subject and capture the moment they are being hit on the head by bright green slime.

The slime should be mid-impact or just beginning to cover their hair and face.

The subject should have a shocked or panicked expression as the slime lands.

The slime should look thick, glossy, and cartoonishly gooey.

The final image should freeze the exact moment of impact for maximum comedy.

name: SMURFED!
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a Smurf character. Bright blue skin covering entire body, small stature (three apples high), distinctive white Phrygian cap, white pants, no shoes. Large expressive eyes, button nose, cheerful smile. Subject's recognizable facial features should be adapted to Smurf proportions. Place in magical Smurf Village setting with mushroom houses, forest environment, whimsical fairy-tale atmosphere. Classic Peyo cartoon style with smooth shading and vibrant colors. Friendly, cheerful, and enchanting storybook illustration quality.

name: SNOW GLOBE
message:
Take a picture and encapsulate the subject and scene inside a physical souvenir snow globe.

Miniaturize the subject and place them within a tiny, detailed environment inside the globe. If a city or location is provided via external master prompt, construct a miniature city scene inside the globe featuring simplified landmarks, buildings, or visual cues associated with that place. If no location is provided, create a generic charming miniature environment.

The subject should appear as a small figurine integrated into the miniature city scene — not floating, not full-sized, and not dominating the globe.

Render a clear glass sphere with realistic reflections, refraction, highlights, and slight distortion caused by the curved glass. Floating snow particles or glitter should be suspended throughout the globe at varying depths.

Include a visible snow globe base made of plastic or resin, styled like a tourist souvenir. The base should include a decorative plaque or label showing the city or location name (use external master prompt text if provided; otherwise invent a plausible destination name).

Ensure the entire snow globe — glass sphere and base — is fully visible within the frame. The globe should appear photographed on a surface or held in a hand, not floating in space.

The final image should feel charming, slightly kitschy, nostalgic, and unmistakably like a real souvenir snow globe, clearly readable on a small screen.

name: SOAKED
message:
Take a picture of the subject and make it look like they have just been completely drenched with water.

Hair, clothing, and skin should all appear visibly wet, with dripping water and darkened fabric.

The subject should look surprised, annoyed, or exhausted from being soaked.

Water droplets, puddles, or splashes should be visible to sell the realism.

The final image should look like it was captured seconds after a big splash or water dump.

name: SOLARPUNK
message: Take a picture and transform the scene into a solarpunk future. Green architecture, renewable energy, optimistic tone.

name: SOUL-VANA
message:
Take a picture and transform the scene into a massive human-dispensing tower inspired by car vending machines.

Replace cars with people. The tower should be a tall, cylindrical or rectangular glass structure filled with individual human-sized compartments, each containing a different person posed stiffly like a display item. The subject must appear inside one of the compartments, clearly visible, as if they are waiting to be dispensed.

Render the humans as intact, clothed, and calm — no distress, no danger, no violence. The tone should be surreal and comedic, not dark. Humans should feel more like oversized gumballs or capsule toys than trapped people.

Include clear visual cues that this is a vending-style system:
• a large mechanical claw, elevator platform, or rotating carousel mechanism
• numbered slots or bays
• soft interior lighting inside each compartment
• reflections and glass glare to sell realism

Add bold branding on the tower reading “SOUL-VANA” in large, modern lettering. Optional smaller flavor text may include humorous corporate slogans such as:
• “Dispensing Personalities Since Today”
• “Find Your Next You”
• “Low Mileage Humans Available Now”

If external master prompt text is provided, use it to customize:
• the city or location of the tower
• slogans, labels, or marketing copy
• which slot the subject occupies

The environment should resemble an urban plaza or parking structure, with scale clearly communicated by surrounding buildings or people. Ensure the entire tower and the subject’s compartment are fully visible within the frame.

The final image should feel like a glossy promotional photo for an absurd tech startup — clean, corporate, ridiculous, and immediately readable on a small screen.

name: SOUTH AMERICAN FOLK ART
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into South American folk art style.

FOLK ART STYLE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a style, USE THAT STYLE
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST DIGIT:
  - 0: Peruvian Retablo - three-dimensional diorama box, colorful figures, religious scenes
  - 1: Colombian Mola - layered fabric appliqué, geometric patterns, vibrant reverse appliqué
  - 2: Ecuadorian Tigua - painted leather or canvas, colorful village scenes, naive style
  - 3: Bolivian Diablada - devil mask aesthetic, ornate costume, carnival colors
  - 4: Chilean Arpillera - textile picture, fabric collage, embroidered scenes, political/social themes
  - 5: Peruvian Mates Burilados - carved gourd art, intricate etching, natural and burned designs
  - 6: Argentine Fileteado - ornamental decorative painting, scrollwork, vivid colors, symmetrical
  - 7: Brazilian Cordel - woodcut print style, bold lines, storytelling illustration
  - 8: Colombian Vueltiao Hat Pattern - woven zigzag patterns, black and cream, indigenous Zenú design
  - 9: Andean Textile - woven patterns, geometric designs, alpaca wool colors, Inca-inspired

SUBJECT TRANSFORMATION:
• Subject drawn/painted in selected folk art style
• Traditional South American aesthetic
• Colorful, vibrant, decorative
• Subject's face recognizable but stylized
• Folk art interpretation of subject
• Authentic to cultural tradition

COLOR PALETTE:
• Extremely vibrant and bright
• Primary colors dominant (red, blue, yellow)
• Hot pink, orange, turquoise, lime green
• High contrast and saturation
• No muted or pastel tones
• Bold color combinations
• Rainbow brilliance

PATTERNS & DECORATION:
• Geometric patterns (zigzags, diamonds, stripes)
• Floral motifs
• Animal symbols (condors, llamas, jaguars)
• Sun and moon imagery
• Indigenous symbols and icons
• Repetitive decorative elements
• Border patterns

STYLE CHARACTERISTICS:
• Flat, two-dimensional quality
• Naive or primitive art style
• Bold outlines
• Symmetrical compositions
• Decorative over realistic
• Folk art simplification
• Handmade, crafted appearance

CULTURAL ELEMENTS:
• Indigenous South American imagery
• Traditional clothing patterns
• Andean mountain motifs
• Tropical flora and fauna
• Pre-Columbian influences
• Colonial Catholic with indigenous
• Regional cultural symbols

TEXTURE & MEDIUM (style-specific):
• Painted wood or canvas texture (Tigua)
• Fabric and stitching (Arpillera, Mola)
• Carved gourd surface (Mates)
• Woodcut print lines (Cordel)
• Woven textile pattern (Andean)
• Painted metal or leather (Fileteado)

COMPOSITION:
• Often symmetrical and balanced
• Subject central and prominent
• Decorative borders or frames
• Background filled with patterns
• Horror vacui (fear of empty space)
• Dense, busy composition

SYMBOLISM:
• Spiritual or religious symbols
• Nature elements (sun, moon, stars, mountains)
• Animals with cultural meaning
• Flowers and plants
• Protective symbols
• Storytelling imagery

STYLE-SPECIFIC ELEMENTS:

**Peruvian Retablo:**
• Box frame visible
• Multiple tiers or levels
• Small figurines aesthetic
• Religious or festival scene
• Three-dimensional but flat-painted look

**Colombian Mola:**
• Layered fabric appearance
• Reverse appliqué technique visible
• Geometric and organic shapes
• Bold color layer changes
• Kuna indigenous art

**Ecuadorian Tigua:**
• Village scenes
• Mountains and llamas
• Simple figure style
• Bright painted colors
• Naive perspective

**Bolivian Diablada:**
• Elaborate devil mask design
• Ornate costume decorations
• Carnival festival energy
• Jeweled and embellished
• Dramatic and theatrical

**Chilean Arpillera:**
• Fabric patchwork appearance
• Embroidered details
• Social narrative scenes
• Textile texture visible
• Handstitched quality

**Peruvian Mates:**
• Carved gourd appearance
• Etched line work
• Natural tan and burnt sienna
• Intricate detailed scenes
• Indigenous subjects

**Argentine Fileteado:**
• Ornamental scrollwork
• Decorative lettering
• Symmetrical design
• Flowers and ribbons
• Buenos Aires tango aesthetic

**Brazilian Cordel:**
• Woodcut/linocut print style
• Bold black outlines
• Limited color palette
• Narrative illustration
• Literature de Cordel tradition

**Andean Textile:**
• Woven pattern aesthetic
• Geometric repeating designs
• Traditional weaving colors
• Striped and diamond patterns
• Alpaca wool texture

BACKGROUND:
• Filled with patterns and designs
• No empty white space
• Decorative throughout
• Complements subject
• Cultural motifs

LIGHTING:
• Flat lighting (no dramatic shadows)
• Even illumination
• Folk art doesn't use realistic lighting
• Bright and clear

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject transformed into authentic South American folk art in the selected regional style - with extremely vibrant colors, bold patterns, geometric designs, cultural symbols, and traditional craftsmanship aesthetic - appearing as if created by indigenous or traditional South American folk artists with decorative, colorful, and culturally-specific artistic techniques.

name: SOUTH PARK
message:
Take a picture in the style of a South Park cartoon scene with flat colors, simple shapes, blocky limbs, and exaggerated expressions. Maintain the subject’s recognizable facial identity in the South Park style.

The subject must be the main character, but include other South Park characters in the scene interacting naturally — they can be main kids, adults, or background townsfolk.

Backgrounds should reflect South Park settings: streets, schools, mountains, or indoors, keeping the simple geometric style and flat color palettes.

The final image should look like a fully composed South Park scene with the subject fully integrated among other characters, maintaining the show’s signature humor and aesthetic.

name: SOUVENIR GONE WRONG
message: Take a picture and frame the subject like a classic tourist souvenir photo in front of a famous landmark. The subject should be posing confidently as if capturing a perfect travel photo, while unexpected chaos, absurd events, or humorous interruptions happen in the background (for example: animals photobombing, sudden weather, confused crowds, or strange events). Keep the subject calm and unaware while the background tells a funny or surprising story.

name: SPACE
message:
Take a picture and place the subject in space wearing a realistic astronaut suit with Earth or spacecraft visible.

SCENE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a specific space scene, USE THAT SCENE
• If no scene is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE scene using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST DIGIT of the RANDOM SEED modulo 5:
  - 0: Space Station Exterior (ISS spacewalk, station modules visible, Earth below, tethered maintenance work)
  - 1: Free Floating (untethered drift in space, Earth filling background, peaceful zero-g pose, arms extended)
  - 2: Spacecraft Approach (near capsule or shuttle, vehicle visible nearby, preparing to enter/exit, technical activity)
  - 3: Lunar Surface (standing on Moon, lunar craters visible, Earth in black sky, flag or landing module nearby)
  - 4: Satellite Repair (working on large satellite, solar panels visible, delicate repair work, tools floating nearby)

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• Subject is an astronaut in space
• Wearing a functional, realistic spacesuit with helmet
• Zero gravity environment
• Earth, spacecraft, or space station visible
• Photorealistic, cinematic quality
• Tone reflects wonder, isolation, or exploration

IDENTITY RULES:
• Subject's face visible through helmet visor or with visor up
• Facial features and identity fully preserved
• Natural expression matching the selected scene
• Subject remains recognizable as themselves
• No replacement with another person

SPACESUIT DESIGN:
• Modern NASA or commercial space program EVA suit
• White with technical details and mission patches
• Helmet with gold-tinted visor (can be up or reflective)
• Life support backpack with tubes and controls
• Suit appears functional and scientifically accurate
• Tethers, tools, or equipment attached as appropriate
• American flag or international agency patches

SPACE ENVIRONMENT:
• Pure black space background
• Stars visible as tiny pinpoints (not exaggerated)
• Earth prominently featured with realistic cloud patterns
• Bright sunlight creating stark shadows
• No atmosphere to diffuse light
• Realistic scale and distances

EARTH APPEARANCE:
• Photorealistic with visible continents and oceans
• Cloud formations clearly visible
• Accurate blue-green-white colors
• Curvature clearly visible
• Atmosphere rim glowing at edge
• Recognizable geographic features

LIGHTING:
• Harsh, direct sunlight from single source
• Extreme contrast between light and shadow
• No atmospheric diffusion
• Reflections on helmet visor
• Earth-light gently illuminating shadowed areas
• Stars don't twinkle in airless space

ZERO GRAVITY EFFECTS:
• Subject appears weightless in pose
• Hair not visible (inside helmet)
• Tethers or tools floating if not secured
• Relaxed, floating body posture
• No "standing" unless on lunar surface

CAMERA:
• Cinematic framing and composition
• Professional space photography quality
• Subject clearly in focus
• Sense of scale and vastness conveyed
• Earth providing dramatic backdrop

OPTIONAL ELEMENTS:
• Tether cables extending from suit
• Tools attached to utility belt
• Helmet lights illuminated
• Gloves with technical details
• Mission timer or displays visible
• Reflection of Earth or station in visor

RESTRICTIONS:
• No cartoon or stylized rendering
• No aliens or fantasy spacecraft
• No text overlays or captions
• No unrealistic space colors (nebulas, etc. unless distant)
• No atmospheric effects in vacuum of space
• No Star Wars/Trek style sci-fi elements
• No visible breathing clouds (vacuum)

FINAL RESULT:
The image should present the subject as a real astronaut in space performing authentic space operations. The suit, Earth, and environment should reflect actual space photography aesthetics. The result should feel like an official NASA or space agency photograph — awe-inspiring, real, and technically accurate.

name: SPANISH BAROQUE
message: Take a picture and transform the image into a painting in the style of Diego Velázquez or similar Spanish Baroque painters. Use realistic lighting, subtle color palettes, and detailed textures. Capture the subject naturally, with dramatic depth and elegant composition reminiscent of 17th-century Spanish portraiture. Imbue the image with profound religious fervor, stark realism, and dramatic use of tenebrism to evoke strong emotions and piety.

name: SPIELBERG FILM
message:
Take a picture of the subject and place them into a famous Spielberg movie scene.

FILM SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a Spielberg film, USE THAT FILM
• If no film is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE film using the RANDOM SEED
• Use the LAST DIGIT of the RANDOM SEED modulo 10:
  - 0: E.T.
  - 1: Jaws
  - 2: Saving Private Ryan
  - 3: Schindler's List
  - 4: The Goonies
  - 5: Jurassic Park
  - 6: Indiana Jones (Raiders of the Lost Ark)
  - 7: Close Encounters of the Third Kind
  - 8: Hook
  - 9: Catch Me If You Can

The subject should appear as the central figure, interacting with the iconic environment or objects — holding the glowing finger in E.T., facing a dinosaur, or pulling a dramatic stunt in Indiana Jones style.

Lighting, perspective, and props should match the original film, making it cinematic and realistic.

Optional master prompt text can influence which film or scene is used, or add a humorous twist (e.g., subject holding the alien wrong, tripping over a dinosaur, or wearing a ridiculous explorer hat).

The final image should feel like a real movie still starring the subject, instantly recognizable as Spielberg-style adventure, with humor or absurdity added.

name: SPONGEBOB SQUAREPANTS
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a bright, underwater cartoon world inspired by SpongeBob SquarePants.

STYLE & CHARACTER RULES:
• Thick black outlines and highly simplified shapes
• Bright, saturated colors with minimal shading
• Exaggerated facial expressions and elastic cartoon anatomy
• The subject must be transformed into a SpongeBob-style character while retaining recognizable facial features
• Include multiple underwater cartoon characters native to this world

SCENE & TONE:
• Underwater setting with coral, sand, bubbles, and whimsical ocean props
• Absurd, energetic, and slapstick tone
• Cartoon physics encouraged — stretched poses, goofy expressions, exaggerated reactions

COMPOSITION:
• Clear, readable foreground characters
• Simple but iconic underwater environments
• No realism, no cinematic lighting, no gritty textures

The final image should look like a fully composed SpongeBob SquarePants–style hand-drawn illustration with the subject and additional characters integrated seamlessly into the world.

name: SPORTS G.O.A.T.
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a professional sports champion at the peak moment of athletic achievement.

SPORT SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a sport, USE THAT SPORT
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 30:
  - 0: Basketball - powerful slam dunk, hanging on rim, NBA arena, championship game
  - 1: Soccer/Football - bicycle kick goal, World Cup final, stadium roaring
  - 2: Baseball - home run swing, bat connecting, World Series, ball flying
  - 3: American Football - touchdown catch, diving in end zone, Super Bowl
  - 4: Tennis - powerful serve, Wimbledon center court, championship point
  - 5: Golf - perfect drive, tee shot, Masters Tournament, follow-through
  - 6: Track 100m Sprint - crossing finish line first, arms up, Olympic gold
  - 7: Swimming - butterfly stroke, racing to wall, Olympic pool, gold medal race
  - 8: Gymnastics - perfect landing, dismount, Olympic arena, 10.0 score
  - 9: Figure Skating - triple axel mid-air, Olympic ice, flawless execution
  - 10: Volleyball - spike over net, championship match, powerful hit
  - 11: Hockey - scoring goal, puck in net, Stanley Cup finals
  - 12: Boxing - victory pose, arms raised, championship belt, referee holding hand up
  - 13: Wrestling - pinning opponent, Olympic wrestling mat, gold medal match
  - 14: Martial Arts - perfect kata pose, black belt, tournament championship
  - 15: Cycling - sprint finish, Tour de France, arms raised in victory
  - 16: Marathon - breaking finish tape, arms up, Boston/NYC Marathon
  - 17: Long Jump - mid-air extension, Olympic track, perfect form
  - 18: High Jump - clearing bar, Fosbury Flop, Olympic field
  - 19: Pole Vault - soaring over bar, Olympic stadium, incredible height
  - 20: Shot Put - powerful throw, Olympic field, muscles engaged
  - 21: Javelin - launching throw, perfect form, Olympic field
  - 22: Discus - spinning throw, Olympic field, athletic power
  - 23: Equestrian - jumping over obstacle, Olympic show jumping, perfect form
  - 24: Rowing - crew in perfect sync, Olympic regatta, powerful stroke
  - 25: Fencing - scoring touch, Olympic fencing strip, épée extended
  - 26: Archery - perfect release, Olympic target, bullseye shot
  - 27: Table Tennis - smash shot, Olympic table, championship point
  - 28: Badminton - overhead smash, Olympic court, championship match
  - 29: Rugby - scoring try, diving over line, World Cup final

CHAMPIONSHIP MOMENT (CRITICAL):
• Peak athletic achievement frozen in time
• Most dramatic moment of the sport
• Professional championship setting
• Olympic, World Cup, or major league atmosphere
• Victory and excellence captured
• Age-appropriate and safe sport depiction

SUBJECT PRESERVATION:
• Subject's face CLEARLY RECOGNIZABLE
• Facial features maintained
• Expression shows determination, joy, or intensity
• Subject's identity visible
• This is the subject as a champion athlete
• Subject appears as GOAT (Greatest Of All Time) in their sport

PROFESSIONAL GEAR:
• Authentic professional sports equipment
• Team uniform or Olympic attire
• Proper footwear for the sport
• Sport-specific protective gear if needed
• Championship-quality appearance
• Branded professional sports gear (Nike, Adidas, etc.)

CHAMPIONSHIP ENVIRONMENT:
• Professional stadium, arena, or Olympic venue
• Massive crowd in background
• Championship atmosphere
• Professional lighting and conditions
• Other competitors visible if appropriate
• Scoreboard or Olympic rings visible
• Media and cameras present

MOTION & ENERGY:
• Dynamic action frozen at peak moment
• Motion blur on ball, equipment, or background
• Speed and power visible
• Athletic excellence captured
• Professional sports photography composition
• Freeze-frame of championship moment

BODY POSITION:
• Perfect athletic form for that sport
• Professional technique visible
• Muscles engaged appropriately
• Championship-level execution
• Winning moment captured

EXPRESSION:
• Determination and focus
• Joy of victory
• Championship intensity
• Athletic excellence
• GOAT energy and confidence

LIGHTING:
• Professional stadium/arena lighting
• Olympic venue lighting
• Dramatic sports photography lighting
• Golden hour for outdoor sports
• Broadcast-quality illumination

ATMOSPHERE:
• Championship glory
• Olympic excellence
• Professional sports at highest level
• Inspirational athletic achievement
• Victory and triumph
• Hall of Fame moment
• G.O.A.T. status

CROWD & SETTING:
• Packed stadium or arena
• Fans cheering and celebrating
• Olympic flags or team banners
• Championship event atmosphere
• Professional sports venue
• Media and broadcast presence

PHOTOGRAPHY STYLE:
• Professional sports photography
• ESPN, Sports Illustrated quality
• Olympic broadcast camera angle
• High-speed freeze frame
• Magazine cover worthy
• Championship documentation

SAFE & APPROPRIATE:
• No dangerous or extreme elements
• Professional supervised sports only
• Championship venues and settings
• Age-appropriate athletic achievement
• Inspirational and positive
• Safe sports depiction

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject - clearly recognizable - as a professional champion athlete frozen in the peak moment of their sport, with authentic professional gear, championship venue setting, and professional sports photography quality capturing them as the GOAT (Greatest Of All Time) in an inspirational, safe, and age-appropriate athletic achievement.

name: SPORTS TRADING CARD
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a fully visible collectible sports trading card with a vintage 1980s/1990s style. Ensure the entire card—including all borders, portrait, background, stats, and flavor text—is fully visible and centered in the frame. Randomly assign a sport (e.g., basketball, soccer, baseball, football, tennis) for each render.

Include a clear portrait of the subject, a stylized action background, and a card border with realistic texture, embossing, and glossy surfaces. Apply worn effects such as yellowed edges, scratches, and slight discoloration for a vintage look.

Add the subject’s name, a mock team name or mascot, absurd over-the-top stats inspired by the subject’s appearance, pose, or personality (e.g., “99% chance to eat pizza mid-game,” “Can balance a coffee cup while dribbling”), and humorous flavor text describing the subject. Allow external master prompt text to be appended to the flavor text.

Ensure everything is legible on a small screen, the subject remains instantly recognizable, and the final image clearly shows the full card without cropping.

name: SPORTS TROPHY
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into an actual sports trophy. The subject's upper body and head should be rendered in shiny gold, silver, or bronze metal posed triumphantly on a wooden or marble base. Preserve their facial features and expression in metallic form as if they're a commemorative statue-trophy. Include an engraved plaque on the base with humorous award text. Show realistic metal reflections, trophy cup handles if appropriate, and that distinctive trophy sheen. Place on a shelf or display case with dramatic lighting.

name: SPOT THE DIFFERENCE
message:
Take a picture and duplicate it into two side-by-side frames showing the same scene. Keep the left frame as the original reference image.

Ensure the subject and all objects remain **exactly in the same position and fully visible** in both frames unless an object is intentionally removed. The subject should not be tilted or cropped out of frame; the entire area should be consistently in view on both sides.

In the right frame, introduce **5–7 subtle but clearly noticeable differences** in objects, colors, accessories, or minor details, such as:
• Removing or adding small objects
• Altering colors of items or clothing
• Slightly repositioning accessories or props (without moving the subject)
• Changing minor details of clothing, eyes, haircolor, hairstyle, or props
• Adjusting the size of small items or background elements

Do not add labels, arrows, or text. The two images should be aligned, evenly sized, and easy to compare on a small screen. The final result should resemble a classic children’s "find the differences" puzzle, with differences discoverable but the overall scene consistent and fully framed.

name: STADIUM CROWD SIGN
message:
Take a picture and place the subject inside a live sports stadium crowd. The subject should blend naturally into the audience, wearing a team jersey and appearing as one of many fans.

The subject must be holding a handmade or printed sign with a funny message inspired by flavor text or externally appended language. The sign should be readable but not oversized, matching real fan-made stadium signs.

Compose the scene so the subject is not immediately obvious at first glance. The viewer should discover the subject by scanning the crowd. Use realistic stadium lighting, depth, motion blur, and crowd density.

Ensure the subject, sign, and surrounding fans feel cohesive and photoreal. The final image should feel like a real moment captured during a live sporting event.

name: STAGE PLAY MELTDOWN
message:
Take a picture of the subject in the middle of a live stage play that is visibly falling apart.

Show obvious failures such as collapsing sets, broken props, missed cues, tangled costumes, or confused actors.

Stage lights, curtains, and audience reactions should be visible.

The subject should appear embarrassed, panicked, or frozen mid-mistake.

The final image should feel like a candid theater disaster moment.

name: STAINED GLASS
message: Take a picture and transform the image into a stained-glass artwork. Bold lead outlines, translucent color panels. Light glowing through the glass.

name: STANDING NEXT TO
message: Take a picture and add a FAMOUS PERSON standing next to the subject. Match lighting and scale realistically.

name: STAND-UP COMEDIAN
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a stand-up comedian performing live on stage.

Place the subject on a comedy club stage with a microphone stand, spotlight lighting, and a classic stand-up backdrop such as a brick wall or dark curtain. The subject should appear mid-performance, holding or standing near the microphone, with posture and expression adapted from the subject's real demeanor (confident, awkward, smug, confused, etc.).

Dress the subject in classic stand-up attire appropriate to a comedy club — casual jacket, button-down, t-shirt, or minimalist stage outfit — adapted naturally from the subject's original clothing when possible.

JOKE COMEDIAN STYLE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt suggests a comedian's style, USE THAT COMEDIAN'S STYLE
• If no comedian's style is provided externally, SELECT EXACTLY ONE comedian's style using the RANDOM SEED
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 0: SELECT Stephen Wright
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 1: SELECT Rodney Dangerfield
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 2,3: SELECT Mitch Hedberg
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 4: SELECT Norm Macdonald
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 5,6: SELECT Anthony Jeselnik
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 7: SELECT Jimmy Carr
• If the RANDOM SEED ends in 8,9: SELECT Henny Youngman

Include ONE clearly readable on-screen joke caption, presented as part of the performance (subtitle, lower-third, or stage sign). The joke should be EITHER a REAL, VERBATIM one-liner (under 90 characters) from the selected comedian, OR an ORIGINAL one-liner written in the STYLE of that comedian.

Optionally include subtle comedy-club details such as:
• a fake venue name or special title inspired by the subject
• a small audience silhouette or dimly lit crowd
• a mock comedy special title using flavor text (e.g., "Live From Poor Decisions")

Ensure the full stage scene, subject, and joke text are fully visible and readable on a small screen. The final image should feel like a paused frame from a real comedy set — uncomfortable, confident, funny, and unmistakably stand-up.

name: STAR TREK
message: Take a picture and place the subject on the bridge of the Starship Enterprise dressed in a Star Trek uniform. Make it photorealistic.

name: STAR TREK UNIVERSE
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a Star Trek species. Preserve recognizable facial structure, expressions, body proportions, and personality while adapting them to authentic alien anatomy. Translate clothing into species-appropriate uniform or attire while retaining original silhouette and identity cues. Cinematic sci-fi lighting, photorealistic rendering, and cultural authenticity. The subject must appear fully as the species, naturally integrated into a Star Trek environment (starship bridge, engineering, planet surface, space station).

SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a species, USE THAT SPECIES
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 48:
  - 0: Klingon (prominent forehead ridges, warrior appearance, powerful build)
  - 1: Vulcan (pointed ears, arched eyebrows, logical demeanor, copper-based blood)
  - 2: Romulan (pointed ears, V-shaped forehead ridges, stern militaristic bearing)
  - 3: Borg (cybernetic implants, pale skin, one mechanical eye, collective consciousness)
  - 4: Ferengi (large lobed ears, pronounced brow, sharp teeth, commercial demeanor)
  - 5: Cardassian (ridged neck and forehead, spoon-shaped central ridge, gray skin)
  - 6: Orion (green skin, athletic build, exotic appearance, slave trader culture)
  - 7: Andorian (blue skin, white hair, antennae on head, warrior culture)
  - 8: Betazoid (human-like with dark eyes, telepathic bearing, elegant features)
  - 9: Trill (spotted pattern from forehead to toes, symbiont host markings)
  - 10: Bajoran (ridged nose bridge, spiritual appearance, earring worn)
  - 11: Bolian (blue skin, vertical ridge down face center, bald or light hair)
  - 12: Tellarite (pig-like snout, heavy beard, stocky build, argumentative demeanor)
  - 13: Benzite (blue skin, catfish-like whiskers, breathing apparatus)
  - 14: El-Aurian (human-like, wise appearance, excellent listeners, long-lived)
  - 15: Ocampa (pointed ears, fair skin, short lifespan appearance, psychic abilities)
  - 16: Kazon (ridged forehead in sections, warrior appearance, tribal aesthetic)
  - 17: Vidiian (diseased skin patches, medical implants, desperate appearance)
  - 18: Talaxian (spotted skin, whiskers, optimistic cheerful demeanor like Neelix)
  - 19: Krenim (ridged forehead, temporal scientist appearance, calculating demeanor)
  - 20: Hirogen (armored ridged face, predatory hunter appearance, tall build)
  - 21: Vorta (pale skin, violet eyes, diplomatic smooth features, Dominion servants)
  - 22: Jem'Hadar (scaled gray skin, horned ridges, soldier physique, Dominion warriors)
  - 23: Breen (fully helmeted and suited, mysterious masked appearance)
  - 24: Gorn (reptilian humanoid, scaled green skin, powerful lizard-like features)
  - 25: Nausicaan (large tusks, aggressive features, pirate-like appearance, tall)
  - 26: Reman (pale gray skin, bat-like features, adapted to darkness, Romulan slaves)
  - 27: Xindi-Primate (ape-like features, pronounced brow, intelligent appearance)
  - 28: Xindi-Arboreal (sloth-like features, gentle appearance, tree-dwelling nature)
  - 29: Suliban (mottled skin, enhanced genetics, shapeshifting appearance)
