  - 43: Walking into animal enclosure through open gate
  - 44: Standing under lightning storm holding metal rod
  - 45: Ignoring 'DO NOT STACK' collapse warning
  - 46: Standing in radiation zone signage
  - 47: Eating allergen-heavy food under allergy warning
  - 48: Ignoring 'AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL ONLY'
  - 49: Standing directly behind jet engine intake

CORE RULES:
• A visible warning sign MUST be present
• The subject must be actively violating the warning
• Consequences should be imminent or implied
• Subject must remain fully recognizable

FINAL RESULT:
The image must clearly depict the subject ignoring an explicit warning sign, capturing the exact moment before consequences occur.

name: WATERCOLOR
message: Take a picture in the style of a Watercolor painting. The pigments are mixed with water and applied to paper, creating luminous, transparent washes of color.

name: WEDDING CAKE TOPPER
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject(s) into the traditional two-figure wedding cake topper. If only one subject is provided, assign them to one of the two figures; if two subjects are provided, each becomes one of the figures.

Render the figures as small, cheap plastic or resin figurines with smooth, slightly glossy surfaces and simplified, mass-produced detailing. The faces and features should retain recognizable aspects of the subjects but remain stylized and clearly toy-like. Clothing details (tuxedo, suit, wedding gown, veil, bouquet) should be painted on, not fabric.

Place the two figures securely on the top tier of a multi-layer wedding cake. Include realistic frosting textures, piped borders, subtle crumbs, and decorations such as flowers or fondant accents.

Position the toppers close together in the classic wedding pose, slightly off-center if needed to reflect a real hand-placed topper. The figures must clearly appear as part of the cake, not floating or separate.

Set the scene on a wedding reception table with soft lighting, pastel or neutral tones, and subtle background elements like table linens, flowers, or candles.

Ensure the entire top tier and both figurines are fully visible within the frame. Scale, shadows, and perspective must reinforce that the subject(s) are physical cheap plastic wedding cake toppers. The final image should feel charming, humorous, and recognizably a wedding cake topper scene.

name: WEEBLE WOBBLE
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a classic egg-shaped wobble toy inspired by vintage roly-poly figures.

SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies additional styling details, USE THOSE
• If none is specified, proceed with the default classic toy configuration

CORE SHAPE (MANDATORY):
• The toy must be a smooth egg-shaped roly-poly figure
• The bottom must be rounded and weighted
• No visible limbs
• No realistic body proportions
• The silhouette must be a single continuous egg form

COLOR STRUCTURE (MANDATORY):
• The top third (head dome) must be a solid color matching the subject’s hair color
• The bottom third (base) must be a solid color chosen from: blue, green, red, or yellow
• The center band must feature simplified cartoon-style painted clothing inspired by the subject’s outfit
• No gradients unless subtle toy shading
• No photographic textures

FACE & HEAD INTEGRATION (CRITICAL):
• The face must wrap around the upper curved dome
• The head must not appear as a photo pasted on top
• Facial features must be simplified into toy-like painted shapes
• No hyper-real skin texture
• No sticker, decal, or image overlay
• The head must feel like a molded and painted toy surface
• The hair color must define the solid dome color, not realistic hair strands

CLOTHING BAND (MANDATORY):
• The subject’s clothing must be simplified into cartoon-style painted graphics
• Bold shapes, clean lines
• No fabric realism
• Must look factory-painted onto plastic

MATERIAL & FINISH:
• Glossy molded plastic
• Soft highlight reflections
• Slight seam line where top and bottom halves meet
• Subtle shadow beneath toy indicating weight

TAGLINE (MANDATORY):
• The phrase "Weebles wobble, but they don't fall down" must appear beneath the toy
• Typography should resemble vintage toy advertisement style
• Do not recreate official packaging layouts
• Present as a simple promotional caption under the toy

VISUAL STYLE:
• Studio product photography
• Neutral or soft gradient background
• Clean commercial lighting
• Toy-store catalog aesthetic

IMPORTANT:
• The result must look like a mass-produced molded plastic toy
• No realistic portrait rendering
• No photographic face texture
• The subject must be recognizable through simplified painted features only

FINAL RESULT:
The final image should look like a professionally photographed classic egg-shaped wobble toy with a solid color head dome matching the subject’s hair, a solid colored base, cartoon-style painted clothing in the center band, and a fully integrated painted face wrapping around the curved top surface.

name: WEEKEND UPDATE
message:
Take a picture and transform the scene into a Weekend Update segment from Saturday Night Live.

CORE REQUIREMENT (CRITICAL):
• The image MUST include a recognizable Weekend Update anchor seated at the desk (e.g., Colin Jost or Michael Che anchor)
• The anchor must appear as part of the scene, not implied or cropped out

SCENE SETUP:
• Classic Weekend Update desk and backdrop
• Clean studio lighting and broadcast camera framing
• The anchor is visible on one side of the frame at the desk
• A topic image box appears beside the anchor, as seen in real Weekend Update segments

SUBJECT PRESENTATION:
• The subject appears ONLY inside the topic image box next to the anchor
• The subject image must look like a broadcast graphic, not a pasted photograph
• Match studio lighting, scale, and perspective of real Weekend Update graphics
• The subject must remain recognizable

HEADLINE / CHYRON (CRITICAL):
• A humorous headline or caption must appear directly beneath or over the subject’s image
• Headline must feel like authentic SNL Weekend Update writing
• Use external master prompt flavor text to influence the joke or headline
• If no external flavor text is provided, invent a sharp, absurd, or ironic headline

COMPOSITION RULES:
• Preserve the full Weekend Update framing
• Do NOT zoom into the subject image
• Do NOT remove the anchor
• The anchor and subject graphic must clearly coexist in the same shot

STYLE & TONE:
• Broadcast news realism
• Sharp, legible typography
• Comedic, satirical tone consistent with Weekend Update

FINAL RESULT:
The image must look like a real Weekend Update moment, with a visible anchor delivering a joke while the subject appears in the on-screen topic graphic with a humorous headline.

name: WEIRD SCIENCE
message:
Take a picture of the subject in the middle of a science experiment that is actively failing.

Show visible chaos such as smoke, foam overflow, sparks, cracked glassware, runaway reactions, or unexpected substances escaping.

The subject must appear caught mid-failure — shocked, panicked, or frozen in regret.

The image should look like a candid photograph taken at the exact moment the experiment went wrong.

name: WENDIGO
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a wendigo creature from Algonquian folklore.

WENDIGO INTERPRETATION SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies interpretation, USE THAT INTERPRETATION
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST DIGIT:
  - 0: Traditional Folklore - emaciated human, frostbitten, ash-gray skin, sunken eyes, cannibalistic
  - 1: Deer Skull - humanoid body with deer/elk skull for head, massive antlers, skeletal
  - 2: Feral Beast - half-human half-deer, animalistic, predatory, twisted transformation
  - 3: Frozen Corpse - preserved in ice, ancient, mummified, eternally hungry
  - 4: Shadow Wendigo - dark silhouette, glowing eyes, barely visible, stalking presence
  - 5: Modern Horror - tall, antlered, emaciated, horror movie monster, Until Dawn style
  - 6: Possessed Human - mid-transformation, human struggling with curse, body changing
  - 7: Ancient Spirit - ghostly, translucent, winter spirit, ethereal horror
  - 8: Forest Giant - massive (12+ feet), towering, primal, apex predator
  - 9: Skeletal Horror - exposed bones, torn flesh, rotting, decomposed but alive

SUBJECT TRANSFORMATION:
• Subject's face visible in creature form
• Recognizable features within wendigo
• Subject AS the wendigo, not generic monster
• Identity maintained through horror transformation
• Human elements still present

WENDIGO CORE FEATURES (CRITICAL):
• EXTREMELY emaciated, skeletal
• Skin stretched tight over bones
• Ribs and spine visible
• Gaunt, starving appearance
• Impossibly thin limbs
• Tall (7-12 feet depending on type)
• Gray, white, or ash-colored skin
• Frostbitten appearance

HEAD & FACE:
• Sunken eyes (glowing yellow/white)
• Hollow cheeks
• Lipless mouth revealing teeth
• Sharp, predatory teeth (some interpretations)
• Deer/elk skull (some versions)
• Massive antlers (common modern interpretation)
• Elongated face
• Frozen expression of eternal hunger

ANTLERS (If applicable):
• Large elk or deer antlers
• Protruding from skull
• Multiple points (8-12+ points)
• Weathered and aged
• Covered in frost or snow
• Imposing and crown-like
• Natural but massive

SKIN:
• Ash-gray or pale white
• Frostbitten (blackened extremities)
• Tight over bones
• Leathery, mummified texture
• Covered in frost or ice
• Cracked and dry
• Corpse-like pallor
• Almost translucent in places

BODY:
• Skeletal frame visible
• No body fat whatsoever
• Elongated limbs
• Hunched or crouched posture
• Spine and ribs protruding
• Clawed hands (long fingers)
• Digitigrade legs (some versions)
• Unnaturally tall

CLAWS & HANDS:
• Long, sharp claws
• Skeletal fingers
• Black nails or talons
• Frostbitten fingertips
• Capable of tearing flesh
• Grasping, predatory

HAIR:
• Sparse, patchy
• White or gray
• Frozen with ice crystals
• Matted and filthy
• Falling out
• OR completely hairless

EYES:
• Glowing (yellow, white, or pale blue)
• Sunken deep in sockets
• Hollow, empty
• Predatory stare
• Reflecting light like animal
• Hungry, insatiable look
• No humanity remaining

MOUTH & TEETH:
• Lipless (skin pulled back)
• Sharp, carnivorous teeth
• Blood-stained
• Jaw can unhinge
• Frozen saliva
• Constant hunger evident
• Predatory fangs

POSE & STANCE:
• Hunched, predatory crouch
• Stalking pose
• Feeding on carcass
• Standing menacingly tall
• Crawling on all fours
• Emerging from trees
• Ready to pounce

SETTING (CRITICAL - Winter/Forest):
• Deep winter forest
• Snow-covered ground
• Bare trees
• Frozen landscape
• Blizzard or snowstorm
• Mountain wilderness
• Remote isolated location
• Northern forest (Canada/Northern US)
• Dusk or night

WEATHER:
• Heavy snow falling
• Blizzard conditions
• Frost and ice everywhere
• Freezing cold atmosphere
• Wind-blown snow
• Winter storm
• Subzero temperatures evident

ENVIRONMENT DETAILS:
• Frozen trees
• Animal tracks in snow
• Carcasses or bones
• Abandoned cabin nearby
• Northern lights (optional)
• Moonlight on snow
• Deep wilderness

ATMOSPHERE:
• Extreme cold
• Isolation and dread
• Primal fear
• Ancient curse
• Starvation and cannibalism
• Winter horror
• Folklore terror
• Survival horror

LIGHTING:
• Moonlight on snow
• Dim twilight
• Flashlight beam
• Campfire light
• Darkness with glowing eyes visible
• Cold blue tones
• High contrast shadows

CULTURAL RESPECT:
• This is Algonquian folklore - treat respectfully
• Not a joke or comedy monster
• Serious horror creature
• Native American mythology
• Wendigo psychosis is real cultural phenomenon
• Represent as folklore dictates

CANNIBALISM ELEMENTS:
• Blood on mouth and claws
• Bones scattered nearby
• Recent kill visible
• Never satisfied hunger
• Predatory focus
• Hunter of humans
• Insatiable appetite

FROZEN/ICE ELEMENTS:
• Frost covering body
• Icicles hanging from antlers
• Frozen breath visible
• Ice crystals on skin
• Snow clinging to creature
• Cold emanating from it

SOUND DESIGN (IMPLIED):
• Howling wind
• Cracking branches
• Heavy breathing
• Chittering or clicking sounds
• Screams (mimicking humans)
• Silence then sudden noise

HORROR STYLE:
• Until Dawn video game aesthetic
• Pet Sematary wendigo
• Antlers horror film
• Native folklore horror
• Survival horror
• Monster horror
• Photorealistic creature

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject transformed into a wendigo creature - extremely emaciated and skeletal with gray frostbitten skin, possibly with deer skull and massive antlers, glowing eyes, clawed hands, standing in a deep winter forest during a snowstorm with moonlight, the subject's identity still visible within the horrific transformation - appearing as a terrifying folkloric monster from Algonquian tradition with that endless hunger and winter horror aesthetic, respectfully representing Native American mythology.

name: WES ANDERSON
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a Wes Anderson film scene with perfect symmetry, pastel colors, and whimsical composition.

FILM SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a Wes Anderson film, USE THAT FILM
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 11:
  - 0: The Grand Budapest Hotel (2014) - pink hotel, concierge, European elegance, 1930s
  - 1: The Royal Tenenbaums (2001) - New York townhouse, family portrait, striped wallpaper, tracksuits
  - 2: Moonrise Kingdom (2012) - 1960s New England island, scout camp, young love, nautical
  - 3: The Darjeeling Limited (2007) - Indian train, brothers, luggage, spiritual journey
  - 4: Fantastic Mr. Fox (2009) - stop-motion, autumn colors, countryside, animal characters
  - 5: The Life Aquatic (2004) - red beanie, boat, underwater, oceanographic expedition
  - 6: Rushmore (1998) - prep school, theater, Max Fischer, bees, Vietnam
  - 7: The French Dispatch (2021) - magazine office, 1960s France, anthology stories, journalism
  - 8: Isle of Dogs (2018) - stop-motion, Japan, dogs, trash island, dystopian
  - 9: Bottle Rocket (1996) - yellow jumpsuit, heist, Southwest, criminal friends
  - 10: Asteroid City (2023) - desert, 1950s, mid-century modern, alien encounter

CORE WES ANDERSON STYLE (CRITICAL):
• Perfect symmetry - subject centered in frame
• One-point perspective composition
• Flat frontal camera angle
• Pastel color palette
• Meticulous production design
• Whimsical storybook aesthetic
• Deadpan expression and pose
• Every detail intentional and designed

COMPOSITION:
• Centered symmetry - subject in exact middle
• Horizontal or vertical axis of symmetry
• Flat frontal angle (not dramatic perspectives)
• Grid-like organization
• Balanced left and right sides
• Architectural framing
• Subject looking directly at camera

COLOR PALETTE:
• Pastel colors (soft pinks, blues, yellows, greens)
• Muted earth tones
• Vintage color grading
• Film-specific palette:
  - Grand Budapest: Pink, purple, red
  - Tenenbaums: Brown, tan, burgundy
  - Moonrise Kingdom: Yellow, green, khaki
  - Darjeeling: Orange, brown, red
  - Life Aquatic: Blue, red, tan
• Carefully coordinated color schemes
• Nostalgic film stock look

PRODUCTION DESIGN:
• Meticulously designed sets
• Vintage props and furniture
• Pattern and texture (wallpaper, fabrics)
• Handmade aesthetic
• Miniature model quality
• Everything color-coordinated
• Retro technology and objects

COSTUME:
• Carefully coordinated outfits
• Vintage or period-appropriate clothing
• Color-matched to set design
• Film-specific iconic costumes:
  - Grand Budapest: Purple concierge uniform
  - Tenenbaums: Adidas tracksuit, headband
  - Moonrise Kingdom: Scout uniform
  - Life Aquatic: Red beanie, Speedo
  - Rushmore: Prep school blazer

TYPOGRAPHY & GRAPHICS:
• Futura font (Anderson's signature typeface)
• Title cards with film/chapter information
• Hand-drawn maps or diagrams
• Vintage labels and signage
• Needlepoint or embroidered text
• Clean sans-serif titles

LIGHTING:
• Soft even lighting
• Natural daylight quality
• No dramatic shadows
• Slightly overexposed/bright
• Storybook lighting
• Warm nostalgic glow

CHARACTER POSE:
• Deadpan expression
• Looking directly at camera
• Formal posed portrait
• Symmetrical body position
• Slight melancholy or whimsy
• Understated emotion

SETTING DETAILS:
• Miniature or diorama quality
• Vintage architecture
• Specific time period (1950s-1970s usually)
• European or exotic locations
• Handcrafted aesthetic
• Every object carefully placed

WES ANDERSON QUIRKS:
• Slow motion walks
• Perfectly packed luggage
• Maps and diagrams
• Letters and correspondence
• Vintage technology (rotary phones, typewriters)
• Model trains or vehicles
• Detailed miniatures

TONE:
• Whimsical melancholy
• Nostalgic and bittersweet
• Quirky family dynamics
• Coming-of-age themes
• Deadpan humor
• Storybook fairy tale quality

CINEMATOGRAPHY:
• Aspect ratio: often 1.85:1 or Academy ratio
• Static camera (minimal movement)
• Tableau-style framing
• Planimetric composition (flat depth)
• Film grain texture
• Vintage film stock aesthetic

FINAL RESULT:
The image should be perfectly symmetrical with the subject centered, in a meticulously designed Wes Anderson film environment with pastel colors, vintage props, deadpan expression, flat frontal camera angle, and that distinctive whimsical storybook aesthetic specific to the selected film.

name: WESTERN
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a cowboy in an Old West setting with complete Western environment.

WESTERN SETTING SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a setting, USE THAT SETTING
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST DIGIT:
  - 0: Main Street - dusty Western town street, wooden buildings, hitching posts, general store
  - 1: Saloon interior - swinging doors, bar, poker tables, piano, whiskey bottles
  - 2: Gunfight duel - two cowboys facing off at high noon, tumbleweeds, dramatic standoff
  - 3: Sheriff's office/jail - desk, wanted posters, jail cells, gun rack
  - 4: Desert/canyon - Monument Valley landscape, red rocks, sagebrush, vast open spaces
  - 5: Ranch/homestead - wooden fence, barn, windmill, cattle, prairie
  - 6: Stagecoach robbery - dusty trail, stagecoach, masked bandits, dramatic action
  - 7: Campfire scene - bedroll, coffee pot, stars, horses tied to trees
  - 8: Bank holdup - old Western bank interior, vault, bags of money, tense moment
  - 9: Gallows/hanging tree - town square, noose, crowd gathered, justice scene

COWBOY TRANSFORMATION:
• Subject dressed as Old West cowboy
• Complete authentic Western costume
• Weathered and dusty appearance
• Rugged frontier look
• 1870s-1890s American West era

COWBOY COSTUME:
• Wide-brimmed cowboy hat (Stetson)
• Bandana around neck
• Leather vest over shirt
• Denim jeans or leather chaps
• Gun belt with holster
• Six-shooter revolver (Colt Peacemaker)
• Cowboy boots with spurs
• Leather gloves
• Duster coat (optional)

COWBOY ROLES (subject can be):
• Gunslinger - dangerous outlaw, quick draw
• Sheriff - badge, law and order
• Outlaw/Bandit - masked, wanted man
• Ranch hand - working cowboy
• Bounty hunter - grizzled, armed
• Gambler - fancy vest, cards
• Prospector - dirty, pan for gold

ENVIRONMENT DETAILS:
• Authentic 1870s-1890s Old West
• Weathered wooden buildings
• Dirt roads
• Horse-drawn wagons
• Hitching posts with horses
• Western architecture (false fronts, porches)
• Saloons, general stores, blacksmith shops
• Wanted posters on walls

WESTERN ATMOSPHERE:
• Dusty and dry
• Hot desert sun or dramatic sunset
• Tumbleweeds rolling
• Wooden plank walkways
• Oil lamps and lanterns
• No modern elements whatsoever
• Sepia or faded color tone

WEAPONS & PROPS:
• Six-shooter revolvers (Colt .45)
• Winchester rifle
• Shotgun
• Whiskey bottle
• Playing cards
• Lasso/rope
• Saddle and horse tack
• Spittoon
• Tobacco pouch

HORSES:
• Period-appropriate horses (mustangs, quarter horses)
• Western saddles
• Tied to hitching posts or ridden
• Integral to Western scenes

LIGHTING:
• Harsh Western sunlight
• Golden hour warm tones
• Dramatic shadows
• Dusty atmosphere diffusing light
• Oil lamp glow for interiors

PHOTOGRAPHY STYLE:
• Photorealistic Western movie aesthetic
• Sergio Leone or John Ford cinematography
• Wide shots showing landscape
• Close-ups of weathered faces
• Dramatic Western film composition
• Could be from actual Western movie

COLOR GRADING:
• Warm sepia tones
• Faded colors (dusty, sun-bleached)
• Golden/orange desert hues
• Brown, tan, rust color palette
• Vintage Western film look

CHARACTER APPEARANCE:
• Weathered, sun-beaten skin
• Dusty clothing
• Unshaven or full beard
• Squinting in bright sun
• Tough, rugged demeanor
• Authentic 1880s grooming

WESTERN TOWN ELEMENTS:
• "Welcome to [Town Name]" signs
• Water trough
• Horse manure in street
• Wooden sidewalks
• Telegraph poles
• Train station (if relevant)
• Livery stable

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject completely transformed into an authentic Old West cowboy in full period costume (hat, vest, gun belt, boots) placed in a photorealistic Western setting (town street, saloon, desert, etc.) with complete environmental immersion in the 1870s-1890s American frontier - weathered, dusty, and looking like a genuine scene from a classic Western film.

name: WHAT / HOW (FROM TEXT)
message:
Take a picture and detect the most prominent readable text referring to a real-world object, place, structure, brand, person, or concept, then generate a complete WHAT IT IS and HOW IT WORKS / HOW IT IS USED / HOW IT IS MADE educational reference page.

TEXT SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies which text to use, USE THAT TEXT
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE prominent readable noun or proper name
• The selected text must refer to a real, identifiable entity

ENTITY CLASSIFICATION (MANDATORY):
Determine which category the selected text belongs to:
• Food or dish
• Drink or beverage
• Plant or tree
• Tool or object
• Building or structure
• Place or landmark
• Brand or product line
• Famous person or historical figure
• Organization or institution

WHAT SECTION (FACTUAL):
• Clear definition of what the entity is
• Key identifying facts (origin, purpose, significance)
• Historical or cultural relevance when applicable
• Important characteristics or components
• For people: who they are and why they are notable

HOW SECTION (CONTEXT-DEPENDENT):
• Food or drink: ingredients + step-by-step preparation (professional but simplified)
• Plant or tree: what it produces, growth habits, basic care
• Tool or object: how it is commonly used
• Building or structure: how it is designed or constructed (simplified)
• Place or landmark: how it is used, visited, or functions
• Brand or product: what it produces and how it is typically used
• Person: how they became notable or what they are known for

IMAGE & VISUAL REQUIREMENTS:
• Include at least ONE clearly rendered visual image or diagram relevant to the identified entity
• The image may be small to allow room for text
• The image must be clearly visible and directly support the written explanation
• Visuals must be integrated naturally into the page layout

LAYOUT RULES:
• Full educational guide or reference-page layout
• Clear section headers (WHAT IT IS / HOW IT WORKS / KEY FACTS)
• Text and image integrated into a single coherent page
• Information density balanced for readability

ACCURACY RULES:
• All factual information must be accurate and well-established
• No speculation or fictional details
• Use cautious educational phrasing when needed

EXCLUSIONS:
• No parody or joke tone
• No unsafe instructions
• No incomplete explanations

COMPOSITION & FRAME:
• The FULL reference page must be visible
• All text and the visual image fully readable
• All four corners visible
• No cropping, zooming, or partial framing

STYLE:
• Clean, educational, reference-quality
• Looks like a museum placard, textbook page, or instructional poster
• Neutral, informative tone

FINAL RESULT:
The image must function as a complete educational reference page containing both accurate written information and a clearly rendered visual image or diagram explaining what the identified entity is and how it works, is used, or is made, presented fully in-frame.

name: WHAT IF?
message:
Take a picture of the subject and place them into a famous historical moment, as if they personally changed the course of history.

The subject should be the central figure in the scene, interacting directly with a major historical event such as signing an important document, making a dramatic discovery, stopping a disaster, leading a crowd, or inventing something world-changing.

The setting, clothing, and environment should match the historical era being shown, making the scene feel authentic and cinematic.

Use external master prompt text, if provided, to suggest the historical moment or twist.

The tone should be playful and humorous, presenting the subject as an unexpected hero or key figure who altered history in a surprising way.

name: WEATHER CONDITIONS FAVORABLE
message: Take a picture of the subject and generate a four-panel side-by-side composition showing the same subject suffering through four extreme weather conditions. Each panel must be photorealistic and depict the subject enduring one condition: extreme rain with heavy downpour and splashing water, extreme heat with harsh sunlight, heat haze, and visible exhaustion, extreme cold with snow, ice, frost, and visible breath, and extreme wind with clothing, hair, debris, and environmental elements violently pushed by gusts. The subject should remain clearly identifiable in all panels, with consistent facial features and body proportions. Lighting, weather effects, and environmental interactions must feel physically accurate and believable in each scenario. The final result should look like four real photographs captured in different extreme conditions rather than stylized or surreal imagery.

name: WHEATIES BOX
message:
Take a picture and transform it into a complete, three-dimensional Wheaties cereal box. The entire box must be fully visible within the frame, including front face, edges, top flap, and box proportions.

Design the front panel in classic Wheaties style with a bold orange background. Feature the subject prominently as the heroic athlete printed on the box front. The subject must appear integrated into the printed packaging, not floating or cropped.

Add an absurd, over-the-top achievement based on the subject’s traits, posture, or environment. Display this achievement prominently like a headline.

Include exaggerated, playful flavor text inspired by cereal-box marketing copy. Use vintage-inspired typography and graphic accents without copying real slogans.

Apply realistic cardboard texture, slight wear, subtle creases, and printing imperfections. The box should appear photographed in a real environment. Ensure all text and the subject are readable on a small screen.

name: WHETHER THE WEATHER
message:
Take a picture and transform the weather conditions into the opposite state while preserving the original scene, composition, and subject.

WEATHER INVERSION RULE (CRITICAL):
• If the original scene is SUNNY or CLEAR → convert it to either RAINING or SNOWING
• If the original scene is RAINING or SNOWING → convert it to SUNNY and CLEAR
• Choose the opposite condition that creates the strongest visual contrast

PHOTOREALISM REQUIREMENT:
• The result must be fully photorealistic
• Lighting, shadows, reflections, and atmospheric effects must match the new weather
• No stylization, illustration, or fantasy effects

ENVIRONMENTAL CONSISTENCY (MANDATORY):
• If converted to RAIN:
  – All previously dry surfaces must appear wet
  – Roads, sidewalks, vehicles, and objects show realistic water sheen and reflections
  – Raindrops, splashes, puddles, and overcast sky must be present

• If converted to SNOW:
  – Objects, ground, rooftops, and surfaces must accumulate snow or ice
  – Breath vapor, frost, and cold haze may be visible
  – Snowfall should match realistic density and scale

• If converted to SUNNY:
  – All previously wet or snowy surfaces must appear dry
  – Snow and ice must be fully removed
  – Bright natural daylight, clear or lightly clouded sky
  – Stronger shadows and warmer color temperature

SUBJECT & OBJECT PRESERVATION:
• Do NOT change the subject, pose, camera angle, or framing
• Preserve all visible objects and structures
• Only alter weather, atmosphere, lighting, and surface conditions

ABSOLUTE PROHIBITIONS:
• No surreal or exaggerated weather
• No partial transformations (everything must obey the new weather)
• No time-of-day change unless required by realism

FINAL RESULT:
The image must look like the exact same photograph taken at the same moment and location — but under completely opposite, fully believable weather conditions.

name: WHO'S A GOOD HUMAN?
message:
Take a picture and apply a role-reversal between humans and pets.

First determine the type of subject:

• If the subject is an ANIMAL (dog, cat, bird, etc.): place them into a realistic human situation such as working in an office, driving a car, shopping, cooking, using a phone, or sitting in a café. The animal should behave like a person while still clearly being an animal. Use proper perspective, props, and body positioning so it looks natural and believable.

• If the subject is a HUMAN: transform them into a pet owned by an animal. The human should be on a leash, being carried, sitting in a pet carrier, or being walked by a dog, cat, or other animal. The animal must clearly be the owner and in control.

The scene should be funny but not mean-spirited — playful, surreal, and instantly understandable at a glance.

Maintain realistic lighting, scale, and contact between characters so the interaction feels physically real. The subject must be fully integrated into the scene, not pasted on.

If external master prompt text is provided, use it to influence the setting (for example: city, park, medieval, sci-fi, luxury, etc.).

The final image should feel like a clever visual gag you’d see on a magazine cover or viral poster.

name: WIKIPEDIA ARTICLE
message:
Take a picture and present the subject as the topic of a Wikipedia article page.

ARTICLE TYPE SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies an article type, USE THAT TYPE
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY — you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST DIGIT modulo 5:
  - 0: Notable Person (general biography)
  - 1: Internet Personality / Meme Figure
  - 2: Local Legend / Folk Figure
  - 3: Professional or Occupational Figure
  - 4: Unexplained or Culturally Significant Phenomenon

WIKIPEDIA PAGE STRUCTURE:
• Standard Wikipedia layout and typography
• Page title is the subject’s name or best-guess identifier
• Lead paragraph summarizes who/what the subject is
• Section headers such as:
  - Early life
  - Background
  - Career or Activities
  - Public perception
  - Trivia or Cultural impact
• Neutral, encyclopedic tone throughout

FLAVOR TEXT GENERATION:
• Use visible surroundings, clothing, objects, posture, and expression
• Derive biographical details from environment cues (location, tools, signage, setting)
• If uncertainty exists, use Wikipedia-style phrasing ("is believed to", "has been described as")
• Light dry humor allowed, but written deadpan and factual

IMAGE & INFOBOX RULES:
• Subject photo appears in the upper-right infobox
• Infobox includes fields such as:
  - Born
  - Occupation
  - Known for
  - Notable traits
• Data inferred from image context when possible

AUTHENTICITY RULES:
• Must look indistinguishable from a real Wikipedia article screenshot
• Correct spacing, link styling, and section hierarchy
• Blue hyperlinks and citation markers (e.g., [1], [2]) allowed
• No parody fonts or exaggerated satire

EXCLUSIONS:
• No overt jokes or cartoon language
• No first-person narration
• No social media UI elements

COMPOSITION & FRAME:
• Full Wikipedia page visible within frame
• Article header, title, and infobox clearly readable
• FULL image visible with all four corners present
• No cropping, zooming, or perspective skew

STYLE:
• Clean, informational, documentary
• Neutral Wikipedia voice
• Reads like a legitimate encyclopedic entry

FINAL RESULT:
The image should appear as a genuine Wikipedia article page about the subject, using realistic encyclopedic language and flavor text derived from the subject and their surroundings, making the subject seem notable, documented, and culturally recorded.

name: WINDOWS WALLPAPER
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into a widescreen desktop wallpaper that looks like a fake, humorous Windows-style computer desktop.

Use a wide landscape aspect ratio (about 16:9 or wider). The subject should appear as the main wallpaper image — either posed inside a scene or interacting with the ‘desktop.’

Overlay a fake desktop interface including:
• fake desktop icons with funny names based on the subject’s personality (e.g., "Tax Panic", "Selfies", "Emotional Support Folder", "Definitely Not Work")
• a fake taskbar with a clock, system tray, and silly system notifications
• at least one humorous pop-up or error message related to the subject

Icons should be placed around the subject so they do not block the face or important features.

The overall look should feel like a real computer desktop that someone paused mid-chaos — silly, cluttered, and personality-driven.

The final image should feel like a snapshot of the subject’s ridiculous personal computer, clearly readable on a large screen.

name: WONDERS OF THE WORLD
message:
Take a picture and place the subject at one of the Wonders of the World.

WONDER SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a wonder, USE THAT WONDER
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 21:
  - 0: Great Pyramid of Giza (Egypt - only surviving ancient wonder, massive stone pyramid)
  - 1: Hanging Gardens of Babylon (Iraq - terraced gardens, ancient Mesopotamia)
  - 2: Temple of Artemis at Ephesus (Turkey - grand Greek temple ruins)
  - 3: Statue of Zeus at Olympia (Greece - massive seated Zeus sculpture)
  - 4: Mausoleum at Halicarnassus (Turkey - grand tomb)
  - 5: Colossus of Rhodes (Greece - giant bronze statue)
  - 6: Lighthouse of Alexandria (Egypt - ancient lighthouse tower)
  - 7: Great Wall of China (China - winding defensive wall across mountains)
  - 8: Petra (Jordan - ancient rose-red carved city in cliffs)
  - 9: Christ the Redeemer (Brazil - massive Jesus statue overlooking Rio)
  - 10: Machu Picchu (Peru - Incan mountain city ruins)
  - 11: Chichen Itza (Mexico - Mayan pyramid El Castillo)
  - 12: Roman Colosseum (Italy - ancient amphitheater)
  - 13: Taj Mahal (India - white marble mausoleum)
  - 14: Grand Canyon (USA - massive desert canyon)
  - 15: Great Barrier Reef (Australia - underwater coral reef)
  - 16: Victoria Falls (Zambia/Zimbabwe - massive waterfall)
  - 17: Mount Everest (Nepal/Tibet - world's highest mountain)
  - 18: Aurora Borealis/Northern Lights (Arctic - natural light display)
  - 19: Paricutin Volcano (Mexico - volcano birth witnessed)
  - 20: Harbor of Rio de Janeiro (Brazil - natural harbor with Sugarloaf Mountain)

PLACE THE SUBJECT:
• Standing before or within the selected wonder
• Scale should show the monumentality of the structure/natural feature
• Subject appears as tourist, explorer, or visitor
• Time period appropriate to the wonder (modern for existing ones, historical for ancient destroyed ones)
• Include other tourists or period-appropriate people in background

STYLE:
• Photorealistic
• Epic scale - emphasize the grandeur and size of the wonder
• Natural lighting appropriate to location and time of day
• Subject should look awestruck, inspired, or contemplative

FINAL RESULT:
The image should capture the majesty and scale of the wonder while integrating the subject as a visitor experiencing one of humanity's greatest achievements or nature's most spectacular sights.

name: WOOD CARVING
message:
Take a picture of the subject and completely transform ONLY the subject into a carved wooden sculpture.

ABSOLUTE REQUIREMENT: The subject must be 100% wood — no skin, fabric, metal, plastic, or photographic texture may remain.

The subject must appear SOLID and VOLUMETRIC, as if carved from a single block of wood.

Wood characteristics MUST include:
• Continuous wood grain wrapping around the entire body
• Visible carving marks, chisel lines, and tool imperfections
• Grain direction that follows anatomy (face, limbs, torso)
• Natural wood seams, knots, and density variation

DO NOT apply wood as a surface texture.
DO NOT allow pores, fabric weave, or skin shading to remain.

Clothing, hair, facial features, and accessories must ALL be carved wood — not separate materials.

Lighting must behave like real wood:
• Diffuse reflection
• No skin subsurface scattering
• Subtle grain-based shadow breakup

The environment MUST remain fully photographic and unchanged.

FINAL VALIDATION RULE:
If the subject looks like a person with a wood filter applied, IT IS WRONG.

The final image must look like a real wooden statue placed into the photographed environment.

name: WOODCUT
message: Take a picture and transform the image into a traditional woodcut print. Bold carved lines, high contrast. Limited color palette.

name: WORLD PARK ICON
message:
Take a picture and place the subject inside a famous real-world park or garden outside the United States.

LOCATION SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a park, USE THAT
• Otherwise SELECT EXACTLY ONE using LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 100:
  - 0: Tivoli Gardens — Copenhagen
  - 1: Parque del Retiro — Madrid
  - 2: Boboli Gardens — Florence
  - 3: Hyde Park — London
  - 4: Kensington Gardens — London
  - 5: Luxembourg Gardens — Paris
  - 6: Tuileries Garden — Paris
  - 7: Vondelpark — Amsterdam
  - 8: Englischer Garten — Munich
  - 9: Schönbrunn Gardens — Vienna
  - 10: Tiergarten — Berlin

name: X-RAY
message: Take a picture and transform the image into an X-ray view. Semi-transparent layers revealing internal structure. Monochrome glow.

name: XENOMORPH CHEST BURST
message: Take a picture and add an alien xenomorph chest protrusion to the subject as seen in the movie Aliens. The subject's face and body remain completely normal and recognizable. A small alien xenomorph is bursting through or protruding from the center of the subject's chest in mid-emergence - partially visible with distinctive elongated head and metallic biomechanical appearance. Include tearing and distortion of clothing around the emergence point with appropriate biological effects (small amount of alien matter, tension in fabric). Subject's expression shows surprise, shock, or remains neutral. Keep it visually striking but not overly gory. Photorealistic rendering with dramatic lighting emphasizing the moment. Make it look like a behind-the-scenes promotional photo or movie still from the Alien franchise with cinematic quality.

name: YARD SALE ITEM
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject into an item being sold at a casual neighborhood yard sale.

Depict the subject posed stiffly or passively like merchandise, with a strip of masking tape on their chest or body displaying a handwritten price. The price and text should be humorous, such as 'Still Works,' 'No Returns,' or 'As-Is.'

Include a handwritten yard-sale sign nearby with casual marker lettering and uneven lines. Surround the subject with typical yard sale items like folding tables, boxes, old toys, lamps, or clothes racks.

Use natural daylight and slightly cluttered suburban surroundings to sell the realism. The subject should feel like an object for sale, not a person shopping at the sale.

Ensure the full subject and sale setup are fully visible within the frame. The tone should be funny, awkward, and unmistakably a yard sale scenario.

name: YEARBOOK
message:
Take a picture and place the subject on an actual yearbook page with an unflattering, awkward school photo.

YEARBOOK ERA SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies era or provides student info, USE THAT INFO
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST DIGIT:
  - 0: 1950s - formal, black and white, conservative hairstyles, ties and dresses
  - 1: 1960s - bouffant hair, mod fashion, Beatles influence, early color photography
  - 2: 1970s - feathered hair, bell bottoms era, mustaches, wide collars, brown tones
  - 3: 1980s - big hair, neon, mullets, perms, dramatic makeup, laser backgrounds
  - 4: 1990s - grunge, curtain hair, chokers, frosted tips, denim everything
  - 5: 2000s - emo/scene hair, popped collars, side-swept bangs, digital photography
  - 6: 2010s - hipster glasses, side parts, smartphone era, Instagram influence
  - 7: Recent/Modern - current styles, high-quality digital, polished but candid
  - 8: Awkward middle school - braces, acne, unfortunate haircuts, puberty years
  - 9: Senior portraits - professional, outdoor location, multiple poses, graduation gown option

UNFLATTERING PHOTO REQUIREMENTS (CRITICAL):
• Awkward forced smile or uncomfortable expression
• Unflattering camera angle or lighting
• Bad hair day - messy, frizzy, badly cut, or unfortunate styling
• Visible braces with food stuck in them (especially middle school)
• Acne, blemishes, or awkward teenage skin
• Glasses (thick, unflattering frames for the era)
• Caught with eyes half-closed or weird blink
• Double chin from bad angle
• Greasy or shiny skin from harsh lighting
• Awkward neck position or posture
• Visible retainer or headgear
• Too-wide or too-tight smile showing too much gum
• Unfortunate clothing choice (too tight, too baggy, stain visible, wrinkled)
• Bad school photo backdrop clash with outfit
• Sweat visible on forehead
• Cowlick sticking up
• Uneven bangs or hair parts
• Visible nervous tension in face
• Attempt at "cool" pose that looks awkward instead

AWKWARD ERA-SPECIFIC ELEMENTS:
• 1970s: Unfortunate mustache attempt, thick glasses, bad perm
• 1980s: Terribly permed hair, excessive shoulder pads, laser background making it worse
• 1990s: Unfortunate frosted tips, visible braces, regrettable choker
• 2000s: Scene hair covering half face, over-plucked eyebrows, popped collar gone wrong
• Middle School: Peak puberty awkwardness, growth spurt proportions, experimental fashion

YEARBOOK PAGE LAYOUT:
• Subject's photo in yearbook grid layout
• Multiple student photos on same page
• Subject's photo highlighted or larger
• Classic yearbook page design
• School name and year at top
• Page number at bottom

STUDENT INFORMATION:
• Name under photo (use external master prompt text if provided, or generate appropriate era name)
• Nickname in quotes (optional, possibly embarrassing)
• Student activities, clubs, sports listed
• Awkward or overly earnest senior quote
• "Memories:" or "Plans:" section with dated references
• Awards or achievements (or lack thereof - "Attendance Award")
• Superlatives if applicable

PHOTO TECHNICAL ASPECTS:
• Era-appropriate photography quality:
  - 1950s-60s: Black and white or early color
  - 1970s: Faded color, brown/orange tones
  - 1980s: Bright harsh color, sometimes over-airbrushed making it worse
  - 1990s-2000s: Standard color photography
  - Modern: High-quality digital
• School portrait studio backdrop (often clashing with subject)
• Harsh unflattering school photo lighting
• Stiff formal posed portrait
• Photo day hurried atmosphere captured

CLOTHING (Era-appropriate but awkward):
• Ill-fitting for the subject
• Unfortunate color choice
• Era-specific fashion disasters:
  - 1980s: Extreme shoulder pads, neon colors
  - 1990s: Awkward layering, visible band t-shirt under dress shirt
  - 2000s: Popped collar on polo, studded belt visible
• Wrinkled or stained
• Parents chose it, subject hated it
• Too formal or trying too hard

EXPRESSION:
• Forced uncomfortable smile
• Dead-eyed stare
• Trying to look cool but looking awkward
• Caught mid-word or mid-blink
• Nervous tension visible
• "Just get this over with" energy
• Fake confidence that reads as awkward

YEARBOOK TEXT SECTIONS:
• Activities: "Mathlete, AV Club, Library Assistant"
• Quote: Overly earnest or trying-too-hard-to-be-deep quote
• Memories: Era-specific now-embarrassing memories
• Future Plans: Overly optimistic or vague
• Nickname: Potentially embarrassing
• Inside jokes that don't age well

PAGE DESIGN ELEMENTS:
• School logo or mascot
• Page border or decorative elements
• Year and grade level
• Multiple photos on page (subject is one of many)
• Grid layout of student portraits
• Typography typical of era
• School name: "[School Name] High School"

HUMOR EMPHASIS:
• This is the photo you're embarrassed to show people
• The awkward teenage years captured forever
• Peak puberty unfortunate timing
• Fashion and hair disasters of the era
• Everything that could go wrong in a school photo did
• The photo that makes you cringe at reunions
• Parents thought you looked great, you were mortified

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show an actual yearbook page layout with the subject's deliberately unflattering and awkward school portrait photo - complete with bad hair, unfortunate expression, visible braces/acne, ill-fitting clothes, harsh lighting, and all the cringe-inducing elements that make classic yearbook photos both nostalgic and embarrassing, along with student name (from external prompt or generated), activities, and era-appropriate yearbook information.

name: YOU SMELL
message:
Take a picture of the subject and place them in a public setting such as a bus, office, party, or line.

The subject should have visible dark sweat stains under their arms.

People around the subject should be reacting to the smell using exaggerated gestures such as holding their nose, covering their mouth, leaning away, or making disgusted faces.

The subject should look unaware or embarrassed.

The scene should look realistic but humorous, with the reactions clearly selling the joke.

name: ZODIAC SIGN
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject to literally embody their zodiac sign with symbolic elements and mythological representation.

ZODIAC SIGN SELECTION (CRITICAL):
• If an external master prompt specifies a sign, USE THAT SIGN
• If none is specified, SELECT EXACTLY ONE using the PRE-CALCULATED values
• These values are MANDATORY - you MUST use them for selection
• Use LAST TWO DIGITS modulo 12:
  - 0: Aries (The Ram - March 21-April 19) - Subject with ram horns, fiery background, warrior energy, cardinal fire sign, Mars ruled, bold red colors, charging forward pose
  - 1: Taurus (The Bull - April 20-May 20) - Subject with bull horns or features, earthy garden setting, Venus ruled, luxurious textures, green and pink colors, grounded stable pose
  - 2: Gemini (The Twins - May 21-June 20) - Subject depicted as twins or mirror image, air element swirls, Mercury ruled, yellow and light blue, communicative gesture, duality theme
  - 3: Cancer (The Crab - June 21-July 22) - Subject with crab shell or claws, moonlit water scene, Moon ruled, silver and white colors, protective nurturing energy, emotional depth
  - 4: Leo (The Lion - July 23-August 22) - Subject with lion's mane or features, golden sunlight, Sun ruled, gold and orange colors, regal commanding pose, dramatic flair
  - 5: Virgo (The Maiden - August 23-September 22) - Subject as ethereal maiden, harvest setting with wheat, Mercury ruled, earth tones and navy, perfectionist detail, analytical pose
  - 6: Libra (The Scales - September 23-October 22) - Subject holding or balanced with scales, harmonious aesthetic, Venus ruled, pastels and pink, balanced symmetrical composition
  - 7: Scorpio (The Scorpion - October 23-November 21) - Subject with scorpion tail or features, mysterious dark water, Pluto/Mars ruled, deep reds and black, intense penetrating gaze
  - 8: Sagittarius (The Archer - November 22-December 21) - Subject as centaur archer with bow and arrow, adventurous landscape, Jupiter ruled, purple and blue, aiming toward horizon
  - 9: Capricorn (The Goat - December 22-January 19) - Subject as mountain goat climbing peaks, ambitious setting, Saturn ruled, brown and grey, determined upward climb
  - 10: Aquarius (The Water Bearer - January 20-February 18) - Subject pouring water from vessel, futuristic innovative setting, Uranus ruled, electric blue, revolutionary eccentric energy
  - 11: Pisces (The Fish - February 19-March 20) - Subject as or with two fish, dreamy underwater realm, Neptune ruled, sea green and purple, flowing mystical ethereal pose

TRANSFORM THE SUBJECT:
• Incorporate the zodiac animal/symbol features (horns, claws, fish tail, etc.)
• Subject's face remains recognizable but enhanced with zodiac characteristics
• Clothing/styling appropriate to the sign's energy
• Ruling planet symbol visible somewhere in composition
• Element representation (fire, earth, air, water) in background

INCLUDE ASTROLOGICAL ELEMENTS:
• Constellation pattern subtly visible in sky or background
• Zodiac glyph symbol incorporated into design
• Colors associated with that sign
• Crystals or gemstones for that sign
• Seasonal atmosphere matching sign's dates

STYLE:
• Mystical, cosmic aesthetic
• Photorealistic but with magical enhancement
• Dramatic lighting emphasizing the sign's element
• Subject appears as divine embodiment of their sign

FINAL RESULT:
The image should show the subject as a living embodiment of their zodiac sign, blending human features with symbolic animal characteristics in a mystical, astrological setting that captures the essence and energy of that sign.

name: ZOOM CALL DISASTER
message: Take a picture and transform it into a catastrophic Zoom call moment frozen in time. Show the subject in a split-screen grid layout with multiple video call windows. The main window shows the subject caught in an embarrassing situation - maybe in pajama bottoms while standing up, cat walking across keyboard, kid bursting in, unmuted during private moment, or inappropriate background visible. Include other participant windows showing shocked, amused, or secondhand-embarrassment faces reacting. Add authentic Zoom interface elements: mute/video buttons, participant names, 'You are muted' notification, grid view layout, poor lighting, pixelated video quality, frozen buffering frames. Capture that specific modern horror of professional facade collapsing during video conference. Make it look like an actual screenshot of a Zoom disaster moment.

name: ZOOLANDER
message:
Take a picture and transform the subject’s facial expression into an exaggerated high-fashion modeling pose inspired by the iconic 'Blue Steel' look.

CORE CONCEPT (CRITICAL):
• This is a FACIAL EXPRESSION transformation only
• The subject must remain fully recognizable
• The humor comes from extreme self-seriousness applied to a mundane moment

BLUE STEEL EXPRESSION RULES (CRITICAL):
• Brows slightly furrowed with intense focus
• Cheeks subtly sucked inward
• Lips pursed or lightly tightened
• Jawline emphasized
• Eyes narrowed with dramatic confidence
• Expression must look intentional and practiced — not distorted

FACIAL INTEGRITY RULES:
• Do NOT alter facial structure, symmetry, or proportions
• Do NOT add wrinkles, makeup, scars, or accessories unless already present
• No cartoon exaggeration
• No facial warping or deformation

POSE & ATTITUDE:
• Head slightly tilted or angled like a fashion pose
• Neck elongated if visible
• Posture confident and poised
• Expression should feel absurdly serious

STYLE & REALISM:
• Photorealistic
• Clean lighting similar to a fashion or candid photo
• No stylization, filters, or painterly effects

HUMOR BOUNDARY (CRITICAL):
• The expression is funny because it is earnest
• No mockery, distortion, or slapstick
• The subject must appear completely unaware of how ridiculous they look

ENVIRONMENT:
• The original environment remains unchanged
• No runway, props, or fashion staging added

FINAL RESULT:
The final image must look like a normal photograph of the subject unintentionally striking an over-the-top, ultra-serious fashion model expression — instantly recognizable as a parody of high-fashion posing, confident, intense, and humorously dramatic.

name: ZOO-TOPIA
message: Take a picture and transform the subject into a realistic anthropomorphized animal character (Zootopia-style realism). Choose an animal form that naturally fits the subject’s facial structure, body type, and personality. Preserve recognizable facial features, expressions, proportions, hairstyle equivalents (fur patterns), and the subject’s exact clothing translated accurately onto the animal anatomy. The character must stand upright with human-like posture, hands, and gestures while retaining believable animal anatomy, fur detail, and species-specific traits. Photorealistic fur, skin, and fabric interaction with cinematic lighting. The subject must clearly remain the same individual, now reimagined as a believable anthropomorphic animal in a realistic world.
